A reactor is a container for chemical reaction.反应器是进行化学反应的容器。
We are doing a chemical experiment.我们正在做化学实验。
The industry produces agricultural chemicals.这个工厂生产农药。
The fine chemicals become more and more important.精致药品变得越来越重要了。
The chemical can behave as an acid.这种化学制品能起酸的作用。
He is experimenting with a new chemical.他正在实验一种新的化学制品。

chili pepper


Image Search
a small hot-tasting pod of a variety of capsicum, used chopped (and often dried) in sauces, relishes, and spice powders. There are various forms with pods of differing size, color, and strength of flavor, such as cascabels and jalapeños.
short for chili powder.
short for chili con carne.
This variety of red pepper is especially hot.这种红辣椒特别辣。
A handful of freshly picked chili peppers may look harmless.一把新摘的红辣椒看起来好象没有什么杀伤力。

chilly

['tʃɪli], ['tʃɪli]


Image Search
adj. 寒冷的；冷淡的
n. 干辣椒
uncomfortably cool or cold.
(of a person) feeling cold.
unfriendly.
"it had turned chilly"
"I felt a bit chilly"
"a chilly reception"
It's a chilly morning.这是一个寒冷的早晨。
A gust of chilly autumn wind is blowing from the north.一阵冷飕飕的秋风从北方吹来。
It often happens that a balmy morning passes into a chilly afternoon.一个温和的上午常常转为一个寒冷的下午。
The visitors got a very chilly reception.客人受到了非常冷淡的接待。
He had a chilly welcome of our coming.他冷淡地迎接我们的到来。

chronic

['krɒnɪk], ['krɑːnɪk]


Image Search
adj. 长期的；慢性的；惯常的
(of an illness) persisting for a long time or constantly recurring.
(of a person) having an illness persisting for a long time or constantly recurring.
(of a problem) long-lasting and difficult to eradicate.
(of a person) having a particular bad habit.
"chronic bronchitis"
"a chronic asthmatic"
"the school suffers from chronic overcrowding"
"a chronic liar"
There is a chronic unemployment problem in America.在美国存在长期失业问题。
We finally won in this chronic war.我们终于打赢了这场长期战争。
My brother has chronic bronchitis.我的哥哥患有慢性支气管炎。
Have you got any chronic diseases in the past?你过去有没有慢性病?
The school put us on notice for chronic lateness.因经常迟到学校将我们的名字公布在公告栏上。

chronicle

['krɒnɪkl], ['krɑːnɪkl]


Image Search
n. 年代记；记录；编年史
a factual written account of important or historical events in the order of their occurrence.
a work of fiction or nonfiction that describes a particular series of events.
record (a related series of events) in a factual and detailed way.
"his work chronicles 20th-century displacement and migration"
Since I will start building a brand new workstation pretty soon, I've decided to chronicle my experience.既然我将很快搭建一个全新的工作站，我决定记录下这一过程。
The subscription rule was canceled because an event chronicle rule that it depends on failed.由于所依赖的事件历史记录规则失败，订阅规则被取消。
Every mouldering stone was a chronicle.每块崩碎剥落的石头都是一部编年史。
The chronicle breaks down into four parts.这部编年史分成四部分。

cinch

[sɪntʃ], [sɪntʃ]


Image Search
n. (马的)肚带；容易做的事情；必然发生的事情
v. 系肚带；确保
an extremely easy task.
a sure thing; a certainty.
a girth for a Western saddle or pack.
secure (a garment) with a belt.
fix (a saddle) securely by means of a girth; girth up (a horse).
make certain of.
"the program was a cinch to use"
"he was a cinch to take a prize"
"his advice cinched her decision to accept the offer"
That horse is a cinch to win the next race.那匹马在下一场比赛中肯定赢。
That's a cinch for me.那对我来说太容易了。

circumstances

['sɜːkəmstənsɪz], ['sɜːkəmstənsɪz]


Image Search
n. 情况；境遇；事项；详细情节
名词circumstance的复数形式.
a fact or condition connected with or relevant to an event or action.
an event or fact that causes or helps to cause something to happen, typically something undesirable.
one's state of financial or material welfare.
"we wanted to marry but circumstances didn't permit"
"he was found dead but there were no suspicious circumstances"
"the artists are living in reduced circumstances"
Circumstances have compelled a change of plan.因情况所迫，计划已经改变。
Maybe under these circumstances we may say that man can conquer nature.也许在这样的情况下我们可以说人定胜天。
He is in bad, distressed circumstances.他境遇贫困，生活痛苦。
Circumstances combined early to make her view the world as a vale of tears.种种境遇使她很早就认为这世间苦难无边。
She writes with circumstances.她写得很详细。

cited

[saɪt], [saɪt]


Image Search
vt. 引用；传讯；表扬；举(例)
quote (a passage, book, or author) as evidence for or justification of an argument or statement, especially in a scholarly work.
mention as an example.
refer to a former tried case as a guide to deciding a comparable case or in support of an argument.
praise (someone, typically a member of the armed forces) for a courageous act in an official dispatch.
summon (someone) to appear in a court of law.
"medics have been cited as a key example of a modern breed of technical expert"
"the summons cited four of the defendants"
The lawyer cited a previous case to support his argument.律师引用了以前的案例来支持他的论点。
It's no use citing the Bible to somebody who doesn't believe in God.对不信上帝的人引用圣经的话是没用的。
I'll just cite some figures for comparison.我要引用一些数字作比较。
He was cited for contempt of court.他因蔑视法庭而被传讯。
The soldier was cited by the king for his bravery.这士兵由于英勇而受到国王的褒扬。
To illstrate the theory in question, we can cite many examples.为了说明我们讨论的这一理论,我们可以举一些例子。

civil

['sɪvl], ['sɪvl]


Image Search
adj. 公民的；文明的；国内的；民用的；民事的；【建】土木的
relating to ordinary citizens and their concerns, as distinct from military or ecclesiastical matters.
(of disorder or conflict) occurring between citizens of the same country.
relating to private relations between members of a community; noncriminal.
relating to civil law.
courteous and polite.
(of time measurement or a point in time) fixed by custom or law rather than being natural or astronomical.
"civil aviation"
"a civil action"
"we tried to be civil to him"
"civil twilight starts at sunset"
The law shall strictly protect civil rights.法律应严格保护公民的权利。
The presence of the army should act as a check on civil unrest.军队的存在应能制止民间的动乱。
The boy was so cold and even didn't return a civil greeting.那个男孩是那么的冷淡,他甚至都没有回敬一个礼貌的问候。
The America Civil War broke out during the presidency of Lincoln.在林肯就职其间,美国爆发了内战。
I am working on a master's degree in civil architecture.我在攻读民用建筑专业的硕士学位。
It was a civil case so there was no question of him being sent to prison.这是一桩民事案件，因此他没有被送进监狱的可能。

clam

[klæm], [klæm]


Image Search
n. 蛤；沉默寡言的人
vi. 保持沉默；挖蚌
a marine bivalve mollusk with shells of equal size.
any of a number of edible bivalve mollusks, e.g., a scallop.
a dollar.
a shy or withdrawn person.
dig for or collect clams.
abruptly stop talking, either for fear of revealing a secret or from shyness.
"all I got for the job was 50 lousy clams"
"it was one of the worst times for clamming"
Yup! I also like clam soup and sea cucumbers.对呀！我还喜欢蛤仔汤和海参。
Everybody shut up like a clam as soon as you mention it.你一提及此事，大家便都闭口不言
He is a clam about his business dealing.他对自己的生意买卖守口如瓶。
It started off well, but he seemed to clam up towards the end.刚开始很，但是最后他似乎有些沉默。
I used to clam up when the talk turned to politics or economics当话题转到政治或经济问题时，我常沉默不语。

clarification

[ˌklærəfɪ'keɪʃn], [ˌklærəfɪ'keɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 澄清；阐明
the action of making a statement or situation less confused and more comprehensible.
"please advise us if you require further clarification"
It is time for the clarification of the situation.澄清事实的时候到了。
They asked for a clarification of his position.他们要求他表明立场。
In this context I will like to make a clarification.关于这一点，我想澄清一下。
After I read the clause, I feel it needs some clarification.读过这一条款之后，我觉得这条需要说明一下。
See the examples below for clarification.看下面的例子你就会明白。

clarity

['klærəti], ['klærəti]


Image Search
n. 清楚；透明
the quality of being clear, in particular.
the quality of coherence and intelligibility.
the quality of being easy to see or hear; sharpness of image or sound.
the quality of being certain or definite.
the quality of transparency or purity.
"for the sake of clarity, each of these strategies is dealt with separately"
"the clarity of the picture"
"it was clarity of purpose that he needed"
"the crystal clarity of water"
These adjectives mean lacking clarity of meaning.这些形容词都有意思不清楚的含义。
Let me try to provide some clarity.让我提供一些清楚的信息。
Clarity is very important for a business letter.文笔清晰对于商业信件非常重要。
Clarity of dictionis vital for a public speaker.发音清晰对演说家至关重要。
But we are a long way from clarity and honesty.但我们离透明和坦诚还相去甚远。
Clarity was just one major problem for researchers.透明度是研究者们所研究的一个主要课题。

classical

['klæsɪkl], ['klæsɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 古典的；权威的；传统的；正统的
relating to ancient Greek or Latin literature, art, or culture.
(of art or architecture) influenced by ancient Greek or Roman forms or principles.
(typically of a form of art) regarded as representing an exemplary standard; traditional and long-established in form or style.
relating to the first significant period of an area of study.
relating to or based upon concepts and theories which preceded the theories of relativity and quantum mechanics; Newtonian.
"classical mythology"
"a classical ballet"
"classical mechanics"
"classical physics"
Beethoven is regarded as one of the immortals of classical music.贝多芬被认为是不朽的古典音乐大师。
Some young people like pop music, while still others like classical music.一些年青人喜欢流行音乐，但仍有其它人喜欢古典音乐。
He is regarded as one of the classical composers in this century.他被认为是本世纪第一流的作曲家之一。
The classical approach could be realized in at least two forms.传统的道路被认为至少有两种形式。
Classical scientific ideas about light were changed by Einstein.爱因斯坦改变了科学上关于光的传统观念。
She has asked classical archeologist Dr. Lori-Ann Touchette to show her the Roman forum.她请到了一位正统的考古学家安奇特博士作为她罗马广场的向导。
In this classical surreal film, a sailor meets a student who has just murdered his tutor.在这部正统的超现实电影中，一个水手碰到了一个刚刚杀害了自己的家庭教师的学生。

classify

['klæsɪfaɪ], ['klæsɪfaɪ]


Image Search
vt. 分类；归类
arrange (a group of people or things) in classes or categories according to shared qualities or characteristics.
assign (someone or something) to a particular class or category.
designate (documents or information) as officially secret or to which only authorized people may have access.
"mountain peaks are classified according to their shape"
"elements are usually classified as metals or nonmetals"
"government officials classified 6.3 million documents in 1992"
The books in the library are classified by subject.图书馆的书是按科目分类的。
We can classify these subjects under three headings.我们可以将这些题目加以分类成三个主题。
Would you classify her novels as serious literature or other?你认为她的小说属于文学类，还是其它类?
It is entirly proper to classify Kant as a transcendental idealist.把康德化归类为先验的唯心主义者是完全正确的。

clause

[klɔːz], [klɔːz]


Image Search
n. 条款；[语]从句
a unit of grammatical organization next below the sentence in rank and in traditional grammar said to consist of a subject and predicate.
a particular and separate article, stipulation, or proviso in a treaty, bill, or contract.
There is a contentious clause in the treaty.这条约中有一条有争议的条款。
A penalty clause was written into the contract.在合同中写入了一项罚款条款。
Please pay attention to this clause in the sentence.请注意看句中的这个从句。
This is an attributive clause.这是一个定语从句。

clergy

['klɜːdʒi], ['klɜːrdʒi]


Image Search
n. [总称]牧师；神职人员
the body of all people ordained for religious duties, especially in the Christian Church.
"all marriages were to be solemnized by the clergy"
The clergy were sacred beings in Miss Ainley's eyes.在安利小姐看来，牧师都是圣人。
I could heartily wish that more of our country clergy would follow this example.我衷心希望，我国有更多的牧师效法这个榜样。
Prior to the law's enactment, most of the Danish clergy opposed it.在通过该法规之前，多数丹麦神职人员反对此法规。
The superior clergy and a small remnant of other educated men read and wrote Latin.上等的神职人员和一小部分残余的其他受过教育的人使用拉丁语读写。

clutch

[klʌtʃ], [klʌtʃ]


Image Search
vt. 抓住；抓牢
vi. 企图抓住；踩离合器
n. 抓住；爪子；离合器；紧要关头
n. 一窝鸡（蛋）；一群
adj. 关键的；致胜的
grasp or seize (something) tightly or eagerly.
become nervous and panicked.
a tight grasp or an act of grasping something.
a person's power or control, especially when perceived as cruel or inescapable.
a slim, flat handbag without handles or a strap.
a mechanism for connecting and disconnecting a vehicle engine from its transmission system.
the pedal operating a vehicle's clutch.
(in sport) denoting or occurring in a critical situation in which the outcome of a game or competition is at stake.
(of a player or action) achieving or characterized by success at a critical moment in a game or competition.
a group of eggs fertilized at the same time, typically laid in a single session and (in birds) incubated together.
a brood of chicks.
a small group of people or things.
"he stood clutching a microphone"
"doctors could clutch up and lose control as easily as anyone"
"she made a clutch at his body"
"she escaped the clutches of her temperamental family"
"they both are hard-nosed players who seem to thrive in clutch situations"
"a clutch quarterback"
"a clutch of young girls on roller skates"
The boy clutched the marbles and ran away.那男孩一把抢去弹珠便逃之夭夭。
The child clutched his toy.那个孩子紧抓着他的玩具不放。
John jumped up to clutch at the branch,but missed.约翰跳起来试图抓住那树枝，但是没有成功。
It is useless to clutch at a straw.抓救命稻草是无济于事的。
Engage the clutch before selecting a gear.先踩离合器再挂挡。
The eagle flew away with a rabbit in the clutch of its claws.鹰用爪子紧紧抓住一只野兔，飞走了。
He fell into the clutches of the criminal gang.他落到了犯罪集团的魔爪中。
He burnt out the clutch on his car.他把他汽车上的离合器烧坏了。
She release the clutch and the car begin to move.她放开离合器，汽车就动了。
He was great in the clutch as he could make shots and pass to his teammates for easy shots.他总能在比赛紧要关头投篮命中或者妙传队友轻松得分。
He's won a whole clutch of awards.他获得一大堆奖。
The Prime Minister was there with a clutch of cabinet ministers.首相和一群内阁部长都在那里。
Tmac is a choker and will never be able to get it done during clutch time.麦迪就像一条围巾，在关键的时候很难从脖子上取下来。

coalesce

[ˌkəʊə'les], [ˌkoʊə'les]


Image Search
v. 合并；联合；接合
come together and form one mass or whole.
combine (elements) in a mass or whole.
"the puddles had coalesced into shallow streams"
"to help coalesce the community, they established an office"
The views of party leaders coalesced to form a coherent policy.党的领导人的各种观点已统一为一致的政策。
I hope patriotism can coalesce under this kind of idea and express itself.愿爱国主义在这样的理念下凝聚起来，表达出来。

code

[kəʊd], [koʊd]


Image Search
n. 密码；法规；准则
v. 制成法典；把 ... 编码
a system of words, letters, figures, or other symbols substituted for other words, letters, etc., especially for the purposes of secrecy.
a system of signals, such as sounds, light flashes, or flags, used to send messages.
a series of letters, numbers, or symbols assigned to something for the purposes of classification or identification.
program instructions.
a systematic collection of laws or regulations.
a set of conventions governing behavior or activity in a particular sphere.
a set of rules and standards adhered to by a society, class, or individual.
convert (the words of a message) into a particular code in order to convey a secret meaning.
express the meaning of (a statement or communication) in an indirect or euphemistic way.
assign a code to (something) for purposes of classification, analysis, or identification.
write code for (a computer program).
specify the genetic sequence for (an amino acid or protein).
be the genetic determiner of (a characteristic).
"the Americans cracked their diplomatic code"
"Morse code"
"the genetic code"
"assembly code"
"the criminal code"
"a dress code"
"a stern code of honor"
"only Mitch knew how to read the message—even the name was coded"
"they code their language when talking to the general public"
"she coded the samples and sent them down for dissection"
"most developers code C + + like C"
"genes that code for human growth hormone"
"one pair of homologous chromosomes that codes for eye color"
I can break the code of this box.我能破译这个箱子的密码。
She tapped out in code to headquarters.她给总部发出密码电报。
The Highway Code has been carried out.公路法规已经被执行。
Managers are expected to comply with the company's code of conduct.希望经理能够遵守公司的行为准则。
They coded each sample and sent them to the lab for analysis.他们把每个样本都编了代码并送到实验室分析。

coerce

[kəʊ'ɜːs], [koʊ'ɜːrs]


Image Search
vt. 强制；威胁
persuade (an unwilling person) to do something by using force or threats.
obtain (something) by using force or threats.
"they were coerced into silence"
"their confessions were allegedly coerced by torture"
You can't coerce her into obedience.你不能强制她服从。
Do you think there is any way that we can coerce them otherwise?你认为我们有什么办法强迫他们不那样吗?
His plan was to resist every effort to coerce him to the last ditch.他的计划就是要同那欺凌他的力量抵抗到底。
The policy of the prohibition against using tortures to coerce a statement is provided clearly and definitely.严禁逼供信政策明确规定了公安机关及其人员在讯问过程中不得刑讯逼供。

cognizable

['kɒgnɪzəbl], ['kɒgnɪzəbəl]


Image Search
adj. 可认识的
perceptible; clearly identifiable.
within the jurisdiction of a court.
At the present time, human actual law system is far distant from the cognizable justice target. 目前，人类的实在法制度与可认知的正义目标还有很远的距离。
Yet, the integration of discourse, as a subject, and the cognizable psychology of both a translator and a reader are more important. 然而，语篇这一课题所具有的整体性，以及译者与读者的认知心理更是中心所在。
His opinion also noted that the decision does not foreclose the act from challenge by someone who suffers “judicially cognizable injury resulting from it. 译为：他的意见也表明这结果没有妨碍来自一位受害者的“公平审理受伤害结果”的提案。
The denial of a recognized nationality, just as the denial of a recognized citizenship, constitutes a legally cognizable injury-in-fact for the purpose of standing. 否定公认国籍，如同否定公认公民权，于是构成兴讼论据的法定事实损害。
The Cognizable Base of Hayak's Individualism 哈耶克的个人主义的认知基础

coherence

[kəʊ'hɪərəns], [koʊ'hɪrəns]


Image Search
n. 一致；连贯
the quality of being logical and consistent.
the quality of forming a unified whole.
"this raises further questions on the coherence of state policy"
"the group began to lose coherence and the artists took separate directions"
He was starkly unable to achieve coherence.他完全不能达到一致。
This article lacks unity and coherence.这篇文章层次不清。
Logical connectors is one of the major cohesive devices, it can achieve coherence in discourse.逻辑连接词是衔接的一种主要方式,能实现语篇的连贯。

coincide

[ˌkəʊɪn'saɪd], [ˌkoʊɪn'saɪd]


Image Search
vi. 一致；同时发生；符合
occur at or during the same time.
correspond in nature; tally.
correspond in position; meet or intersect.
be in agreement.
"publication is timed to coincide with a major exhibition"
"the interests of employers and employees do not always coincide"
"the two long-distance walks briefly coincide here"
"the members of the College coincide in this opinion"
They didn't coincide in opinion.他们的意见不统一。
Our opinions did not coincide on this case.在这个案例上,我们的意见不一致。
My religious beliefs don't coincide with yours.我的宗教信仰跟你的不一样。
Their stories coincided.他们的叙述一致.
The demonstration had been carefully stage-managed to coincide with the Prime Minister's visit.这次示威活动事先作了精心安排，正好在首相访问时进行。
It's a pity our trips to New York don't coincide.真遗憾我们不能同一时间去纽约旅行。
Two boxes of your product didn't coincide with your sample last time.上次你们的货物中有两箱品质和规格与样品不符。

collaborated

[kə'læbəreɪt], [kə'læbəreɪt]


Image Search
vi. 合作；通敌
work jointly on an activity, especially to produce or create something.
cooperate traitorously with an enemy.
"he collaborated with a distinguished painter on the designs"
"the indigenous elite who collaborated with the colonizers"
She collaborated with her sister/She and her sister collaborated on a biography of their father.她和姐姐合作写父亲的传记。
We would ask you to collaborate with us.我们愿意请你们和我们合作。
This supplier and I collaborate on certain points.我与供应商有数方面或以上的合作。

collapse

[kə'læps], [kə'læps]


Image Search
v. （使）倒塌；（使）崩溃；（使）瓦解；折叠
n. 倒塌；崩溃；暴跌
(of a structure) fall down or in; give way.
cause (something) to fall in or give way.
(of a lung or blood vessel) become flat and empty with the walls fallen inward.
cause (a lung or blood vessel) to collapse.
(of a person) fall down and become unconscious, typically through illness or injury.
sit or lie down as a result of tiredness or amusement.
(of an institution or undertaking) fail suddenly and completely.
(of a price or currency) drop suddenly in value.
fold or be folded to fit into a small space.
compress a displayed part of (a spreadsheet or other electronic document).
an instance of a structure falling down or in.
a sudden failure of an institution or undertaking.
a physical or mental breakdown.
"the roof collapsed on top of me"
"it feels as if the slightest pressure would collapse it"
"she was so dehydrated that her veins had collapsed"
"he had an operation to collapse his lung"
"he collapsed from loss of blood"
"exhausted, he collapsed on the bed"
"in the face of such resolve his opposition finally collapsed"
"some cots collapse down to fit into a bag"
"tabulation programs can be used to collapse this list in various ways"
"the collapse of a railroad bridge"
"the collapse of the Ottoman Empire"
"he suffered a collapse from overwork"
The roof collapsed under the weight of snow.房顶在雪的重压下突然坍塌下来。
If you work too hard,your health may collapse.如果你工作太累的话，你可能病倒。
The enterprise collapsed through lack of support.该企业因无力支持而倒闭。
He collapsed the wheelchair and put it on the boat.他将轮椅折叠起来放在船上。
A flood caused the collapse of the bridge.洪水使桥倒塌了。
The stock market was on the brink of collapse.股市已到崩盘的边缘。
The market collapse was caused by weakness of the dollar.市场价格暴跌是由于美元疲弱引起的。

colleagues

['kɒliːɡ], ['kɑːliːɡ]


Image Search
n. 同事
a person with whom one works in a profession or business.
Please allow me to introduce my colleague Professor Zhang to you.请允许我把我的同事张教授介绍给你。

colossal

[kə'lɒsl], [kə'lɑːsl]


Image Search
adj. 巨大的； <口>异常的
extremely large.
(of a giant order) having more than one story of columns.
(of a statue) at least twice life size.
"a colossal amount of mail"
This is indeed a colossal success.这确实是个巨大的成功。
But to go back to the old ways would be a colossal mistake.但是，回到老路上将是一个巨大的错误。

commemorate

[kə'meməreɪt], [kə'meməreɪt]


Image Search
vt. 纪念
recall and show respect for (someone or something).
celebrate (an event, a person, or a situation) by doing or building something.
"a wreath-laying ceremony to commemorate the war dead"
"it was a night commemorated in a song"
A monument was built to commemorate the victory.为了纪念胜利，建造了一座纪念碑。
Christmas commemorates the birth of Christ.圣诞节是为了纪念耶酥的诞生。
They reared a monument to commemorate the great musician.他们建立起一座纪念碑，纪念这位伟大的音乐家。
We celebrate this day to commemorate the brave soldiers.我们庆祝这天，以纪念英勇的士兵。
Today, moon cakes are eaten to commemorate this event.今天，人们吃月饼纪念此事。

commenced

[kə'mens], [kə'mens]


Image Search
v. 开始；着手；<英>获得学位
begin; start.
"his design team commenced work"
I commence from this point.我从此点开始。
The second term commences in March.第二学期自三月开始。
We will commence with this work.我们要着手进行这项工作。
I commence a round of visit.我开始着手一系列访问。

commentary

['kɒməntri], ['kɑːmənteri]


Image Search
n. 实况报道；现场解说；评论；注释
an expression of opinions or offering of explanations explanations about an event or situation.
a descriptive spoken account (especially on a broadcast) of an event or performance as it happens.
a set of explanatory or critical notes on a text.
"an editorial commentary"
"a commentary on the Old Testament"
His running commentary on the football match was excellent.他对这次足球赛所作的实况报道十分精彩。
Tours have live English commentary.旅游配有现场英语解说。
We'd better not make any commentary on others.我们最好不要评论他人。
I think his commentary on this issue is not correct.我认为他对这个问题的评论是不正确的。
The mere quotation outtells all commentary.纯粹的引用文句比所有一手注解更能表达。

comments

['kɒments], ['kɒments]


Image Search
n. 评论；意见；注解；注释
名词comment的复数形式.
a verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or reaction.
discussion, especially of a critical nature, of an issue or event.
an indirect expression of the views of the creator of an artistic work.
an explanatory note in a book or other written text.
a written explanation or commentary.
a piece of specially tagged text placed within a program to help other users to understand it, which the computer ignores when running the program.
express (an opinion or reaction).
place a piece of specially tagged explanatory text within (a program) to assist other users.
turn (part of a program) into a comment so that the computer ignores it when running the program.
"you asked for comments on the new proposals"
"the plans were not sent to the council for comment"
"their second single is a comment on the commercial nature of raves"
"the company would not comment on the venture"
"you could try commenting out that line"
He made several favorable comments about their candidate.他对他们的候选人发表了一些有利的评论。
I think there is a kernel of truth in these otherwise frivolous comments.我认为在这些本来是无关紧要的评论中含有一定的真实性。
He has already been told, so our comments are superfluous.早就有人同他说过，所以我们的意见是多余的。
His comments sparked a lot of controversy.他的注解发出大量的论争。
Are comments aligned with the code they explain?注解是否和代码对齐。
Avoid the use of end-line comments.避免使用行尾注释。
Comments must both start and end in one batch.注释必须在一个批处理中开始并结束。

commission

[kə'mɪʃn], [kə'mɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 佣金；委员会；委托；委任；犯罪
vt. 授予；使服役；委托
an instruction, command, or duty given to a person or group of people.
an order for something, especially a work of art, to be produced.
a work produced in response to a commission.
the authority to perform a task or certain duties.
a group of people officially charged with a particular function.
an amount of money, typically a set percentage of the value involved, paid to an agent in a commercial transaction.
a warrant conferring the rank of officer in an army, navy, or air force.
the action of committing a crime or offense.
give an order for or authorize the production of (something such as a building, piece of equipment, or work of art).
order or authorize (a person or organization) to do or produce something.
bring (something newly produced, such as a factory or machine) into working condition.
bring (a warship) into readiness for active service.
appoint (someone) to the rank of officer in the armed services.
"his commission to redesign the building"
"Mozart at last received a commission to write an opera"
"the United Nations High Commission for Refugees"
"foreign banks may charge a commission"
"he has resigned his commission"
"use of a deadly weapon in the commission of a felony"
"the portrait was commissioned by his widow in 1792"
"they commissioned an architect to manage the building project"
"we had a few hiccups getting the heating equipment commissioned"
"the aircraft carrier Midway was commissioned in 1945"
"he was commissioned after attending midshipman school"
Do not deduct any commission from the consignment value.不要从货物的价值中扣除佣金。
The report was submitted to the commission for consideration.这份报告已呈报委员会审批。
He had received the commission to build a new bridge over the river.他受委托在这条河上建一座新桥。
We all approve of the commission of authority to him.我们都赞成把职权委任於他。
The prisoner pleaded that he was drawn in to the commission of the crime.囚犯辩解说他是受人引诱而犯罪的。
He was commissioned captain of the United States Air Force.他被授予美国空军上校。
Some wartime vessels are still commissioned in that area.有些战时的军舰仍在该地区服役。
The musician was commissioned a new symphony for the festival.那位音乐家受托为这个节庆写一首新的交响乐曲。

commitment

[kə'mɪtmənt], [kə'mɪtmənt]


Image Search
n. 承诺；保证；信奉；献身；委任；交押
the state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, etc.
a pledge or undertaking.
an engagement or obligation that restricts freedom of action.
"the company's commitment to quality"
"I cannot make such a commitment at the moment"
"business commitments"
If you are serious about our relationship, you should make a commitment.如果你对我们的关系很认真，你就应该给个承诺。
He made a commitment to pay the rent on time.他保证按时付房租。
It saddens me to recall that I assured him that I had no expectations of a long-term commitment.现在回想起来，我为我一开始就向他保证说我也不期望一段长期的关系而伤感。
It has been argued that this anticipated the punctuated equilibrium hypothesis, but other scholars have preferred to emphasise Darwin's commitment to gradualism.有人认为这加快了间断平衡假说的发展，但其他学者倾向于强调这表明了达尔文对渐进论的信奉。
We want to demonstrate our commitment to human rights.我们想表明我们为人权而献身。
They are looking for someone with a real sense of commitment to the job.他们正在找一个对这一工作有献身精神的人。

commodities

[kə'mɒdəti], [kə'mɑːdəti]


Image Search
n. 商品；日用品；有价值之物
a raw material or primary agricultural product that can be bought and sold, such as copper or coffee.
a useful or valuable thing, such as water or time.
Coal is becoming a rare commodity.煤正在成为一种稀缺商品。
In spite of the depression, the price of commodity is still high尽管有些萧条,但商品的价格仍然很高。
The country is heavily dependent on its exports of agricultural commodities.这个国家很大程度上依靠农产品的出口。
Time is our most valuable commodity.时间是最有价值之物。

commodity

[kə'mɒdəti], [kə'mɑːdəti]


Image Search
n. 商品；日用品；有价值之物
a raw material or primary agricultural product that can be bought and sold, such as copper or coffee.
a useful or valuable thing, such as water or time.
"commodities such as copper and coffee"
"water is a precious commodity"
Coal is becoming a rare commodity.煤正在成为一种稀缺商品。
In spite of the depression, the price of commodity is still high尽管有些萧条,但商品的价格仍然很高。
The country is heavily dependent on its exports of agricultural commodities.这个国家很大程度上依靠农产品的出口。
Time is our most valuable commodity.时间是最有价值之物。

communication

[kəˌmjuːnɪ'keɪʃn], [kəˌmjuːnɪ'keɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 交流；通讯；传达；通信；沟通
the imparting or exchanging of information or news.
a letter or message containing information or news.
the successful conveying or sharing of ideas and feelings.
social contact.
means of sending or receiving information, such as telephone lines or computers.
the field of study concerned with the transmission of information by various means.
the means of traveling or of transporting goods, such as roads or railroads.
"at the moment I am in communication with London"
"there was a lack of communication between Pamela and her parents"
"she gave him some hope of her return, or at least of their future communication"
"satellite communications"
"a city providing excellent road and rail communications"
Most important of all, computers create wide communication around the world.最重要的是,计算机在世界范围内建立了广泛的交流。
Being able to hold a conversation does not necessarily mean having effective communication.能够对话并不意味着在进行有效的交流。
This area has not been covered by the communication net.这个地区还不在通讯网的覆盖之内。
The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication.海滨救生员通常用旗号传达讯息。
Gestures comprise a major form of nonverbal communication.手势是非语言传达中很重要的一环。
Radio and television are important means of communication.无线电和电视是重要的通信手段。
Students should come with better preparation and better communication skills.学生应做好更充分的准备,具备更好的沟通能力。

community

[kə'mjuːnəti], [kə'mjuːnəti]


Image Search
n. 社区；社会；公众；共同体；团体；共享；共有；[生]群落
a group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common.
a group of people living together in one place, especially one practicing common ownership.
a particular area or place considered together with its inhabitants.
a body of nations or states unified by common interests.
the people of a district or country considered collectively, especially in the context of social values and responsibilities; society.
denoting a worker or resource designed to serve the people of a particular area.
a feeling of fellowship with others, as a result of sharing common attitudes, interests, and goals.
a similarity or identity.
joint ownership or liability.
a group of interdependent organisms of different species growing or living together in a specified habitat.
"the scientific community"
"a community of nuns"
"a rural community"
"the European Community"
"preparing prisoners for life back in the community"
"community health services"
"the sense of community that organized religion can provide"
"writers who shared a community of interests"
"a commitment to the community of goods"
"communities of insectivorous birds"
Here is a local Jewish community.这是当地犹太人的一个社区。
Everyone should invest some time in community service.每个人都应该花些时间在社区服务上。
Community colleges have become popular and their enrollments have increased rapidly.社区大学日渐增多，报名人数迅速增长。
The international community forbids use of any chemical weapons.国际社会禁止使用一切化学武器。
The welfare of the community is the same as the welfare of its members.社会的福利就等于其成员的福利。
His action was interpreted as constituting a threat to the community.他的行为被理解为是对公众的威胁。
The political community is composed of a number of diverse economic and functional groups.政治共同体由一系列在经济上和功能上不同的团体组成。
He refuses to join any community.他不参加任何团体。
He is ill reputed in the business community.他在商界名声不好。
There is a strong sense of community in this town.这个镇上有一种强烈的社区意识。
The appearance of the ecological community can vary depending on the time of year.生态群落的形态可能会根据一年之内时间的不同而变化。

compassion

[kəm'pæʃn], [kəm'pæʃn]


Image Search
n. 怜悯；同情
sympathetic pity and concern for the sufferings or misfortunes of others.
"the victims should be treated with compassion"
I had compassion for him.我怜悯他。
He teaches us to have compassion on the poor.他教导我们对穷人应有怜悯心。
Compassion is a sign of weakness.怜悯是弱者的标志。
I should not have compassion for those lofty birds.我不会怜悯这些高贵的鸟。
We had compassion for the poor widow.我们同情这个可怜的寡妇。
The nurse had great compassion for her patients.那位护士十分同情她的病人。
I feel a measure of compassion for her.我对她怀有一定程度的同情。
Compassion often engenders love.同情常会产生爱情。

compel

[kəm'pel], [kəm'pel]


Image Search
v. 强迫；迫使；使不得已
force or oblige (someone) to do something.
bring about (something) by the use of force or pressure.
drive forcibly.
"a sense of duty compelled Harry to answer her questions"
"they may compel a witness's attendance at court by issue of a summons"
"by heav'n's high will compell'd from shore to shore"
Nothing can compel me to do such a thing.没有什么可以强迫我做这件事。
I was compelled to do so by absolute necessity.我因绝对的需要,被迫这样做的。
The heavy rain compelled us to stay indoors.大雨迫使我们呆在户内。
Duty compelled the soldiers to volunteer for the mission.责任驱使军人必须志愿加入此任务
Her intelligence and skill compel our admiration.她的聪明和技巧使我们非常佩服。

compensation

[ˌkɒmpen'seɪʃn], [ˌkɑːmpen'seɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 补偿；赔偿；赔偿金
something, typically money, awarded to someone as a recompense for loss, injury, or suffering.
the action or process of awarding someone money as a recompense for loss, injury, or suffering.
the money received by an employee from an employer as a salary or wages.
something that counterbalances or makes up for an undesirable or unwelcome state of affairs.
the process of concealing or offsetting a psychological difficulty by developing in another direction.
"seeking compensation for injuries suffered at work"
"the compensation of victims"
"the gray streets of London were small compensation for the loss of her beloved Africa"
My job is hard,but it has its compensations.It is a great delight to pursue what I am interested in.我拍的工作虽苦,但也有所补偿。能够从事我感兴趣的工作让我很开心。
Compensation of injured workers has cost the company a lot.公司花了一大笔钱赔偿受伤的工人。
My job is hard, but it has its compensations—it is my happiness to pursue what I am interested in.我的工作虽苦,但却有所补偿（有好的方面因而不觉得太苦）。

competent

['kɒmpɪtənt], ['kɑːmpɪtənt]


Image Search
adj. 有能力的；足够的；胜任的
having the necessary ability, knowledge, or skill to do something successfully.
(of a person) efficient and capable.
acceptable and satisfactory, though not outstanding.
(chiefly of a court or other body) accepted as having legal authority to deal with a particular matter.
(of a criminal defendant) able to understand the charges and to aid in defending themselves.
capable of performing the normal function effectively.
"a highly competent surgeon"
"an infinitely competent mother of three"
"she spoke quite competent French"
"the governor was not the competent authority to deal with the matter"
Her drawing is competent, but her composition is poor.她的画有功力，但布局欠佳。
She was declared mentally competent to stand trial.她被宣告有接受审判的精神能力。
He is competent enough to fill that position.他完全胜任那个职位。
Is Mary competent as a teacher?玛丽胜任教师的工作吗？
We know you are competent in doing this job.我们知道你可以胜任这项工作。

competition

[ˌkɒmpə'tɪʃn], [ˌkɑːmpə'tɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 竞争；比赛
the activity or condition of competing.
an event or contest in which people compete.
the person or people with whom one is competing, especially in a commercial or sporting arena; the opposition.
interaction between organisms, populations, or species, in which birth, growth and death depend on gaining a share of a limited environmental resource.
"there is fierce competition between banks"
"a beauty competition"
"I walked around to check out the competition"
Everyone in modern society faces keen competitions.现代社会的每个人都面临着激烈的竞争。
To our satisfaction, he had got the first prize in the diving competition.我们满意的是,他在跳水比赛中获得了一等奖。

compiled

[kəm'paɪld], [kəm'paɪld]


Image Search
adj. 编译的
动词compile的过去式和过去分词.
produce (something, especially a list, report, or book) by assembling information collected from other sources.
collect (information) in order to produce something.
accumulate (a specified score).
(of a computer) convert (a program) into a machine-code or lower-level form in which the program can be executed.
"the local authority must compile a list of taxpayers"
"the figures were compiled from a survey of 2,000 schoolchildren"
"the 49ers have compiled a league-leading 14–2 record"
That can be used to read the code to be compiled.可用于读取要编译的代码。
A native image is a file containing compiled processor-specific machine code.本机映像是包含已编译的处理器特定的机器码的文件。

complement

['kɒmplɪment], ['kɑːmplɪment]


Image Search
vt. 相辅相成
n. 补足物；补语；余角
a thing that completes or brings to perfection.
a number or quantity of something, especially that required to make a group complete.
the number of people required to crew a ship.
the amount in degrees by which a given angle is less than 90°.
the members of a set that are not members of a given subset.
one or more words, phrases, or clauses governed by a verb (or by a nominalization or a predicative adjective) that complete the meaning of the predicate.
(in systemic grammar) an adjective or noun that has the same reference as either the subject (as mad in he is mad ) or the object (as mad in he drove her mad ).
a group of proteins present in blood plasma and tissue fluid which combine with an antigen–antibody complex to bring about the lysis of foreign cells.
add to (something) in a way that enhances or improves it; make perfect.
add to or make complete.
"the libretto proved a perfect complement to the music"
"at the moment we have a full complement of staff"
"almost half the ship's complement of 322 were wounded"
"a classic blazer complements a look that's stylish or casual"
"the proposals complement the incentives already available"
This wine complements the food perfectly.用这种酒配这种菜肴最妙不过了。
His business skill complements her flair for design.他的经营技巧和她的设计才能相辅相成。
A wine is a complement to a good meal.美食加美酒才算完备。
In the sentence 'I'm angry', 'angry' is the complement.在I'm angry一句中,angry是补语。

complex

['kɒmpleks], [kəm'pleks]


Image Search
adj. 复杂的；合成的；复合的
n. 综合体；复合体；[医]综合症状；[心]情结
consisting of many different and connected parts.
not easy to analyze or understand; complicated or intricate.
denoting or involving numbers or quantities containing both a real and an imaginary part.
denoting an ion or molecule in which one or more groups are linked to a metal atom by coordinate bonds.
a group of similar buildings or facilities on the same site.
a group or system of different things that are linked in a close or complicated way; a network.
a related group of emotionally significant ideas that are completely or partly repressed and that cause psychic conflict leading to abnormal mental states or behavior.
a disproportionate concern or anxiety about something.
an ion or molecule in which one or more groups are linked to a metal atom by coordinate bonds.
any loosely bonded species formed by the association of two molecules.
make (an atom or compound) form a complex with another.
"a complex network of water channels"
"a complex personality"
"a new apartment complex"
"a complex of mountain roads"
"there's no point having a complex about losing your hair"
"cross-linked protein-DNA complexes"
"the DNA was complexed with the nuclear extract"
It was a complex problem.这是一个复杂的问题。
This enhances the complex flavors and bouquet of the wine.这加强了酒的合成的味道。
Complex briary fruit with smoldering oak.有复合的水果香和烟熏橡木香。
They also provide composable functionality required to support complex, large-scale systems.并提供可复合的功能以支持复杂的大规模系统。
Libraries are great complexes of tiny items.图书馆是细小类目的大综合体。
The synaptonemal complex is protein in nature.联合复合体实质上是蛋白质。
An inferiority complex is very harmful to you and is the greatest obstacle .自卑心是最伤害自己的，是最大的障碍。

complexity

[kəm'pleksəti], [kəm'pleksəti]


Image Search
n. 复杂；复杂性；复杂的事物
the state or quality of being intricate or complicated.
a factor involved in a complicated process or situation.
"an issue of great complexity"
"the complexities of family life"
I often reflect on the beauty and complexity of life.我们经常思考人生的美丽与复杂。
We are facing a problem of great complexity.我们正面对着一个极复杂的问题。

compliant

[kəm'plaɪənt], [kəm'plaɪənt]


Image Search
adj. 适用的；顺从的
inclined to agree with others or obey rules, especially to an excessive degree; acquiescent.
meeting or in accordance with rules or standards.
having the property of compliance.
"good-humored, eagerly compliant girls"
"the systems are Y2K compliant"
Future versions will be fully compliant with the industry standard.今后的版本将完全符合工业标准的要求。
For years I had tried to be a compliant and dutiful wife.几年来,我努力做一名顺从和尽职尽职的妻子。

complicate

['kɒmplɪkeɪt], ['kɑːmplɪkeɪt]


Image Search
v. 使复杂化；使起纠纷
adj. 复杂的
make (something) more difficult or confusing by causing it to be more complex.
introduce complications in (an existing condition).
"middlemen can complicate the process"
"smoking may complicate pregnancy"
There is no need to complicate matters.没有必要使问题复杂化。
He always likes to complicate simple matters.他总喜欢把简单的事情复杂化。
This text is more complicate than we can imagine.这篇课文比我们想象的还要复杂。
My brother can understand the most complicate circuit diagrams.再复杂的线路图哥哥都能看懂。

complicit

[kəm'plɪsɪt], [kəm'plɪsɪt]


Image Search
adj. 同谋的；串通一气的
involved with others in an illegal activity or wrongdoing.
"all of these people are complicit in some criminal conspiracy"
What has been said is that arming and abetting an oil-rich government that slaughters its own people makes one complicit in genocide.所指责的是武装和教唆一个屠杀自己人民产油国政府，这样的行为就使中国在种族屠杀问题上有了同谋的嫌疑。
Lenders were, of course, complicit, happily issuing high-priced loans to people with little or no hope of repaying them.当然贷款人是和经纪人串通一气的，它们乐于向那些几乎不可能回头的客户发放高息贷款。
In Japan,the government was deeply complicit in puffing up the market and complicit,too, in hiding the ensuing mess for years.而在日本，长期以来，政府串通一气的夸大市场表现，并对随之而来的危机视而不见。

comply

[kəm'plaɪ], [kəm'plaɪ]


Image Search
vi. 顺从；遵照；答应
(of a person or group) act in accordance with a wish or command.
(of an article) meet specified standards.
"we are unable to comply with your request"
"all secondhand furniture must comply with the new standards"
She was told to pay the fine, but refused to comply.通知她交纳罚款，但她拒不服从。
He was willing to comply with my proposal.他愿意顺从我的建议。
Everyone should comply with the law.每个人都应该遵守法律。
Is it our duty to comply with his requests?我们有义务满足他的要求吗?
I am sorry I am unable to comply with your request.很抱歉，我不能答应你的请求。

components

[kəm'pəʊnənt], [kəm'poʊnənt]


Image Search
n. 零组件；成分
a part or element of a larger whole, especially a part of a machine or vehicle.
each of two or more forces, velocities, or other vectors acting in different directions which are together equivalent to a given vector.
"stereo components"
Some of the components are now sourced in Hongkong.现在有些组件是由香港提供的。
New fuel-cell components will revolutionize the auto industry.新的燃料电池零组件将为汽车业带来大变革。
A chemist can seperate a medicine into its components.化学家能把一种药物的各种成分分解出来。
It is vital to know the accurate components of an indicator.知道有关指标是由哪些成分组成也非常重要。
Life is complex. It has real and imaginary components .生活是复杂的，包含了真实和想象的成分。

composure

[kəm'pəʊʒə(r)], [kəm'poʊʒər]


Image Search
n. 镇静；沉着
the state or feeling of being calm and in control of oneself.
"she was struggling to regain her composure"
Keep calm; don't lose your composure.保持镇静，不要惊慌失措。
She recovered her composure and smiled.她恢复了镇静，笑了笑。
He could see that she was struggling to preserve her composure.他看出她是竭力故作镇定。
He showed great composure in difficult situations.他在困难环境中表现得极沉着。

compounds

['kɒmpaʊnd], ['kɑːmpaʊnd]


Image Search
n. 化合物；复合词；复合物
n. 院子(用围墙圈起来的场地）
adj. 化合的；【语】（词语等）复合的；【植】复合的；【动】群体的
vt. 混合；调合；使严重；私了；【经】以复利计算
vi. 妥协
a thing that is composed of two or more separate elements; a mixture.
a substance formed from two or more elements chemically united in fixed proportions.
a word made up of two or more existing words, such as steamship.
make up (a composite whole); constitute.
mix or combine (ingredients or constituents).
calculate (interest) on previously accumulated interest.
make (something bad) worse; intensify the negative aspects of.
forbear from prosecuting (a felony) in exchange for money or other consideration.
settle (a debt or other matter) in exchange for money or other consideration.
an open area enclosed by a fence, for example around a factory or large house or within a prison.
"the air smelled like a compound of diesel and gasoline fumes"
"a compound of hydrogen and oxygen"
"a dialect compounded of Spanish and Dutch"
"yellow pastas compounded with lemon zest or saffron"
"the yield at which the interest is compounded"
"I compounded the problem by trying to make wrong things right"
"he compounded the case with the defendant for a cash payment"
Water is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen.水是氢和氧的化合物。
'Bus conductor', 'dark-haired' and 'policeman' are compounds.bus conductor,dark-haired和policeman都是复合词。
Medicines are usually compounds.药品通常是复合物。
All prisoners were frog-marched (out) into the compound.犯人都被迫反剪双臂(出来)进入院子。
"Fingerprint" is a compound word.“Fingerprint”（指纹）是一个复合词。
Rose is a plant with compound leaves.玫瑰是复叶植物。
He compounded various ingredients into an effective drug.他将各种成分混合成一种有效的药物。
I ran out of petrol and then, to compound the felony, I found that I'd got a flat tyre.我的汽油用完了，然而使事情更糟的是，我发现有一只车胎爆破了。
to compound a felony对重罪案私了(不予起诉)
My bank compounds interests semiannually.我的银行以半年为单位计算复利。
He compounded with his creditors for a remission of what he owed.他和他的债权人谈妥免除其债务。
He compounded with the house owner for the rent.他同房主就租金之事作了妥协。

comprehensive

[ˌkɒmprɪ'hensɪv], [ˌkɑːmprɪ'hensɪv]


Image Search
adj. 全面的；广泛的；综合的；理解的
complete; including all or nearly all elements or aspects of something.
of large content or scope; wide-ranging.
(of automobile insurance) providing coverage for most risks, including damage to the policyholder's own vehicle.
an examination testing a student's command of a special field of knowledge.
relating to understanding.
a secondary school catering to children of all abilities from a given area.
"a comprehensive list of sources"
"a comprehensive collection of photographs"
"comprehensive and collision insurance"
The reporter has made a comprehensive report.记者已做了全面的报道。
She has a comprehensive grasp of the subject.她已全面掌握了这一学科。
Applying the most comprehensive metal is iron.应用最广泛的金属是铁。
We have a rather comprehensive subway system here.我们这儿有相当广泛的地铁系统。
He was educated at the local comprehensive school.他曾在地区的综合中学受教育。
This book should be adapted to the comprehensive ability of the freshmen.应该将本书改写一下,以便适合新生的理解能力。

compress

['kɒmpres], ['kɑːmpres]


Image Search
vt. 压缩；压榨
n. [医]敷布
flatten by pressure; squeeze; press.
be squeezed or pressed together or into a smaller space.
squeeze or press (two things) together.
express in a shorter form; abridge.
alter the form of (data) to reduce the amount of storage necessary.
having a narrow shape as if flattened, especially sideways.
a pad of absorbent material pressed onto part of the body to relieve inflammation or stop bleeding.
"the skirt can be folded and compressed into a small bag"
"the land is sinking as the soil compresses"
"Violet compressed her lips together grimly"
"in this chapter we compress into summary form the main findings"
"most sea snakes have a compressed tail"
"a cold compress"
Compress this clay into a small ball.把这块粘土压缩成一个小球。
Click the picture that you want to compress.单击要压缩的图片。

comprise

[kəm'praɪz], [kəm'praɪz]


Image Search

consist of; be made up of.

"the country comprises twenty states"
"this single breed comprises 50 percent of the Swiss cattle population"
This month's figures are comprised in the total.这个月的数字已包含在总数之内。
Fifteen separate republics comprised the Soviet Union.苏联由十五个加盟共和国组成。
Fifty states comprise the Union.五十个州组成美国。
Twelve departments comprise this university.12个系组成了这所大学。
The chapters that comprise the first part of the novel are especially good.构成那部小说开头部分的几章特别好。
A cricket team is comprised of eleven players.一个板球队由11名队员组成。
The company will comprise the flash memory units of Intel and STMicro.新公司由英特尔和意法半导体的闪存部门组成。

compromise

['kɒmprəmaɪz], ['kɑːmprəmaɪz]


Image Search
n. 妥协；折衷；折衷案；和解
vt. 妥协处理；危害
vi. 妥协，和解；让步
an agreement or a settlement of a dispute that is reached by each side making concessions.
a middle state between conflicting opinions or actions reached by mutual concession or modification.
the acceptance of standards that are lower than is desirable.
settle a dispute by mutual concession.
settle (a dispute) by mutual concession.
accept standards that are lower than is desirable.
weaken (a reputation or principle) by accepting standards that are lower than is desirable.
bring into disrepute or danger by indiscreet, foolish, or reckless behavior.
cause to become vulnerable or function less effectively.
"an ability to listen to two sides in a dispute, and devise a compromise acceptable to both"
"a compromise between commercial appeal and historical interest"
"sexism should be tackled without compromise"
"in the end we compromised and deferred the issue"
"I should compromise the matter with my father"
"we were not prepared to compromise on safety"
"commercial pressures could compromise safety"
"situations in which his troops could be compromised"
"yo-yo dieting can compromise your immune system"
He did it without compromise of his dignity.他做这事而不损及他的尊严。
The agreement is a compromise, not a sell-out.这个协议是双方妥协的产物而不是一方让步。
After some discussion we arrive at a compromise.经过一番讨论之后，我们达成一项折衷方案。
Or are we ready to compromise our faith?或者，我们准备好了在信仰上折衷吗？
With this increased awareness, attackers are finding it more difficult to compromise systems at the network level.由于对这些认识得越来越清楚，攻击者发现在网络级上危害系统更加困难。
Build the disorder that does not have the market to compromise project quality forthrightly.建没市场的混乱直接地危害工程质量。
They found it wiser to compromise with her.他们觉得与她妥协更明智。
The agreement is a compromise, not a sell-out.这个协议是双方妥协的产物而不是一方让步。
The agreement is a compromise, not a sell-out.这个协议是双方妥协的产物而不是一方让步。
I think we'd better reach a compromise.我认为我们最好相互让步。

Image Search
n. 电脑；计算机
an electronic device for storing and processing data, typically in binary form, according to instructions given to it in a variable program.
a person who makes calculations, especially with a calculating machine.

This computer company was established last year.这家电脑公司是去年成立的。

I am a computer operator.我是一名计算机操作人员。
We should be watchful of computer viruses.我们应该警惕计算机病毒。
We make copies of our computer disks as a safeguard against accidents.我们复制了计算机磁盘以防意外。

concentration

[ˌkɒnsen'treɪʃən], [ˌkɒnsen'treɪʃən]


Image Search
n. 集中；专心；浓度
the action or power of focusing one's attention or mental effort.
dealing with one particular thing above all others.
a close gathering of people or things.
the action of gathering together closely.
the relative amount of a given substance contained within a solution or in a particular volume of space; the amount of solute per unit volume of solution.
the action of strengthening a solution by the removal of water or other diluting agent or by the selective accumulation of atoms or molecules.
"frowning in concentration"
"concentration on the needs of the young can mean that the elderly are forgotten"
"the largest concentration of Canada geese on earth"
"the concentration of power"
"the gas can collect in dangerous concentrations"
The tennis players need total concentration during play.网球运动员在比赛中需要全神贯注。
Stress and tiredness often result in a lack of concentration.紧张和疲劳常使人精神不集中。
Concentration is essential if you want to do a good job.如果你想把事情做好,专心是必要的。
His area of concentration is economics.他专心研究经济学。
Check oxygen concentration by a refractometer.用折射仪测量一下氧气的浓度。
Titanium is useful at low concentration only.钛只在低浓度时起作用。

The two countries are reported to have concluded a military convention.据报导,这两个国家已缔结军事协定。

So far no correct conclusion has arrived at.到目前为止,还没有得出任何正确的结论。

conduct

[kən'dʌkt], [kən'dʌkt]


Image Search
n. 行为；举动；品行
v. 引导；指挥；管理
vt. 导电；传热
the manner in which a person behaves, especially on a particular occasion or in a particular context.
the action or manner of managing an activity or organization.
the action of leading; guidance.
organize and carry out.
lead or guide (someone) to or around a particular place.
transmit (a form of energy such as heat or electricity) by conduction.
direct the performance of (a piece of music or a musical ensemble).
behave in a specified way.
"the conduct of the police during the riot"
"his conduct of the campaign"
"traveling through the world under the conduct of chance"
"in the second trial he conducted his own defense"
"he conducted us through his personal gallery of the Civil War"
"heat is conducted to the surface"
"my first attempt to conduct a great work"
"he conducted himself with the utmost propriety"
Your conduct is not consistent with what you say.你的言行不一致。
His behavior transgressed the unwritten rules of social conduct.他的行为违反了不成文的社交规范。
His conduct roused the suspicion of the police.他的举动引起了警察的怀疑。
He has good conduct.他品行端正。
A man of irreproachable conduct commands the respect of others.品行端正的人,受人尊敬。
The guide conducted us around the ruins of the ancient city.导游引导我们游览了古城废墟。
The visitors were conducted over the factory.参观者被引导到工厂的各处去参观。
Who is conducting the orchestra tonight?谁指挥今晚的管弦乐队呢?
They hired agents to conduct their company.他们雇请代理人来管理他们的公司。
As to softwares for management, they can aid people to conduct scientific management.管理软件可以帮助人们进行科学的管理。
Most metals can conduct electricity.大多数金属能导电。
Most plastics do not readily conduct heat or electricity.大多数塑料不易导电导热。
Metal conducts heat better than wood.金属传热性能比木头好。
Copper is a good medium for conducting heat.铜是传热的良导体。

confine

[kən'faɪn], [kən'faɪn]


Image Search
vt. 限制；禁闭
n. 范围；界限；约束；限制
keep or restrict someone or something within certain limits of (space, scope, quantity, or time).
restrain or forbid someone from leaving (a place).
(of a person) be unable to leave (one's bed, home, or a wheelchair) because of illness or disability.
(of a woman) remain in bed for a period before, during, and after the birth of a child.
the borders or boundaries of a place, especially with regard to their restricting freedom of movement.
the limits or restrictions of something abstract, especially a subject or sphere of activity.
"he does not confine his message to politics"
"the troops were confined to their barracks"
"he was confined to bed for four days with a bad dose of flu"
"she was confined for nearly a month"
"they were cramped within the confines of a little cabin"
"the narrow confines of political life"
I wish the speaker would confine himself to the subject.我希望演说者不要离题。
I am sick, I have to confine to bed.我病了，我得卧床休息。
The thief was confined in a prison.窃贼被关押在监狱里。
Is it cruel to confine a bird in a cage?把鸟关在笼子里残忍不残忍?
This is outside the confines of human knowledge.这超出了人类知识范畴。
The refiner defined a definite confine with her fine finger.提炼者用她精细的手指定义了一个明确的界限。
Our first example of confining waves will be to confine a wave at one boundary.约束波的第一例子是使波动在一个界面上受到限制。
It will use magnetic fields to confine hydrogen isotopes and heat them to hundreds of millions of degrees Celcius.它利用磁场约束氢的同位素并将其加热到数亿摄氏度。
The murderer was placed in the confine.杀人犯被监禁了。

confined

[kən'faɪnd], [kən'faɪnd]


Image Search
adj. 被限制的；狭窄的；在分娩中的
动词confine的过去式和过去分词.
(of a space) restricted in area or volume; cramped.
keep or restrict someone or something within certain limits of (space, scope, quantity, or time).
restrain or forbid someone from leaving (a place).
(of a person) be unable to leave (one's bed, home, or a wheelchair) because of illness or disability.
(of a woman) remain in bed for a period before, during, and after the birth of a child.
"wear a dust mask and goggles when soldering in confined spaces"
"he does not confine his message to politics"
"the troops were confined to their barracks"
"he was confined to bed for four days with a bad dose of flu"
"she was confined for nearly a month"
Confined waves have definite frequencies.被限制的波具有确定的频率。
They can serve as an internal reservoir to entrap matter from the outer diluted continuous phase into the inner confined space.他们可以提供一个内部储藏处使物质由外在稀薄的连续相进入被限制的内相。
Here the river is confined in a narrow channel.这条河在这里流入狭窄的河床。
In addition, it suggested that the genetic germplasms for sugarbeet breeding were very confined.从分子水平上进一步证明了我国掩甜菜育种中存在的遗传材料基础狭窄的问题。

confirm

[kən'fɜːm], [kən'fɜːrm]


Image Search
v. 证实；批准；确定
establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed, suspected, or feared to be the case).
state with assurance that a report or fact is true.
reinforce someone in (an opinion, belief, or feeling).
make (a provisional arrangement or appointment) definite.
make (something, especially a person's appointment to a position or an agreement) formally valid; ratify.
formally declare (someone) to be appointed to a particular position.
administer the religious rite of confirmation to.
"if these fears are confirmed, the outlook for the economy will be dire"
"he confirmed that the general was in the hands of the rebels"
"he fueled his misogyny by cultivating women who confirmed him in this view"
"Mr. Baker's assistant telephoned to confirm his appointment with the chairman"
"the organization has confirmed the appointment of Mr. Collins as managing director"
"he was confirmed as the new peace envoy"
"he had been baptized and confirmed"
His letter confirmed everything.他的信证实了一切。
The treaty was confirmed by the president.条约已被总统批准。
Could you confirm the dispatch date?您可以确定发货日期吗?

confirmed

[kən'fɜːmd], [kən'fɜːrmd]


Image Search
adj. 确认的；证实的；惯常的
v. 证实，确认（动词confirm的过去式和过去分词形式）
(of a person) firmly established in a particular habit, belief, or way of life and unlikely to change.
establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed, suspected, or feared to be the case).
state with assurance that a report or fact is true.
reinforce someone in (an opinion, belief, or feeling).
make (a provisional arrangement or appointment) definite.
make (something, especially a person's appointment to a position or an agreement) formally valid; ratify.
formally declare (someone) to be appointed to a particular position.
administer the religious rite of confirmation to.
"a confirmed bachelor"
"if these fears are confirmed, the outlook for the economy will be dire"
"he confirmed that the general was in the hands of the rebels"
"two recent experiences have confirmed me in this view"
"Mr. Baker's assistant telephoned to confirm his appointment with the chairman"
"the organization has confirmed the appointment of Mr. Collins as managing director"
"he was confirmed as the new peace envoy"
"he had been baptized and confirmed"
There have been eight confirmed cases of the disease.这个疾病已有八起确认的病例。
L. Peter confirmed prophecies concerning Jesus.彼得证实了关于耶稣的预言。
I. Paul confirmed Luke's testimony as Scripture.保罗被证实的卢克的证词作为圣经。
He'll never get married; he's a confirmed bachelor.他永远不会结婚，因为他过惯了单身生活。
The news confirmed my resolution.这消息加强了我的决心。
Our suppositions were fully confirmed.我们猜测的事实已全部证实。
The new minister will be confirmed in office by the Queen.新的部长将由女王批准任职。

confiscate

['kɒnfɪskeɪt], ['kɒnfɪsˌkeɪt]


Image Search
v. 没收；充公
take or seize (someone's property) with authority.
take (a possession, especially land) as a penalty and give it to the public treasury.
"the guards confiscated his camera"
"the government confiscated his property"
We'll have to confiscate this object.我们要没收这些物品。
The present policy of our Party is still to reduce rents, not to confiscate land.目前我党方针，仍然是减租而不是没收土地。

conflict

['kɒnflɪkt], ['kɑːnflɪkt]


Image Search
n. 冲突；战斗；矛盾；斗争
vi. 冲突；抵触；争执
a serious disagreement or argument, typically a protracted one.
a prolonged armed struggle.
an incompatibility between two or more opinions, principles, or interests.
a condition in which a person experiences a clash of opposing wishes or needs.
be incompatible or at variance; clash.
having or showing confused and mutually inconsistent feelings.
"the eternal conflict between the sexes"
"overseas conflicts"
"there was a conflict between his business and domestic life"
"parents' and children's interests sometimes conflict"
"my feelings are so conflicted that I hardly know how to answer"
Both sides suffered heavy casualties in the border armed conflict.在这次边界武装冲突中双方都遭到了重大伤亡。
He was wounded in the conflict.他在战斗中负伤。
This is an irreconcilable conflict.这是一个不可调和的矛盾。
He's got involved in a political conflict he can't extricate himself from.他陷在一场政治斗争中不能脱身。
Your interests conflict with mine.你的利益和我的冲突。
The hours of those two exams conflict.那两门测验的钟点互有抵触。
John often comes into conflict with his boss.约翰经常和他的老板发生争执。
A careless move may well trigger an all new debate and conflict.一不小心，还可能引发全新的争执和冲突。

conform

[kən'fɔːm], [kən'fɔːrm]


Image Search
v. 使一致；遵从
comply with rules, standards, or laws.
(of a person) behave according to socially acceptable conventions or standards.
be similar in form or type; agree.
"the kitchen does not conform to hygiene regulations"
"the pressure to conform"
"the countryside should conform to a certain idea of the picturesque"
His ideas do not conform to mine.他的想法和我的不一致。
He doesn't conform to the usual stereotype of the city businessman with a dark suit and rolled umbrella.他不像典型的城市商人那样，穿一身深色的套服、 带一把收好的雨伞。
She refused to conform to the normal social conventions.她拒绝遵从正常的社会习俗。
She left home to escape the pressure to conform to her family's way of life.她离家出走以求摆脱她家生活方式对她的束缚。
Students are required to conform to the rules.学生被要求遵守规则。

conformity

[kən'fɔːmɪtɪ], [kən'fɔːmətɪ]


Image Search
n. 一致；符合；遵守
compliance with standards, rules, or laws.
behavior in accordance with socially accepted conventions or standards.
compliance with the practices of the Church of England.
similarity in form or type; agreement in character.
(of strata in contact) a continuous sequence of deposits, typically in parallel strata.
"conformity to regulations"
"loyalty to one's party need not imply unquestioning conformity"
"these changes are intended to ensure conformity between all schemes"
His behavior was in conformity with his ideals.他的行为与他的理想一致。
Houses have to be built in conformity with local codes.房子一定要造的符合当地法规。
His conformity was only pretending.他的遵从只是一种假像。
We should act in conformity with the rules.我们应该依照规定行事。
I went to the place in conformity with your instructions.依照你的指示我去了那个地方。

confound

[kən'faʊnd], [kən'faʊnd]


Image Search
vt. 使困惑；混淆；挫败；诅咒
cause surprise or confusion in (someone), especially by acting against their expectations.
prove (a theory, expectation, or prediction) wrong.
defeat (a plan, aim, or hope).
overthrow (an enemy).
mix up (something) with something else so that the individual elements become difficult to distinguish.
used to express anger or annoyance.
"the inflation figure confounded economic analysts"
"the rise in prices confounded expectations"
"we will confound these tactics by the pressure groups"
"'nuke' is now a cooking technique, as microwave radiation is confounded with nuclear radiation"
"oh, confound it, where is the thing?"
Don't confound the means with the ends.不要把手段和目的混淆起来。
To confound two things means not to be able to tell them apart.混淆两件事物的意思是说没能把它们区分开来。

confront

[kən'frʌnt], [kən'frʌnt]


Image Search
vt. 对抗；遭遇；面临
meet (someone) face to face with hostile or argumentative intent.
face up to and deal with (a problem or difficult situation).
compel (someone) to face or consider something, especially by way of accusation.
(of a problem, difficulty, etc.) present itself to (someone) so that dealing with it cannot be avoided.
appear or be placed in front of (someone) so as to unsettle or threaten.
"300 policemen confronted an equal number of union supporters"
"we knew we couldn't ignore the race issue and decided we'd confront it head on"
"Tricia confronted him with her suspicions"
"post-czarist Russia was confronted with a Ukrainian national movement"
"we were confronted with pictures of moving skeletons"
We must confront future with optimism.我们必须乐观地面对未来。
You must confront your problems.你必须面对自己的问题。
It's no use to confront your boss.对抗你的老板是没有用的。
A soldier often has to confront danger.士兵常常要身临险境。
Confronted by an angry crowd, the police retreated.警察面对愤怒的人群只好后撤了。
The difficulties that confront us seem insuperable.我们面临的困难似乎是不可克服的。

congenial

[kən'dʒiːniəl], [kən'dʒiːniəl]


Image Search
adj. 同性质的；适意的；趣味相同的；友善的
(of a person) pleasant because of a personality, qualities, or interests that are similar to one's own.
(of a thing) pleasant or agreeable because suited to one's taste or inclination.
"his need for some congenial company"
"he went back to a climate more congenial to his cold stony soul"
No fuss was made in my day if a new writer took from an old one whatever material he found congenial.在我那个时代，如果一个新作家从一个老作家的作品中摘取了他能用的合适材料，并不受到反对。
In the next year he obtained, through the good offices of an old friend, a post with a publishing firm which, though not highly paid, he found more congenial.第二年，通过一个老朋友帮忙，他在一家出版公司谋到一个职位，薪水虽不高，却更令他感到惬意。
They are of congenial temper.他们的性情相投。
I found him very congenial.我发现他跟人很合得来。

conglomerate

[kən'ɡlɒmərət], [kən'ɡlɑːmərət]


Image Search
n. 联合企业；密集体；城郊混合区；[地]砾岩
adj. 聚成一团的；成簇的
vt. 使聚集；使结成；结合
a number of different things or parts that are put or grouped together to form a whole but remain distinct entities.
a large corporation formed by the merging of separate and diverse firms.
a coarse-grained sedimentary rock composed of rounded fragments (> 2 mm) within a matrix of finer grained material.
relating to a conglomerate, especially a large corporation.
gather together into a compact mass.
form a conglomerate by merging diverse businesses.
"the Earth is a specialized conglomerate of organisms"
"a media conglomerate"
"the sediments vary from coarse conglomerate to fine silt and clay"
"conglomerate businesses"
"atoms that conglomerate at the center"
An American conglomerate holds a major share in the company.一家美国的大联合企业持有该公司的大部分股份。
The firm has been taken over by an American conglomerate.该公司已被美国一企业集团接管。
The house was a conglomerate of architectural styles.这幢房子是多种建筑风格的综合。
Sandstone and conglomerate are the consolidated equivalent of sand and gravel.砂岩和砾岩分别是砂和砾石固结的产物。
A large number of people conglomerated round her.在她周围聚集了一大群人。

conniving

[kə'naɪv], [kə'naɪv]


Image Search
v. 共谋；默许；纵容
given to or involved in conspiring to do something immoral, illegal, or harmful.
secretly allow (something considered immoral, illegal, wrong, or harmful) to occur.
conspire to do something considered immoral, illegal, or harmful.
"a heartless and conniving person"
"you have it in your power to connive at my escape"
"the government had connived with security forces in permitting murder"
We want to let to benefit the customer and connive development.我们就是要做到让利于客户
The student tried to connive with her friend to cheat in the examination.那个学生企图和她的朋友串谋考试作弊。
Some government officials connive at graft.有些政府官员对贪污受贿视而不见。
The prisoners paid the guards to connive at their escape.囚犯们贿赂看守，使看守默许他们越狱。
Some policemen connive at gambling.有些警察纵容赌博。

consensus

[kən'sensəs], [kən'sensəs]


Image Search
n. 一致；同意；共识
general agreement.
"a consensus of opinion among judges"
The two parties have reached a consensus.这两个政党达成了一致意见。
It would be a good idea to predict which proposal is most likely to achieve consensus.不妨研究一下哪项提案最有可能获得一致同意。
Yet the events of the past two years have called that consensus in question.然而,过去两年来发生的各种事件使人们对这一共识产生了疑虑。

consent

[kən'sent], [kən'sent]


Image Search
n. 同意；赞成
v. 同意；答应
permission for something to happen or agreement to do something.
give permission for something to happen.
agree to do something.
"no change may be made without the consent of all the partners"
"he consented to a search by a detective"
"he had consented to serve on the panel"
My father will never give his consent to our marriage.我父亲决不会同意我们的婚姻的。
By the common consent of critics, Shakespeare is the prince of character delineators.评论家一致公认莎士比亚是刻画人物的大师。
Her smile implied her consent to our proposal.她的微笑暗示她赞成我们的提议。
On the other hand, it is not likely that the few landlords from the upper strata of the Miao nationality will consent to their demand.但是这样的要求，可能苗族上层少数地主分子不赞成。
I'm sure he wouldn't consent我确信他不会同意。
His father would not consent to his leaving school.他的父亲不会同意他放弃学业。
I agree with you, but yet I can't consent.我同意你的意见, 但是我不能答应。
Her father reluctantly consented to the marriage.她父亲勉强答应了这桩婚姻。

consequence

['kɒnsɪkwəns], ['kɑːnsəkwens]


Image Search
n. 结果；后果；重要性；影响
a result or effect of an action or condition.
importance or relevance.
social distinction.
"many have been laid off from work as a consequence of the administration's policies"
"the past is of no consequence"
"a woman of consequence"
It terrified me to contemplate the consequence of your action.一想到你行动的后果,我就感到害怕。
He studied hard, and in consequence he passed the exam.他努力学习，因此通过了考试。
Happiness is not a reward it is a consequence.幸福不是报偿，而是结果。
In consequence of his bad conduct he was dismissed.由于行为不良，他被开除了。
He is a man of great consequence.他是一个很重要的人物。
Both sides think of the point as of no consequence.双方都认为这一点不重要。
The difference is not of consequence.此差别是无关紧要的。

consequences


Image Search
