a result or effect of an action or condition.
importance or relevance.
social distinction.
"many have been laid off from work as a consequence of the administration's policies"
"the past is of no consequence"
"a woman of consequence"

conserve

[kən'sɜːv], [kən'sɜːrv]


Image Search
n. 蜜饯；果酱
v. 保存；保持；节省；用糖保存
protect (something, especially an environmentally or culturally important place or thing) from harm or destruction.
prevent the wasteful or harmful overuse of (a resource).
maintain (a quantity such as energy or mass) at a constant overall total.
retain (a particular amino acid, nucleotide, or sequence of these) unchanged in different protein or DNA molecules.
preserve (food, typically fruit) with sugar.
a sweet food made by preserving fruit with sugar; jam.
"the funds raised will help conserve endangered meadowlands"
"industry should conserve more water"
This is a recipe for strawberry conserve.这是制作草莓酱的食谱。
I was surprised to find that the strong man liked to eat conserves.我很惊讶地发现这个强壮的男人喜欢吃蜜饯。
This is a recipe for strawberry conserve.这是制作草莓酱的食谱。
We must learn to conserve what remains.我们必须学会保存那些剩余的资源。
We must conserve our forests and woodlands for future generations.我们必须为子孙后代保护森林资源。
It is important to conserve energy.节省能源十分重要。

considerable

[kən'sɪdərəbl], [kən'sɪdərəbl]


Image Search
adj. 重要的；相当大的；可观的
notably large in size, amount, or extent.
(of a person) having merit or distinction.
"a position of considerable influence"
"he was a limited, but still considerable, novelist"
The mayor is a considerable official.市长是一位重要的官员。
He is a considerable person in that college.他是那所学院相当重要的人物。
The economy was a considerable issue in the campaign.在竞选运动中经济是一个重要问题。
His remarks provoked considerable comment.他的话引起了相当大的议论。
Your work shows considerable improvement.你的工作显示出相当大的改进。
The design requires considerable modification.这个设计需要大的修改。
It is a considerable sum of money.那是一笔数量可观的钱。
He was a man of considerable wealth.他是个有可观的财富的人。

consistent

[kən'sɪstənt], [kən'sɪstənt]


Image Search
adj. 始终如一的；持续的；一致的
acting or done in the same way over time, especially so as to be fair or accurate.
unchanging in nature, standard, or effect over time.
compatible or in agreement with something.
(of an argument or set of ideas) not containing any logical contradictions.
"the parents are being consistent and firm in their reactions"
"he is their most consistent player this season"
"the injuries are consistent with falling from a great height"
"a consistent explanation"
She is a consistent girl in her feeling.在感情方面她是个始终如一的女孩。
Our aim is to ensure a consistent growth.我们的目标是确保持续的增长。
Your conduct is not consistent with what you say.你的言行不一致。

consonant

['kɒnsənənt], ['kɑːnsənənt]


Image Search
n. 辅音
adj. 一致的；符合的；辅音的
a basic speech sound in which the breath is at least partly obstructed and which can be combined with a vowel to form a syllable.
a letter representing a consonant.
denoting or relating to a consonant sound or letter.
in agreement or harmony with.
making a harmonious interval or chord.
"a consonant phoneme"
"the findings are consonant with other research"
"the bass is consonant with all the upper notes"
She asked me to pronounce each vowel and consonant clearly.她叫我把每个元音和辅音都清晰地发出来。
Many letters in the alphabet such as b, c, d, etc are consonants.字母表中的许多字母像b，c，d，等等都是辅音字母。
His view on the issue is consonant with mine.他对这个问题的看法和我是一致的。
The quality of this suit is not quite consonant with its price .这套衣服的质量与价钱不太相符。
English has 24 consonant phonemes.英语有24个辅音音素。

consortium

[kən'sɔːtɪəm], [kən'sɔːʃɪəm]


Image Search
n. 财团；联合；合伙
an association, typically of several business companies.
the right of association and companionship with one's husband or wife.
The aircraft will be built by a European consortium.这架飞机将由一个欧洲财团建造。
The new aircraft was developed by a European consortium.这种新飞机是一家欧洲财团出资研制的。
They want to organize a consortium of labor parties.他们想要组织一个劳工团体。
Each of the groups making up the consortium has its own scientific focus.每一个小组为协会拟订各自的关注方面。

conspicuous

[kən'spɪkjuəs], [kən'spɪkjuəs]


Image Search
adj. 显著的；显眼的；显而易见的
standing out so as to be clearly visible.
attracting notice or attention.
"he was very thin, with a conspicuous Adam's apple"
"he showed conspicuous bravery"
Lincoln is a conspicuous example of a poor boy who succeeded.林肯是一个穷苦孩子而功成名就的出色例子。
He was conspicuous for his bravery.他因骁勇而出名。
A traffic sign should be conspicuous.交通标志应该明显。
Notices shall be put in conspicuous places.要保证把布告贴在显眼的地方。
I found several conspicuous errors in his speech.我发现他的演讲中有几个显而易见的错误。

constant

['kɒnstənt], ['kɑːnstənt]


Image Search
adj. 不变的；经常的
n. 常数；恒量
occurring continuously over a period of time.
remaining the same over a period of time.
(of a person) unchangingly faithful and dependable.
a situation or state of affairs that does not change.
a quantity or parameter that does not change its value whatever the value of the variables, under a given set of conditions.
a number expressing a relation or property which remains the same in all circumstances, or for the same substance under the same conditions.
"the pain is constant"
"the company has kept its prices fairly constant"
"the condition of struggle remained a constant"
In our world nothing seems constant.在我们这个世界上似乎没有东西是永恒不变的。
The birth rate in this city is almost constant.这城市的出生率几乎是不变的。
The machinery requires constant maintenance.这些机器需要经常保养维修。
The constant friction between the young couple finally caused divorce.小夫妻俩之间经常的冲突终于导致了离婚。
The speed of light is an important constant.光速是一个重要的常数。
The size can be set only as a constant.大小只能被设置为常数。
This quantity is called the universal gas constant.这个量叫做普适气体恒量。

constitutional

[ˌkɒnstɪ'tjuːʃənl], [ˌkɒnstə'tjuːʃənəl]


Image Search
adj. 宪法的；合乎宪法的；体质的；组成的
n. 散步保健
relating to an established set of principles governing a state.
in accordance with or allowed by an established set of principles governing a state.
relating to someone's physical or mental condition.
a walk, typically one taken regularly to maintain or restore good health.
"a constitutional amendment"
"a constitutional monarchy"
"a constitutional weakness"
They have made the constitutional reform.他们已经做了宪法的修改。
The United Kingdom is a constitutional monarchy.英国是君主立宪国。
They claimed that the new law was not constitutional.他们声称这项新法律不符合宪法。
It is not constitutional to censor the press.审查新闻是违反宪法的。
He takes a constitutional every morning.他每天早上都要散步健身。

constrain

[kən'streɪn], [kən'streɪn]


Image Search
vt. 强迫；限制
compel or force (someone) toward a particular course of action.
cause to appear unnaturally forced, typically because of embarrassment.
severely restrict the scope, extent, or activity of.
bring about (something) by compulsion.
confine forcibly; imprison.
"children are constrained to work in the way the book dictates"
"he was acting in a constrained manner"
"agricultural development is considerably constrained by climate"
"Calypso in her caves constrained his stay"
I felt constrained to do what he told me.做他叫我做的事,我心里很不舒服。
She tried to constrain herself from a cough in class.上课时她竭力忍住不咳嗽。
Cold weather constrains the plant's growth.寒冷的天气抑制了植物的生长。
Don't constrain yourself only to class study.不要把自己的学习只局限于课堂。
The police used horses to constrain the crowd from violence.警察骑着马阻止那群人诉诸暴力。

constraints

[kən'streɪnt], [kən'streɪnt]


Image Search
n. 强制；被约束；拘束
a limitation or restriction.
stiffness of manner and inhibition in relations between people.
"time constraints make it impossible to do everything"
"they would be able to talk without constraint"
These constraints are summarized by Kirchhoff's laws.这些强制的约束关系可总结为基尔霍夫定律。
Often there is a choice between constraints and restraints.常常要对强制和限制进行选择。

construction

[kən'strʌkʃn], [kən'strʌkʃn]


Image Search
n. 建设；结构；建筑物；建造；构造；解释
the building of something, typically a large structure.
the building of large structures considered as an industry.
the style or method used in the building of something.
a building or other structure.
the creation or formation of an abstract entity.
an interpretation or explanation.
the arrangement of words according to syntactical rules.
"there was a skyscraper under construction"
"the mill is of brick construction"
"language plays a large part in our construction of reality"
"you could put an honest construction upon their conduct"
"sentence construction"
China is striding ahead in her economic construction.中国正在经济建设方面大步前进。
It is an object of simple construction.它是一个简单结构的物体。
The cathedral is a fantastic modern construction.那个教堂是奇特的现代建筑。
The new airport is still under construction.新机场仍在修建中。
The building was of bizarre construction.这建筑构造奇异。
This page is still under construction.此页还在构造之中。
I was inclined to put a favorable construction on his reply.我总是对他的回答作出很好的解释。

consultation

[ˌkɒnsl'teɪʃn], [ˌkɑːnsl'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 咨询；请教；协议会
the action or process of formally consulting or discussing.
a meeting with an expert or professional, such as a medical doctor, in order to seek advice.
"they improved standards in consultation with consumer representatives"
He mastered these words through the arduous consultation of the dictionary.通过勤查字典，他掌握了这些单词。
I'll call you for consultation next time I take a trip somewhere.下次我再去什么地方玩，也要打电话咨询一下。
They retired to another room for private consultation.他们退到另一房间秘密磋商。
The doctors held a consultation to decide whether an operation was necessary.医生们进行会诊，决定是否需要动手术。

consume

[kən'sjuːm], [kən'suːm]


Image Search
v. 消耗；吃喝；毁灭
eat, drink, or ingest (food or drink).
buy (goods or services).
use up (a resource).
(especially of a fire) completely destroy.
(of a feeling) absorb all of the attention and energy of (someone).
"people consume a good deal of sugar in drinks"
"these machines consume 5 percent of the natural gas in the U.S"
"the fire spread rapidly, consuming many homes"
"Carolyn was consumed with guilt"
His old car consumed much gasoline.他的旧汽车耗油很多。
Each year Americans consume a high percentage of the world's energy.每年美国人都消耗掉世界能源的很大比例
I'm sure that Chinese people consume the largest amount of rice in the world.我敢肯定,世界上中国人吃掉的大米最多。
I saw the flames consuming the whole building.我看见火焰吞噬了整栋建筑物。

consumer

[kən'sjuːmə], [kən'sjuːmə]


Image Search
n. 消费者；用户；消费品
a person who purchases goods and services for personal use.
a person or thing that eats or uses something.
"consumer demand"
"Scandinavians are the largest consumers of rye"
We need more feedback from the consumer in order to improve our goods.我们需要从消费者那里多得到些反馈信息以提高产品质量。
The price increases were passed on by the firm to the consumers.那个公司把上涨的费用都转嫁到了消费者身上。
We should adopt the consumers' suggestion.我们应该接受用户的建议。
Consumer goods production was to go up by 6.6 percent in that city.在那个城市消费品生产将增长6.6%25。
That covers many consumer products.这涉及到许多消费产品。

contact

['kɒntækt], ['kɑːntækt]


Image Search
n. 接触；联系；熟人
v. (与)联系；(与)接触
adj. 接触的
the state or condition of physical touching.
activated by or operating through physical touch.
a connection for the passage of an electric current from one thing to another, or a part or device by which such a connection is made.
contact lenses.
the state or condition of communicating or meeting.
a meeting, communication, or relationship with someone.
a person who may be communicated with for information or assistance, especially with regard to one's job.
a person who has associated with a patient with a contagious disease (and so may carry the infection).
communicate with (someone), typically in order to give or receive specific information.
touch.
"the tennis ball is in contact with the court surface for as little as 5 milliseconds"
"contact dermatitis"
"a one-way electrical contact between a metal and a semiconductor"
"Lewis and Clark came into contact with numerous river tribes"
"they have forged contacts with key people in business"
"Francie had good contacts"
"I winced as my blister contacted the floor"
The rich secluded themselves from contact with the poor.富人不肯同穷人接触。
I finally made contact with her in Paris.我终于在巴黎同她取得了联系。
She has a contact in the software industry.她在软件行业有个熟人。
Contact the police at once!立刻与警方联系！
Our patrols on all our fronts contacted no enemy today.今天我方在各条战线上的巡逻队均未遭遇敌人。
She suffers from a contact skin rash.她患上了一种接触传染性皮疹。

contaminated

[kən'tæmɪneɪtɪd], [kən'tæməneɪtɪd]


Image Search
adj. 受污染的
动词contaminate的过去式和过去分词.
make (something) impure by exposure to or addition of a poisonous or polluting substance.
"the site was found to be contaminated by radioactivity"
Four children have died after drinking the contaminated milk made by some of China's main producers.四个孩子在饮用由中国一些主要生产商的受污染的牛奶后已经死亡。
The disease is caused by ingesting food or water contaminated with a comma-shaped bacterium called Vibrio cholerae.这种疾病是由于摄取的食物或食水受污染的同一个逗号形细菌称为霍乱弧菌。

make (something) impure by exposure to or addition of a poisonous or polluting substance.
"the site was found to be contaminated by radioactivity"

contemplation

[ˌkɒntəm'pleɪʃn], [ˌkɑːntəm'pleɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 注视；沉思；打算
the action of looking thoughtfully at something for a long time.
deep reflective thought.
the state of being thought about or planned.
religious meditation.
(in Christian spirituality) a form of prayer or meditation in which a person seeks to pass beyond mental images and concepts to a direct experience of the divine.
"the road is too busy for leisurely contemplation of the scenery"
"he would retire to his room for study or contemplation"
I take greater comfort in the contemplation of eternity.在对永恒的注视之中我获得较大的安慰。
Mr. Quilp was serenely gazing at the stars, quite absorbed in celestial contemplation.奎尔普先生正在从容地注视着繁星，好象全神对着天空沉思似的。
She spent an hour in quiet contemplation.她静静地沉思了一个小时。
He has a new novel in contemplation.他打算写一部新小说。
Various kinds of studies concerning earthquake prediction are now under contemplation in the Yamasaki region.在山崎地区，现在已经打算进行地震预报的各种研究工作。

contemporary

[kən'temprəri], [kən'tempəreri]


Image Search
adj. 同时代的；当代的
n. 同时代的人；同龄人
living or occurring at the same time.
dating from the same time.
belonging to or occurring in the present.
following modern ideas or fashion in style or design.
a person or thing living or existing at the same time as another.
a person of roughly the same age as another.
"the event was recorded by a contemporary historian"
"this series of paintings is contemporary with other works in an early style"
"the tension and complexities of our contemporary society"
"contemporary art"
"he was a contemporary of Darwin"
"my contemporaries at school"
Marlowe was contemporary with Shakespeare.马洛与莎士比亚是同时代的。
He had devoted his whole life to the study of contemporary art.他把他的一生都献给了当代艺术研究。
Thackeray is a contemporary of Dickens.萨克莱跟狄更斯是同时期的人。
She and I were contemporaries at college.她和我在学院里是同学。
He is a contemporary of mine, but our experiences are completely different.他和我是同龄人，但我们的经历截然不同。

contented

[kən'tentɪd], [kən'tentɪd]


Image Search
adj. 满足的；心安的
动词content的过去式和过去分词形式.
happy and at ease.
willing to accept something; satisfied.
satisfy (someone).
accept as adequate despite wanting more or better.
"I felt warm and contented"
"I was never contented with half measures"
"nothing would content her"
"we contented ourselves with a few small purchases"
A contented person does not create progress.满足的人不能进步。
The lady looked at me with a contented smile.那位夫人带着满意的微笑看着我。
By following the steps, mothers should be able to lead a fulfilling and contented life.按照这些步骤去做,妈妈们一定会感到日子充实、心情惬意。

a state of happiness and satisfaction.

She was swollen with contentment.她感到十分满足。

context

['kɒntekst], ['kɒntekst]


Image Search
n. 上下文；环境；背景
the circumstances that form the setting for an event, statement, or idea, and in terms of which it can be fully understood and assessed.
the parts of something written or spoken that immediately precede and follow a word or passage and clarify its meaning.
"the decision was taken within the context of planned cuts in spending"
"word processing is affected by the context in which words appear"
It is usually easier to pick out the meaning of a phrase in a given context.在特定的上下文中理解一个短语的含意往往要更容易些。
In the context of the present economic crisis it seems unwise to lower taxes.鉴於当前的经济危机，降低税率似乎不妥。
This speech needs to be set in the context of Britain in the 1960s.这篇演说需要放到20世纪60年代的英国这一背景之下来看待。

contract

['kɒntrækt], ['kɑːntrækt]


Image Search
n. 合同；婚约；合约；契约
v. 缩小；订合同；缩短；感染（疾病）；招致
a written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.
the branch of law concerned with the making and observation of contracts.
an arrangement for someone to be killed by a hired assassin.
the declarer's undertaking to win the number of tricks bid with a stated suit as trump.
a formal agreement to marry.
decrease in size, number, or range.
(of a muscle) become shorter and tighter in order to effect movement of part of the body.
shorten (a word or phrase) by combination or elision.
enter into a formal and legally binding agreement.
secure specified rights or undertake specified obligations in a formal and legally binding agreement.
impose an obligation on (someone) to do something by means of a formal agreement.
arrange for work to be done by another organization.
formally enter into (a marriage).
enter into (a friendship or other relationship).
catch or develop (a disease or infectious agent).
become liable to pay (a debt).
"both parties must sign employment contracts"
"smuggling bosses routinely put out contracts on witnesses"
"South can make the contract with correct play"
"glass contracts as it cools"
"the heart is a muscle that contracts about seventy times a minute"
"“quasistellar object” was soon contracted to “quasar.”"
"the local authority will contract with a wide range of agencies to provide services"
"a buyer may contract for the right to withhold payment"
"health authorities contract a hospital to treat a specific number of patients"
"local authorities will have to contract out waste management"
"before Fanny met him, he had contracted a disastrous liaison and marriage"
"the patterns of social relationships contracted by men and women differ"
"three people contracted a killer virus"
"he contracted a debt of $3,300"
They had set a term to the contract.他们已给合同定了期限。
Families sought favourable alliances, either by marriage or contract.各个家庭通过婚姻或者婚约来建立有力的亲缘关系。
Several companies will bid for the contract.数家公司要投标争取合约。
He managed to disengage himself from the contract.他成功地为自己解除了契约义务。
The heat contracted the woollen garment.高温让羊毛衣缩小了。
We'd like to contract in on this project,if possible.如有可能，我们愿意签订合同参加这一计划。
It's an urgent business, we have no time for unnecessary consideration—please contract your inspection period!这是个紧急时间,我们没时间做多余的考虑了——请缩短你的审查期！
She has contracted a severe fever.她感染上了严重的热病。
He has contracted the habit of talking to himself.他养成了自言自语的习惯。

contradict

[ˌkɒntrə'dɪkt], [ˌkɒntrə'dɪkt]


Image Search
vt. 反驳；与 ... 矛盾
deny the truth of (a statement), especially by asserting the opposite.
assert the opposite of a statement made by (someone).
be in conflict with.
"the survey appears to contradict the industry's claims"
"he did not contradict her but just said nothing"
"that evaporation seems to contradict one of the most fundamental principles of physics"
He did not contradict his attorney's comment.他没有反驳律师的意见。
She doesn't like to contradict her husband in public.她不愿在众人面前反驳她丈夫。
Don't contradict your father.别和你父亲犟嘴。
The report contradicts what we heard yesterday.这个报道与我们昨天听到的有矛盾。
The two statements contradict each other.两种说法相互抵触。

contradiction

[ˌkɒntrə'dɪkʃn], [ˌkɑːntrə'dɪkʃn]


Image Search
n. 矛盾；反驳；否认；不一致
a combination of statements, ideas, or features of a situation that are opposed to one another.
a person, thing, or situation in which inconsistent elements are present.
the statement of a position opposite to one already made.
"the proposed new system suffers from a set of internal contradictions"
"the paradox of using force to overcome force is a real contradiction"
"the second sentence appears to be in flat contradiction of the first"
Motion itself is a contradiction.运动本身就是矛盾。
The contradiction was only apparent.那矛盾只是表面上的。
The contradiction has become apparent.矛盾表面化了。
This contradiction is hushed up .这个矛盾消除了。
The report received the following contradiction.这报告受到如下反驳意见。
he spoke as if his claims were immune to contradiction.他认为他的说法无法反驳。
Those facts admit of no contradiction.那些事实不容否认。
There seems to be a contradiction between her word and action.她的言行似乎不一致。
That's a flat contradiction of what you said before.这可和你以前说的恰恰相反。

contrary

['kɒntrəri], ['kɑːntreri]


Image Search
adj. 相反的；截然不同的；执拗的
n. 反面；相反
opposite in nature, direction, or meaning.
(of two or more statements, beliefs, etc.) opposed to one another.
(of a wind) blowing in the opposite direction to one's course; unfavorable.
(of two propositions) so related that one or neither but not both must be true.
perversely inclined to disagree or to do the opposite of what is expected or desired.
the opposite.
a contrary proposition.
"he ignored contrary advice and agreed on the deal"
"his mother had given him contrary messages"
"she is sulky and contrary where her work is concerned"
"the magazine has proved that the contrary is true"
Hot and cold are contrary terms.热与冷是相反的词语。
My sister's taste in dresses is contrary to my own.在服装方面，我妹妹的爱好和我完全不同。
Mrs. Smith is too contrary to make friends easily.史密斯太太过于固执而不易交朋友。
Cruelty is the contrary of kindness.残忍是仁慈的反面。
On the contrary,I have tons of things to do.正相反,我有一大堆事要做。

contrast

['kɒntrɑːst], ['kɑːntræst]


Image Search
n. 对比；差别；对照物
v. 对比；成对照
n. [计算机] 反差
the state of being strikingly different from something else in juxtaposition or close association.
enhancement of the apparent brightness or clarity of a design provided by the juxtaposition of different colors or textures.
the degree of difference between tones in a television picture, photograph, or other image.
the action of calling attention to notable differences.
a thing or person having qualities noticeably different from another.
differ strikingly.
compare in such a way as to emphasize differences.
"the day began cold and blustery, in contrast to almost two weeks of uninterrupted sunshine"
"use knowledge of other languages for contrast and comparison with English"
"the castle is quite a contrast to other places where the singer has performed"
"his friend's success contrasted with his own failure"
"people contrasted her with her sister"
Black and white shows a striking contrast.黑和白形成明显的对比。
There is a great contrast between good and evil.善与恶有明显的差别。
The little village was a total contrast to San Francisco.这个小村庄与圣弗朗西斯科形成强烈对照。
When you contrast their work records, Julie is clearly more qualified.对比他们的工作记录,你会发现茱莉更有能力。
The microscope image contains contrast effects.显微镜所成的图像具有反差效应。

contribution

[ˌkɒntrɪ'bjuːʃn], [ˌkɑːntrɪ'bjuːʃn]


Image Search
n. 贡献；捐款(赠)；投稿
a gift or payment to a common fund or collection.
the part played by a person or thing in bringing about a result or helping something to advance.
an article or other piece of writing submitted for publication in a collection.
"charitable contributions"
"he made a lasting contribution by designing the modern radio telescope"
Don't undervalue Jim's contribution to the research.不要低估了吉姆在研究工作中的贡献。
He has made an important contribution to the company's success.他对公司的成功作出了重要的贡献。
All contribution, however small, will be greatly appreciated.所有捐款，无论数目多么少，我们都深表感谢。
The union successfully negotiated increased employer contributions to the health benefits package.工会成功地让雇主增加对医疗福利的捐赠。

contrite

[kən'traɪt], [kən'traɪt]


Image Search
adj. 悔悟了的；后悔的；痛悔的
feeling or expressing remorse or penitence; affected by guilt.
"a broken and a contrite heart"
He was to be contrite and wish to be reconciled.他必须感到悔悟，并且希望得到赦免。
He made a contrite apology.他深表懊悔地致歉。
The look she gave Anna was guilty and contrite.她给安娜的脸色是内疚和愧悔的。
She was contrite the whole morning after her angry outburst.她发了一通脾气之后整个早上都追悔莫及。

controversial

[ˌkɒntrə'vɜːʃl], [ˌkɑːntrə'vɜːrʃl]

This is a controversial question.这是个引起争论的问题。

controversy

['kɒntrəvɜːsɪ], ['kɒntrəˌvɜːsɪ]


Image Search
n. 争议；(公开的)争论
disagreement, typically when prolonged, public, and heated.
"the announcement ended a protracted controversy"

The remark touched off a heated controversy.这句话引起了热烈的争论。
The new government appointments have caused much controversy.政府在人事上作的新的委任，引起了许多争论。

convention

[kən'venʃn], [kən'venʃn]


Image Search
n. 大会；协定；惯例；公约
a way in which something is usually done, especially within a particular area or activity.
behavior that is considered acceptable or polite to most members of a society.
an artificial bid by which a bidder tries to convey specific information about the hand to their partner.
an agreement between countries covering particular matters, especially one less formal than a treaty.
a large meeting or conference, especially of members of a political party or a particular profession.
(in the US) an assembly of the delegates of a political party to select candidates for office.
an organized meeting of enthusiasts for a television program, movie, or literary genre.
a body set up by agreement to deal with a particular issue.
"the woman who overturned so many conventions of children's literature"
"he was an upholder of convention and correct form"
"a convention of retail merchants"
"a Star Trek convention"
"the convention is a UN body responsible for the regulation of sea dumping"
The convention looms as political battle.这场大会将是一场政治角斗。
Delegates will be picked at a convention.代表将在大会上选出。
This convention results in no ambiguity.这个协定不会导致误解。
The countries all agreed to sign the convention.各国都同意签署这项协定。
The handshake is a social convention.握手是社交惯例。
Convention requires that such meetings open with prayer.惯例上要求这样的集会应当以祈祷开始。
Property Management Convention agreed receivers?物业管理公约约定啥？
We follow Geneva Convention procedures.我们遵守日内瓦公约规定的程序。

conventional

[kən'venʃənl], [kən'venʃənl]


Image Search
adj. 传统的；惯例的；常规的
based on or in accordance with what is generally done or believed.
(of a person) concerned with what is generally held to be acceptable at the expense of individuality and sincerity.
(of a work of art or literature) following traditional forms and genres.
(of weapons or power) nonnuclear.
(of a bid) intended to convey a particular meaning according to an agreed upon convention.
"a conventional morality had dictated behavior"
"conventional love poetry"
"agreement on reducing conventional forces in Europe"
Her book is a hilarious send-up of a conventional spy story.她写的书用的是取笑传统侦探小说的笔法，令人捧腹。
According to conventional wisdom, voters usually make their choice on the basis of domestic issues.按一般人在这些问题上的看法，选民常常着眼于国内问题来选择候选人。
After a conventional opening remarks, he made a brilliant speech.在一个常规的开场白后,他做了个很精彩的演讲。
I can never get a girl like that with conventional methods.我用寻常套路可永远也得不到这样的女孩。

conversely

['kɒnvɜːsli], ['kɑːnvɜːrsli]


Image Search
adv. 相反地
introducing a statement or idea which reverses one that has just been made or referred to.
"we're not going to have enough onions to last the year, while courgettes, conversely, are in a major surplus"
Conversely, defining a new class is less common, but often the crucial step.相反地，很少定义一个新的类，但这通常是关键的一步。
Conversely, when Earth and Mars are near each other, Mars looms large and bright.相反地，当地球和火星距离较近，火星看上去就显得很大很明亮。

converted

[kən'vɜːtɪd], [kən'vɜːtɪd]


Image Search
adj. 转换的；修改的
动词convert的过去式和过去分词.
(of a building) having been adapted to be suitable for a new purpose.
cause to change in form, character, or function.
change or be able to change from one form to another.
change (money, stocks, or units in which a quantity is expressed) into others of a different kind.
adapt (a building) to make it suitable for a new purpose.
transpose the subject and predicate of (a proposition) according to certain rules to form a new proposition by inference.
change one's religious faith or other beliefs.
persuade (someone) to change one's religious faith or other beliefs.
score from (a penalty kick, pass, or other opportunity) in a sport or game.
advance the ball far enough during a down to earn a first down.
score an extra point or points after having scored a touchdown by kicking a goal (one point) or running another play into the end zone (two points).
"a converted Victorian property"
"production processes that converted raw material into useful forms"
"the seating converts to a double or two single beds"
"the figures have been converted at $0.545 to the Dutch guilder"
"the space can be easily converted into a home office"
"at sixteen he converted to Catholicism"
"he was converted in his later years to the socialist cause"
"the Oilers converted on over half of their third downs"
It then compares converted text to converted search terms.然后将转换后的文字与转换后的搜索条件做比较。
I live in a converted loft.我住在一间改建的阁楼里。

convinced

[kən'vɪnst], [kən'vɪnst]


Image Search
adj. 信服的；确信的
completely certain about something.
firm in one's belief with regard to a particular cause or issue.
cause (someone) to believe firmly in the truth of something.
persuade (someone) to do something.
"she was not entirely convinced of the soundness of his motives"
"a convinced pacifist"
"Robert's expression had obviously convinced her of his innocence"
"she convinced my father to branch out on his own"
I'm quite convinced.我很相信。
I'm not convinced your idea will work, but I'll keep an open mind for the moment.我还没想通是否你的意见可行，不过我先考虑一下。
I am convinced of his honesty.我对他的诚实深信不疑。
I am not at all convinced about that.我根本没法确信此事。

convolute

['kɒnvəˌluːt], ['kɒnvəˌluːt]


Image Search
v. 盘旋；回旋
adj. 回旋状的

rolled longitudinally upon itself, as a leaf in the bud.

cooperative

[kəʊ'ɒpərətɪv], [koʊ'ɑːpərətɪv]


Image Search
adj. 合作的；协作的
n. 合作社
involving mutual assistance in working toward a common goal.
willing to be of assistance.
(of a farm, business, etc.) owned and run jointly by its members, with profits or benefits shared among them.
a farm, business, or other organization which is owned and run jointly by its members, who share the profits or benefits.
"every member has clearly defined tasks in a cooperative enterprise"
"they have been extremely considerate, polite, and cooperative"
We found him friendly and cooperative.我们感到他是友好的，乐于合作的。
They are trying to adopt a more cooperative posture.他们正试图采取更为合作的态度。
The management would like to thank the staff for being so cooperative.资方要感谢全体员工的通力合作。
The school was very cooperative when we made a film there.我们到该校拍摄影片时，获得校方的大力协助。
They decided to set up a cooperative.他们决定开办一家合作社。

coordination

[kəʊˌɔːdɪ'neɪʃn], [koʊˌɔːrdɪ'neɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 协调
the organization of the different elements of a complex body or activity so as to enable them to work together effectively.
cooperative effort resulting in an effective relationship.
the ability to use different parts of the body together smoothly and efficiently.
the linking of atoms by coordinate bonds.
"both countries agreed to intensify efforts at economic policy coordination"
"action groups work in coordination with local groups to end rainforest destruction"
"changing from one foot position to another requires coordination and balance"
These dancers have poor coordination.这些舞蹈演员协调能力不好。
Learning to drive is all a matter of coordination.学开车主要是靠协调。
Lack planning coordination can be extremely costly.规划缺乏协调，势必造成极大的浪费。
We have improved the coordination of services.我们加强了各项服务的相互配合。
He is with good coordination and a sunny smile.他非常随和，一副春风得意的样子。

cope

[kəʊp], [koʊp]


Image Search
vi. 应付；对抗；妥善处理
vt. 笼罩；盖上斗篷
n. 长袍；斗篷状物
(of a person) deal effectively with something difficult.
(of a machine or system) have the capacity to deal successfully with.
a long, loose cloak worn by a priest or bishop on ceremonial occasions.
a thing resembling or likened to a cloak.
(in building) cover (a joint or structure) with a coping.
"his ability to cope with stress"
"the roads are barely adequate to cope with the present traffic"
"the bay and the square were a seamless cope"
He was scarcely able to cope with the situation.他几乎不知道如何去应付这个局面。
I don't know how she copes with looking after her family and doing a full-time job.既要照顾家庭又要全天工作，我不知道她是如何对付的。
No one could cope with him in debate.没人能同他在辩论中对抗。
I cannot cope with such a pile of work.我无法处理这么多工作。
How do you cope with the problem of poor vision?怎样解决视力不好这一难题呢?
The cope of clouds covering the city cleared up by mid-day.笼罩城市的厚重乌云在中午时散开了。
The judge was wearing a black cope.这位法官穿著一件黑色的法衣。
The brick cope was corroded by frost damage.这个砖墙已被霜冻腐蚀了。
The cope of clouds covering the city cleared up by mid-day.笼罩城市的厚重乌云在中午时散开了。

warm and friendly.

a sweet fruit-flavored drink.

"I earned his cordial loathing"
"wine cups and fruit cordials"
By means of a few drops of strong cordial, the doctor revived the besotted corpse for a few minutes.博士滴了几滴强烈的兴奋剂，使这个没有知觉的身躯复活了几分钟。
It was a cordial affair in which Pancalli expressed his appreciation for the work carried out by Juventus in recent months.这是一次热忱的会晤，潘卡利感谢了近几个月来尤文所做的工作。
Please accept my cordial and humblest apologies.请接受我诚恳的道歉。

core

[kɔː(r)], [kɔːr]


Image Search
n. 核心；果心；要点
vt. 挖去果核
the tough central part of various fruits, containing the seeds.
the central or most important part of something.
the part of something that is central to its existence or character.
an important or unchanging group of people forming the central part of a larger body.
the dense central region of a planet, especially the nickel–iron inner part of the earth.
the central part of a nuclear reactor, which contains the fissile material.
a tiny ring of magnetic material used in a computer memory to store one bit of data, now superseded by semiconductor memories.
the inner strand of an electrical cable or rope.
the muscles of the torso, especially the lower back and abdominal area, which assist in the maintenance of good posture, balance, etc.
a piece of soft iron forming the center of an electromagnet or an induction coil.
an internal mold filling a space to be left hollow in a casting.
a cylindrical sample of rock, ice, or other material obtained by boring with a hollow drill.
a piece of flint from which flakes or blades have been removed.
denoting or relating to a figure for inflation that excludes certain items, chiefly food and energy, that are subject to sudden and temporary price fluctuations.
remove the tough central part and seeds from (a fruit).
(used as the second element of various compounds) denoting types of rock or dance music that have an aggressive presentation.
Congress of Racial Equality.
"quarter the pears, remove the cores then slice again into wedges"
"the plan has the interests of children at its core"
"nothing will strengthen your core like balancing a heavy barbell on your back or lifting one off the floor"
"core inflation was up 2.3 percent over the 12 month period"
"peel and core the pears"
"queercore"
The core of our appeal is freedom of speech.我们的要求的核心是言论自由。
He is American to the core.他是个地地道道的美国人。
He ate the plum, and threw the core away.他吃掉了李子，并扔掉了果核。
Let's get to the core of the argument.咱们进入实质性的辩论吧。
This concept is at the very core of her theory.这个概念是她理论的核心。

corresponding

[ˌkɒrə'spɒndɪŋ], [ˌkɔːrə'spɑːndɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 相当的；相应的；一致的
动词correspond的现在分词形式.
analogous or equivalent in character, form, or function; comparable.
have a close similarity; match or agree almost exactly.
be analogous or equivalent in character, form, or function.
communicate by exchanging letters.
"the corresponding Jamaican word is ‘bada’"
"the carved heads described in the poem correspond to those in the drawing"
"the Inuit month corresponding to December was called Aagjulirvik"
"Margaret corresponded with him until his death"
You will be punished in a way corresponding to your profession.你们将受到相当于你的职业的处罚。
Sales are up 10% on the corresponding period last year.销售额和去年同时期相比增加了10%25。
Investment in the subway will bring a corresponding improvement in services.对地铁进行投资将使服务得到相应的提升。
The corresponding results have a good agreement with the reactor dynamics.得到了与相应反应堆动力学很一致的结果。
Instead, each dataset has a unique label assigned, usually a plain-text name to identify the corresponding object in the coordinate grid.与此相反，每一个数据集都有唯一一个给定的标签，经常是平常的文本名，在坐标格子中用来识别一致的事物。

corroboration

[kəˌrɒbə'reɪʃn], [kəˌrɒbə'reɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 证实；支持；证据
evidence that confirms or supports a statement, theory, or finding; confirmation.
"there is no independent corroboration for this"
In corroboration of his story (ie to give support to it) he produced a signed statement from his employer.为了进一步证明他所说的是事实，他出示了一份雇主签了字的文件。
His possession of the gun is corroboration of his guilt.他藏有枪是他犯罪的又一证据。

counterfeit

['kaʊntəfɪt], ['kaʊntərfɪt]


Image Search

pretended; sham.
a fraudulent imitation of something else; a forgery.
imitate fraudulently.
pretend to feel or possess (an emotion or quality).
resemble closely.
"two men were remanded on bail on a charge of passing counterfeit $10 bills"
"a counterfeit image of reality"
"he knew the tapes to be counterfeits"
"my signature is extremely hard to counterfeit"
"no pretense could have counterfeited such terror"
"sleep counterfeited Death so well"
This ten-dollar bill is a counterfeit.这张十元钞票是伪钞。
We suspect the paper to be a counterfeit.我们疑心这个证件是伪造的。
This note is counterfeit, but that one's good.这张钞票是假的，那张是真的。
And eyes will be very difficult to counterfeit.而且眼睛将是非常难以仿造的。
It is against the law to counterfeit money.伪造货币是违法的。
She counterfeited alarm when he confessed his love.当他向她示爱时她假装惊讶的样子。

Only a coward would run from danger. 只有懦夫才临危脱逃。

cram

[kræm], [kræm]


Image Search
v. 塞满；猛吃；仓促备考
n. 仓促备考；挤成一堆的人群
Cram.
n. 克拉姆(姓氏或男子名)
completely fill (a place or container) to the point that it appears to be overflowing.
force (people or things) into a place or container that is or appears to be too small to contain them.
(of a number of people) enter a place or space that is or seems to be too small to accommodate all of them.
study intensively over a short period of time just before an examination.
"the ashtray by the bed was crammed with cigarette butts"
"it's amazing how you've managed to cram everyone in"
"they all crammed into the car"
"lectures were called off so students could cram for finals"
This box is crammed with Christmas gifts.这个盒子里塞满了圣诞礼物。
He crammed as much candy into his pockets as they would hold.他把口袋都塞满了糖果。
I managed to cram down a few mouthfuls of food.我好歹狼吞虎咽地吃了几口东西。
The teacher tried to cram his pupils.老师试图用填鸭式教学把知识灌输给学生。
I have to cram up six subjects for my examinations.为了考试我得刻苦复习6门课程。
My son go to cram school every evening.我的儿子每晚都去上补习班。
There was such a cram in the church.教堂里挤得要命。
Cram ran a fine race to take the gold medal.克拉姆在赛跑中成绩突出夺得金牌。

credit

['kredɪt], ['kredɪt]


Image Search
n. 信用；荣誉；学分；赞扬；贷款；赊欠；贷方；存款
(复)credits: 演职员名单.
v. 归功于；相信；记入贷方
the ability of a customer to obtain goods or services before payment, based on the trust that payment will be made in the future.
the money lent or made available under a credit arrangement.
an entry recording a sum received, listed on the right-hand side or column of an account.
a payment received.
entitlement to a set amount of a particular company's goods or services, typically paid for in advance of use.
public acknowledgment or praise, typically that given or received when a person's responsibility for an action or idea becomes or is made apparent.
a source of pride, typically someone or something that reflects well on another person or organization.
an acknowledgment of a contributor's services to a movie or a television program, typically one of a list that is scrolled down the screen at the beginning or end of a movie or program.
the acknowledgment of a student's completion of a course or activity that counts toward a degree or diploma as maintained in a school's records.
a unit of study counting toward a degree or diploma.
acknowledgment of merit in an examination which is reflected in the grades awarded.
the quality of being believed or credited.
favorable estimation; good reputation.
publicly acknowledge someone as a participant in the production of (something published or broadcast).
ascribe (an achievement or good quality) to someone.
add (an amount of money) to an account.
believe (something surprising or unlikely).
"I've got unlimited credit"
"the bank refused to extend their credit"
"you need to record debits or credits made to your account"
"in the middle of our conversation his phone ran out of credit"
"the president claims credit for each accomplishment"
"he's a credit to his mother"
"the closing credits finished rolling"
"a student can earn one unit of academic credit"
"in his first semester he earned 17 credits"
"students will receive credit for accuracy and style"
"the abstract philosophy of Cicero has lost its credit"
"John Gilpin was a citizen of credit and renown"
"the screenplay is credited to one American and two Japanese writers"
"he is credited with painting one hundred and twenty-five canvases"
"this deferred tax can be credited to the profit and loss account"
"you would hardly credit it—but it was true"
Credit counseling helped us get out from under.信用咨询使我们免除了忧虑
Where can I see my credit score?我在哪能看到我的信用分数?
They are working hard for the credit of China.他们在为中国的荣誉而努力工作。
You must pass the examination to get credit for the course.你必须通过考试才能获得那门课程的学分。
I give them full credit for their work.我高度赞扬了他们的工作。
He was given credit for his work.他的工作受到赞扬。
He is very awkward about give us further credit.他为给我们进一步地增加贷款而为难。
No credit is given at this shop.这家商店概不赊欠。
Is this item a debit or a credit?这笔帐属于借方还是属于贷方?
How much do I have to my credit?我们银行户头上还有多少存款？
At the time, we used to credit everything to one person.那时大家把什么都归功于一个人。
I can credit all that you are telling me .我可以相信你告诉我的一切。
I want to credit this to my account.我想把这个记在我的账上。

cringe

[krɪndʒ], [krɪndʒ]


Image Search
vi. 畏缩；觉得尴尬不安或难为情；阿谀，奉承
n. 畏缩；阿谀，奉承
bend one's head and body in fear or in a servile manner.
experience an inward shiver of embarrassment or disgust.
an act of cringing.
"he cringed away from the blow"
"I cringed at the fellow's stupidity"
People often cringe when they hear the word "fat".人们常常听到“脂肪”这个词后会畏缩。
But just the thought of mentioning it to her made him cringe.可是一想到要向她表明这一想法，他就会犹豫、退缩。
It may be difficult to believe, but some people actually cringe when an opportunity presents itself.令人难以置信的是，有些人竟在机遇来临时畏缩。
His way of sleeping makes me cringe.他睡觉的方式令我生厌。
I cringe when I think of the poems I wrote then.每当我想起我那时写的诗歌就感到很难堪。
I cringe with embarrassment when I reread those first stories I wrote.我重读了我初期编写的故事

criteria

[kraɪ'tɪəriə], [kraɪ'tɪəriə]


Image Search
n. 标准；尺度；准则
名词criterion的复数形式.
a principle or standard by which something may be judged or decided.
"the launch came too close to violating safety criteria"
It was necessary to satisfy stringent criteria to justify its use.使用苛刻的标准来评价其实用性是完全必要的。
The criteria will be different from those that pertain elsewhere.这里的标准将不同于其他地方适用的标准。
They commonly focus attention upon easily recognizable criteria of action.它们通常把注意力集中在作用的易于识别的尺度上。
Is the defined method and the criteria made known to all staff concerned?公司有否向有关职员公布该编配方法和准则?

crotchety

['krɒtʃəti], ['krɑːtʃəti]


Image Search
adj. 思想奇怪的；脾气坏的
irritable.
"he was tired and crotchety"
His crotchety, even cruel behavior must be mischaracterized too. 他反复无常、甚至是残酷的行为一定也是由于复杂的性格原因。
It seems that he is in crotchety opposition to his father. 看起来，他对他爸爸火气很大，也很敌对。
It was one of thoes rare occasions when I ignored the crotchety old voice that spoiled my fun. 像这样无视那扼杀了我的乐趣的古怪声音，还真是屈指可数。
It's hardly surprising that this bold, or perhaps crotchety, proposal was instantly controversial. 不出所料，这个大胆，些许有些离奇的建议一经提出便立刻引起争议。
My character is the sort of crotchety Yankee show -me type, and I'm not there to actually do the cooking. 我的性格属于那种美国式的想入非非的自我展示型，我实际上不是真的在烹调。
Indeed they don't, Mother. My mother may be crotchety, Miss Potter, but she does have an eye for beautiful things. She was fascinated by your drawings. 是啊,大家都不听了。我母亲也许是有点神神叨叨,波特小姐,但是她可有双善于发现美丽的眼睛。她非常欣赏你的画。

crouch

[kraʊtʃ], [kraʊtʃ]


Image Search
v. 蹲下；屈膝
n. 蹲伏；蜷缩
adopt a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down, sometimes to avoid detection or to defend oneself.
a crouching stance or posture.
"we crouched down in the trench"
He crouched down among the tangled foliage.他蹲下把身子藏在紊乱的叶丛中。
They crouch, back to back, in a sort of hut of fate.他们彼此背靠着背，蹲在一种黑洞似的命运里。
They did not crouch under the oppression.他们受压迫而不屈服。
He chuckled, said, "Very convincing," and then suddenly sank into a crouch, his muscles coiled like a spring.他咯咯地笑着说,“很有说服力，”然后突然蹲伏下来，他的肌肉就像个收紧的弹簧。
They crouch in their corner and weave their web of pale hours, they count their coins sitting in the dust and call me back.他们蜷缩在角落里，编织着他们苍白的时间之网，他们坐在尘土中，数着他们的硬币，召唤我回去。
As he mounted higher, sometimes standing, sometimes clawing his way up in a scrabbling crouch, he peered out from the stairs.他一直向上爬着，有时直着身子，有时蜷缩着身子，挣扎着向上爬着，他从楼梯向四处张望。

crucial

['kruːʃl], ['kruːʃl]


Image Search
adj. 决定性的；关键的
decisive or critical, especially in the success or failure of something.
of great importance.
"negotiations were at a crucial stage"
"this game is crucial to our survival"
Her work has been crucial to the project's success.她的工作对项目的成功至关重要。
It is crucial that we get this right.我们把这个问题弄明白是极其重要的。
Trust is crucial for successful friendship.相互信任是维系友谊的关键。
The battle had reached a crucial stage.战斗已到了关键阶段。

crude

[kruːd], [kruːd]


Image Search
adj. 天然的；未加工的；粗鲁的；粗糙的；简陋的
n. 原油；天然的物质
in a natural or raw state; not yet processed or refined.
(of figures) not adjusted or corrected.
(of an estimate or guess) likely to be only approximately accurate.
constructed in a rudimentary or makeshift way.
(of an action) showing little finesse or subtlety and as a result unlikely to succeed.
(of language, behavior, or a person) offensively coarse or rude, especially in relation to sexual matters.
natural petroleum.
"crude protein"
"the crude mortality rate"
"a relatively crude nuclear weapon"
"the measure was condemned by economists as crude and ill-conceived"
"a crude joke"
"the ship was carrying 80,000 tons of crude"
China is a country rich in crude oil.中国是一个原油丰富的国家。
The price of crude oil has come down recently.最近原油的价格已经下降了。
This crude glycerin is from pure virgin vegetable oil.这是未加工的甘油，来自纯洁，原始的植物油。
It was crude of him to say that.他那样说太粗鲁了。
We turned upstream to find a crude wooden bridge.我们转向上游走，发现了一座粗糙的木桥。
Primitive man hunted wild animals with crude stone implements.原始社会的人用粗糙的石器猎取野兽。
The great man is said to have been born in a crude hut.据说那个伟人生于一个简陋的小屋里。
In fact, a speciality crude is suitable only for bitumen production.事实上，这种特性的原油只适宜于生产沥青。

culprit

Image Search

a person who is responsible for a crime or other misdeed.
the cause of a problem or defect.

The hunt is on for the culprit.正在搜捕该罪犯。
The police are now on the scent of the culprit.警方已获得罪犯的线索。
The culprit will be whipped when he is found.那个罪犯找到后就要挨鞭子抽打。
High production costs are the main culprit.高生产成本是主要原因所在。

cultural

['kʌltʃərəl], ['kʌltʃərəl]


Image Search
adj. 文化的；和养动植物有关的
relating to the ideas, customs, and social behavior of a society.
relating to the arts and to intellectual achievements.
"the cultural diversity of the world's peoples"
"a cultural festival"
Cultural differences are always hugely played down.文化的差异通常被大大地淡化了。
Many people suffered from cultural shock when they came abroad.许多人到国外时，都感受到文化震撼。
We should get a thorough understanding about the cultural diversity of the United States.我们应该对美国文化的多样性有一个全面的了解。
This paper studied the effects of different crop stubbles put in soil on soil humus by cultural experiment of churnozem.通过黑钙土的培养试验，研究了不同作物根茬施入土壤后对土壤腐殖质的影响。

cumin

['kʌmɪn], ['kʌmɪn]


Image Search
n. 莳萝；小茴香（子）；孜然芹
the aromatic seeds of a plant of the parsley family, used as a spice, especially ground and used in curry powder.
the small, slender plant that bears cumin and grows from the Mediterranean to central Asia.
We want to buy Cumin, Coffee Beans, Peanut, Lentils and Cloves Coffee我们要采购时萝
The kebabs are spiced with cumin, chili pepper and garam masala.菜饼中还需加入孜然芹、辣椒粉、胡椒粉和格兰马撒拉等原料调味。
In this forest, trees are made of broccoli, with peas hanging as fruits and the highways are paved with cumin.在森林中，树是以甘蓝做成并吊著豆子当作果实，以及以小茴香铺成的道路。
After leveling the soil, does he not begin to sow caraway and scatter cumin, wheat and barley and put spelt as the border?当他把地弄平了以后，不是要撒上小茴香，播种大茴香，种植大麦和小麦，地边种玉蜀黍吗？

cunning

['kʌnɪŋ], ['kʌnɪŋ]


Image Search

having or showing skill in achieving one's ends by deceit or evasion.
ingenious.
attractive; quaint.
skill in achieving one's ends by deceit.
ingenuity.
"a cunning look came into his eyes"
"plants have evolved cunning defenses"
"the baby will look cunning in that pink print"
"a statesman to whom cunning had come as second nature"
"what resources of energy and cunning it took just to survive"
Many politicians are cunning sophists.许多政客都是狡猾的诡辩家。
The fox is known for its cleverness and cunning.狐狸的机敏和狡猾是人所共知的。
She showed her cunning in the way she avoided answering the question.她对问题避而不答，显示出她很狡猾。
He devised a very cunning scheme to help her.他想出一个帮助她的很好的办法。
John happened to come up with a cunning marketing strategy.约翰突然提出了极富远见的市场策略。
The cunning workman does not quarrel with his tools.（谚）巧匠不挑剔工具。
It takes cunning workmen to make such elaborate furniture.能工巧匠才能制作如此精致的家俱。
What a cunning kitten!这只小猫多么逗人喜爱!
The fox is believed to have a great deal of cunning.人们相信狐狸十分狡猾。
A look of cunning came into her eyes.她的眼睛闪起一丝狡狯的神情。

the fact or quality of being generally accepted or in use.

"no claim had been made during the currency of the policy"

Our currency will not be depreciated.我们的货币不会贬值。
There are currency restrictions on the sums allowed for foreign travel.到国外旅行允许携带的款额有所限制。
The word has attained general currency.这个词已经通用起来了。

curtail

[kɜː'teɪl], [kɜːr'teɪl]


Image Search

reduce in extent or quantity; impose a restriction on.

Illness has curtailed her sporting activities.她因病而减少了体育活动。
The government hopes to curtail public spending.政府希望缩减公共事业开支。
The government hopes to curtail public spending in the next tax year.政府希望在下个财税年度减少公家开支。
Given this, China will continue to take measures to curtail the trend of deflation.因此,中国还要继续采取措施以遏制通缩的趋势。
The President had to curtail his visit.总统不得不缩短他的访问日期。

cycle

['saɪkl], ['saɪkl]


Image Search
n. 循环；周期；自行车；摩托车
v. 骑自行车；(使)轮转；(使)循环
a series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order.
the period of time taken to complete a single sequence of events.
a recurring series of successive operations or states, as in the working of an internal combustion engine, or in the alternation of an electric current or a wave.
a recurring series of events or metabolic processes in the lifetime of a plant or animal.
a series of successive metabolic reactions in which one of the products is regenerated and reused.
the movement of a simple substance through the soil, rocks, water, atmosphere, and living organisms of the earth.
a single set of hardware operations, especially that by which memory is accessed and an item is transferred to or from it, to the point at which the memory may be accessed again.
a cycle per second; one hertz.
a complete set or series.
a series of songs, stories, plays, or poems composed around a particular theme, and usually intended to be performed or read in sequence.
a bicycle or tricycle.
a ride on a bicycle.
ride a bicycle.
move in or follow a regularly repeated sequence of events.
"the boom and slump periods of a trade cycle"
"the cells are shed over a cycle of twenty-eight days"
"the familiar four cycles of intake, combustion, ignition, and exhaust"
"the storks' breeding cycle"
"the painting is one of a cycle of seven"
"Wagner's Ring Cycle"
"a 112-mile cycle"
"she cycled to work every day"
"economies cycle regularly between boom and slump"
The seasons of the year make a cycle.一年四季构成一个循环。
The business cycle experienced a sudden down.商业周期经历了突然的萧条。
A cycle of the sun takes a year.太阳循环周期需要一年。
I go to school by cycle every day.我每天骑自行车上学。
There are thousands of cycle paths in Holland.荷兰有数千条自行车道。
Her latest stunt is riding a motor cycle through a ring of flames.她的最新特技表演是骑摩托车钻火圈。
I usually cycle home through the park.我通常骑自行车穿过公园回家。
It's easier to cycle with the wind behind you.顺风骑车省力。
This machine automatically cycles.这台机器能够自动轮转。
You can press TAB to cycle through the windows.你可以按Tab键循环切换窗口。

dabble

['dæbl], ['dæbl]


Image Search
v. 喷洒；玩水；泼溅；涉猎；浅尝
immerse (one's hands or feet) partially in water and move them around gently.
(of a duck or other waterbird) move the bill around in shallow water while feeding.
take part in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
"they dabbled their feet in the rock pools"
"teal dabble in the shallows"
"he dabbled in writing as a young man"
She dabbled her hands in the fountain.她把手伸到喷泉中玩水。
Children like to dabble in water.孩子们喜欢玩水。
He just dabbles in politics.他仅仅是涉足政治而已。
I have to be careful, for I dabble with poisons a good deal.我不得不小心一点,因为我常和毒物接触。
She is a talented musician but is content to just dabble.她很有音乐天赋，但满足于浅尝。

A typical example of a long haired dachshund. 长有毛发的达克斯猎狗图片 Long haired dachshund.

名词datum的复数形式.

things known or assumed as facts, making the basis of reasoning or calculation.
a piece of information.
an assumption or premise from which inferences may be drawn.
a fixed starting point of a scale or operation.
The data should be updated once a week.这些数据应该每星期更新一次。
In Name, type a name for the data source.在“名称”中,为数据源键入名称。
Very little data is available.现有的资料十分不足。

dawdle

['dɔːdl], ['dɔːdl]


Image Search

waste time; be slow.
move slowly and idly.
"I couldn't dawdle over my coffee any longer"
"Ruth dawdled back through the woods"
Look sharp! Do not dawdle about like that.快点！别这么磨磨蹭蹭了。
Look smart! Don't always dawdle about like that!快一点！别总是那么拖拖拉拉！
He dawdles the hours away watching television.他把时间都荒废在看电视上了。
Don't dawdle over your clothing. You're so beautiful already.不要再在衣着上花费时间了，你已经够漂亮的了。
Students scurry around campus during the bleak winter months; they rarely dawdle.萧瑟的冬季里,校园中学生行色匆匆,少有人漫游闲逛。

"she was dazed by his revelations"
"he was walking around in a daze"

I've been in a complete daze since hearing the news.自从听到那消息，我一直茫然不知所措。
He had been in a daze all the way to New York.他去纽约途中一路恍惚。

debate

[dɪ'beɪt], [dɪ'beɪt]


Image Search
n. 辩论；讨论
vt. 争论；思考
vi. 辩论
a formal discussion on a particular topic in a public meeting or legislative assembly, in which opposing arguments are put forward.
an argument about a particular subject, especially one in which many people are involved.
argue about (a subject), especially in a formal manner.
consider a possible course of action in one's mind before reaching a decision.
"the national debate on abortion"
"the board debated his proposal"
"he debated whether he should leave the matter alone or speak to her"
After a long debate, the house of commons approved the bill.经过长时间的辩论，下议院通过了议案。
We had a long debate as to whether we should spend so much money on space technology.至于我们要否花那么多钱在太空技术上,我们辩论了很久。
Her resignation caused much public debate.她辞职一事引起群众议论纷纷。
There has been heated debate about whether the film should be allowed.关于这场电影是否该通过,人们展开了热烈的讨论。
I don't wish to debate my opinions with you.我不想就我的看法同你辩论。
He debated buying a new car, but didn't in the end.他思量很久是否买辆新汽车,但最后还是没买。
This is a question that they have often debated.这是个他们常讨论的问题。

debt

[det], [det]


Image Search
n. 债务；恩情；负债状态；义务；罪
something, typically money, that is owed or due.
the state of owing money.
a feeling of gratitude for a service or favor.
"I paid off my debts"
"the firm is heavily in debt"
"we owe them a debt of thanks"
He promised to pay his debt within a month.他保证在1个月内偿还债务。
If I pay all my debts I'll have no money.我若还请所有欠债就分文不剩了。
We owe you a debt of gratitude for you help.承蒙帮助，感恩不尽。
The company is deep in debt.这家公司正负债累累。
We'll run into debt if you spend more than our income.要是你花的比我们挣的还多，我们就要欠债了。
You have an obligation to pay your debt to society.你有义务偿还对社会的债务。
Liabilities are the obligatio or debt that a busine must pay in money or services at some time in the future.负债是指将来需用货币或服务偿还的债务或履行的义务。
He's in debt to the extent of200.请求为他犯的偷窃罪从轻量刑。
They said that they would drop the charges if we paid off the debt.他们说还清欠款就可以顶罪了。

A new product will debut next week.一种新产品将在下周面世。
He decided to debut with several other violinists.他决定与其他几名小提琴手一起首次登台演出。
The network will debut her new series next March.电视联播网将于明年三月首次放映她的新的连续剧。

deceive

[dɪ'siːv], [dɪ'siːv]


Image Search
vt. 欺骗
vi. 行骗
(of a person) cause (someone) to believe something that is not true, typically in order to gain some personal advantage.
(of a thing) give a mistaken impression.
fail to admit to oneself that something is true.
be sexually unfaithful to (one's regular partner).
"I didn't intend to deceive people into thinking it was French champagne"
"the area may seem to offer nothing of interest, but don't be deceived"
"enabling the rulers to deceive themselves about the nature of their own rule"
It's not honorable to deceive them.欺骗他们是不光彩的。
He was foiled in his attempt to deceive us.他企图欺骗我们,但没有得逞。
He deceived me into signing the papers.他骗我在文件上签了字。
You are deceiving yourself if you still believe that she loves you.你如果还相信她爱你，你就是在欺骗自己。
Appearances can deceive.外表是有欺骗性的。
Who are ready to believe are easy to deceive.轻信的人容易受骗。

decline

[dɪ'klaɪn], [dɪ'klaɪn]


Image Search
v. 下降；减少；变弱；拒绝；倾斜
n. 衰微；跌落；晚年
(typically of something regarded as good) become smaller, fewer, or less; decrease.
diminish in strength or quality; deteriorate.
politely refuse (an invitation or offer).
politely refuse to do something.
(especially of the sun) move downward.
bend down; droop.
(in the grammar of Latin, Greek, and certain other languages) state the forms of (a noun, pronoun, or adjective) corresponding to cases, number, and gender.
a gradual and continuous loss of strength, numbers, quality, or value.
the gradual setting of the sun.
any disease in which bodily strength gradually fails, especially tuberculosis.
"the birth rate continued to decline"
"her health began to decline"
"Caroline declined the coffee"
"the company declined to comment"
"a serious decline in bird numbers"
I wish prices would decline.但愿物价下降。
The price of 14 inches TV set declined from 400 to 320 yuan each.14英寸的电视机每台从400元降到320元。
He spent his declining years in the country.他在乡间度过晚年。
I must regretfully decline your kind invitation.我很抱歉必须拒绝你的盛情邀请。
The wall declined slightly on account of the earthquake.墙壁因地震而倾斜。
This decline in vigour with the passing of time is called ageing.这种随着时间流逝的活力衰退就叫做衰老。
There is a sharp decline in unemployment.失业率急剧下跌。
The decline of sales embarrassed the company.销路下降使公司陷于财政困难。

decree

[dɪ'kriː], [dɪ'kriː]


Image Search
n. 法令；判决
v. 颁布；裁定；注定
an official order issued by a legal authority.
the issuing of a decree.
a judgment or decision of certain law courts.
order (something) by decree.
"the king ruled by decree"
"the government decreed a ban on any contact with the guerrillas"
This decree obliges unions to delay strikes .这项法令使协会不得不推迟罢工。
The decree imposed strict censorship of the media.这个法令强制实行严格的媒体审查制度。
The final decree dissolved their marriage.最后的判决解除了他们的婚姻关系。
This decree has the force of law behind it.这一裁决有法律的力量作后盾。
The dictator decreed that his birthday would be a public holiday.该独裁者发布命令，将其生日定为公众假期。
The court decreed that he should be transported to Australia.法院判决将他流放到澳洲。
Fate decreed that Ulysses should travel long and far.命运注定尤里西斯要作长途跋涉的旅行。

decry

[dɪ'kraɪ], [dɪ'kraɪ]


Image Search
v. 责难；诽谤
publicly denounce.
"they decried human rights abuses"
Many people decry flogging.许多人反对鞭打。
All the mayors decry gambling in all its forms.所有市长都谴责各式各样的赌博。
Environmental activists decry destruction in Amazon.环保人士谴责破坏亚马逊热带雨林的活动。

dedication

[ˌdedɪ'keɪʃn], [ˌdedɪ'keɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 奉献；献词；献堂礼
the quality of being dedicated or committed to a task or purpose.
the action of dedicating a church or other building.
the words with which a book or other artistic work is dedicated.
"his dedication to his duties"
"the dedication and unveiling was attended by some 5,000 people"
"the hardback edition contained a warm dedication to his wife"
Her dedication to her work was admirable.她对工作的奉献精神可钦可佩。
She wanted to buy his love with her dedication to him and his work.她想通过自己对他及其工作的奉献来换取他的爱。
His talent and dedication will insure his success.他的才气和执着将确保他成功。
The book's dedication reads "To Mother".本书献词写道：“献给母亲”。
This was the dedication of the altar, after that it was anointed.这就是用膏抹坛之后，为行奉献坛之礼所献的。

deduction

[dɪ'dʌkʃn], [dɪ'dʌkʃn]


Image Search
n. 扣除；扣除额；推论；推理；演绎
the action of deducting or subtracting something.
an amount that is or may be deducted from something, especially from taxable income or tax to be paid.
the inference of particular instances by reference to a general law or principle.
"the dividend will be paid without deduction of tax"
"tax deductions"
"the detective must uncover the murderer by deduction from facts"
Net salary is gross salary minus tax and national insurance deduction.净工资是工资总额减去税收和扣除国民保险。
The deduction of a payment is made by a debtor from an amount due.贷款扣除额由欠债人从应付数目中的付款扣除。
The deduction is not a tax per se, but it's a charitable contribution that the company takes out of your paycheck.这个扣除额不是所谓的税，但也算公司从你的薪水中扣除的公益捐款。
Her deduction that he was now dead was correct.她作出的他此时已经死亡的推论是正确的。
Your deduction is definitely unreasonable.你的推论无疑是不合理的。
He arrived at the solution by a simple process of deduction.他通过一番简单的推理得出了解决问题的方法。
His demonstration of the deduction logic does not hold water.他对推理逻辑的论证不是很严谨。

deem

[diːm], [diːm]


Image Search
v. 认为；视作
regard or consider in a specified way.
"the event was deemed a great success"
They were deemed to be illegal immigrants.他们被认为是不法移民。
They deemed that he was no longer capable of managing the business.他们认为他没有能力再继续管理这个公司了。
These buildings are deemed to be of architectural importance and must be protected.这些楼房被视为具有建筑的重要性

defensive

[dɪ'fensɪv], [dɪ'fensɪv]


Image Search
adj. 防卫的；防御的；辩护的
n. 防卫姿势；防卫物
used or intended to defend or protect.
(in sports) relating to or intended as defense.
very anxious to challenge or avoid criticism.
"troops in defensive positions"
"he was very defensive about that side of his life"
They teamed together into a defensive alliance.他们联合起来组成一个防卫同盟。
Our troops took up defensive positions on high ground overlooking the river.我部队在临河高地上占据了防御阵地。
When asked to explain her behavior, she gave a very defensive answer.当问她为什么要这样做时，她极力为自己辩护。
She's very defensive about her part in the affair.她极力掩盖她在此事中充当的角色。
They put entirely on the defensive.他们被迫完全处于守势。

defiant

[dɪ'faɪənt], [dɪ'faɪənt]


Image Search
adj. 挑衅的；目中无人
showing defiance.
"she was in a defiant mood"
He put his paw on the prize and glared across the water with a defiant growl.他把他的爪子放在猎获物上，盯着河对岸，发出一声挑衅的吼叫。
Correspondents say the appointment seems intended to send a defiant message to South Korea.通讯员称该任命似乎意在向韩国发出挑衅的信号。
What he said showed he was really defiant.他所说的话显示出他真是目中无人。
Bellatrix remained defiant to the end.直到审判的最后，贝拉特里克斯仍保持着她的桀骜不驯，目中无人。

deficient

[dɪ'fɪʃnt], [dɪ'fɪʃnt]


Image Search
adj. 不足的；不充分的；有缺陷的
not having enough of a specified quality or ingredient.
insufficient or inadequate.
having mental disabilities.
"this diet is deficient in vitamin B"
"they trashed the legislation as deficient"
We are deficient in hands.我们人手不够。
The crops are suffering from deficient rain.庄稼因雨量不足而遭受损害。
Our knowledge of the matter is deficient.我们对此事了解不足。
A mentally deficient person is one who is weak-minded.一个智力上不足的人是个低能的人。
The evidence he gave us was deficient.他提供给我们的证据不充分。
His training in linguistics is deficient.他在语言学方面受到的训练是有缺陷的。
He couldn't join the army because of his deficient sight.由于视力缺陷，他没办法参军。

definite

['defɪnət], ['defɪnət]


Image Search
adj. 明确的；一定的；有把握的
clearly stated or decided; not vague or doubtful.
clearly true or real; unambiguous.
(of a person) certain or sure about something.
clear or undeniable (used for emphasis).
having exact and discernible physical limits or form.
"we had no definite plans"
"no definite proof has emerged"
"you're very definite about that!"
"video is a definite asset in the classroom"
His vague ideas crystallized into a definite plan.他那些模糊的想法变成了一个明确的计划。
The workers demand a definite answer.工人们要求一个明确的答复。
You have our definite support.我们绝对支持您。
It's definite that he will win.他肯定会赢。
Is it definite that they will sign that contract?他们肯定会签署这份合同吗？

definition

[ˌdefɪ'nɪʃn], [ˌdefɪ'nɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 定义；阐释；清晰度
a statement of the exact meaning of a word, especially in a dictionary.
an exact statement or description of the nature, scope, or meaning of something.
the action or process of defining something.
the degree of distinctness in outline of an object, image, or sound, especially of an image in a photograph or on a screen.
the capacity of an instrument or device for making images distinct in outline.
"our definition of what constitutes poetry"
"we've been pleased with the definition of this TV"
To give a definition of a word is more difficult than to give an illustration of its use.给一个词下定义要比举例说明它的用法困难。
My duties require clearer definition.我的职责需要更清楚的说明。
The photo lacks definition.这张照片不够清晰。

deflect

[dɪ'flekt], [dɪ'flekt]


Image Search
v. 使偏斜；转向；改变原计划
cause (something) to change direction by interposing something; turn aside from a straight course.
(of an object) change direction after hitting something.
cause (someone) to deviate from an intended purpose.
cause (something) to change orientation.
"the bullet was deflected harmlessly into the ceiling"
"the ball deflected off his body"
"she refused to be deflected from anything she had set her mind on"
"the compass needle is deflected from magnetic north by metal in the aircraft"
The missile deflected from its trajectory.导弹已偏离轨道。
The bullet hit a wall and was deflected from its course.子弹击中墙壁而改变了方向。
Don't try to deflect me from my intention!别想改变我的意图。

She was charged with intent to defraud.她被指控犯有蓄意诈骗钱财罪。

deft

[deft], [deft]


Image Search
adj. 敏捷熟练的；灵巧的
neatly skillful and quick in one's movements.

"a deft piece of footwork"

She is deft at dealing with reporters.她善於与记者周旋。
Sister Irene was a tall, deft woman in her early thirties.艾琳修女是个三十出头、精明能干的高个妇女。
With deft fingers she untangled the wire.她用灵巧的手指解开了金属线。
My sister is a clever and deft person who can make pretty dresses.姐姐是个心灵手巧的人，做的衣服很漂亮。

dejected

[dɪ'dʒektɪd], [dɪ'dʒektɪd]


Image Search
