"Larry was turning out to be a drag on her career"
"working nine to five can be a drag"
"he took a long drag on his cigarette"
"a fashion show, complete with men in drag"
"the main drag"
"they had the education but they didn't have the drag"
He dragged the heavy case across the floor.他在地板上拖着那个沉重的箱子。
shrug aside不予理会
She dragged herself out of bed, still half asleep.她挣扎着起了床,还是睡眼惺忪。
She always drags behind us.她总是在我们后面吃力地跟着。
The first hour of the movie really dragged.那部电影的前一个小时真的是过得很慢。
I don't want to drag out this argument any further.我不想再就这场争论进一步拖长下去。
She dragged up that incident just to embarrass me.她又扯起那件事故意想使我难堪。
They dragged the canal for the missing child.他们用拖网沿运河打捞失踪孩子的尸体。
The cat is really excited by the drag of the basket on the floor.在地板上来来回回拖着篮子可着实让那只猫兴奋了一回。
The drag of the his son up to top of the mountain exhausted him.把他的儿子拉上山顶可真累坏了他。
Walking is a drag--let's take the car.走路太费事了——我们坐汽车吧。
High interest rates are a drag on the housing market.高利率是住房市场上的一个阻力。

drawback

['drɔːbæk], ['drɔːbæk]


Image Search
n. 缺点；退税；退款；不利条件；弊

"the main drawback of fitting catalytic converters is the cost"
The great drawback to living near a main road is noise.住在大街旁最大的缺点是噪音。
Everything has its drawbacks.凡事都有不足之处。
Many people are talking about the impact of export drawback system reform on the economy in China these days.这些天来许多人都在讨论出口退税制度改革对我国经济的影响。
Illness is a great drawback to a learner.患病对学生来说是大为不利的。
The bad weather is a major drawback.恶劣天气是一个主要的障碍。
The only drawback to the plan is its expense.该计划实施的唯一障碍是经费问题。

I dread to think what will happen if she finds out the truth.我不敢去想她知道真相后会怎么样。
Much of what we dread is really due to indistinctness of outline.畏生于不明，大抵如此。
The Jews lived in dread of being caught.这些犹太人生活在会遭到拘捕的恐惧之中。
My greatest dread is that my parents will find out.我最担心的就是父母会察觉出来。

The countryside lay as under some dread enchantment.乡村好像躺在某种可怖的魔法之下。

The poster wouldn't stick even though I drenched it with glue.我涂了大量胶水，可那张海报就是贴不住。

"time-sharing has been brought into disrepute by dubious sales methods"
"she earned the dubious distinction of being the lowest-paid teacher in the nation"
I feel dubious about his honesty.我对他的诚实表示怀疑。
I am dubious about accepting the offer of the job.我犹豫不定是否接受提供给我的那份工作。
I remain dubious about her motives.我对她的动机仍存疑念。
The testimony given by him is dubious.他所作的证据是可疑的。
He uses some dubious shifts to get money.他用一些可疑的手段去赚钱。
He shares the same rotten tastes with some dubious characters.他和一些不三不四的人臭味相投。
I am still dubious about that plan.我仍然对那个计划拿不准。

dumbfounded

[dʌm'faʊndɪd], [dʌm'faʊndɪd]


Image Search
adj. 惊呆的
动词dumbfound的过去式和过去分词形式.
=dumfounded.
greatly astonish or amaze.
"they were dumbfounded at his popularity"
We were completely dumbfounded by her rudeness.她粗鲁无礼，把我们吓呆了。

duration

[dju'reɪʃn], [du'reɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 持续时间；期间
the time during which something continues.
"the subway stop has been closed for the duration of the convention"
The duration of the movie is 110 minutes.这部电影的持续时间是110分钟。
He finished the work of three years' duration.他用三年的时间完成了这项工作。
The duration of marriage is related most obviously to the expectation of life.很明显，婚姻生活的持续时间与人的预期寿命有关。
Well, I'm stuck here for the duration.哎，这段时间我只得呆在这儿了。
Let's hope the gunmen will hold off for the duration of the cease-fire.但愿持枪歹徒在停火期间能约束自己的行动。

dynamic

[daɪ'næmɪk], [daɪ'næmɪk]


Image Search
adj. 动力的；动态的；有活力的；【音】力度变化的
n. 动力；动力学
(of a process or system) characterized by constant change, activity, or progress.
relating to forces producing motion.
(of a verb) expressing an action, activity, event, or process.
denoting or relating to web pages that update frequently or are generated according to an individual's search terms.
(of a person) positive in attitude and full of energy and new ideas.
relating to the volume of sound produced by an instrument, voice, or recording.
(of a memory device) needing to be refreshed by the periodic application of a voltage.
a force that stimulates change or progress within a system or process.
another term for dynamics (sense 3).
"a dynamic economy"
"the dynamic content of these sites keeps their audience informed and up to date"
"she's dynamic and determined"
"an astounding dynamic range"
"evaluation is part of the basic dynamic of the project"
This chapter is on the transformation of heat energy into dynamic energy.这一章是关于热能转化成动力的。
The different varieties of the language are in a dynamic relationship with each other.这种语言的不同变体间存在着动态的联系。
We are looking for dynamic persons to be salesmen.我们正在寻找充满活力的销售人员。
A dynamic government is necessary to meet the demands of a changing society.一个有活力的政府必须适应社会的改变。
They hoped it would act as a spiritual dynamic on all churches.他们希望这对所有教堂来说都是一种精神动力。
Dynamics is a discipline that cannot be mastered without extensive practice.动力学是一门不做大量习题就不能掌握的学科。

eager

['iːɡə(r)], ['iːɡər]


Image Search
adj. 热切的；渴望的
(of a person) wanting to do or have something very much.
(of a person's expression or tone of voice) characterized by keen expectancy or interest.
"the man was eager to please"
"small eager faces looked up and listened"
He is eager for you to meet his friends.他热切希望你见见他的朋友。
Eager fans mobbed the popular singer.热切的歌迷们团团围住住这位流行歌手
The boys listened to my story with eager attention.男孩们以热切的心情非常注意地倾听我的故事。
He was eager to see her.他渴望见到她。
The company is eager to expand into new markets.那家公司急欲开辟新的市场。

earnest

['ɜːnɪst], ['ɜːrnɪst]


Image Search
adj. 认真的；真诚的
n. 定金；预示；保证
n. 认真；诚挚
resulting from or showing sincere and intense conviction.
a thing intended or regarded as a sign or promise of what is to come.
"an earnest student"
"the presence of the troops is an earnest of the world's desire not to see the conflict repeated elsewhere"
I'm sure he was earnest when he said he would come.我相信他说他会来是认真的。
He is a good, earnest, diligent student.他是一个认真勤奋的好学生。
I strive to live each day with earnest gratitude.我努力使生活的每一天都充满真诚的感激。
Earnest was legally unnecessary.法律上并不要求必须有定金。
The money was given in earnest to finalize the contract.这笔钱是作为敲定合同的定金。
The current economic slump is an earnest of the major recession to come.当前的经济滑坡预示着一次大的衰退即将来临。
You will have to pay"earnest money" to guarantee your participation till the end of the tender.为保证您自始至终参加投标，您应该缴纳保证金。
She spoke half in sport, half in earnest.她半开玩笑半认真地说。
At last he has settled to his work in earnest.最后他安心认真地干起他的工作来。
I could tell she spoke in earnest.我看得出她是郑重其事地说的。

echelon

['eʃəlɒn], ['eʃəlɑːn]


Image Search
n. 职权的等级；阶层；梯队；梯次编队
v. 排成梯形
a level or rank in an organization, a profession, or society.
a part of a military force differentiated by position in battle or by function.
a formation of troops, ships, aircraft, or vehicles in parallel rows with the end of each row projecting further than the one in front.
arrange in an echelon formation.
"the upper echelons of the business world"
"the rear echelon"
"the echeloning of fire teams"

economic

[ˌiːkə'nɒmɪk], [ˌiːkə'nɑːmɪk]


Image Search
adj. 经济学的；经济的；有利可图的
relating to economics or the economy.
(of a subject) considered in relation to trade, industry, and the creation of wealth.
justified in terms of profitability.
requiring fewer resources or costing less money.
"the government's economic policy"
"economic history"
"many organizations must become larger if they are to remain economic"
"solar power may provide a more economic solution"
Economic analysis displays its effectiveness in tackling pollution.通过对污染税的经济学分析可以看出其较强的治理效果。
They had led the country into economic disaster.他们把国家带入了经济灾难中。
The threat of an economic depression hangs over the world.经济衰退的威胁笼罩着世界。
The economic sanctions could not prevent the development of that country.经济制裁不能阻碍那个国家的发展。
It is not always economic for buses to run on Sundays.公共汽车星期日行驶不一定准能赚钱。（《牛津高阶英汉双解词典》）

economical

[ˌiːkə'nɒmɪkl], [ˌiːkə'nɑːmɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 节俭的；经济的；合算的
relating to economics or the economy.
(of a subject) considered in relation to trade, industry, and the creation of wealth.
justified in terms of profitability.
requiring fewer resources or costing less money.
"the government's economic policy"
"economic history"
"many organizations must become larger if they are to remain economic"
"solar power may provide a more economic solution"
She is an economical housekeeper and feeds her family cheaply.她是一个节俭的家庭主妇，她全家的花销不大。
We are advocate economical life.我们提倡俭朴的生活。
This is not an economical method of heating.这不是一种经济的取暖方式。
She writes novels with economical style.她以简练的风格写小说。
She is economical in her use of salt when cooking.她烹饪时用盐很少。
A monthly is more economical than 4 weeklies.一张月票比四张周票上算。
When we had done the costings on the project, it was clear it would not be economical to go ahead with it.我们计算了成本，清楚表明这项工程不合算。

economize

[ɪ'kɒnəmaɪz], [ɪ'kɑːnəmaɪz]


Image Search
v. 节约；节省；有效地利用
=economise（英）
spend less; reduce one's expenses.
"I have to economize where I can"
This new machine will help economize on raw materials.这台新机器将有助于节约原材料。
Our electricity bills are higher than we can afford–we must start to economize.我们的电费已经高得付不起了——得节省些了。

edition

[ɪ'dɪʃn], [ɪ'dɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 版；版本
a particular form or version of a published text.
a particular version of a text that has been revised or created from a substantially new setting of type.
a person or thing that is compared to another as a copy to an original.
the total number of copies of a book, newspaper, or other published material issued at one time.
a particular version or instance of a regular program or broadcast.
"a paperback edition"
"a first edition"
"the building was a simpler edition of its namesake"
"the Monday edition will be repeated on Wednesday afternoons"
The second edition greatly improves on the first edition.第二版比第一版好了许多。
It has just entered the seventh edition.它刚出版了第七版。
This edition of the dictionary is sold out.这个版本的字典已售完了。
Have you read the unabridged edition of that book?你读过那本书的全文版本吗？
They issued a new edition of Lu Xun's works.他们发行了鲁迅著作的一个新版本。

eerie

['ɪəri], ['ɪri]


Image Search
adj. 怪诞的；可怕的；奇异的；害怕的
strange and frightening.
"an eerie green glow in the sky"
The eerie glow filled the cabin as the pressure built around them.当压力在他们周围建造的时候，怪诞的赤热装满了小屋。
The sky had an eerie yellow-orange hue, with the sun glowing behind a peculiar haze.天空呈现出怪诞的橘黄色调，太阳隐在一层奇异的雾霭后透出昏黄的光晕。
Near an ear, a nearer ear, a nearly eerie ear.靠近一只耳朵，一只近一些的耳朵，一只近乎可怕的耳朵。
So what's so eerie about this name?但这名字有什麽可怕的呢？
An eerie wind blew through the assembled throng.一阵奇异的风吹过拥挤的人群。
Churning mist adds an eerie ambiance to your Halloween table.搅动的薄雾给你的万圣节餐桌添加了一种奇异的气氛。

eerily

['ɪəri], ['ɪri]


Image Search
adj. 怪诞的；可怕的；奇异的；害怕的
in a strange and frightening manner.
"their footsteps echoed eerily"
The eerie glow filled the cabin as the pressure built around them.当压力在他们周围建造的时候，怪诞的赤热装满了小屋。
The sky had an eerie yellow-orange hue, with the sun glowing behind a peculiar haze.天空呈现出怪诞的橘黄色调，太阳隐在一层奇异的雾霭后透出昏黄的光晕。
Near an ear, a nearer ear, a nearly eerie ear.靠近一只耳朵，一只近一些的耳朵，一只近乎可怕的耳朵。
So what's so eerie about this name?但这名字有什麽可怕的呢？
An eerie wind blew through the assembled throng.一阵奇异的风吹过拥挤的人群。
Churning mist adds an eerie ambiance to your Halloween table.搅动的薄雾给你的万圣节餐桌添加了一种奇异的气氛。

efficacy

['efɪkəsi], ['efɪkəsi]


Image Search
n. 功效
the ability to produce a desired or intended result.
"there is little information on the efficacy of this treatment"
We are testing the efficacy of a new drug.我们正在测试新药的功效。
Exogenously administered ozone may, in this model, amplify the efficacy of antigen-antibody dynamics.在这个情况中，从外施加的臭氧会扩大抗原抗体作用的功效。

effusive

[ɪ'fjuːsɪv], [ɪ'fjuːsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 溢于言表的；感情奔放的
expressing feelings of gratitude, pleasure, or approval in an unrestrained or heartfelt manner.
(of igneous rock) poured out when molten and later solidified.
relating to the eruption of large volumes of molten rock.
"an effusive welcome"
He had not been effusive when he was brought in to see Thomas.当他被带去见托马斯时，并没大动感情。
Her effusive welcome was not sincere.她那过分热情的欢迎是不真诚的。
Her effusive thanks embarrassed everybody.她道谢时非常激动，弄得大家不好意思。

eggplant

['eɡplɑːnt], ['eɡplænt]


Image Search
n. <美>茄子；黑紫色
the large egg-shaped fruit of an Old World plant, eaten as a vegetable. Its skin is typically dark purple, but the skin of certain cultivated varieties is white or yellow.
a dark purple color like the skin of the eggplant.
the large plant of the nightshade family that bears the eggplant fruit.
The braised eggplant is delicious today.今天的红烧茄子很好吃。

egotist

['iːɡətɪst], ['iːɡətɪst]


Image Search
n. 自大者；自我中心的人
a person who is excessively conceited or self-absorbed; self-seeker.
"he is a self-absorbed egotist"
You need to be an egotist to succeed in politics. 要在政治上成功就必须自负。
I think you mean egotist， Tom said. 我想是你把我看成自我主义者了。
Richter：Because I'm an egotist. 李希特：因为我很自我中心。
If your club tries to big itself up, you are a monstrous egotist. 如果你的俱乐部想要充大，那你也是一个恶魔般的自我中心论者。
If you're proud of your achievements, you're an egotist. 如果你送花给她，你是在追求点什么。
But he was too much the egotist to reach the polish which Hurstwood possessed. 不过他过于自顾自，没有赫斯渥所具有的那种修养。

egress

['iːɡres], ['iːɡres]


Image Search
n. 外出；外出权；出路；出口
v. 外出
the action of going out of or leaving a place.
a way out.
the right or freedom to come out or go out.
another term for emersion.
go out of or leave (a place).
"direct means of access and egress for passengers"
"a narrow egress"
"they'd egress the area by heading southwest"
Safe access and egress can be achieved by various methods.可以采用各种方法安全的进入或离开。
The secured area should meet all life safety code egress requirements.受保护区域要满足所有的生命安全法规对出口的要求。

either

['aɪðə(r)], ['iðər]


Image Search
adj. 任一的；两方的
pron. 任一
adv. 也（用于否定句中）
conj. 或者（常用于either...or...的结构中）
used before the first of two (or occasionally more) alternatives that are being specified (the other being introduced by “or”).
used to indicate a similarity or link with a statement just made.
for that matter; moreover (used to add information).
one or the other of two people or things.
each of two.
"either I'll accompany you to your room, or I'll wait here"
"you don't like him, do you? I don't, either"
"I was too tired to go. And I couldn't have paid my way, either"
"there were no children of either marriage"
"the road was straight with fields of grass on either side"
The thief was put in the police car with a policeman on either side of him.窃贼被送到警车上，身旁各坐着一个警察。
You may take either of the roads.两条路你随便走哪一条。
It's not as heavy, either.这也不那么重。
If you do not go, I shall not go either.你不去，我也不去。
I will go on business either this week or next week.我将在这星期或下星期出差。
Either we will find a supply, or we will make the goods.我们或是寻求供货，或者自己制造。

elegant

['elɪɡənt], ['elɪɡənt]


Image Search
adj. 优雅的；雅致的
pleasingly graceful and stylish in appearance or manner.
(of a scientific theory or solution to a problem) pleasingly ingenious and simple.
"she will look elegant in black"
"the grand unified theory is compact and elegant in mathematical terms"
He strolled about, looking very debonair in his elegant new suit.他穿了一身讲究的新衣服逛来逛去，显得颇为惬意。
He proudly promenaded his elegant companion in the park.他得意地领著他那标致的伴侣遛公园。
We all wonder how you always look so young and beautiful and elegant!我们都很想知道,为什么你总是那么优雅年轻。
The lady wears an elegant dark suit.那位女士穿着雅致的深色套装。
I like my clothes to be simple but elegant.我喜欢朴素但漂亮雅致的衣服。

elegy

['elədʒi], ['elədʒi]


Image Search
n. 悲歌；哀歌；挽歌
a poem of serious reflection, typically a lament for the dead.
(in Greek and Roman poetry) a poem written in elegiac couplets, as notably by Catullus and Propertius.
Critics have spent entire books interpreting Gray's "Elegy.批评家们整本整本的书长篇累牍的来诠释格雷的“挽歌”。

elements

['elɪmənts], ['elɪmənts]


Image Search
n. 要素，元素；基本原则；恶劣天气
element的复数形式
a part or aspect of something abstract, especially one that is essential or characteristic.
a small but significant presence of a feeling or abstract quality.
the rudiments of a branch of knowledge.
a group of people of a particular kind within a larger group or organization.
an entity that is a single member of a set.
each of more than one hundred substances that cannot be chemically interconverted or broken down into simpler substances and are primary constituents of matter. Each element is distinguished by its atomic number, i.e., the number of protons in the nuclei of its atoms.
any of the four substances (earth, water, air, and fire) regarded as the fundamental constituents of the world in ancient and medieval philosophy.
one of the four substances (earth, water, air, or fire) considered as a person's or animal's natural environment.
the weather, especially strong winds, heavy rain, and other kinds of bad weather.
(in church use) the bread and wine of the Eucharist.
a part in an electric teapot, heater, or stove that contains a wire through which an electric current is passed to provide heat.
on some electric typewriters, a ball with raised letters that print when the keys are pressed.
"the death had all the elements of a great tabloid story"
"it was the element of danger he loved in flying"
"legal training may include the elements of economics and political science"
"extreme right-wing elements in the army"
"for the islanders, the sea is their kingdom, water their element"
"there was no barrier against the elements"
Water is composed of the elements hydrogen and oxygen.水是由氢元素和氧元素组成的。
What a sensational story! It has all the elements of a soap opera.多麽耸人听闻的事! 具备连续剧的一切要素。
The two elements are synthesized by a chemical process.这两种元素已经化学合成。
These are inactive elements.这些是惰性元素。
Honesty, industry and kindness are elements of a good life.诚实、勤劳和善良是幸福生活的要素。
Battle was joined, shortly after ten o'clock, with advance elements of two enemy divisions.10点钟过后不久，就同敌方两个师的先遣部队接上了火。
If the atoms of all these elements just stayed apart from each other, there be only about105 different things in the world.如果所有这些元素的原子都彼此不组合的话，世界上大约就只有105种不同的东西了。
You must understand the elements of mathematics before we can proceed further.你必须先弄懂数学基础知识，我们才能进一步学习。

eliminate

[ɪ'lɪmɪneɪt], [ɪ'lɪmɪneɪt]


Image Search
v. 除去；剔除；忽略；淘汰
completely remove or get rid of (something).
exclude (someone or something) from consideration.
murder (a rival or political opponent).
exclude (a person or team) from further participation in a sporting competition following defeat or inadequate results.
remove (a variable) from an equation, typically by substituting another that is shown by a different equation to be equivalent.
generate or remove (a simple substance) as a product in the course of a reaction involving larger molecules.
expel (waste matter) from the body.
"a policy that would eliminate inflation"
"the police have eliminated Larry from their inquiries"
"security agents have started a campaign to eliminate some of the government's opponents"
"the Bears were eliminated from the playoffs in the first round"
You must eliminate an unknown quantity.你必须消去一个未知数。
Let us eliminate all uncertain on thought.让我们从思想上消除一切疑惑。
We must eliminate unnecessary steps and get directly to the point.我们必须忽略不必要的步骤,直接切入主题。
Their team was eliminated in the first round.他们队在第一轮就被淘汰了。

elongate

['iːlɒŋɡeɪt], [ɪ'lɔːŋɡeɪt]


Image Search
v. 延长；伸长
adj. 延长了的；细长的
make (something) longer, especially unusually so in relation to its width.
grow longer.
long in relation to width; elongated.
"elongate, fishlike creatures"
We plan to elongate the cooperation with that company in Australia.我们打算延长与澳洲那家公司的合作关系。
Lines will elongate when height is increased.线可随着深度的增加而拉长。
These elongate sand bodies are attached to a bulge of the mainland.这些长条形砂体连接于主陆的突出部位。

eloquent

['eləkwənt], ['eləkwənt]


Image Search
adj. 雄辩的；有口才的；动人的
fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
clearly expressing or indicating something.
"an eloquent speech"
"the touches of fatherliness are eloquent of the real man"
He addressed the audience in an eloquent speech.他向听众发表了雄辩的演说。
Eloquent elephants telephoned other eloquent elephants.雄辩的大象打电话给其他雄辩的大象。
Such an eloquent man will easily talk us down.这样一个有口才的人很容易把我们驳得无话说。
An eloquent speaker is one skilled in the use of words.有口才的人善于用词。
She turned her eloquent eyes upon him.她那双动人的眼睛瞟向他。

elusive

[i'luːsɪv], [i'luːsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 难懂的；难捉摸的；难找的；逃避的
difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
difficult to remember or recall.
"success will become ever more elusive"
"the elusive thought he had had moments before"
Number is a crucial but elusive concept in English teaching and learning.数是英语教学中的一个关键而又难以捉摸的概念。
The Abominable Snowman who haunts the imagination of climbers in the Himalayas is hardly more elusive.常使喜马拉雅山的攀登者浮想联翩的雪人也不比此更难以捉摸。
Men like to pursue an elusive woman, like a cake of wet soap in a bathtub- even men who hate bath.男人们喜欢追逐那些象浴缸里的湿肥皂般难以捉摸的女人，即使是讨厌洗澡的男人也无不如此。
He spent a year prospecting for the elusive metal.他花了一年的功夫去勘探那种很难到手的金属。
Interpol have searched all the corners of the earth for the elusive hijackers.国际刑警组织已在世界各地搜查在逃的飞机劫持者。

embodiment

[ɪm'bɒdimənt], [ɪm'bɑːdimənt]


Image Search
n. 化身；体现
a tangible or visible form of an idea, quality, or feeling.
the representation or expression of something in a tangible or visible form.
"she seemed to be a living embodiment of vitality"
"it was in Germany alone that his hope seemed capable of embodiment"
She's the embodiment of kindness.她是慈祥的化身。
The new factory is the embodiment of the very latest ideas.这座新工厂是那些最新设想的体现。
If there is a French exception, Mr Chirac is its embodiment.如果说，存在一个法国例外，希拉克就是其体现。

embryonic

[ˌembri'ɒnɪk], [ˌembri'ɑːnɪk]


Image Search
adj. 胚胎的；萌芽期的
relating to an embryo.
(of a system, idea, or organization) in a rudimentary stage with potential for further development.
"the plan is still in its embryonic stages"
Embryonic stem cells are totipotent.胚胎干细胞是两性的。
Market economy was in its embryonic stages as early as feudalist society.市场经济，在封建社会时期就有了萌芽。
The plan, as yet, only exists in embryonic form.这个计划迄今为止还只是在酝酿之中。

emerged

[i'mɜːdʒ], [i'mɜːrdʒ]


Image Search
vi. 浮现；(由某种状态)脱出；(事实)显现出来
move out of or away from something and come into view.
become apparent, important, or prominent.
(of facts or circumstances) become known.
recover from or survive a difficult or demanding situation.
(of an insect or other invertebrate) break out from an egg, cocoon, or pupal case.
"black ravens emerged from the fog"
"Philadelphia has emerged as the clear favorite"
"reports of a deadlock emerged during preliminary discussions"
"the economy has started to emerge from recession"
A wonderful idea emerged in my mind.我的脑海里浮现出一个极妙的想法。
Man has gradually emerged from barbarism into civilization over the long history.在悠久的历史长河中人类逐渐脱离野蛮状态而进入文明。
Many facts emerged as a result of the investigation.调查结果,许多事实暴露出来。

emphasis

['emfəsɪs], ['emfəsɪs]


Image Search
n. 强调；重点；[语]加强语气
special importance, value, or prominence given to something.
stress laid on a word or words to indicate special meaning or particular importance.
vigor or intensity of expression.
"they placed great emphasis on the individual's freedom"
"he spoke with emphasis and with complete conviction"
They put emphasis on making to quota this quarter.他们强调要达到这一季的配额。
Our English course places great emphasis on conversational skills.我们的英语课程非常重视会话技能。
In recent years, the emphasis has moved away from punishing drug addicts towards helping them.最近几年,重点从惩罚吸毒者转移到救助他们。
You put too much emphasis on the last syllable.你把最后一个音节读得太重。

emphasize

['emfəsaɪz], ['emfəsaɪz]


Image Search
vt. 强调；着重；使突出
give special importance or prominence to (something) in speaking or writing.
lay stress on (a word or phrase) when speaking.
make (something) more clearly defined.
"he jabbed a finger into the tabletop to emphasize his point"
"a one-piece bathing suit that emphasized her build"
He emphasized the importance of careful driving.他强调小心驾驶的重要性。
We cannot emphasize too much the importance of learning English.我们再怎样强调学英文的重要性也不为过。
Which word should I emphasize?我应该重读哪个词?
I would like to emphasize that we are ready to meet the management at any time.我想着重指出，我们愿意在任何时候与管理部门会谈。
Jane's short hair emphasized her cheekbones.简的短发使她的颧骨更突出。

emphatically

[ɪm'fætɪkli], [ɪm'fætɪkli]


Image Search
adv. 断然地；强调地
in a forceful way.
without doubt; clearly.
"Jane, though born in California, feels emphatically Canadian"
He has always emphatically denied the allegations.他一直断然否认这些指控。
'Certainly not,' he replied emphatically.“当然不。”他断然回答道。
The house detective shook his head emphatically.侦探长断然地摇了摇头。
She is emphatically opposed to the proposals.她坚决反对这些建议。
He is emphatically a retiring and unassuming man.他的确是一个与世无争和谦虚纯朴的人。
He states emphatically that he never seems to miss a trick with his staff.他强调他对下属是明察秋毫,无所不知。
It must be emphatically pointed out that these views are wrong.应该着重指出，这些观点是错误的。

empirical

[ɪm'pɪrɪkl], [ɪm'pɪrɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 经验主义的；以观察或实验为根据的
based on, concerned with, or verifiable by observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
"they provided considerable empirical evidence to support their argument"
His science was generally empirical and often bad.他的科学一般来自经验。
Inquiry into the nature of things based on logical reasoning rather than empirical methods.自然科学基于逻辑推理而不是凭经验得来的方法来探究事物的本质。
Unboundedness has a greater empirical credibility.无界性有更大的经验可信性。
The Sprint phase is an empirical process.冲刺阶段是一个完全根据经验的过程。
He is involved in an empirical study.他参与了一项实验研究。

employee

[ɪm'plɔɪiː], [ɪm'plɔɪiː]


Image Search
n. 雇员
a person employed for wages or salary, especially at nonexecutive level.
This employee was dismissed for laziness.这名雇员因为懒惰而被解雇。
Their situations are now reversed as employee has become employer.他们双方的地位转换了，雇员成了雇主。
The boss struck off 100 dollars from the salary of the employee as fine.老板从这个雇员的工资里扣除100美元作为罚款。

empower

[ɪm'paʊə(r)], [ɪm'paʊər]


Image Search
vt. 授权；使能够
give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
make (someone) stronger and more confident, especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
"nobody was empowered to sign checks on her behalf"
"movements to empower the poor"
The lawyer was empowered to pay all her bills.律师已被授权偿付她的一切帐单。
The new laws empower the police to stop anybody in the street.新法令授予警察可以在街上截停任何人的权利。
The new laws empower the police to search private house.新的法律使警察得以搜查私人住宅。
Modern science and technology empower human beings to control natural forces more effectively.现代科学技术使人类能更有效地制服自然。

emulsion

[ɪ'mʌlʃn], [ɪ'mʌlʃn]


Image Search
n. 乳状液；感光乳剂
a fine dispersion of minute droplets of one liquid in another in which it is not soluble or miscible.
a fine dispersion of one liquid or pureed food substance in another.
a water-based paint used for walls.
a light-sensitive coating for photographic films and plates, containing crystals of a silver compound dispersed in a medium such as gelatin.
"ravioli with pea and ginger emulsion"
After cooling, the emulsion flows into a centrifuge.冷却后，乳状液流入离心分离机。
The device can be considered as a useful tool in study on the emulsion stability.这种显微图像装置在乳状液稳定性研究领城有广阔的应用前景。
You can ask the photographer for some emulsion.你可以找摄影师要点感光乳剂。
Their images were captured on plates of glass on which the photographer had spread an emulsion.影像拍摄在摄影师涂上了感光乳剂的玻璃板上。

enable

[ɪ'neɪbl], [ɪ'neɪbl]


Image Search
vt. 使能够；使可能
give (someone or something) the authority or means to do something.
make possible.
make (a device or system) operational; activate.
"the evidence would enable us to arrive at firm conclusions"
"a number of courses are available to enable an understanding of a broad range of issues"
Listening to music enables us to feel relaxed.听音乐能使我们放松。
A dog's ears enable it to hear the least sound.狗的耳朵使它能听到极细微的声音。
This train will enable me to get there in time.这列火车能使我及时到达那儿。
Hobbies may enable you to make many friends.业余爱好能够使你结识很多朋友.
Training will enable you to find a job.培训将使你找到工作。

encompass

[ɪn'kʌmpəs], [ɪn'kʌmpəs]


Image Search
vt. 围绕；包围；包括；完成
surround and have or hold within.
include comprehensively.
cause (something) to take place.
"a vast halo encompassing the Milky Way galaxy"
"no studies encompass all aspects of medical care"
"an act designed to encompass the death of the king"
The prison is encompassed by high walls.监狱被高墙围绕着。
The voices of people and sounds of cars encompass his path.他在路上听见四面八方都是人声车声。
The general arts at the university encompass a wide range of subjects.大学文科包括的科目非常广泛。

encounter

[ɪn'kaʊntə(r)], [ɪn'kaʊntər]


Image Search
n. 意外的相见；邂逅；遭遇
v. 遭遇；遇到；偶然碰到
unexpectedly experience or be faced with (something difficult or hostile).
meet (someone) unexpectedly.
an unexpected or casual meeting with someone or something.
a confrontation or unpleasant struggle.
"we have encountered one small problem"
"his close encounter with death"
If both participate, it may be an actual encounter of bodiless consciousness.如果是双向的，这会是一个真实的与灵魂的相见。
A fortunate encounter brought us together.一次幸运的邂逅使我们相识。
It was a bloody encounter between the two armies.这是那两军之间的一次激烈的遭遇战。
Don't be afraid to encounter risks.不要害怕遭遇危险。
Otherwise, we will encounter grave difficulties.否则便将遇到极大的困难。
I encountered an old friend at Rome.我在罗马邂逅了一个老朋友。

encountered

[ɪn'kaʊntəd], [ɪn'kaʊntəd]


Image Search
adj. 遇到的；遭遇的
动词encounter的过去式和过去分词.
unexpectedly experience or be faced with (something difficult or hostile).
meet (someone) unexpectedly.
"we have encountered one small problem"
The first person she encountered was Mr. Smith.她遇到的第一个人是史密斯先生。
The record encountered by this database operation is not an object.数据库操作遇到的记录不是一个对象。
Her range of weaponry could easily decimate any convoy she encountered.她强大的武器装备可以轻易地让任何和她遭遇的护航舰队灰飞烟灭。
Ok, to its credit the River of Fire was appropriate, and all the demons we encountered were very cool.好吧，其实那火焰之河还是很衬景的，而且我们一路上遭遇的那些恶魔们也很酷。

endanger

[ɪn'deɪndʒə(r)], [ɪn'deɪndʒər]


Image Search
vt. 危及；危害
put (someone or something) at risk or in danger.
"he was driving in a manner likely to endanger life"
It was foolish to endanger your life in that way.用那种方式危及你的生命是愚蠢的。
Development of the area would endanger wildlife.开发这一地区将会危及到野生生物。
Overworking can endanger your health.工作过度可能会危害你的健康。
He did it in the knowledge that it might endanger his life.他做那件事时知道它可能危害他的生命。

endeavor

[ɪn'devə], [ɪn'devər]


Image Search
n. 尽力；努力
v. 尽力；努力；力图
try hard to do or achieve something.
an attempt to achieve a goal.
earnest and industrious effort, especially when sustained over a period of time.
an enterprise or undertaking.
"he is endeavoring to help the Third World"
"an endeavor to reduce serious injury"
"enthusiasm is a vital ingredient in all human endeavor"
"a political endeavor"
Please make every endeavor to be early.请尽量早点儿。
He failed in convincing the buyer despite endeavor.尽管他已经尽力了,还是无法说服买主。
Where there is no hope, there can be no endeavor.哪里没有希望,哪里就不可能有努力。
His success came from endeavor rather than opportunity.他的成功与其说是由于机遇
The man endeavored to please his beloved wife.那人尽量使他深爱的妻子快乐。
You must endeavor to improve your work.你必须努力改进自己的工作。
They endeavor to achieve the goal.他们力图完成目标。

endemic

[en'demɪk], [en'demɪk]


Image Search
adj. 风土的；地方的
n. 地方病；风土病
(of a disease or condition) regularly found among particular people or in a certain area.
denoting an area in which a particular disease is regularly found.
(of a plant or animal) native or restricted to a certain country or area.
an endemic plant or animal.
"areas where malaria is endemic"
"a marsupial endemic to northeastern Australia"
Endemic diseases are common in this area.这个地区地方病流行。
With the efforts for many years, great achievements have been made in the prevention of the endemic diseases.经过多年的努力，地方病防治工作取得了很大成绩。

endow

[ɪn'daʊ], [ɪn'daʊ]


Image Search
vt. 捐助；赋予；使具有某种品质
give or bequeath an income or property to (a person or institution).
establish (a college post, annual prize, or project) by donating the funds needed to maintain it.
provide with a quality, ability, or asset.
"he endowed the church with lands"
"he was endowed with tremendous physical strength"
I can only endow 100 dollors at most.我充其量只能捐助100美元。
He endowed the hospital with a large fortune.他捐赠一笔巨款给这家医院。
She both built and endowed the hospital.她不仅建了医院还给医院捐赠资金。
He is endowed with literary talent.他有文学天分。
The long history and the splendid culture endow it with profoundness.悠久的历史、灿烂的文化，赋予了金华深厚的底蕴；
This advantage endows the nuclear weapon with deterrent power.正是这个优势赋予了核武器威慑力量。
For God did not endow her with wisdom or give her a share of good sense.因为上帝使他没有智慧,也未将悟性赐给她。

energy

['enədʒi], ['enərdʒi]


Image Search
n. 精力；活力；能源
the strength and vitality required for sustained physical or mental activity.
a person's physical and mental powers, typically as applied to a particular task or activity.
power derived from the utilization of physical or chemical resources, especially to provide light and heat or to work machines.
the property of matter and radiation which is manifest as a capacity to perform work (such as causing motion or the interaction of molecules).
a degree or level of energy possessed by something or required by a process.
"changes in the levels of vitamins can affect energy and well-being"
"a collision in which no energy is transferred"
"gamma rays at different energies"
Young people usually have more energy than the old.青年人通常比老年人精力充沛。
Don't waste your time and energy on trifles.别把你的时间和精力浪费在琐事上。
Auckland is a city full of energy.奥克兰是个充满活力的城市。
The industry felt the effects of the energy crisis.该工业受到能源危机的影响。
He gave a lecture on the use of solar energy.他就太阳能的利用作了一场讲演。

enforcement

[ɪn'fɔːsmənt], [ɪn'fɔːsmənt]


Image Search
n. 执行；强制；实施
the act of compelling observance of or compliance with a law, rule, or obligation.
"the strict enforcement of environmental regulations"
The police are responsible for the enforcement of the law.警察负责执法。
Effective enforcement can only flow from good laws.要有效地执行知识产权权利，就必定要有完善的法律。
The enforcement of compulsory pilotage shall be stipulated by MOTC by order.强制引水之实施，由交通部以命令定之。
Some countries stress the enforcement powers laid down by Chapter VII.一些国家重点强调第七章规定的强制权力。
Law enforcement cannot responsibly stand aloof.实施法律不能袖手旁观。
The enforcement of this law will clear the way for further reform.该项法律的实施将进一步扫除改革的障碍。

engage

[ɪn'ɡeɪdʒ], [ɪn'ɡeɪdʒ]


Image Search
v. 雇佣；啮合；与……交战；答应；订婚；预定；参加；从事
occupy, attract, or involve (someone's interest or attention).
cause someone to become involved in (a conversation or discussion).
arrange to employ or hire (someone).
pledge or enter into a contract to do something.
reserve (accommodations, a place, etc.) in advance.
participate or become involved in.
establish a meaningful contact or connection with.
(with reference to a part of a machine or engine) move into position so as to come into operation.
(of fencers or swordsmen) bring (weapons) together preparatory to fighting.
enter into conflict or combat with (an enemy).
(of a writer, artist, or their works) morally committed to a particular aim or cause.
"he plowed on, trying to outline his plans and engage Sutton's attention"
"he was engaged as a trainee copywriter"
"he engaged to pay them $10,000 against a bond"
"he had engaged a small sailboat"
"organizations engage in a variety of activities"
"the teams needed to engage with local communities"
"the clutch will not engage"
The restaurant decide to engage a pop singer.餐馆决定雇用一名流行歌手。
If the big gear did not engage with the small one,the machine would refuse to work.如果大齿轮与小齿轮不相啮合的话，机器就不会工作。
Our orders are to engage (the enemy) immediately.我们的命令是立即(与敌军)开战。
I will engage to manage the business if you will engage to provide the capital.如果你答应出资本，我答应经管这个生意。
Jack and Anne are engaged.杰克和安妮订婚了。
I have engaged a room at this hotel.我已经在这个旅馆里预订了一个房间。
I have no time to engage in the debate.我没时间参加辩论。
Is it wise to engage in active sports at your age?我这样的年纪积极参加体育活动是否明智？
They engage in the study of music.他们从事音乐研究。
Those who engage in mental work are also workers.从事脑力劳动的人也是劳动者。

engulf

[ɪn'ɡʌlf], [ɪn'ɡʌlf]


Image Search
vt. 吞没；席卷；吞噬
(of a natural force) sweep over (something) so as to surround or cover it completely.
eat or swallow (something) whole.
"the cafe was engulfed in flames"
"the toad can engulf nestling birds"
The waves engulfed the boat.大浪吞没了小舟。
The stormy sea engulfed the small motor sailboat.汹涌的大海吞没了那艘小机帆船。
The country was engulfed in civil war.该国陷入内战。
A wave of grief engulfed them.一阵悲伤吞噬了他们。

enhanced


Image Search
adj. 加强的；提高的
动词enhance的过去式和过去分词形式.
intensify, increase, or further improve the quality, value, or extent of.
"his refusal does nothing to enhance his reputation"
To be sure, these enhanced penetration concepts could be applied to nuclear munitions as well.当然，这类加强的钻地技术同样可应用在核弹上。
Even though the weather systems are intensifying and governments do involve themselves with trying to control weather, still dear ones everything is enhanced and in Divine Order.即使天气系统强化和政府它们自己试图努力控制天气，但是亲爱的朋友一切是提高的并且在神性的秩序里。
Mahler was, like Bruckner, the bearer of a transcendental mission, a spiritual sage and guide, master of an inspired tonal language enriched and enhanced by himself.马勒和布鲁克纳一样，肩负着灵界的高尚使命，是一位精神上的智者和向导，一位不断自我丰富与提高的通灵的音乐语言大师。

enigma

[ɪ'nɪɡmə], [ɪ'nɪɡmə]


Image Search
n. 难以理解的事物；谜；谜一般的人
a person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
I've known him for many years, but he remains something of an enigma to me.我与他相识多年，他仍然难以捉摸。
It is an enigma to me.它对我来说是个迷。
It is the enigma of life itself that you desire me to solve.你要我解决的是人生之谜。
Faraway space is an enigma to people.遥远的太空对人类来说是一个谜。
The queer behavior of the child was an enigma, even to its parents.那个孩子古怪的行为，甚至对其父母亲来说都是个谜。
He is an enigma to all of us.对我们而言，他是个神秘莫测的人物。
She never yielded and never became an enigma.她从不屈服，从来没有成为一个不可思议的人。

enormous

[ɪ'nɔːməs], [ɪ'nɔːrməs]


Image Search
adj. 巨大的；庞大的
very large in size, quantity, or extent.
"the possibilities are enormous"
Long ago enormous animals lived on the earth.很久以前，地球上生活着巨大的动物。
She stood alone on the enormous stage.她孤零零地站在巨大的舞台上。
They overlooked the enormous risks involved.他们忽略了暗含的巨大危险。
The sight of such an enormous crowd astonished us.看到如此庞大的人群我惊讶万分。
I was enormous when I was carrying my first baby.我怀头胎的时候非常胖。

ensure

[ɪn'ʃʊə(r)], [ɪn'ʃʊr]


Image Search
vt. 担保；保证；使安全；确保
make certain that (something) shall occur or be the case.
make certain of obtaining or providing (something).
make sure that (a problem) shall not occur.
"the client must ensure that accurate records be kept"
"she would ensure him a place in society"
We have worked closely with the Deaf community first, on passage of ADA, and most recently, to ensure that the Act is enforced.我们最近经常在ada路边的聋人社会附近工作，可以担保该法案得到了实施。
I can't ensure that he will be there on time.我不能担保他会及时到那儿。
This medicine will ensure you a good night's sleep.这药保证能让你好好睡一觉。
People should wash regularly to ensure personal hygiene.人们应经常洗澡以保证个人卫生。
The doctors were zealous in their efforts to ensure the survival of premature babies.医生们在努力保证早产婴儿成活方面热情很高。
We must ensure the purity of drinking water.我们必须确保饮用水的纯净。
If you want to ensure that you catch the plane, take a taxi.你要想确保能赶上那班飞机，就坐出租车去吧。

enthusiastic

[ɪnˌθjuːzi'æstɪk], [ɪnˌθuːzi'æstɪk]


Image Search
adj. 热心的；热情的；热烈的
having or showing intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval.
"the promoter was enthusiastic about the concert venue"
He is enthusiastic about helping others.他热心助人。
He doesn't know much about this subject, but he's very enthusiastic.他对这事所知不多,但他非常热心。
The audience were enthusiastic on the opening night of the play.那出戏首次公演之夜观众非常热情。
His idea received an enthusiastic response.他的想法获得热烈的响应。

entities

['entəti], ['entəti]


Image Search
n. 实体；存在；本质
a thing with distinct and independent existence.
existence; being.
"Church and empire were fused in a single entity"
"entity and nonentity"
A corporation is treated by the law as an entity.法人在法律上被视为一个实体。
It describes the change in an entity's state.它描述了一个实体的状态变化。

entrust

[ɪn'trʌst], [ɪn'trʌst]


Image Search
vt. 信赖；信托；交托
assign the responsibility for doing something to (someone).
put (something) into someone's care or protection.
"I've been entrusted with the task of getting him safely back"
"you persuade people to entrust their savings to you"
I hope we can entrust each other.我希望我们能彼此相互信任。
I know I can entrust you with my secret.我知道我能把我的秘密告诉你。
I wouldn't advise you to entrust anything of value to him.我劝你不要把任何贵重的东西托付给他看管。
You are a magistrate, and the only person I can entrust this matter to.你是法官，这件事我只信托你一个人。
I entrust my cat to a friend while I am away.我不在家时把猫托给朋友照料。
He's entrusted his children to my care for a day.他托我照看一天孩子。

enumerate

[ɪ'njuːməreɪt], [ɪ'nuːməreɪt]


Image Search
vt. 数；列举；枚举
mention (a number of things) one by one.
establish the number of.
"there is not space to enumerate all his works"
"the 2000 census enumerated 10,493 households in the county"
We found more children at the circus than we could enumerate.我们见到数不清的孩子在看马戏。
Can you enumerate the capitals of the50 states?你能把五十州的首府列举出来吗？
Let me enumerate many flaws in your hypothesis.让我列举你前提中的许多谬误。
Provide the path of the root folder to enumerate.提供要枚举的根文件夹的路径。
An error occurred while trying to enumerate all available policies.试图枚举所有可用的策略时出错。

environment

[ɪn'vaɪrənmənt], [ɪn'vaɪrənmənt]


Image Search
n. 环境；外界
the surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates.
the setting or conditions in which a particular activity is carried on.
the overall structure within which a user, computer, or program operates.
the natural world, as a whole or in a particular geographical area, especially as affected by human activity.
"a good learning environment"
"a desktop development environment"
She is not used to the new environment.她对新环境不习惯。
We are required by environment protecting department to use anthracite.环保部门要求我们使用无烟煤。
At one time, children didn't have to learn any more than how to cope with their physical environment.曾经有一段时间,儿童除了学习适应外界环境以外,什么都不学。

envy

['envi], ['envi]


Image Search
v. 羡慕；妒忌
n. 羡慕；(妒忌的)对象
a feeling of discontented or resentful longing aroused by someone else's possessions, qualities, or luck.
a person or thing that inspires envy.
desire to have a quality, possession, or other desirable attribute belonging to (someone else).
desire for oneself (something possessed or enjoyed by another).
"she felt a twinge of envy for the people on board"
"their national health service is the envy of many in Europe"
"he envied people who did not have to work on weekends"
"a lifestyle that most of us would envy"
They envy him his good fortune.他们羡慕他的好运气。
I envy her ability to dance in front of a crowd.她在众人面前所展现的的舞技令我羡慕不已。
Don't envy anyone who lives better than you.不要妒忌比你日子过得好的任何人。
He was filled with envy at my success.他对我的成功满怀羡慕。
His new house was the envy of all his friends.他的新居成了所有朋友羡慕的对象。

ephemeral

[ɪ'femərəl], [ɪ'femərəl]


Image Search
adj. 短暂的；朝生暮死的
n. 生存极短时间的事物
lasting for a very short time.
(chiefly of plants) having a very short life cycle.
an ephemeral plant.
"fashions are ephemeral"
Most newspapers are of ephemeral interest.多数报纸只能引起读者短暂的注意。
Slang words are often ephemeral.俚语往往只流行于一时。
Such novels came forward to enjoy ephemeral popularity only.这样的小说只是昙花一现的东西而已。

epic

['epɪk], ['epɪk]


Image Search
n. 史诗；叙事诗
adj. 史诗的；叙事诗的；宏大的；壮丽的
a long poem, typically one derived from ancient oral tradition, narrating the deeds and adventures of heroic or legendary figures or the history of a nation.
the genre of epic poems.
a long film, book, or other work portraying heroic deeds and adventures or covering an extended period of time.
relating to or characteristic of an epic or epics.
heroic or grand in scale or character.
particularly impressive or remarkable.
"the romances display gentler emotions not found in Greek epic"
"a Hollywood biblical epic"
"England's national epic poem Beowulf"
"his epic journey around the world"
"the gig last night was epic"
That movie was an epic about the Roman Empire.那电影是一部有关罗马帝国的史诗般的作品。
The Odyssey is an epic of ancient Greece.《奥德塞》是古希腊的一首史诗。
It is still the beginning of the home epic.它依然是一篇家庭叙事诗的开端。
It is perhaps the best of epic fantasies.这也许是史诗奇幻小说中最好的。
Scott described the making of an epic film.斯科特介绍了这一史诗般影片的制作过程。
It is still the beginning of the home epic.它依然是一篇家庭叙事诗的开端。
These epic processes melted and reprocessed vast amounts of rock and concentrated chemical elements in new ways.在这个宏大的过程中，岩石被融化，再生，以新方式聚集化学元素。

epidermis

[ˌepɪ'dɜːmɪs], [ˌepɪ'dɜːrmɪs]


Image Search
n. 表皮；上皮
the outer layer of cells covering an organism, in particular.
the surface epithelium of the skin of an animal, overlying the dermis.
the outer layer of tissue in a plant, except where it is replaced by periderm.
That part of the epidermis on his hand is damaged.他手上那块表皮受到损伤。
We may say that the epidermis protects the dermis.我们可以说是表皮保护了真皮。
All debris and detached epidermis must be removed.一切碎屑和分离的老皮必须清除。

epitome

[ɪ'pɪtəmi], [ɪ'pɪtəmi]


Image Search
n. 缩影；化身；摘要（古）
a person or thing that is a perfect example of a particular quality or type.
a summary of a written work; an abstract.
a thing representing something else in miniature.
"she looked the epitome of elegance and good taste"
The divisions we see in this school are the epitome of those occurring throughout the whole country.我们在这所学校中看到的各个部门是全国各校的缩影。
The Bund is a symbol of Shanghai and an epitome of Shanghai's modern history.外滩是上海的象征，亦是上海近代史的缩影。
My cat is the epitome of laziness.我的猫是懒惰的化身。
He is the epitome of diligence.他是勤勉的典型。

equation

[ɪ'kweɪʒn], [ɪ'kweɪʒn]


Image Search
n. 相等；均衡；方程式；等式
a statement that the values of two mathematical expressions are equal (indicated by the sign =).
the process of equating one thing with another.
a situation or problem in which several factors must be taken into account.
a symbolic representation of the changes which occur in a chemical reaction, expressed in terms of the formulae of the molecules or other species involved.
"the equation of science with objectivity"
"money also came into the equation"
The equation of wealth with happiness can be dangerous.把财富与幸福等同起来是很危险的
I can't make this equation come out.我不会解这个方程式。
What does x represent in this equation?这个方程式中的x代表什么?
The professor wrote an equation on the blackboard.教授在黑板上写了一个等式。

equipment

[ɪ'kwɪpmənt], [ɪ'kwɪpmənt]


Image Search
n. 设备；装备；器材
the necessary items for a particular purpose.
the process of supplying someone or something with items necessary for a particular purpose.
mental resources.
a man's genitals.
"office equipment"
"the construction and equipment of new harbor facilities"
"they lacked the intellectual equipment to recognize the jokes"
The government has an interest in importing scientific equipment.政府对引进科学设备非常感兴趣。
We should make a better use of the existing equipment.我们应该更好地利用现有设备。
The equipment must be bought from a supplier approved by the company.设备必须从公司认可的供应商那里购买。
The Army is auctioning off a lot of old equipment.军队正在把大量旧装备拍卖掉。
I tried to fix the equipment but I failed.我想把机器修理好，但是失败了。

equity

['ekwəti], ['ekwəti]


Image Search
n. 公平；公正
n. 衡平法；权益；产权；(无固定利息的)股票
the quality of being fair and impartial.
a branch of law that developed alongside common law in order to remedy some of its defects in fairness and justice, formerly administered in special courts.
(in the US, UK, and several other countries) a trade union to which most professional actors belong.
the value of the shares issued by a company.
stocks and shares that carry no fixed interest.
the value of a mortgaged property after deduction of charges against it.
"equity of treatment"
"he owns 62% of the group's equity"
The equity of the referee's decision was accepted by everyone.大家都同意裁判员的公正裁判.
They shared the work of the house with perfect equity.他们很公平地分担屋内的工作。
He seeks after equity all life long.他一生都在追求公正。
The judge has become a model of justice and equity.这位法官已经成了公正正义的楷模。
This became the characteristic idea of classical equity.这成了典型的衡平法所具备的特殊观念。
When the existing laws fail to render a satisfactory judgment, equity applies.当现存的法律不能作出令人满意的判决时衡平法就生效。
The equity of the house needed to be re-valued.这所房子的权益需要进行重新评估。
Thus, owners' equity is equal to the total assets minus the liabilities.因此，所有者权益就等于资产总值减去负债的数额。
Equity theory has a relatively strong following in many countries.产权理论有一相对地强跟随在许多国家。
Property rights reform, decentralization of equity, rational structure.产权改革，使股权分散，结构合理。
Equity fund Money market fund investing in equity stocks.股本基金指投资于股票的货币市场基金。
October was a mixed month for global equity markets.对全球股票市场来说，十月是一个充满变数的月份。

equivalent

[ɪ'kwɪvələnt], [ɪ'kwɪvələnt]


Image Search
adj. 等价的 相等的
n. 相等物
equal in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.
having the same or a similar effect as.
belonging to the same equivalence class.
a person or thing that is equal to or corresponds with another in value, amount, function, meaning, etc.
the mass of a particular substance that can combine with or displace one gram of hydrogen or eight grams of oxygen, used in expressing combining powers, especially of elements.
"one unit is equivalent to one glass of wine"
"some regulations are equivalent to censorship"
"the French equivalent of the FBI"
Is there a French word that is the exact equivalent of the English word `home'?法语中有没有和英语home完全一样的对应词?

eradicate

[ɪ'rædɪkeɪt], [ɪ'rædɪkeɪt]


Image Search
vt. 根除；根绝；消灭
destroy completely; put an end to.
"this disease has been eradicated from the world"
He eradicated weeds in his garden.他把花园中的杂草根除了。
They attempted to eradicate crime.他们力图根除罪恶。
The disease has now been successfully eradicated from the world.这种疾病已经成功地从世界上根除了。
Smallpox has almost been eradicated.天花几乎已经被消灭了。

erosion

[ɪ'rəʊʒn], [ɪ'rəʊʒn]


Image Search
n. 腐蚀；侵蚀；减少，流失
the process of eroding or being eroded by wind, water, or other natural agents.
the gradual destruction or diminution of something.
the gradual destruction of tissue or tooth enamel by physical or chemical action.
a place where surface tissue has been gradually destroyed.
"the problem of soil erosion"
"the erosion of support for the party"
"patients with gastric erosions"
Therefore, the corrosion was caused by erosion of rainwater during ocean shipping.因此，这些腐蚀是海运途中雨水的浸蚀造成的。
The erosion of beach here is serious.这里海岸的腐蚀很严重。
The cement petrified after many years' erosion.经过多年的侵蚀，水泥石化了。
The erosion of the soil is damaging the forest.土壤侵蚀使得森林遭到了破坏。
Deposition is the counterpart of erosion.淤积是侵蚀的对应面。
The rock is resistant to weathering and erosion.这种岩石不易风化和侵蚀。

erratic

[ɪ'rætɪk], [ɪ'rætɪk]


Image Search
adj. 古怪的；飘忽不定的；不稳定的
not even or regular in pattern or movement; unpredictable.
a rock or boulder that differs from the surrounding rock and is believed to have been brought from a distance by glacial action.
"her breathing was erratic"
He was like a stormy, erratic boy.他好象是个性急的古怪的孩子。
Though occasionally chatty, his moods were erratic.他虽然有时健谈，但是他的脾气却很难捉摸。
An erratic mind jump from one idea to another.心意不定的人反复无常。
They no longer fear the erratic behavior of the market.他们永远不害怕市场飘忽不定的行为。
This clock is rather erratic.这个钟不太准。
Deliveries of goods are erratic.不按规定送货。

erroneous

[ɪ'rəʊniəs], [ɪ'roʊniəs]


Image Search
adj. 错误的；不正确的
wrong; incorrect.
"employers sometimes make erroneous assumptions"
We must oppose these erroneous trends of thought.我们必须反对所有这些错误的思潮。
Sometimes this information may be erroneous.有时候这种信息是错误的。
Some of the erroneous pictures of America are painted by others.但是对美国的一些不正确的描述也来自外部世界。
So on bad CD-ROM drives it is possible that you receive erroneous results.以至于使用不好的光驱抓轨，可能会接收到不正确的结果。

error

['erə(r)], ['erər]


Image Search
n. 错误；过失；误差；谬误
a mistake.
the state or condition of being wrong in conduct or judgment.
a misplay by a fielder that allows a batter to reach base or a runner to advance.
a measure of the estimated difference between the observed or calculated value of a quantity and its true value.
a mistake of fact or of law in a court's opinion, judgment or order.
"spelling errors"
"the crash was caused by human error"
"the decisions of the appeal committee disclosed no error of law"
He overlooked a spelling error on the first page.他没有看出第一页中有个拼写错误。
An alert listener will have noticed the error.耳朵尖的人能听出这个错。
Every man is liable to error.人人都可能犯错误。
The accident was caused by human error.这宗事故是人为过失造成的。
Human error invoked the disaster.人的过失带来灾难。
Error analysis of the measurement system is given.给出了次测量系统的误差分析。
After several repetitions there still remains an error.重复数次之后仍然存在误差。
Custom without reason is but ancient error.习俗没有道理，古代谬误而已。
Divination is made up of a little error and superstition, plus a lot of fraud.占卜是由一些谬误和迷信构成，再加上大量的欺骗。

erudite

['erudaɪt], ['erudaɪt]


Image Search
adj. 博学的
having or showing great knowledge or learning.
The lecture was not very erudite.这次演讲的内容不很精深广博。
He likes to talk with erudite people.他喜欢和学识宏达的人交往。
The unlearned always pretend to be erudite.不学无术的人总是伪装知识渊博。

escarpment

[ɪ'skɑːpmənt], [ɪ'skɑːrpmənt]


Image Search
n. 长而陡的坡或悬崖
a long, steep slope, especially one at the edge of a plateau or separating areas of land at different heights.
Warm tip: Watch out for escarpment.温馨敬告：坡陡，注意安全。
The fox went to ground under a rocky escarpment.狐狸钻进了石崖下面的洞里。
There was an escarpment about 150 meters to our right.在我们右侧大约150米的地方是一处悬崖。

esophagus

[i'sɒfəɡəs], [i'sɑːfəɡəs]


Image Search
n. 食道
the part of the alimentary canal that connects the throat to the stomach; the gullet. In humans and other vertebrates it is a muscular tube lined with mucous membrane.
Stomach or can esophagus problem affect a heart?胃或者食道问题会不会影响到心脏？
Lipomas of the esophagus are rare benign tumors.摘要食道脂肪瘤是罕见的良性肿瘤。

esoteric

[ˌesə'terɪk], [ˌesə'terɪk]


Image Search
adj. 秘传的；神秘的；难懂的
intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest.
"esoteric philosophical debates"
I asked, but he said he couldn't tell me the recipe because it was esoteric.我问了，但是他说他不能告诉我那药方，因为那是秘传的。
Certain kinds of armor are made according to arcane and esoteric methods that involve weaving magic into the substance of the armor.有一些护甲在制造的过程中用秘传的方法和神秘的技艺将魔法编织在护甲之上。
Like many esoteric pursuits, this has been facilitated by the internet.像好多神秘的追求嗜好一样，互联网也已经为此提供了便利。
There are no esoteric formulas or secret states of mind that produce good designs effortlessly.没有任何奥妙的公式或神秘的心境可毫不费力地提出好的设计方案。
Eventual consistency is not some esoteric property of extreme distributed systems.最终一致性不是那些被过度分布的系统中存在的晦涩难懂的属性。

essential

[ɪ'senʃl], [ɪ'senʃl]


Image Search
adj. 本质的；必要的；重要的
n. 要素；必需品
absolutely necessary; extremely important.
fundamental or central to the nature of something or someone.
(of an amino acid or fatty acid) required for normal growth but not synthesized in the body and therefore necessary in the diet.
(of a disease) with no known external stimulus or cause; idiopathic.
a thing that is absolutely necessary.
the fundamental elements or characteristics of something.
"it is essential to keep up-to-date records"
"the essential weakness of the plaintiff's case"
"essential hypertension"
"we had only the bare essentials in the way of gear"
"he was quick to grasp the essentials of an opponent's argument"
This is of course still the essential method.这当然仍是本质的方法。
This is desirable but by no means essential to the primary objective of validating mathematical models of aircraft behaviour.对于验证飞机性能的数学模型这一主要目的来说，这是必须的，但决不是最本质的.
Concentration is essential if you want to do a good job.如果你想把事情做好,专心是必要的。
Mass education is essential in promoting democracy.民众教育对提倡民主是非常重要的。
What are the essentials of good teaching?成功教学的要素是什么?
The first essential, of course, is to know what you want.第一要素当然是知道自己想要什么。
We only had time to pack a few essentials.我们只来得及装上几件必需品。
A man should never neglect these social essentials.一个人决不该疏忽了这些社交上的必需品。

established

[ɪ'stæblɪʃt], [ɪ'stæblɪʃt]


Image Search
adj. 确定的；建立的；制定的
动词establish的过去式和过去分词形式.
having been in existence for a long time and therefore recognized and generally accepted.
(of a plant) having taken root; growing well.
(of a church or religion) recognized by the government as the national church or religion.
set up (an organization, system, or set of rules) on a firm or permanent basis.
initiate or bring about (contact or communication).
achieve permanent acceptance or recognition for.
introduce (a character, set, or location) into a film or play and allow its identification.
show (something) to be true or certain by determining the facts.
ensure that one's remaining cards in (a suit) will be winners (if not trumped) by playing off the high cards in that suit.
"the ceremony was an established event in the annual calendar"
"the British established a rich trade with Portugal"
"the two countries established diplomatic relations"
"the principle of the supremacy of national parliaments needs to be firmly established"
"establish the location with a wide shot"
"the police established that the two passports were forgeries"
She is reading a book that challenges established beliefs.她在读一本对确定的信念表示异议的书籍。
Each article was then reviewed, abstracted, and classified using an established evidence scoring system.利用确定的证据评分体系对每一篇文章复习、摘要、分类。
They adhere to the accepted or traditional and established faith.他们坚守被接受的或传统的和业已建立的信念。
Established rights are to be respected.既定权力必受尊重。
Established practices are difficult to modify.既定的惯例是很难更改的。

estate

[ɪ'steɪt], [ɪ'steɪt]


Image Search
n. 财产；遗产；房地产；状态；庄园
an extensive area of land in the country, usually with a large house, owned by one person, family, or organization.
a housing or commercial development.
a property where coffee, rubber, grapes, or other crops are cultivated.
all the money and property owned by a particular person, especially at death.
a class or order regarded as forming part of the body politic, in particular (in Britain), one of the three groups constituting Parliament, now the Lords spiritual (the heads of the Church), the Lords temporal (the peerage), and the Commons. They are also known as the three estates.
a particular class or category of people in society.
a particular state, period, or condition in life.
"in his will, he divided his estate between his wife and daughter"
"the spiritual welfare of all estates of men"
"programs for the improvement of man's estate"
The residue of estate belongs to his son.剩余财产属于他的儿子。
He settled part of his estate on his son.他把部分财产转让给儿子了。
The old man left an estate of two million dollars when he died.那老人去世时留下二百万美元的遗产。
He owns a large estate in Scotland.他在苏格兰有大量地产。
There is no reason to believe that people of every estate will support the political platform.没有理由相信社会各阶层的人都会拥护这个政纲。
He has a beautiful estate near London.他在离伦敦不远处有一个美丽的庄园。

esteem

[ɪ'stiːm], [ɪ'stiːm]


Image Search
n. 尊敬
vt. 尊敬；认为
respect and admiration, typically for a person.
respect and admire.
consider; deem.
"he was held in high esteem by colleagues"
"many of these qualities are esteemed by managers"
"I should esteem it a favor if you could speak to them"
We all have great esteem for you.我们都非常敬重您。
All his students held him in high esteem.他的学生对他都很尊敬。
No one can esteem you more than I do.没有人会比我更敬重你。
He is esteemed for his courage.他因有勇气而受人尊敬。
We esteem him to be worthy of trust.我们认为他值得信任。
She esteemed that she knew what life was.她认为自己懂得什么是生活。

estimate

['estɪmət], ['estɪmət]


Image Search
n. 估价；估计
v. 估计；估价；评价
roughly calculate or judge the value, number, quantity, or extent of.
an approximate calculation or judgment of the value, number, quantity, or extent of something.
a written statement indicating the likely price that will be charged for specified work or repairs.
a judgment of the worth or character of someone or something.
"the aim is to estimate the effects of macroeconomic policy on the economy"
"at a rough estimate, our staff is recycling a quarter of the paper used"
"compare costs by getting estimates from at least two firms"
"his high estimate of the poem"
This is an outside estimate of the price.这是最高的估价。
Your estimate was rejected by the seller.你的估价单被卖家回绝了。
This is a safe estimate.这是个有把握的估计。
We need to make an accurate estimate beforehand.我们需要事先作出准确的估计。
I estimate it will take three months to build the bridge .我估计建造这座桥得用3个月时间。
Statisticians can estimate the highest expected winds.统计人员能估计最大风速。
He estimates his losses at two million.他估计他的损失为两百万元。
The medicare cost is estimated to be one billion dollars.老年医疗保健费用估计为十亿美元。
It's impossible to estimate his abilities yet.目前评价他的能力是不可能的。
He is highly estimated among his colleagues.同事们对他的评价很高。

estuary

['estʃuəri], ['estʃueri]


Image Search
n. 河口；江口；海湾
the tidal mouth of a large river, where the tide meets the stream.
The ship has touched bottom, the estuary must is shallower than we thought.船搁浅了
We live near the Thames estuary.我们的住处靠近泰晤士河入海口。
There are many boats in the estuary.港湾里有许多小船。

ethical

['eθɪkl], ['eθɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
relating to moral principles or the branch of knowledge dealing with these.
morally good or correct.
avoiding activities or organizations that do harm to people or the environment.
(of a medicine) legally available only on a doctor's prescription and usually not advertised to the general public.
"ethical issues in nursing"
"can a profitable business be ethical?"
"an expert on ethical investment"
You can't divorce science from ethical questions.不能把科学与伦理问题截然分开。
Her behavior is alien to our ethical values.她的行为和我们的伦理标准格格不入。
They teach the relativity of all ethical ideas.他们宣扬一切道德观念的相对性。
Some medicine we need is ethical drug which you can't buy without a prescription.我们需要的一些药是处方药,没有处方你是买不到的。

ethnic

['eθnɪk], ['eθnɪk]


Image Search
adj. 种族的；民族的；有民族特色的
n. 少数民族的一员
relating to a population subgroup (within a larger or dominant national or cultural group) with a common national or cultural tradition.
relating to national and cultural origins.
denoting origin by birth or descent rather than by present nationality.
characteristic of or belonging to a non-Western cultural tradition.
neither Christian nor Jewish; pagan or heathen.
a member of an ethnic minority.
"leaders of ethnic communities"
"two playwrights of different ethnic origins"
"ethnic Albanians in Kosovo"
"ethnic dishes"
Canada is a multicultural country. Regardless of your ethnic origin, you will feel at home in Canada;加拿大是一个多元文化国家,无论你为何种族,在加拿大你都会感到安适;
Along the way, tourists can see the Tujia ethnic minorities tilling the land.沿着这条路,旅游者可以看到土家族的人在耕地。
That's why you can find almost every kind of ethnic food in America.那也就是为什么在美国你几乎可以看到所有不同民族的食物。
Now all the 55 ethnic minorities have their own college students,and some even are master's and doctor's degree holders.目前，55个少数民族都有了本民族的大学生，有的还有了硕士生和博士生。
This music would sound more ethnic if you played it in steel drums.如果你用钢鼓演奏, 这首乐曲将更具民族特色。

ethos

['iːθɒs], ['iːθɑːs]


Image Search
n. 民族精神；道德风貌；气质
the characteristic spirit of a culture, era, or community as manifested in its beliefs and aspirations.
"a challenge to the ethos of the 1960s"
We must develop an ethos of cost consciousness.我们必须提高人们在成本意识方面的精神素质。
The day could not be far distant when naturalism would dominate the ethos of American literature.自然主义将支配美国文学风气的时日，已经为期不远。
They cultivated a subversive alternative ethos.他们培育了一种破坏性的交替的民族气质。

euphemism

['juːfəmɪzəm], ['juːfəmɪzəm]


Image Search
n. 委婉语
a mild or indirect word or expression substituted for one considered to be too harsh or blunt when referring to something unpleasant or embarrassing.
"“downsizing” as a euphemism for cuts"
"Pass away" is a euphemism for "die"."过世"是"死"的委婉语。
Euphemism is a very common and complicated linguistic phenomenon.委婉语是一种十分常见而又非常复杂的语言现象。

evacuate

[ɪ'vækjueɪt], [ɪ'vækjueɪt]


Image Search
v. 疏散；撤出；排泄
remove (someone) from a place of danger to a safe place.
leave or cause the occupants to leave (a place of danger).
(of troops) withdraw from (a place).
remove air, water, or other contents from (a container).
empty (the bowels or another bodily organ).
discharge (feces or other matter) from the body.
deprive (something) of contents, value, or force.
"several families were evacuated from their homes"
"fire alarms forced staff to evacuate the building"
"the last American troops evacuated the Canal Zone"
"when it springs a leak, evacuate the pond"
"he evacuated time and history of significance"
There's been a bomb threat we need to evacuate.有人威胁说在这安放了炸弹 我们需要紧急疏散
Please evacuate the building immediately.请立刻自大楼疏散。
The first priority shall be to evacuate the bus.汽车着火后的第一要务是疏散乘客。
All people would evacuate the area.所有人员也都全部撤离这一地区。

evade

[ɪ'veɪd], [ɪ'veɪd]


Image Search
v. 逃避；躲避；规避
escape or avoid, especially by cleverness or trickery.
(of an abstract thing) elude (someone).
avoid giving a direct answer to (a question).
avoid dealing with or accepting; contrive not to do (something morally or legally required).
escape paying (tax or duty), especially by illegitimate presentation of one's finances.
defeat the intention of (a law or rule), especially while complying with its letter.
"friends helped him to evade capture for a time"
"sleep still evaded her"
"he denied evading the question"
"difficulties to be faced and not evaded"
He could not evade the law.他逃避不了法律。
They evade paying taxes by living abroad.他们住在国外以逃避交税。
In order to evade the persecution of fascists, he had to escape abroad.为躲避法西斯的迫害，他不得不流徙到国外。
Give me a direct answer, and stop evade the issue.给我一个直截了当的回答，不要回避这一问题。
The question could not be evaded.那个质问无法规避。

evaluation

[ɪˌvælju'eɪʃn], [ɪˌvælju'eɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 估价；评价
the making of a judgment about the amount, number, or value of something; assessment.
"the evaluation of each method"
The product needs an expert evaluation.这种产品需要专家评估。
We need to carry out a proper evaluation of the new system.我们需要对这套新体系做出一个正确的评价。

eventually

[ɪ'ventʃuəli], [ɪ'ventʃuəli]


Image Search
adv. 最后；终于
in the end, especially after a long delay, dispute, or series of problems.
"eventually, after midnight, I arrived at the hotel"
It was a long journey, but we eventually arrived.旅程很长，但我们最后还是到达了。
He struggled with his assailants and eventually drove them off.他同攻击他的人进行搏斗，最后把他们赶走了。
She eventually got back the book she had lent him.她终于收回了借给他的书。
Eventually the fire was under control.火势终于被控制住了。

evidence

['evɪdəns], ['evɪdəns]


Image Search
n. 证据；证词；根据；迹象
v. 证明；证实
the available body of facts or information indicating whether a belief or proposition is true or valid.
information given personally, drawn from a document, or in the form of material objects, tending or used to establish facts in a legal investigation or admissible as testimony in court.
signs or indications of something.
be or show evidence of.
"the study finds little evidence of overt discrimination"
"without evidence, they can't bring a charge"
"there was no obvious evidence of a break-in"
"that it has been populated from prehistoric times is evidenced by the remains of Neolithic buildings"
There wasn't enough evidence to prove his guilt.没有充分的证据能证明他有罪。
Evidence weighted against the defendant.证词很不利于被告。
It is a statement in conflict with other evidence.这一陈述与其他证词不一致。
Have you any evidence to support this statement?你这种说法有根据吗?
Experiment shows no evidence of the production of explosive forces.实验表明,丝毫没有产生爆炸力的迹象。
When the ship reached port, it bore abundant evidence of the severity of the storm.船抵港时，船上满是受到暴风雨肆虐的痕迹。
His answer evidenced a guilty conscience.他的回答证明他良心有愧。
The volcano is still active, as evidenced by the recent eruption.正如最近的喷发所证明，火山仍很活跃。

evident

['evɪdənt], ['evɪdənt]


Image Search
adj. 明白的；明显的
plain or obvious; clearly seen or understood.
"she ate the cookies with evident enjoyment"
Now it became evident that he spoke two languages at once.现在我才明白，原来他心里一套表面一套。
Inertia is evident in our every day experiences.惯性在我们日常生活中是很常见的。
The purpose may not be immediately evident.这种目的不一定显而易见。
The rationale for the present study is evident.该研究的理论基础是明显的。
He looks at twelve children with evident pride.他带着明显的得意看着12个儿女。

evince

[ɪ'vɪns], [ɪ'vɪns]


Image Search
v. 表明；表示
reveal the presence of (a quality or feeling).
be evidence of; indicate.
"his letters evince the excitement he felt at undertaking this journey"
"man's inhumanity to man as evinced in the use of torture"
The boy evinces great intelligence.这个男孩表现出很高的智慧。
The intrinsic value of tussle is to evince one's aversion.斗争的本质就是表明自己的厌恶之情。
He evinced great sorrow for what he had done.他对自己的所作所为深表歉疚。
She at last condescended to evince awareness of his proximity.最后她才纡贵屈尊地表示出她注意到他在旁边。

eviscerate

[ɪ'vɪsəreɪt], [ɪ'vɪsəreɪt]


Image Search
v. 取出内脏；除去精华
disembowel (a person or animal).
deprive (something) of its essential content.
remove the contents of (a body organ).
"the goat had been skinned and neatly eviscerated"
"myriad little concessions that would eviscerate the project"
Save your cold blood eviscerate as a finisher. 留着你的冷血剔骨做为最后一击。
Or a Rogue in 2 Hemos and an Eviscerate. 或者是盗贼两个出血一个剔骨就死了。
Lethality will no longer affect the Eviscerate ability. 致命伤不再影响剔骨攻击。
Eviscerate demolition meat, cut into the meat section. 拆肉剔骨，将肉切成条。
Improved Eviscerate (Assassination) now increases damage by 7/14/20%. 强化剔骨现在增加剔骨伤害7/14/20%25。
Eviscerate: Manual of Eviscerate (Rank 9) now drops somewhere in the world. 剔骨：9级剔骨现在可以掉落。

evolution

[ˌiːvə'luːʃn], [ˌiːvə'luːʃn]


Image Search
n. 进化；发展；演变
the process by which different kinds of living organisms are thought to have developed and diversified from earlier forms during the history of the earth.
the gradual development of something, especially from a simple to a more complex form.
the giving off of a gaseous product, or of heat.
a pattern of movements or maneuvers.
the extraction of a root from a given quantity.
"the forms of written languages undergo constant evolution"
"silk ribbons waving in fanciful evolutions"
Charles Darwin and Alfred Russell Wallace discovered evolution independently.查尔斯·达尔文和阿尔弗雷德· 罗素·华莱士各自独立地发现了进化论。
Within 30 years,humans could be debating whether to take charge of their own evolution.不出30年，人类将讨论是否要掌控自身的进化。
Our watchword is: ‘Evolution, not revolution’.我们的口号是: ‘要循序渐进,不要剧烈变革’。
Our political institutions are in continuous evolution.我们的政治制度正在不断发展中。
In politics Britain has preferred evolution to revolution.在政治上，英国喜欢渐进而不喜欢革命。
Do you know about the evolution of a seed into a plant?你知道从种子发展成为植物的过程吗？

exalt

[ɪɡ'zɔːlt], [ɪɡ'zɔːlt]


Image Search
v. 赞扬；提升；加强
hold (someone or something) in very high regard; think or speak very highly of.
raise to a higher rank or a position of greater power.
make noble in character; dignify.
"the party will continue to exalt its hero"
"this naturally exalts the peasant above his brethren in the same rank of society"
"romanticism liberated the imagination and exalted the emotions"
All the people of whom you and I are the rag-tag and bobtail, all the camp followers of western civilization, we have taken it for granted that even if we did not live up to those exalted ethical standards, we did a great deal better than anyone else.我们所有的人，包括你和我这样的下层平民，以及所有西方文明的依附者都认为，即使我们尚未达到那些崇高的道德标准，我们也还是是比别的任何人都干得好得多。
He was exalted to the position of general manager.他被提升到总经理的职位。

exasperate

[ɪɡ'zæspəreɪt], [ɪɡ'zæspəreɪt]


Image Search
v. 使 ... 恼怒；激怒；使恶化
adj. 被激怒的；表面粗糙的
irritate intensely; infuriate.
"this futile process exasperates prison officials"
That child exasperates me.那孩子真让我生气。
She was exasperated at his stupidity.她因为他的愚笨而发怒。
He shouted in an exasperate voice.他以愤怒的声音嚷着。

excavate

['ekskəveɪt], ['ekskəveɪt]


Image Search
v. 挖掘；挖开；发掘（古物）
make (a hole or channel) by digging.
dig out material from (the ground).
extract (material) from the ground by digging.
remove earth carefully and systematically from (an area) in order to find buried remains.
reveal or extract (buried remains) by carefully removing earth.
"the cheapest way of doing this was to excavate a long trench"
"the ground was largely excavated by hand"
"a very large amount of gravel would be excavated to form the channel"
"clothing and weapons were excavated from the burial site"
It took a long time to excavate the ancient city of Troy.挖掘古老的特洛伊城，花了很长时间。
I let him excavate around the mine.我准许他在金矿周围挖掘。
They plan to excavate a large hole.他们计划挖个大洞。
The archaeologists excavated a buried city.考古学家发掘出一个埋在地下的城市。

exceed

[ɪk'siːd], [ɪk'siːd]


Image Search
vt. 超过；超出
vi. 领先
be greater in number or size than (a quantity, number, or other measurable thing).
go beyond what is allowed or stipulated by (a set limit, especially of one's authority).
be better than; surpass.
"production costs have exceeded $60,000"
"the Tribunal's decision clearly exceeds its powers under the statute"
"catalog sales have exceeded expectations"
His knowledge of history exceeds mine.他的历史知识超过我。
Demand began to exceed supply.开始供不应求。
The fine shall not exceed $300.罚款不超过三百美元。

excel

[ɪk'sel], [ɪk'sel]


Image Search
vt. 优于；超过
vi. 胜出
n. [计] 电子表格（软件名称）
be exceptionally good at or proficient in an activity or subject.
"a sturdy youth who excelled at football"
He excels in painting.他擅长绘画。
His wife excels him in strategical ability.他的妻子在战略上胜过他。
We strive to excel in bringing out our clients vision and style.我们努力在带给我们的客户不同的观念和风格上优于他人。
They each excel in their respective fields.他们在各自领域里都是出类拔萃的。
He excels all other composers of his period.他超过了同时期的所有其他作曲家。
He is working hard to excel his predecessors.他正努力超越他的前任。
He always hopes that his son will excel over him someday.他总是希望他的儿子有天能胜过他.
Excel is widely applied in the vacuum metrology.在真空计量领域中，Excel电子表格软件得到了广泛的应用。
Excel mainly provides electric sheet.Excel提供的主要是电子表格功能。

excerpt

['eksɜːpt], ['eksɜːrpt]


Image Search
n. 摘录
vt. 摘录；引用
a short extract from a film, broadcast, or piece of music or writing.
take (a short extract) from a text.
take an excerpt or excerpts from (a text).
"the notes are excerpted from his forthcoming biography"
This is an excerpt from a novel.这是一部小说的摘录。
I've seen a short excerpt from the film on television.我在电视上看过这部影片的片段。
You can excerpt passages from a book.你可以从一本书中摘录几段。
Can you excerpt something from the newspaper?你能从报纸上选录些东西吗?
You should clarify where the words come from, if you excerpt them.如果写作时引用了他人的话，应当注明出处。

excluded

[ɪk'skluːd], [ɪk'skluːd]


Image Search
vt. 排除；阻止；拒绝接受
deny (someone) access to or bar (someone) from a place, group, or privilege.
keep (something) out of a place.
remove from consideration; rule out.
prevent the occurrence of; preclude.
"women had been excluded from many scientific societies"
"apply flux to exclude oxygen"
"computer software is excluded from the mandatory 15-year write-off"
"clauses seeking to exclude liability for loss or damage"
At this stage we cannot entirely exclude the possibility of staff cuts.在目前这个阶段,我们还不能完全排除裁员的可能性。
I mean the last thing we would think about is to exclude the children from this plan.我的意思是,我们绝不会考虑把孩子们排除在这个计划之外的。
Thick curtains help to exclude street noises.厚窗帘有助于隔绝街上的噪音。
The court excluded the improperly obtained evidence.法院不接受非正常渠道获得的证据

exemplify

[ɪɡ'zemplɪfaɪ], [ɪɡ'zemplɪfaɪ]


Image Search
vt. 例证；示范
be a typical example of.
give an example of; illustrate by giving an example.
make an attested copy of (a document) under an official seal.
"rock bands that best exemplify the spirit of the age"
I will exemplify my point with a story.我会用一个故事举例说明我的观点。
To exemplify this theory,let us examine some species of insect.为举例说明这种理论，我们来检查一些种类的昆虫。
The plays of Wilds exemplify the comedy of manners.王尔德的戏剧是风尚喜剧的典范。
The recent oil price rises exemplify the difficulties which the motor industry is now facing.最近的石油涨价是汽车工业正面临的困难的一个例子。
This painting exemplifies the artist's early style.这幅画是该画家早期艺术风格的典型。

exert

[ɪɡ'zɜːt], [ɪɡ'zɜːrt]


Image Search
vt. 运用；施加
apply or bring to bear (a force, influence, or quality).
make a physical or mental effort.
"the moon exerts a force on the Earth"
"he needs to exert himself to try to find an answer"
He exerted all his influence to make them accept his plan.他用尽一切影响力使他们接受他的计划。
He doesn't have to exert himself on my behalf.他不必为我费那么大力气。
You have to exert more efforts if you want to catch up with your classmates.你要想赶上你的同学的话,就得多花些功夫。
His teachings still exert a strong influence.他的教导仍在产生巨大影响。

exhibit

[ɪɡ'zɪbɪt], [ɪɡ'zɪbɪt]


Image Search
v. 展览；陈列；展示；表现
n. 展品；展览
publicly display (a work of art or item of interest) in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
(of an artist) display one's work to the public in an art gallery or museum.
publicly display the work of (an artist) in an art gallery or museum.
manifest or deliberately display (a quality or a type of behavior).
show as a sign or symptom.
an object or collection of objects on public display in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
an exhibition.
a document or other object produced in a court as evidence.
"only one sculpture was exhibited in the artist's lifetime"
"she was invited to exhibit at several French museums"
"no foreign painters were exhibited"
"he could exhibit a saintlike submissiveness"
"patients with alcoholic liver disease exhibit many biochemical abnormalities"
"the museum is rich in exhibits"
"people flocked to the exhibit in record-breaking numbers"
Many unearthed cultural relics were exhibited at the museum.博物馆展出了许多出土文物。
He was given a whole room to exhibit his paintings.整个房间用来展览他的画作。
She exhibited great powers of endurance during the climb.她在攀登过程中表现出极大的耐力。
They deprecated the new exhibit.他们很不赞成新展品。
The exhibit will be open through February, 2004.展览将一直开放到2004年2月。

exhilarating

[ɪɡ'zɪləreɪtɪŋ], [ɪɡ'zɪləreɪtɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 令人振奋的；令人兴奋的；令人高兴的
making one feel very happy, animated, or elated; thrilling.
make (someone) feel very happy, animated, or elated.
"an exhilarating two-hour rafting experience"
"the children were exhilarated by a sense of purpose"
And it has been an exhilarating and eventful time.这是一个令人激动的并且重要的时间。
I had more exhilarating fun coming back this summer than I had had before.这个夏天的回归我所得到的振奋和乐趣远比以往为多。
Our first parachute jump was an exhilarating experience.我们第一次跳伞感到兴奋莫名。
Jason: The most exhilarating day in my life.杰森：今天是我一生中最最兴奋的日子。
And it's been an exhilarating and eventful time.那是一段令人愉快和波折的时光。”

exile

['eksaɪl], ['ekzaɪl]


Image Search
n. 放逐；流放；被放逐者
vt. 放逐；流放
the state of being barred from one's native country, typically for political or punitive reasons.
a person who lives away from their native country, either from choice or compulsion.
another term for Babylonian Captivity.
expel and bar (someone) from their native country, typically for political or punitive reasons.
"he knew now that he would die in exile"
"the return of political exiles"
"a corrupt dictator who had been exiled from his country"
The king was sent into exile.国王遭到放逐。
He was publicly disgraced and sent into exile.他被当众贬谪，放逐异乡。
Everyone is born king,and most people die in exile.每个人生下来都是王，而大多数人却在放逐中死去。
Exile was for him a living death.他遭流放是进了活地狱。
He had been five years in exile.他过流放生活已经五年了。
He was condemned to lifelong exile.他被判处终身流放。
He returned after 40 years of exile.他流放40年后归来。
He was in the unenviable position of having to choose between imprisonment or exile.他已陷於进退维谷的地步，不是坐牢就是流放，必须在两者间做出抉择。
He has been an exile for ten years.他已经流亡十年。
He was exiled from the country for one year.他被放逐一年。
He was condemned to exile for treason .他因叛国罪被判处流放。

expansion

[ɪk'spænʃn], [ɪk'spænʃn]


Image Search
n. 膨胀；扩展；扩充
the action of becoming larger or more extensive.
extension of a state's territory by encroaching on that of other nations, pursued as a political strategy.
a thing formed by the enlargement, broadening, or development of something.
the increase in the volume of fuel on combustion in the cylinder of an engine, or the piston stroke in which this occurs.
"the rapid expansion of suburban Washington"
"German expansion in the 1930s"
"the book is an expansion of a lecture given last year"
Metals undergo expansion when heated.金属加热时会膨胀。
The thermostat is based on the fact that different metals have different coefficients of expansion.恒温器是以不同的金属有不同的膨胀系数这一事实为根据的。
His economic policies paved the way for industrial expansion.他的经济政策为工业的扩展铺平了道路。
The time has come for the firm to consolidate after several years of rapid expansion.公司经过几年的迅速发展之後，该整顿一下了。
This book is an expansion of the play he wrote before.这本书是他以前写的剧本的扩充。

expectation

[ˌekspek'teɪʃn], [ˌekspek'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 预料；期望
a strong belief that something will happen or be the case in the future.
a belief that someone will or should achieve something.
one's prospects of inheritance.
another term for expected value.
"reality had not lived up to expectations"
"students had high expectations for their future"
It is really out of my expectation.这真是出乎我的意料。
There's no expectation of snow tonight.今晚预料无雪.
