His parents have great expectations for his future.他父母对他的前途深寄厚望。
She had high expectations of what university had to offer.她对大学所能给她提供的一切期望很高.

expectations

[ekspek'teɪʃnz], [ekspek'teɪʃnz]


Image Search
预期继承的遗产
a strong belief that something will happen or be the case in the future.
a belief that someone will or should achieve something.
one's prospects of inheritance.
another term for expected value.
"reality had not lived up to expectations"
"students had high expectations for their future"

expend

[ɪk'spend], [ɪk'spend]


Image Search
vt. 花费；消耗
spend or use up (a resource such as money, time, or energy).
"we do not need to expend energy working on our marriage"
He lived high and expended largely.他生活讲究，花费很大。
He has expended much time and energy on that experiment.他已经花费许多时间、金钱在那实验上。
The soldiers expended all their ammunition in that fight.士兵在那场战斗中用尽了所有的弹药。
I had expended much time on the work but they told me it's useless.我花了很多时间在这件工作上，他们却告诉我说这是无用的。

expensive

[ɪk'spensɪv], [ɪk'spensɪv]


Image Search
adj. 昂贵的；高价的
costing a lot of money.
"keeping a horse is expensive"
The dress is too expensive for me to buy.那衣服太昂贵，我买不起。
A cheaper camera is not always inferior to a more expensive one.廉价照相机的质量并总不比昂贵的差。
This set of crystal wine cups is very expensive.这套水晶玻璃酒杯非常昂贵。
The overhead costs are ridiculously expensive.日常开支太高了。
It is more expensive to go by plane than by boat.坐飞机去比坐船去的费用更高一些。

expert

['ekspɜːt], ['ekspɜːrt]


Image Search
n. 专家；能手
adj. 熟练的；内行的
a person who has a comprehensive and authoritative knowledge of or skill in a particular area.
having or involving authoritative knowledge.
"a financial expert"
"he had received expert academic advice"
She is a reputable expert.她是个有声望的专家。
According to expert opinions, they gave up the experiment immediately.根据专家们的意见，他们马上放弃了这项试验。
He is an expert in unarmed combat.他是徒手格斗的能手。
The surgeon cut away the tumour with expert skill.外科大夫用熟练的技术把肿瘤切去。
To her expert eye, the painting was terrible.她以内行的眼光看，这幅画糟透了。
Could you give me your expert advice?你可以给我一些专业意见吗?

expiration

[ˌekspə'reɪʃn], [ˌekspə'reɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 终止；期满；呼出；呼气
the ending of the fixed period for which a contract is valid.
the end of a period of time.
exhalation of breath.
"the expiration of the lease"
"the expiration of three years"
This Contract shall be terminated on the expiration date.劳动合同期满，即行终止。
A contract subject to a time of expiration is extinguished at such time.附终止期限的合同，自期限届满时失效。
The expiration of contract is coming.合同快到期了。
When is the expiration of your driving license?你的驾驶执照何时到期？
This ticket has passed its expiration date, and so it is now invalid.这张票已过了有效期，现在作废了。

explicit

[ɪk'splɪsɪt], [ɪk'splɪsɪt]


Image Search
adj. 明确的；清晰的；清楚的；露骨的
stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt.
(of a person) stating something in a clear and detailed way.
describing or representing sexual activity in a graphic fashion.
the closing words of a text, manuscript, early printed book, or chanted liturgical text.
"the speaker's intentions were not made explicit"
"let me be explicit"
"explicit photos showing poses and acts"
They gave explicit reasons for leaving.他们明确地说出了离开的原因。
A man can try his best to perfect and improve himself only if he has strong desires and explicit goal.只有怀着强烈的欲望,有着明确的目标,一个人才能竭尽全力去完善自我,提升自我。
He has an explicit understanding of this.他对这个了解得很清晰。
He gave me explicit directions on how to get there.他清清楚楚地告诉我怎样到达那里。
This film will never pass the censors, because it is too sexually explicit这部电影一定不能通过审查这一关,因色情过于露骨。

exploitation

[ˌeksplɔɪ'teɪʃn], [ˌeksplɔɪ'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 开发；开采；剥削；利用
the action or fact of treating someone unfairly in order to benefit from their work.
the action of making use of and benefiting from resources.
the fact of making use of a situation to gain unfair advantage for oneself.
"the exploitation of migrant workers"
"the Bronze Age saw exploitation of gold deposits"
"this administration's exploitation of the fear of crime"
Excessive exploitation makes the soil barren.过度开发使这些土地变得贫瘠了。
The government has a monopoly of oil exploitation in that country.在那个国家，政府独占石油开采权。
Generally speaking, mineral exploitation is a feast-or-famine industry.一般来说，开矿这种事业不是大大成功便是彻底失败。
The boss made a fortune by means of exploitation.这个老板是靠剥削发的财。
He is unscrupulous in his exploitation of people.他肆无忌弹地剥削人民。
The capitalist system reposes on the exploitation of the labouring people.资本主义制度建立在剥削劳动人民的基础上。

export

['ekspɔːt], ['ekspɔːrt]


Image Search
n. 输出；出口；输出品；输出存储器的信息
v. 输出；出口；带走，运走；从存储器输出信息
send (goods or services) to another country for sale.
spread or introduce (ideas and beliefs) to another country.
transfer (data) in a format that can be used by other programs.
a commodity, article, or service sold abroad.
sales of goods or services to other countries, or the revenue from such sales.
the selling and sending out of goods or services to other countries.
of a high standard suitable for export.
"we exported $16 million worth of mussels to Japan"
"the Greeks exported Hellenic culture around the Mediterranean basin"
"wool and mohair were the principal exports"
"meat exports"
"the export of Western technology"
"high-grade export coal"
Prohibition was laid on the export of coal.禁止煤炭输出。
The company's gearing up for the big export drive.公司正为大规模输出作好准备。
Consultancy, insurance and tourism are also parts of the export trade.咨询,保险及旅游也是出口贸易的一部分。
Export had suffered during the last six months.前6个月内，出口已蒙受损失。
Oil has supplanted coffee as our main export.原油已经取代咖啡成为我们的主要出口货物。
Sugar is one chief export of China.糖是中国的主要输出品之一。
The blood can also export waste products from the tissues.血液还能从身体组织里输出废物。
Africa is exporting beef to Europe.非洲向欧洲出口牛肉。
They sell to the home market,but they don't export.他们向国内市场销售,但不出口。

exposure

[ɪk'spəʊʒə(r)], [ɪk'spoʊʒər]


Image Search
n. 暴露；揭露；胶片；曝光时间；(在电视、报纸等媒体上的)亮相；挨冻
the state of being exposed to contact with something.
a physical condition resulting from being outside in severe weather conditions without adequate protection.
experience of something.
the action of placing oneself at risk of financial losses, e.g., through making loans, granting credit, or underwriting insurance.
the revelation of an identity or fact, especially one that is concealed or likely to arouse disapproval.
the publicizing of information or an event.
the action of exposing a photographic film to light or other radiation.
the quantity of light or other radiation reaching a photographic film, as determined by shutter speed and lens aperture.
the direction in which a building faces; an outlook.
"the dangers posed by exposure to asbestos"
"he died of exposure at 8,000 feet"
"his exposure to the banking system"
"she took her life for fear of exposure as a spy"
"scientific findings receive regular exposure in the media"
"a camera that would give a picture immediately after exposure"
"the exposure is perfect—a gentle slope to the southwest"
Exposure of the body to strong sunlight can be harmful.身体受烈日暴晒会造成伤害。
Her skin was dry after exposure to the wind.经过风吹后她的皮肤很干。
His election toppled down due to the exposure of his bribery.他的竞选因为受贿被揭露而失败了。
How many exposures have you left?还剩多少底片没有照？
I used a long exposure for this one.我这张照片用的曝光时间长。
Her new movie has had a lot of exposure in the media.她的新片媒体有很多报道。
The girl is very pleased to take exposure on TV singing program.这个女孩对在电视歌唱节目上露面非常高兴。
He nearly died of exposure on the cold mountain.他在寒冷的高山上差一点没有冻死。

expressly

[ɪk'spresli], [ɪk'spresli]


Image Search
adv. 清楚地；特意地；专门地
explicitly; clearly.
for a specific purpose; solely.
"she was expressly forbidden to use the stove"
"the house was expressly built for entertaining"
I expressly told him I wouldn't go.我清楚地告诉他,我不愿去。
I told you expressly to lock the door.我明白地对你说过要锁上门。
You were expressly told not to touch my papers.已经明确地告诉过你不要动我的文件。
The rule was introduced expressly for this purpose.这项规则是为此特意提出的。
This ship was designed expressly for exploring the Arctic waters.这艘船是为考察北极水域而特意设计的。
Icame expressly to bring it to you.我是专门来给你送东西的。
We came here expressly to see the sunrise.我们到这里来就是为了看日出。
It is an article written expressly for the paper.这是专门为该报而撰写的文章。

Her skirt has very exquisite lace.她的裙子有非常精致的花边。
The bracelet was made with exquisite workmanship.这只手镯做得巧夺天工。
She has an exquisite ear for music.她对音乐有细腻的听觉。
I couldn't sleep for exquisite pain.我因剧痛而不能入睡。

external

[ɪk'stɜːnl], [ɪk'stɜːrnl]

coming or derived from a source outside the subject affected.
coming from or relating to a foreign country or an outside institution.

the outward features of something.
features that are only superficial; inessentials.
"the external walls"
"for external application only"

"the place has all the appropriate externals, such as chimneys choked with ivy and windows with jasmine"
This news program only covers external events.这一新闻节目只报道国外消息。
The external sector performance also improved significantly during the period.在此期间,我国的涉外经济成绩斐然。
This force takes two forms, one internal and one external.这个权力有两种形式:一种是对内的,一种是对外的。
All his injuries are external.他受的伤都是外伤。
The external features of the building are very attractive.这座建筑物的外观是很吸引人的。
These load cells are specially designed with small external dimensions.这些测力元件精心设计了小外观尺寸。
He is just listening in external of that room.他正在那房间的外面留神听着。

extinct

[ɪk'stɪŋkt], [ɪk'stɪŋkt]


Image Search
adj. 灭绝的；熄灭的；消亡的
(of a species, family, or other larger group) having no living members.
no longer in existence.
(of a volcano) not having erupted in recorded history.
no longer burning.
(of a title of nobility) having no qualified claimant.
"trilobites and dinosaurs are extinct"
"an extinct language"
"his now extinct pipe"
This is an extinct species of fish.这是一种已经灭绝的鱼。
This species will be extinct in a few decades.几十年后这个物种将会灭绝。
An extinct volcano can no longer erupt.一个灭绝的火山已不能再爆发。
My hope of getting some employment was extinct.我要找到工作的希望落空了。

extort

[ɪk'stɔːt], [ɪk'stɔːrt]


Image Search

"he was convicted of trying to extort $1 million from a developer"

The blackmailer tried to extort a large sum of money from him.勒索者企图向他敲诈一大笔钱。
The police used torture to extort a confession from him.警方对他严刑逼供。

extract

['ekstrækt], ['ekstrækt]


Image Search
vt. 摘录；提取；拔出；榨出；选取
[计算机] 提取.
n. 摘录；精华；榨出物
remove or take out, especially by effort or force.
obtain (something such as money or an admission) from someone in the face of initial unwillingness.
obtain (a substance or resource) from something by a special method.
select (a passage from a piece of writing, music, or film) for quotation, performance, or reproduction.
derive (an idea or the evidence for it) from a body of information.
calculate (a root of a number).
a short passage taken from a piece of writing, music, or film.
a preparation containing the active ingredient of a substance in concentrated form.
"the decayed tooth will have to be extracted"
"I won't let you go without trying to extract a promise from you"
"lead was extracted from the copper"
"the table is extracted from the report"
"the desire to extract meaningful lessons from a few experiments"
"an extract from a historical film"
"vanilla extract"
She extracted passages for the students to translate.她选了些短文让学生翻译.
She extracted a small notebook from her handbag.她从手提包里取出了一个小笔记本。
He tried to extract his pole from the mud.他试图用力将杆子从泥中拔出来。
It takes a major operation to extract money from a minor poet.要从小诗人那儿榨出钱来，得施行一次大手术。
Bratti means to extract the utmost possible amount of pleasure.布拉蒂决计从生活里榨出尽可能多的快乐来。
I would like to quote two extracts from the book.我很想引用这本书的两段文字。
The following extract is taken from her new novel.下面一段摘自她的新小说。
Cooperating with the extract liquid, the result is better.配合精华液使用，效果更佳。
Moisture dry skin with natural ingredients, apricot kemel oil and dewberry extract.含黑莓和杏仁天然萃取精华。

I find it very extraordinary.我觉得这非常离奇。
He is full of extraordinary ideas.他满脑子都是离奇的想法。

facet

['fæsɪt], ['fæsɪt]


Image Search
n. 小平面；方面；刻面
one side of something many-sided, especially of a cut gem.
a particular aspect or feature of something.
any of the individual units (ommatidia) that make up the compound eye of an insect or crustacean.
"participation by the laity in all facets of church life"
They beat us in every facet of the game.他们在比赛的每个小层面都打败了我们。
He has perfected himself in every facet of his job.他已使自己对工作的各个方面都得心应手。
Locomotion is merely one facet of action.移动只是行动的一个方面而已。
Being a well-paid business woman is only one facet of her life.高薪阶层职业妇女的身份只是她生活的一个方面。
The facet of the gem was examined.宝石的琢面检查过了。

We facilitate them to resist the enemy.我们帮助他们与敌人对抗。
The new underground railway will facilitate the journey to all parts of the city.新的地下铁路将为去城市各处提供方便。

factors

['fæktə(r)], ['fæktər]


Image Search
n. 因素；因数；因子
vt. 把 ... 因素包括进去
vi. 作为因素
a circumstance, fact, or influence that contributes to a result or outcome.
a gene that determines a hereditary characteristic.
a number or quantity that when multiplied with another produces a given number or expression.
a number or algebraic expression by which another is exactly divisible.
any of a number of substances in the blood, mostly identified by numerals, which are involved in coagulation.
a business agent; a merchant buying and selling on commission.
a company that buys a manufacturer's invoices at a discount and takes responsibility for collecting the payments due on them.
an agent, deputy, or representative.
another term for factorize.
sell (one's receivable debts) to a factor.
"she worked fast, conscious of the time factor"
"the Rhesus factor"
The determinate factor of our economy is to control inflation.我们经济的决定性因素是控制通货膨胀。
The committee's support is an important factor in the success of the project.委员会的支持是该项目取得成功的一个重要因素。
2, 3, 4 and 6 are factors of 12.2、3、4 和6是12的因子。
A new factor appears under the integral sign.积分号内出现了一个新的因子。
After cancellation, the factor is still present in the denominator.相消后该因子仍存在于分母中。

famished

['fæmɪʃt], ['fæmɪʃt]


Image Search
adj. 极饥饿的
动词famish的过去式和过去分词.
extremely hungry.
When's lunch? I'm famished!什么时候吃午饭? 我都快饿死了！
He was so famished that golden sparks danced before his eyes.他饿得眼前直冒金花。

Image Search

unlikely and unconvincing; implausible.
It's an interesting book but rather far-fetched.这本书很有趣，只是太离奇了点。

fare

[feə(r)], [fer]


Image Search
n. 车费；路费；乘客；食物
vi. 过活；进展；进食；旅行；行走
the money a passenger on public transportation has to pay.
a passenger paying to travel in a vehicle, especially a taxicab.
a range of food, especially of a particular type.
performance or entertainment of a particular style.
perform in a specified way in a particular situation or over a particular period of time.
happen; turn out.
travel.
"delicious Provençal fare"
"conventional Hollywood fare"
"the party fared badly in the spring elections"
"beware that it fare not with you as with your predecessor"
"a young knight fares forth"
Let me go shares with you in the taxi fare.我和你分摊计程车费吧。
She didn't have enough money for the bus fare.她的钱不够付车费。
He didn't have enough money to pay his train fare.他没有足够的钱来付火车费。
The normal return fare to New York is fifty-six.去纽约的来回票标准价是56元。
What is the fare to London and back?去伦敦来回要多少钱?
Reserve enough money for your home fare.留足你回家的路费。
The taxi-driver stopped to pick up a fare.计程车司机停下车来搭载一名乘客。
The fare in this restaurant is terrible.这家餐馆的饭菜太差了。
How would I fare in a strange city?在一个陌生的城市里，我怎么度日呢?
I think I fared quite well in the interview.我觉得我这次面试考得不错。
It is a pity that she should fare so badly.她竟吃得那么差,真可怜。

fastidious

[fæ'stɪdiəs], [fæ'stɪdiəs]


Image Search
adj. 过分讲究的；挑剔的；苛求的；一丝不苟的
=particular.
very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail.
very concerned about matters of cleanliness.
"he chooses his words with fastidious care"
"the child seemed fastidious about getting her fingers sticky or dirty"
She is too fastidious about her food and clothing.她太讲究吃穿。
She is so fastidious about her food that I never invite her for dinner.她对食物过于挑剔，因此我从不请她吃饭。
The fact was that I became more and more fastidious as I grew older.事实上，随着年龄的增长，我变得越来越吹毛求疵了。
Everything was planned in fastidious detail.样样都一丝不苟地计划好了。

fatality

[fə'tæləti], [fə'tæləti]


Image Search
n. 死亡；灾祸；天命；致命性
an occurrence of death by accident, in war, or from disease.
a person killed by accident, war, or disease.
helplessness in the face of fate.
"shooting was heard and there were fatalities"
"news reports said one of the fatalities was an eight-year-old boy"
"the plot needs a darker sense of fatality to cover its absurdities"
There have been ten swimming fatalities this summer.今年夏季已有十人游泳遇溺。
The explosion accident caused several fatalities.爆炸事故使数人死亡。
There was a strange fatality about their both losing their jobs on the same day.他们两人同一天失去工作，真是天意叵测。
The most serious form of skin cancer has a 30% fatality rate.皮肤癌的最严重情况有30%25的致死率。

fatigue

[fə'tiːɡ], [fə'tiːɡ]


Image Search
n. 疲劳；疲乏；劳务杂役
v. （使）疲劳
adj. 疲劳的
extreme tiredness, typically resulting from mental or physical exertion or illness.
a reduction in the efficiency of a muscle or organ after prolonged activity.
weakness in materials, especially metal, caused by repeated variations of stress.
a lessening in one's response to or enthusiasm for something, typically as a result of overexposure to it.
a group of soldiers ordered to perform menial, nonmilitary tasks, sometimes as a punishment.
loose-fitting clothing, typically khaki, olive drab, or camouflaged, worn by soldiers.
cause (someone) to feel tired or exhausted.
reduce the efficiency of (a muscle or organ) by prolonged activity.
weaken (a material, especially metal) by repeated variations of stress.
"he was nearly dead with fatigue"
"metal fatigue"
"museum fatigue"
"battle fatigues"
"they were fatigued by their journey"
She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.她希望睡一觉之后会消除疲劳。
The aeroplane wing showed signs of metal fatigue.机翼显出有金属疲劳的现象。
He was beaten out with fatigue when he got home.他回到家里时已是疲惫不堪。
Who is on fatigue duty today?今天谁担任杂役?
The patient fatigues easily.病人容易疲劳。
The exercises fatigued her.操练使她感到很疲乏。
They were shedding their fatigue.身上疲劳的感觉渐渐都消失了。
His body was in rebellion against fatigue.他的身体正在发出疲劳的信号。

faze

[feɪz], [feɪz]


Image Search
v. 使担忧；使慌乱；使为难或紧张
disturb or disconcert (someone).
"she was not fazed by his show of anger"
The news did not faze him.这个消息并没有使他担心。
Nothing they say could faze him.他们说什麽都烦扰不了他。

feasible

['fiːzəbl], ['fiːzəbl]


Image Search
adj. 可行的；可能的
possible to do easily or conveniently.
likely; probable.
"it is not feasible to put most finds from excavations on public display"
"the most feasible explanation"
The plan did not seem feasible.这个计划似乎没法实行。
It's quite clear that the electric car is technically feasible.电动汽车明显在工艺技术上是可行的。
It's not feasible to follow your proposals.按照你的建议去做是行不通的。
It's not feasible to dismiss him.不可开除他。
His story sounds feasible.他讲的似乎有理。

features

['fiːtʃəz], ['fiːtʃəz]


Image Search
n. 容貌；特征
名词feature的复数形式.
a distinctive attribute or aspect of something.
a part of the face, such as the mouth or eyes, making a significant contribution to its overall appearance.
a distinctive characteristic of a linguistic unit, especially a speech sound or vocabulary item, that serves to distinguish it from others of the same type.
a newspaper or magazine article or a broadcast program devoted to the treatment of a particular topic, typically at length.
a full-length film intended as the main item in a movie theater program.
have as a prominent attribute or aspect.
have as an important actor or participant.
be a significant characteristic of or take an important part in.
"safety features like dual air bags"
"a feature on Detroit's downtown fishery"
"the hotel features a large lounge, a sauna, and a coin-operated solarium"
"the film featured Glenn Miller and his Orchestra"
"his later paintings feature prominently in the exhibition"
I can recall the men's features.我回忆得起这个人的容貌。
Everyone admired the delicacy of her features.人人都羡慕她娇美的容貌。
His smile predominated his features.他的微笑是他的容貌的重要特色。
He has very regular features.他五官端正。
A rare smile lit up his stern features.他那难得一见的微笑在他死板的脸上平添一些生气。
The professor will give a lecture of geographical features.教授将要做关于地理特征的讲座。
The new car design incorporates all the latest safety features.新的汽车设计具备最新安全措施的一切特点。
The latest computer model embodies many new features.最新型的计算机具备许多新功能。

Feeble and uncertain securities were thrown upon the market.虚弱的或者没有把握的证券都向市场抛售了。
Tighter credit conditions are sapping already feeble demand.紧缩的信贷让本就无力的需求更加乏力。
He bleated out a feeble excuse.他以微弱的声音作无力的辩解。

feign

[feɪn], [feɪn]


Image Search

vi. 假装；装作
pretend to be affected by (a feeling, state, or injury).

"she feigned nervousness"
People may feign incapability to fraudulently claim the benefits, thus depriving the really needy.人可能假装无能欺诈索赔的好处，从而剥夺了真正有需要的。
People may feign incapability to fraudulently claim the benefits, thus depriving the really needy.人可能假装无能欺诈索赔的好处，从而剥夺了真正有需要的。
To feign frankness is a ruse of war.装作坦白，是为了作战的目的。

fertile

['fɜːtaɪl], ['fɜːrtl]


Image Search
adj. 肥沃的；富饶的；能繁殖的；多产的；（创造力）丰富的
(of soil or land) producing or capable of producing abundant vegetation or crops.
(of a seed or egg) capable of becoming a new individual.
(of a person, animal, or plant) able to conceive young or produce seed.
(of a person's mind or imagination) producing many new and inventive ideas with ease.
(of a situation or subject) fruitful and productive in generating new ideas.
(of nuclear material) able to become fissile by the capture of neutrons.
"fields along the fertile flood plains of the river"
"Barbara carefully calculated the period when she was most fertile"
"a series of fertile debates within the social sciences"
There are fertile fields in the Nile Delta.尼罗河三角洲土地肥沃。
We have irrigated the desert area to make it fertile.我们已经灌溉了荒芜地区使它肥沃。
It was a pleasant fertile spot, well wooded and rich in pasture.那是一个富饶的，使人愉快的地方，材木苍然，牧草丰富。
This fertile land bears the hopes of the farmers.这块富饶的土地,孕育着庄稼人的希望！
Tilapia are very fertile, and reproduce several offspring every year.罗非鱼一年能够繁殖数代,生殖能力很强。
The rotation of crops keeps the soil healthy and fertile.谷物轮种使土壤保持了肥力和高质。
His paper was remarkably simple and fertile.他的评论异常简单而且内容丰富。

fickle

['fɪkl], ['fɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 变幻无常的；易变的
changing frequently, especially as regards one's loyalties, interests, or affection.

The weather's so fickle in summer.夏日的天气如此多变。
It's the third time that he changed his mind; he's so fickle!他改变主意已经是第三回了,他这人太反复无常了！
The television world was a notoriously fickle one.电视圈是出了名的变化无常。
He turned out to be fickle - he has left me.他原来是个善变的人 - 他离开我了。

fidelity

[fɪ'deləti], [fɪ'deləti]


Image Search
n. 忠实；忠诚；准确性；保真度

the degree of exactness with which something is copied or reproduced.
"he sought only the strictest fidelity to justice"
"the 1949 recording provides reasonable fidelity"
Waley was much more interested in readability than fidelity.韦利在翻译该书时更加关注译文的可读性，而非忠实程度。
His fidelity and industry brought him speedy promotion.他的忠于职守和勤于工作使他得到迅速晋级。
She praised his servant for his fidelity.她称赞他仆人的忠诚。
They betokened their fidelity to the leader with a vow.他们以宣誓来表示他们对领袖的忠诚。
History is more full of examples of the fidelity of dog than of friend.历史上狗儿忠诚的事例较诸朋友忠诚的事例多得多。
To achieve the requirement of high fidelity listen respectfully, rated power should be pressed according to sound of optimal listen respectfully will decide.为了达到高保真聆听的要求,额定功率应根据最佳聆听声压来确定。

file

[faɪl], [faɪl]


Image Search
n. 档案；卷宗；文件；锉刀，指甲锉
vt. 把 ... 归档；提出(申请书、议案等)

submit (a legal document, application, or charge) to be placed on record by the appropriate authority.
(of a reporter) send (a story) to a newspaper or news organization.
a line of people or things one behind another.
a small detachment of troops.
each of the eight rows of eight squares on a chessboard running away from the player toward the opponent.
(of a group of people) walk one behind the other, typically in an orderly and solemn manner.
a tool with a roughened surface or surfaces, typically of steel, used for smoothing or shaping a hard material.
smooth or shape (something) with a file.
remove something by grinding it off with a file.
pounded or powdered sassafras leaves used to flavor and thicken soup, especially gumbo.
"a file of correspondence"

"the contract, when signed, is filed"
"criminal charges were filed against the firm"
"Plains Cree warriors riding in file down the slopes"
"a file of English soldiers had ridden out from Perth"
"the mourners filed into the church"
"it is possible to make the necessary notch with a file"
"when I have nothing else to do, I file my nails"
"the engine numbers were filed away"
Put this letter in the main file.把这封信放在主要文件夹中。
Would you please take a seat while I look into our file?你先坐一下,我给你查一下我们的卷宗?
Put this letter in the main file.把这封信放在主要文件夹中。
Please file those letters.请把这些信件存档。
Please file the original Articles and return the certified copies to me at the above address.请将公司大纲原件存档,并把经核实的副本按上述地址退还与我。
If a prisoner is not satisfied with the effective judgment, he may file a petition.第二十一条罪犯对生效的判决不服的,可以提出申诉。
We regret to inform you that the goods were underweight and we cannot but file a claim against you.我们很遗憾地告知你方货物重量不足,我们不得不向你方提出索赔。

Any battery has a finite life span no matter what device it powers.任何电池都具有有限的寿命，无论它具有多大的能量。

flaccid

['flæsɪd], ['flæsɪd]

His breathing was hoarse, his face livid, his limbs flaccid, his belly prominent.他的呼吸声沙哑，脸色苍白，双腿无力，肚子鼓胀。

flange

[flændʒ], [flændʒ]


Image Search
n. 凸缘；边缘；轮缘；【机械】法兰（使管子与管子及和阀门相互连接的零件，连接于管端）
v. 装凸缘

"the flanges that held the tailpipe to the aircraft"
Every lens has a mounting flange with which it is attached to the camera body.每个透镜都有一个安装凸缘，依靠它才能把透镜安装到相机上。
The bottom flange and the diaphragms must be selected carefully to match the product.为与产品匹配，需仔细选择底部边缘和隔膜。
Tnis measure method supplies reliable data for security analysis and designing installed flange of steam turbine' s vane.此项技术可为汽轮机叶片安装轮缘的设计和安全性分析提供可靠依据。

flatter

['flætə(r)], ['flætər]


Image Search
v. 奉承；恭维；取悦；显得好看
lavish insincere praise and compliments upon (someone), especially to further one's own interests.
give an unrealistically favorable impression of.
make (someone) feel honored and pleased.
make oneself feel pleased by believing something favorable about oneself, typically something that is unfounded.
(of a color or a style of clothing) make (someone) appear more attractive or to the best advantage.
please (the ear or eye).
smooth and even; without marked lumps or indentations.
(of land) without hills.
(of an expanse of water) calm and without waves.
not sloping.
having a broad level surface but little height or depth; shallow.
(of the foot) having an arch that is lower than usual.
(of shoes) without heels or with very low heels.
lacking interest or emotion; dull and lifeless.
(of a person) without energy; dispirited.
(of a market, prices, etc.) showing little activity; sluggish.
(of a sparkling drink) having lost its effervescence.
(of something kept inflated, especially a tire) having lost some or all of its air, typically because of a puncture.
(of a color) uniform.
(of a photographic print or negative) lacking contrast.
(of paint) without gloss; matte.
(of a fee, wage, or price) the same in all cases, not varying with changed conditions or in particular cases.
(of a denial, contradiction, or refusal) completely definite and firm; absolute.
(of musical sound) below true or normal pitch.
(of a note) a semitone lower than a specified note.
(of a key) having a flat or flats in the signature.
relating to flat racing.
"she was flattering him to avoid doing what he wanted"
"the portraitist flatters his sitter to the detriment of his art"
"I was very flattered to be given the commission"
"I flatter myself I'm the best dressed man here"
"the muted fuchsia shade flattered her pale skin"
"the beauty of the stone flattered the young clergyman's eyes"
"a flat wall"
"thirty-five acres of flat countryside"
"the flat roof of a garage"
"a flat rectangular box"
"“I'm sorry,” he said, in a flat voice"
"his sense of intoxication wore off until he felt flat and weary"
"cash flow was flat at $214 million"
"flat champagne"
"you've got a flat tire"
"the dress was a deadly, flat shade of gray"
"a $30 flat fare"
"his statement was a flat denial that he had misbehaved"
"the double basses' opening low E-flat"
"the Flat season"
My boss likes it when we flatter him.我的老板喜欢我们奉承他。
Friends who flatter you to your face are not true friends.凡是当面奉承你的朋友不是真朋友。
He flattered her about her cooking.他恭维她的烹调手艺。
It's impossible for you to ask a girl to teach you how to flatter another.你不可能让一个女孩教你如何取悦另一个女孩。
This photograph flatters you.这照片比你本人漂亮。
The picture certainly doesn't flatter her.这张照片当然不及她本人好看。

['fledʒlɪŋ], ['fledʒlɪŋ]

a young bird that has just fledged.

"a variety of expressions fleeted across his face"
"the cares of boyhood fleet away"

They fired at a fleeting enemy.他们向正在逃跑的敌人开火。

[ˌfleksə'bɪləti], [ˌfleksə'bɪləti]

n. 灵活性；弹性；适应性；柔韧性
the quality of bending easily without breaking.

"the government has shown flexibility in applying its policy"

flimsy

"sheets of yellow flimsy"

The evidence against him was flimsy.指控他的证据不足信。
A close inspection of this argument would reveal how flimsy it is.仔细想想这个问题就会发现它其实毫无根据。

flotsam

The beaches are wide and filled with interesting flotsam and jetsam.海滩宽阔，到处是有趣的被冲上岸的零碎什物。

flourish

['flʌrɪʃ], ['flɜːrɪʃ]


Image Search
v. 茂盛；繁荣；挥舞；活跃
n. 挥舞；花样；炫耀；华丽词藻
(of a person, animal, or other living organism) grow or develop in a healthy or vigorous way, especially as the result of a particularly favorable environment.
develop rapidly and successfully.
(of a person) be working or at the height of one's career during a specified period.
(of a person) wave (something) around to attract the attention of others.
a bold or extravagant gesture or action, made especially to attract the attention of others.
an instance of suddenly performing or developing in an impressively successful way.
an elaborate rhetorical or literary expression.
an ornamental flowing curve in handwriting or scrollwork.
a fanfare played by brass instruments.
an ornate musical passage.
an improvised addition played especially at the beginning or end of a composition.
"wild plants flourish on the banks of the lake"
"the organization has continued to flourish"
"the caricaturist and wit who flourished in the early years of this century"
"“Happy New Year!” he yelled, flourishing a bottle of whiskey"
"with a flourish, she ushered them inside"
"the Bulldogs produced a late second-half flourish"
"spiky gothic letters with an emphatic flourish beneath them"
"a flourish of trumpets"
There were two or three palm trees flourishing in the promenade garden.街心花园里有两三棵枝繁叶茂的棕榈树。
Plants will not flourish without water.没有水植物就不会长得茂盛。
These plants flourish in a damp climate.这些植物在潮湿的气候下长势茂盛。
Our business seemed to flourish.我们在生意看上去很兴隆。
No new business can flourish in the present economic climate.在目前的经济气候中，任何新生意都兴旺不起来。
She rushed in flourishing a document.她急匆匆地走了进来，手里挥舞着一份文件。
The banner flourished in the wind.旗帜在空中飞舞
Chaucer flourished at the end of 14th century.乔叟在14世纪末享有盛名。
In Germany the baroque style of art flourished in the 17th and 18th centuries.在德国，巴罗克艺术风格在17和18世纪非常盛行。
She rode by with a flourish of her whip.她骑马挥鞭而过。
He opened the door for her with a flourish.他潇洒地为她打开了门。
He went away with a flourish of his hat.他挥帽而去。
He underlined his signature with a little flourish.他挥笔在签名下画了一条线。
He showed us his new design with much flourish.他炫耀地向我们展示他的新设计。
The doctor showed us about his hospital with much flourish.这位医生颇为炫耀地带着我们参观了他的医院。
His is a cut-and-thrust style without any flourish.他的文章风格犀利明快，没有任何华丽的词藻。
Her speech was full of flourish.她的演讲充满了华丽的词藻。

fluctuate

['flʌktʃueɪt], ['flʌktʃueɪt]


Image Search
vi. 波动；动摇；起伏
vt. 使动摇
rise and fall irregularly in number or amount.
"trade with other countries tends to fluctuate from year to year"
Fruit prices fluctuate with the seasons.水果价格随着季节波动。
Some investors panic when stock prices fluctuate wildly.当股票价格大幅波动时,一些投资者便开始恐慌起来。
While the psychological unbalance may fluctuate the individual's original philosophy and regular act tendency which make conditions for the naissance of aberrance.而心理的失衡极大地动摇了个体原有的人生观和行为定势 ,为越轨行为的产生创造了条件。
Both the light and radio outputs fluctuate markedly.光和无线电的输出都引人注目地起伏变化。

fluctuations

[ˌflʌktjʊ'eɪʃəns], [ˌflʌktjʊ'eɪʃəns]


Image Search
n. 波动；起伏现象
名词fluctuation的复数形式.
an irregular rising and falling in number or amount; a variation.
"fluctuations in the yearly values could be caused by a variety of factors"
Fluctuations are spatial and temporal in character.这种波动的特点是空间性和瞬时性的。
Turbulence or gusts produce velocity fluctuations.紊乱性或阵息性使速度产生波动。

fluent

['fluːənt], ['fluːənt]


Image Search
adj. 流利的；流畅的
(of a person) able to express oneself easily and articulately.
(of a person) able to speak or write a particular foreign language easily and accurately.
(of a foreign language) spoken accurately and with facility.
(of speech, language, movement, or style) smoothly graceful and easy.
able to flow freely; fluid.
"a fluent speaker and writer on technical subjects"
"she became fluent in French and German"
"he spoke fluent Spanish"
"his style of play was fast and fluent"
"a fluent discharge from the nose"
She speaks fluent and idiomatic French.她说得一口又流利又地道的法语。
She likes him all the better for his fluent spoken English.正因为他操一口流利的英语，她更爱他。
His work is rather fluent and felicitous.他的作品十分流畅，措辞巧妙。
Her fluent movements surprised us.她那协调优美的动作让我们惊奇。

focus

['fəʊkəs], ['foʊkəs]


Image Search
n. 焦点；焦距；中心
v. （使）集中；聚集
the center of interest or activity.
an act of concentrating interest or activity on something.
the point of origin of an earthquake.
the principal site of an infection or other disease.
the state or quality of having or producing clear visual definition.
another term for focal point.
the point at which an object must be situated with respect to a lens or mirror for an image of it to be well defined.
a device on a lens which can be adjusted to produce a clear image.
one of the fixed points from which the distances to any point of a given curve, such as an ellipse or parabola, are connected by a linear relation.
the part of a sentence given prominence, usually for emphasis or contrast, e.g., Bob in it was Bob who came, not Bill.
(of a person or their eyes) adapt to the prevailing level of light and become able to see clearly.
cause (one's eyes) to focus.
adjust the focus of (a telescope, camera, or other instrument).
(of rays or waves) meet at a single point.
(of a lens) make (rays or waves) meet at a single point.
(of light, radio waves, or other energy) become concentrated into a sharp beam of light or energy.
(of a lens) concentrate (light, radio waves, or energy) into a sharp beam.
pay particular attention to.
concentrate.
place the focus on (a part of a sentence).
"this generation has made the environment a focus of attention"
"our focus on the customer's requirements"
"his face is rather out of focus"
"try to focus on a stationary object"
"trying to focus his bleary eyes on Corbett"
"they were focusing a telescope on a star"
"the study will focus on a number of areas in Wales"
"an opportunity to focus research on the health needs of the population"
He always wants to be the focus of attention.他总想成为注意力的焦点。
He took out the binoculars and adjusted the focus.他取出双筒望远镜并调整了焦距。
The main focus of this manual is the management of fresh ground water resources.本指南的主要中心是地下淡水资源的管理。
The noise made it hard for me to focus on work.噪音让我无法集中注意力工作。
He focused the sun's rays on the paper with a burning glass.他用取火镜使太阳光聚集在纸上。

foe

[fəʊ], [foʊ]


Image Search
n. 敌人；仇敌
an enemy or opponent.
Friends of the Earth.
"join forces against the common foe"
The knight was murdered by his foes.那位骑士被他的敌人谋杀了。
A courageous foe is better than a cowardly friend.勇敢的敌人胜过懦怯的朋友。
She was unsure as yet whether he was friend or foe.她还不确定他究竟是敌是友。
They were all humbled by kobe who is their foe.视他为仇敌的对手在他面前依旧得低头。
Blood of the enemy forcibly taken, you will resurrect your foe.强行夺取的仇人之血，将使你的仇敌复活！

foil

[fɔɪl], [fɔɪl]


Image Search
n. 钝头剑；箔；陪衬物；（击剑运动用的）花剑
vt. 挫败；击退；阻挠
prevent (something considered wrong or undesirable) from succeeding.
frustrate the efforts or plans of.
(of a hunted animal) run over or cross (ground or a scent or track) in such a way as to confuse the hounds.
the track or scent of a hunted animal.
a setback in an enterprise; a defeat.
metal hammered or rolled into a thin flexible sheet, used chiefly for covering or wrapping food.
a person or thing that contrasts with and so emphasizes and enhances the qualities of another.
a thin leaf of metal placed under a precious stone to increase its brilliance.
a leaf-shaped curve formed by the cusping of an arch or circle, typically occurring in groups of three or more in Gothic tracery.
a light fencing sword without cutting edges but with a button on its point.
each of the winglike structures fitted to a hydrofoil's hull to lift it clear of the water at speed.
"a brave policewoman foiled the armed robbery"
"Errol Flynn was a dashing Mountie foiling Nazi agents in Canada"
"aluminum foil"
"the earthy taste of grilled vegetables is a perfect foil for the tart bite of creamy goat cheese"
The foil is a thrusting weapon with no cutting edge.花剑，没有劈杀用的剑刀，是刺戳用兵器。
Our foil packets seal the flavour in.我们用锡纸包装以保持原味。
Aluminum foil can be used for wrapping food.铝箔用于包装食物。
This box of chocolate was wrapped round with foil.这盒巧克力用箔纸包着。
In the play, a wicked old uncle acts as a foil to the noble young prince.在剧中,邪恶年老的叔父为高尚年轻的王子扮演陪衬者的角色。
In foil and saber,only the attacking fencer can score a point.在花剑和佩剑比赛中，只有进攻方才能得分。
Only confident, people will never foil.只要有信心，人永远不会挫败。
Mr. Wang foiled their plans of inventing a new machine.王先生否决了他们关于发明新机器的计划。

foolhardy

"it would be foolhardy to go into the scheme without support"

The foolhardy Zaarin even had the audacity to strike against the Emperor himself.有勇无谋的扎林甚至厚脸皮到了反击帝国的地步。

foray

Image Search

"the garrison made a foray against Richard's camp"
"my first foray into journalism"
"the place into which they were forbidden to foray"

The officer sent a few of his men on a foray.军官送了一些他的人去突袭。
This is the company's first foray into the computer market.这是该公司打入计算机市场的首次尝试。

forego


Image Search
v. 放弃；在……之前
=forgo.
variant spelling of forgo.
precede in place or time.
omit or decline to take (something pleasant or valuable); go without.
refrain from.
"she wanted to forgo the dessert and leave while they could"
"we forgo any comparison between the two men"
Mickey agreed to forego his holiday.米基同意放弃他的假期。
Here, three Santas forego their sleighs in favor of an underground commute.这里，三个圣诞老人放弃了他们的雪橇而选择地铁。
Schumacher elected to forego a break and to test for two days in Vallelunga last week, which was chosen because it is quite similar in character to Imola.舒马赫选择了在比赛之前休息，并在上周的瓦莱伦加赛道进行了为期两天的测试。做出如此选择的原因是那里和伊莫拉非常相似。

foreseen

be aware of beforehand; predict.
"we did not foresee any difficulties"
It appears not all is as you had foreseen.似乎不是所有都按照你们预知的。

forge

[fɔːdʒ], [fɔːrdʒ]


Image Search
vt. 锻造；伪造；建立
vi. 伪造；做铁匠
n. 锻炉；铁匠铺；锻造车间
make or shape (a metal object) by heating it in a fire or furnace and beating or hammering it.
create (a relationship or new conditions).
produce a copy or imitation of (a document, signature, banknote, or work or art) for the purpose of deception.
a blacksmith's workshop; a smithy.
a furnace or hearth for melting or refining metal.
a workshop or factory containing a furnace for refining metal.
move forward gradually or steadily.
"the two women forged a close bond"
"he forged through the crowded side streets"
These machine parts have been forged with the finest steel.这些机器零件得用优质的钢锻造。
George was forced to forge a signature.乔治被迫伪造签名。
They forged their manager's signature on the cheque.他们在支票上伪造了经理的签名。
They tried to forge an alliance.他们试图建立同盟。
Some people forge official documents.有些人伪造公文。
Donald be forced to forge a signature.唐纳德被迫伪造签字。
He began to heat, like iron in the forge.他象锻炉里的铁一样热起来。
The blacksmith came out of the forge to fit the horse shoe.铁匠从工场出来安装马蹄铁。
In the past kitchen knives were made in a forge.过去厨房用刀是在锻造厂打出来的。

format

['fɔːmæt], ['fɔːrmæt]


Image Search
n. 版式；设计
vt. 使格式化；安排
the way in which something is arranged or set out.
the shape, size, and presentation of a book or periodical.
the medium in which a sound recording is made available.
a defined structure for the processing, storage, or display of data.
(especially in computing) arrange or put into a format.
prepare (a storage medium) to receive data.
"the format of the funeral service"
"the album is available as a CD as well as on LP and cassette formats"
"a data file in binary format"
The book has been styled in a modern format.该书已按照现代版式制作。
It's the same book,but a new format.还是那本书
The format of the meeting was such that every one could ask a question.会议安排好可让每个人都能提一个问题。
The disk is too large to format for the specified file system.磁盘过大,无法为指定文件系统进行格式化。
They formatted the conference so that each speaker had less than 15 minutes to deliver a paper.他们安排了会议以至每个演讲者有不到15分钟的时间发表演讲

formula

['fɔːmjələ], ['fɔːrmjələ]


Image Search
n. 配方；公式；规则；代乳品
adj. 方程式的；（赛车的）级的
a mathematical relationship or rule expressed in symbols.
a set of chemical symbols showing the elements present in a compound and their relative proportions, and in some cases the structure of the compound.
a list of ingredients for or constituents of something.
a formulation.
an infant's liquid food preparation based on cow's milk or soy protein, given as a substitute for breast milk.
a method, statement, or procedure for achieving something, especially reconciling different aims or positions.
a fixed form of words, especially one used in particular contexts or as a conventional usage.
a rule or style unintelligently or slavishly followed.
a statement that formally enunciates a religious doctrine.
a stock epithet, phrase, or line repeated for various effects in literary composition, especially epic poetry.
(usually followed by a number) a classification of race car, especially by engine capacity.
"the soft drink company closely guards its secret formula"
"an original coal tar formula that helps prevent dandruff"
"the forlorn hope of finding a peace formula"
"a legal formula"
"one of those formula tunes"
They are working on the perfection of their new paint formula.他们正在努力研制尽善尽美的新颜料配方。
What is the formula for water?水的分子式是什么？
Within the braces, you can include any formula.在大括号内,可以包含任何公式。
It's the formula for converting gallons into liters.这是加仑与升的换算公式。
There is no sure formula for success.成功并无一定之规.
His outwardly relaxed manner hides a sharp mind and a keen will to win, something he did a lot of on the nursery slopes of Formula BMW.他轻松自若的举止下隐藏着敏锐的心思和渴望胜利的决心，这在他参加宝马方程式的培养期里就已经有所体现。

formulate

['fɔːmjuleɪt], ['fɔːrmjuleɪt]


Image Search
v. 用公式表示；系统地阐述；规划；制订
create or devise methodically (a strategy or a proposal).
express (an idea) in a concise or systematic way.
"economists and statisticians were needed to help formulate economic policy"
"the argument is sufficiently clear that it can be formulated mathematically"
Survey the material first to get a sense of it: formulate some questions.考查原始材料首先要了解它的意义：用公式解答问题。
He formulated his thought clearly.他清楚确切地表达了自己的思想。
He struggled to formulate an answer.他努力字斟句酌地回答。
He thought it time to formulate some plan of action.他认为这是该筹划一些行动计划的时候了。
We can then formulate the following rules.我们可以作出下列规定。

forsake

Image Search

abandon (someone or something).

"I won't forsake my vegetarian principles"

Forsake your greed, abandon your appetites of ostentation.除去你的贪心，放弃你所炫耀的爱好。
Forsake learning, and you will ruin yourself.抛弃了学问便是毁了你们自己。
She pleaded with her husband not to forsake her.她恳求丈夫不要抛弃她。

forthcoming

The money we asked for was not forthcoming.我们要的钱尚未得到。
She's never very forthcoming about her plans.她一直不很愿意说出自己的计划。

fortunate

favored by or involving good luck or fortune; lucky.
auspicious or favorable.
materially well-off; prosperous.
"she'd been fortunate to escape more serious injury"
"a most fortunate match for our daughter"
"less fortunate children still converged on the soup kitchens"
It's fortunate you didn't forget.幸好你没忘。
The girl was fortunate enough to have her mother as a bosom friend.这个女孩非常幸运，她的妈妈是她的知心朋友。
The couple forfeited their independence in order to help those less fortunate.这对夫妇把富裕出的钱都拿出来帮助那些受难的人。
It is fortunate that the tanker did not leak.庆幸的是，油罐车没有发生泄漏。
So it was fortunate that we didn't have to carry him.侥幸的是，我们还不必抬它走。
He came at a very fortunate time.他来得恰是时候。

foster

['fɒstə(r)], ['fɔːstər]


Image Search

encourage or promote the development of (something, typically something regarded as good).
develop (a feeling or idea) in oneself.
bring up (a child that is not one's own by birth).
denoting someone that has a specified family connection through fostering rather than birth.
involving or concerned with fostering a child.
"the teacher's task is to foster learning"
"appropriate praise helps a child foster a sense of self-worth"
"foster parent"
"foster care"
People who cannot have a baby of their own sometimes foster (a child).不能生育的人有时领养别人的(孩子).
It is very important to foster an interest.培养一种兴趣是十分重要的。
The mother tried to foster her son's interest in music.母亲设法培养儿子对音乐的兴趣。
Ignorance fosters superstition.无知助长迷信。

We should foster capital investment in areas needing development.我们应鼓励在需要发展的地区投资。
I know that she fosters a secret hope.我知道她抱着秘密的希望。
The foster children also deserve love and care.收养的孩子也应该得到关爱。

foundation

[faʊn'deɪʃn], [faʊn'deɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 根基；基础；根据；创建；基金(会)
the lowest load-bearing part of a building, typically below ground level.
a colored cream, powder, or liquid used as a base to even out facial skin tone before applying other cosmetics.
an underlying basis or principle.
justification or reason.
the action of establishing an institution or organization on a permanent basis, especially with an endowment.
an institution established with an endowment, for example a college or a body devoted to financing research or charity.
"apply moisturizer a few minutes before using foundation"
"this idea is the foundation of all modern economics"
"distorted and misleading accusations with no foundation"
How long will it take to finish digging the foundations?挖地基大概需要多长时间完成呢？
He laid the foundation of his success by study and hard work.他通过学习和努力工作为成功打下了基础。
All these have laid a solid political foundation for consolidated national unity.所有这些为巩固国家统一奠定了坚实的政治基础。
His view is by no means without foundation.他这种看法决不是凭空产生的。
These conclusions must have some solid foundation in reality.这些结论一定有某些牢固的现实根据。
The foundation of this university took place over 100 years ago.这所大学于一百多年前创建。

founded

[faʊnd], [faʊnd]


Image Search
v. 建立；创立；创办；熔铸；找到，发现（动词find的过去式和过去分词）
establish or originate (an institution or organization), especially by providing an endowment.
plan and begin the building of (a town or colony).
construct or base (a principle or other abstract thing) according to a particular principle or grounds.
(of a thing) serve as a basis for.
melt and mold (metal).
fuse (materials) to make glass.
make (an article) by melting and molding metal.
"the monastery was founded in 1665"
"a society founded on the highest principles of religion and education"
"the company's fortunes are founded on its minerals business"
This business company was founded in 1724.这家商业公司建立于1724年。
A good relationship has to be founded on trust.基于信任建立良好的关系。
They founded a college.他们创办了一所大学。
Our goal is to found a lovely school.我们的目标创办一所可爱的学校。

fraction

['frækʃn], ['frækʃn]


Image Search
n. 小部分；少许；分数；片段
a numerical quantity that is not a whole number (e.g., 1/2, 0.5).
a small or tiny part, amount, or proportion of something.
a dissenting group within a larger one.
each of the portions into which a mixture may be separated by a process in which the individual components behave differently according to their physical properties.
(in the Christian Church) the breaking of the Eucharistic bread.
"he hesitated for a fraction of a second"
Mother's careful with her money, and spends only a fraction of her earnings.母亲用钱很审慎,只花自己收入很小的一部分。
The door opened a fraction.门稍微开了条缝。
I can only pay a fraction of my bill.我只付我的帐单的一小部分。
Open the window a fraction, please.请把窗户打开一点。
One forth is a proper fraction.四分之一是一个真分数。
In the reaction, the fraction acts as an agent.在反应中,这些碎片起一种媒介的作用。

fragile

['frædʒaɪl], ['frædʒl]


Image Search
adj. 易碎的；脆的；精细的；虚弱的
(of an object) easily broken or damaged.
flimsy or insubstantial; easily destroyed.
(of a person) not strong or sturdy; delicate and vulnerable.
"you have a fragile grip on reality"
Glasses are fragile and must be handled with great care.玻璃制品易碎，必须小心轻放。
This glass plate is very fragile.这个玻璃盘子很容易碎。
The fragile boxes arrived intact.这些易碎的箱子完整无损地运到了。
Happiness is made of glass, it shines the brightest where it is most fragile.幸福是玻璃做成的,它最脆弱的地方最闪亮!
He's feeling a bit fragile after last night's party.他参加了昨晚的聚会之后，现在觉得有些虚弱。

framework

['freɪmwɜːk], ['freɪmwɜːrk]


Image Search
n. 框架；体系；结构
an essential supporting structure of a building, vehicle, or object.
a basic structure underlying a system, concept, or text.
"a conservatory in a delicate framework of iron"
"the theoretical framework of political sociology"
They established a basic framework of ground rules for discussions.他们建立了讨论的基本准则的基本框架。
Government is the one who establishes national policy framework.国家政策体系的是由政府建立的。
It's a bridge of steel framework.那是座钢铁结构的桥梁。
All the cases can be considered within the framework of the existing rules.一切情况都可依据现行章程的结构加以考虑。

frank

[fræŋk], [fræŋk]


Image Search
adj. 坦白的；直率的；真诚的
vt. 免费邮寄；使自由出入
n. 免费邮寄；弗兰克（人名）
open, honest, and direct in speech or writing, especially when dealing with unpalatable matters.
open, sincere, or undisguised in manner or appearance.
unmistakable; obvious.
stamp an official mark on (a letter or parcel), especially to indicate that postage has been paid or does not need to be paid.
sign (a letter or parcel) to ensure delivery free of charge.
facilitate or pay the passage of (someone).
an official mark or signature on a letter or parcel, especially to indicate that postage has been paid or does not need to be paid.
short for frankfurter.
a member of a Germanic people that conquered Gaul in the 6th century and controlled much of western Europe for several centuries afterward.
(in the eastern Mediterranean region) a person of western European nationality or descent.
"a long and frank discussion"
"Katherine saw her look at Sam with frank admiration"
"frank ulceration"
"English will frank the traveler through most of North America"
A frank discussion can help to clear the air.坦率的谈论有助于消除疑虑。
To be very frank, I think you have very little chance of getting the job.坦白地说，我认为你获得这项工作的机会微乎其微。
He was frank, open and aboveboard.他胸怀坦白，光明磊落。
They tend to be frank and open but alo self-centered and willful.他们的性格坦诚、直率，但往往以自我为中心，并且任性妄为。
He offered a frank apology to her for hurting her feelings.他因伤害了她的感情而真诚地向她道歉。
We are trying to frank him through customs.我们正努力使他免检通过海关。

fray

[freɪ], [freɪ]


Image Search
v. 恼火；紧张
v. 磨损
n. 吵闹；吵架；争斗
n. 磨损处
(of a fabric, rope, or cord) unravel or become worn at the edge, typically through constant rubbing.
(of a person's nerves or temper) show the effects of strain.
(of a male deer) rub (a bush or small tree) with the head in order to remove the velvet from newly formed antlers, or to mark territory during the rut.
a situation of intense activity, typically one incorporating an element of aggression or competition.
a battle or fight.
"cheap fabric soon frays"
"nineteen companies intend to bid for the contract, with three more expected to enter the fray"
Tempers began to fray in the hot weather.大热天脾气烦燥。
As the debate went on, tempers began to fray.随着辩论的继续，火气就上来了。
Her nerves were frayed by the noises in the street.街上的噪音使她神经紧张。
After spending a day with screaming children, her nerves were frayed.与吵吵嚷嚷的孩子们呆了一天后,她的神经快要崩溃了。
The electric wire is fraying and could be dangerous to handle.电线快磨破了，使用起来可能有危险。
It is made of a durable high quality nylon that is designed not to fray.这种带子是由耐用高质量的尼龙制成，其设计也是防止磨损。
The two gangsters seem to be eager for the fray.那两个歹徒似乎唯恐不乱。
Regardless of the reasons for a couple's public argument, for the sake of their own peace of mind, bystanders should try to remove themselves gracefully from the fray.不管两人公开争吵的理由是什么，为了自己的心情平静，旁人应该立刻得体地撤身于吵架之外。
Why should you get involved in their fray?你为什么要介入他们的争吵呢?

friction

['frɪkʃn], ['frɪkʃn]


Image Search
n. 摩擦；摩擦力；分歧
the resistance that one surface or object encounters when moving over another.
the action of one surface or object rubbing against another.
conflict or animosity caused by a clash of wills, temperaments, or opinions.
"a lubrication system that reduces friction"
"the friction of braking"
"a considerable amount of friction between father and son"
Constant friction wore out the heels of my shoes.不断的摩擦磨损了我的鞋跟。
Matches are lighted by friction.火柴由摩擦而生火。
Friction lowers the efficiency of a machine.摩擦减低机器的效率。
Friction causes a rolling ball to stop finally.摩擦力使滚动的球最终停了下来。
Without friction, the brake would not work.如果没有摩擦力,制动器就不能制动。
I oiled the machine to reduce friction.我把机器上油,以减少摩擦力。
My daughter and son always have frictions.我女儿和儿子总发生矛盾。
There is some friction among the family members.家庭成员间有些摩擦。

frigid

['frɪdʒɪd], ['frɪdʒɪd]


Image Search
adj. 寒冷的；冷淡的；(指女性)性冷淡的
very cold in temperature.
(especially of a woman) unable or unwilling to be sexually aroused and responsive.
showing no friendliness or enthusiasm; stiff or formal in behavior or style.
"frigid water"
"Henrietta looked back with a frigid calm"
Huhhot is a frigid city in winter.冬天的呼和浩特是一个寒冷的城市。
Frigid winds blew from the north.寒风从北方吹来。
His frigid glance made me afraid.他那冷淡的目光让我害怕。
She returned his smile with a frigid glance.对他的微笑她报以冷冷的一瞥。

frugal

['fruːɡl], ['fruːɡl]


Image Search
adj. 节俭的；省钱的
sparing or economical with regard to money or food.
simple and plain and costing little.
"he led a remarkably frugal existence"
"a frugal meal"
As far as oil energy is concerned, we cannot be too frugal.就石油能源而言，我们愈节省愈好。
They lived a very frugal existence, avoiding all luxuries.他们生活非常俭朴，力避奢侈。
The frugal boy rarely spends money.那节俭的孩子很少花钱。
My mother was also a frugal woman.我的妈妈也是一位节俭的女人。
The result is that the frugal household is more stable.结果是节俭的家庭更加稳定。
We're planning a frugal Christmas.我们正计划过一个花钱少的圣诞节。

function

['fʌŋkʃn], ['fʌŋkʃn]


Image Search
n. 职务；功能；函数；重大聚会；应变量，有相关关系者；取决于
vi. 运行；起作用
an activity or purpose natural to or intended for a person or thing.
practical use or purpose in design.
a basic task of a computer, especially one that corresponds to a single instruction from the user.
a relationship or expression involving one or more variables.
a variable quantity regarded in relation to one or more other variables in terms of which it may be expressed or on which its value depends.
a functional group.
a thing dependent on another factor or factors.
a large or formal social event or ceremony.
work or operate in a proper or particular way.
fulfill the purpose or task of (a specified thing).
"bridges perform the function of providing access across water"
"building designs that prioritize style over function"
"the function (bx + c)"
"class shame is a function of social power"
"he was obliged to attend party functions"
"her liver is functioning normally"
"the museum intends to function as an educational and study center"
What is his function on the committee?他在委员会里担任什么职务?
The teacher did not explain its grammatical function.老师没有解释它的文法功能。
The function of the ear is to listen.耳的功能是听。
Periodic change imposed on a controlled variable or a function by a controller.通过控制器控制某一变量或函数进行周期性变化。
Heads of state attend numerous functions every year.国家首脑每年要出席很多重大宴会。
Price is a function of supply and demand.价格取决于供求关系的变化。
However, many system features and tasks will not function correctly.但是,许多系统功能和任务将无法正常运行。
A new tax and financial system was functioning effectively.新的财税体制有效运行。
During the reorganization,we should pay careful attention to selecting the key leaders of these sections so that the latter can function properly.调整时，还要注意选配好这些部门的领导骨干，发挥职能机构的作用。
He can't afford to pay the rent, so for now, his car will also function as his home.他付不起租金,所以目前他的车也当成他的家了。
During this mission, the command post is functioning prominently.此次任务中，指挥部的作用尤为突出。

fundamental

[ˌfʌndə'mentl], [ˌfʌndə'mentl]


Image Search
adj. 基本的；根本的；重要的
n. 基础；基本原理
forming a necessary base or core; of central importance.
affecting or relating to the essential nature of something or the crucial point about an issue.
so basic as to be hard to alter, resolve, or overcome.
a central or primary rule or principle on which something is based.
a fundamental note, tone, or frequency.
"the protection of fundamental human rights"
"the fundamental problem remains that of the housing shortage"
"the theories are based on a fundamental error"
"two courses cover the fundamentals of microbiology"
For something fundamental has changed in Venezuela.因为在委内瑞拉，有一些基本的东西已经改变了。
Trial by the jury is a fundamental right.有陪审团陪同审判是一项基本的权利。
From the outset, it had two fundamental flaws.从一开始，这一合作就有两个根本的缺陷。
The fundamental ones are embodied in the Party Constitution.党章是最根本的党规党法。
China quite naturally plays a fundamental role.中国自然发挥着十分重要的作用。
They wished to emphasize more fundamental issues.他们希望强调更重要的问题。
Primary is about fundamental play.原始与基础游戏有关。
The fundamental things are also going on.基础建设也在进行当中。
In all cases the same fundamental principles apply.但在任何情况下基本原理是相同的。
A known fundamental is a usele fundamental.人人皆知的基本原理是毫无用处的基本原理。

funds

[fʌndz], [fʌndz]


Image Search
n. 资金，现金（fund的复数形式）；基金
a sum of money saved or made available for a particular purpose.
financial resources.
a large stock or supply of something, especially information or knowledge.
the stock of the national debt (as a mode of investment).
provide with money for a particular purpose.
"he had set up a fund to coordinate economic investment"
"the misuse of public funds"
"a vast fund of information"
"the World Bank refused to fund the project"
We have limited funds and several competing claims.我们的基金有限而争相申请的却有几处。
The project was hamstrung by lack of funds.这个计划因缺乏资金而难以实现。
He was appealing for funds to build a new school.他在恳求拨款修建一所新学校。
He has enormous funds at his command.他掌握著巨额资金。
Now we can do that as we have funds.现在我们手头有现款就可以办这事了。
The project had hung fire for several years because of lack of funds.这个项目由于缺少资金而推迟了许多年。
The treasurer has run off with the club's funds.会计拐走了俱乐部的资金。
This expense has depleted our funds.这笔花费已使我们的资金所剩无几。

furious

['fjʊəriəs], ['fjʊriəs]


Image Search
adj. 狂怒的；猛烈的
extremely angry.
full of anger or energy; violent or intense.
"she was furious at this attempt to manipulate her"
"he drove at a furious speed"
I was annoyed, indeed furious, over what happened.出了这件事我很不痛快,实际上是愤怒至极。
If this news ever reaches her ears, she'll be furious.这个消息万一传到她的耳朵里，她一定得大发雷霆。
She maintained a calm exterior, though really she was furious.在外表上她保持着平静，但实际上她生气极了。
After receiving the insulting letter, he became furious.他收到辱骂信后怒不可遏。
There was a furious knock at the door.有人在猛烈地敲门。
The ship can weather the furious storm.这条船禁得起狂风暴雨的袭击。

furnish

['fɜːnɪʃ], ['fɜːrnɪʃ]


Image Search
vt. 布置；装备；提供
provide (a house or room) with furniture and fittings.
supply someone with (something); give (something) to someone.
be a source of; provide.
"the proprietor has furnished the bedrooms in a variety of styles"
"she was able to furnish me with details of the incident"
"fish furnish an important source of protein"
They are renting a furnished flat.他们租用了一套带有家具的公寓房子。
We propose to furnish our own house according to our own taste.我们建议按自己的爱好布置自己的房子。
They scouted around for some antiques to furnish their new apartment.他们到处搜罗一些古董来装饰新居。
I am bound to furnish my antagonists with arguments, but not with comprehension.我一定要向对手提供争论点，但并无予以理解的必要。
The shop furnishes everything that is needed for camping.这家商店供应各种野营用品。

furthermore

[ˌfɜːðə'mɔː(r)], [ˌfɜːrðər'mɔːr]


Image Search
adv. 而且；此外
in addition; besides (used to introduce a fresh consideration in an argument).
"this species has a quiet charm and, furthermore, is an easy garden plant"
The house is too small, and furthermore, it's too far from the office.房子太小,而且离办公地点太远。
I don't want to go there, furthermore, I have no time to do so.我不想去那里, 而且我也没时间去。
Furthermore, it teaches in dependence.此外，体育还能教会人独立。
Furthermore, the work flow was irregular.此外，厂里的生产流程也时断时续。
Furthermore, she inspires people through her disability.此外，她更借着自身的残障来鼓舞别人。
