His eyes had never beheld such opulence.他从未见过这样的财富。
The room was decorated with stagy opulence.那房间装饰得富丽堂皇，像戏台似的。

opulent

['ɒpjələnt], ['ɑːpjələnt]


Image Search
adj. 富裕的；充足的
ostentatiously rich and luxurious or lavish.
wealthy.
"the opulent comfort of a limousine"
"his more opulent tenants"
An opulent priest is a contradiction.教士养尊处优，就是离经叛道。
David was easy, and even opulent in his circumstances.戴维的家境不差，甚至相当富裕。
The opulent clothing is decorated with jewelry over her body.她衣着华丽
She is depicted in a room within an opulent palace.她被描绘成住在一座豪华宫殿的房间中。

oracle

['ɒrəkl], ['ɔːrəkl]


Image Search
n. 神谕；神谕处；传达神谕的人；能提供可靠意见的人
a priest or priestess acting as a medium through whom advice or prophecy was sought from the gods in classical antiquity.
a place at which divine advice or prophecy was sought.
a person or thing regarded as an infallible authority or guide on something.
a response or message given by an oracle, typically one that is ambiguous or obscure.
"casting the attorney general as the oracle for and guardian of the public interest is simply impossible"
In times of difficulty, she prayed for an oracle to guide her.在困难的时候,她祈祷神谕来指引她。
The earth is the great parent of all, the stones are her bones; these we may cast behind us; this, I think, the oracle means.大地是万物之母，石头就是她的尸骨。我们可以往身后扔石头，我想神谕说的就是这个意思。
This oracle was still flourishing in 332 B.C.这个神示殿在公元前332年依然很兴旺。
They consulted the oracle at Delphi.他们在德尔斐神示所向神请示。
The message was passed by an oracle.这个信息是由传神谕者传递的。
My sister's the oracle on beauty matters.我妹妹是美容方面的大行家。

orientation

[ˌɔːriən'teɪʃn], [ˌɔːriən'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 适应；定位；情况介绍；信仰；倾向；[计]定向；（学生）迎新会
the determination of the relative position of something or someone (especially oneself).
the relative physical position or direction of something.
an animal's change of position in response to an external stimulus, especially with respect to compass directions.
familiarization with something.
a program of introduction for newcomers to a college or other institution.
a person's basic attitude, beliefs, or feelings in relation to a particular subject or issue.
short for sexual orientation.
"the child's surroundings provide clues to help in orientation"
"two complex shapes, presented in different orientations"
"their training and orientation comes out of magazine and newspaper distribution"
"she attended freshman orientation"
"his book is well worth reading, regardless of your political orientation"
I needed some orientation at this stage.我在这个阶段需要熟悉情况。
The arrangement must show a preferred orientation.排列还必须呈现特定的指向。
The following action steps are a part of the foreman's orientation of the new worker.以下内容是工头指导新工人时应采取的部分措施:介绍新的工作。
Christian Church that truly welcomes everybody disregarding your sexual orientation or denomination.一个不论宗派及性取向，真正欢迎所有人的基督信仰教会。
Second, we demonstrate that theology, specifically an orientation toward this world or heaven, determined whether religious resources were available to antislavery organizations.第二，我们说明了宗教信仰，尤其是宣扬今生或天堂的宗教，决定了宗教资源能否被废奴组织所利用。
We must hold to the correct political orientation.我们必须坚持正确的政治方向。

ostentatious

[ˌɒsten'teɪʃəs], [ˌɑːsten'teɪʃəs]


Image Search
adj. 炫耀的；浮夸的；浮华的；豪华的
characterized by vulgar or pretentious display; designed to impress or attract notice.
"books that people buy and display ostentatiously but never actually finish"
Their daughter was ostentatious on her wedding reception.他们的女儿在办婚事时摆阔。
Owning a sewing machine was a ostentatious display.那时候拥有缝纫机简直是可以炫耀的资本。
Those states, ostentatious and extravagant design will soon be cold-shouldered by the market.那些铺张、摆阔的设计一定会很快受到市场的冷落。
The singers carry the musical instrument to go out the ostentatious bar street wearily , returns to nearby own den to drink eats meal .歌手们背着乐器疲倦地走出浮华的酒吧街，回到自己的老巢边喝酒吃饭。
Their wedding was a most ostentatious and extravagant affair.他们的婚礼办得可排场了。
It is not , however , the most ostentatious house on the reservation.尽管如此，这并非是当地最豪华的公寓。

outcomes


Image Search
n. 产出，结果，成果（名词outcome的复数形式）
the way a thing turns out; a consequence.
"it is the outcome of the vote that counts"
Comprehensive review of end-stage renal disease dialyses outcomes research.终末期肾脏病透析治疗产出研究综述。
Government failure is government intervention that fails to improve economic outcomes.政府失灵是指政府干预并不能改善经济产出。

output

['aʊtpʊt], ['aʊtpʊt]


Image Search
n. 产量；输出功率；输出
vt. 输出(信息等)
the amount of something produced by a person, machine, or industry.
the action or process of producing something.
the power, energy, or other results supplied by a device or system.
a place where power or information leaves a system.
produce, deliver, or supply (data) using a computer or other device.
"efficiency can lead to higher outputs"
"the output of epinephrine"
"the quality of the output from the printer is very good"
"you can output the image directly to a video recording system"
Output has tripled.产量已增加到三倍。
This country ranks last in industrial output.这个国家的工业生产排名最後。
The average output of the factory is 20 cars a day.该工厂的平均产量是每天20辆汽车。
Have you got the one which has an output of 150 horsepower?你们有没有输出功率是一百五十（150）马力的?
These computers have an audio output.这些电脑有音频输出。
There is hum or noise in the speaker output.扬声器输出声带嗡嗡声或杂音。
The printer will output colour chart.打印机将会输出彩色图表。
Computers can now output data much more quickly.现在计算机能更快地输出数据。
The program will output it into a file.这个程序将把它输出到一个文件里。

outright

['aʊtraɪt], ['aʊtraɪt]


Image Search
adj. 直率的；完全的；彻底的
adv. 率直地；立刻地；彻底地
altogether; completely.
without reservation; openly.
immediately.
not by degrees or installments.
open and direct; not concealed.
total; complete.
undisputed; clear.
"logging has been banned outright"
"she couldn't ask him outright"
"the impact killed four horses outright"
"they decided to buy the company outright"
"an outright refusal"
"the outright abolition of the death penalty"
"an outright victory"
Dissatisfaction often leads to outright treason.政治上的不满常常导致断然的背叛。
The statement was an outright lie.这话是十足的谎言。
They can now establish outright dictatorship.他们现在可以建立起彻头彻尾的独裁制度了。
I told him outright what I thought of him.我坦率地向他说出我对他的想法。
If you have a complaint you should tell me outright .如果你有不满意的事你应该直率地对我说。
Most of the crash victims were killed outright.飞机坠毁的遇难者大都是立即惨死。
She own outright.她大获全胜。

ovation

[əʊ'veɪʃn], [oʊ'veɪʃn]


Image Search

a sustained and enthusiastic show of appreciation from an audience, especially by means of applause.

"the performance received a thundering ovation"
The hero received a great ovation from the crowd.那位英雄受到人群的热烈欢迎。
He gets a standing ovation as he moves off stage.他离开舞台时，全体观众起立热烈鼓掌。

overall

[ˌəʊvər'ɔːl], [ˌoʊvər'ɔːl]


Image Search

adv. 总的来说；总共
n. 罩衫；工作服
taking everything into account.
in all parts; taken as a whole.
a garment consisting of trousers with a front flap over the chest held up by straps over the shoulders, made of sturdy material and worn especially as casual or working clothes.
a loose-fitting coat or one-piece garment worn over ordinary clothes for protection against dirt or heavy wear.
"the overall effect is impressive"
"overall, 10,000 jobs will go"
The overall measurement of this room is 80 square meters.这个屋子的总面积是80平方米。
Please provide your overall evaluation.请给出你的总体评价。
There's been an overall improvement recently.近来各方面都有所改进。
Overall, the tone of the book is satirical.总的说来,这本书是讽刺性的。
How much will it cost overall?一共多少钱?
The shop assistant was wearing a white overall.那店员穿著白色长罩衣。

overarching

[ˌəʊvər'ɑːtʃɪŋ], [ˌoʊvər'ɑːrtʃɪŋ]

overbearing

[ˌəʊvə'beərɪŋ], [ˌəʊvə'beərɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 傲慢的；骄傲自大的；蛮横的
unpleasantly or arrogantly domineering.

"his overbearing, sometimes ruthless desire to succeed"
"his will had not been overborne by another's influence"
No one liked his overbearing manners.没有人喜欢他那傲慢的样子。
His overbearing insolence angered everyone.他的傲慢无礼激起了大家的愤怒。
The aging actress was very high-strung and overbearing.这位上了年纪的女演员非常紧张,而且骄傲自大。
He's so overbearing that no one wants to work for him.他那么蛮横,没人愿为他工作。
Everybody was indignant at such an overbearing manner.对于这种蛮横态度，大家无不感到气愤。

overlap

[ˌəʊvə'læp], [ˌoʊvər'læp]


Image Search
vt. 重叠；重复
vi. 有重叠部分
n. 重叠部分；重复
extend over so as to cover partly.
cover part of the same area of interest, responsibility, etc.
partly coincide in time.
a part or amount which overlaps.
a common area of interest, responsibility, etc.
a period of time in which two events or activities happen together.
"the canopy overlaps the house roof at one end"
"their duties sometimes overlapped"
"two new series overlapped"
"an overlap of about half an inch"
"there are many overlaps between the approaches"
A fish's scales overlap each other.鱼鳞是一片片上下交叠起来的。
You need to overlap the pieces of wood slightly.你需要把这些木片搭叠起来。
These two papers overlap in content.这两篇论文有交叉的内容。
The programme has been so organized that none of the talks overlap.日程做了精心安排，以使每一讲都没有重复内容。
Channel ranges must not overlap.频道范围不能重叠。
The roofs of the houses overlap in the crowded city.房子的屋顶重叠在这个拥挤的城市的上空。
There is a small overlap between the two circles.在这两个圆周有一小部分重叠。
There is a considerable overlap between the two subjects.这两门科目之间有相当多的共通之处。
His duties and mine have an overlap.他的职责和我的有部分交叉。

overrated

[ˌəʊvə'reɪt], [ˌoʊvər'reɪt]

He qualified in London as a teacher of English overseas.他在伦敦取得了海外英语教师的资格。

overt

[əʊ'vɜːt], [oʊ'vɜːrt]


Image Search
adj. 公开的；明显的；公然的
done or shown openly; plainly or readily apparent, not secret or hidden.
"an overt act of aggression"
In many emerging economies corruption is egregious and overt.许多新兴经济体中的腐败是异乎寻常的和公开的。
Supreme People's Court promulgated the regulations on overt enforcement.最高人民法院颁布执行公开的规定。
It was full of overt propaganda and the props were primitive.节目充满了明显的宣传，一点也不精致，道具都是简单。
Spotting them can be tricky, since many animals display few overt symptoms.确诊蓝舌病本身已经很难，因为很多染病动物并无明显的临床症状。
Overt expression of hostility is considered evidence of marital problems.公然的敌意表现被认为是预示婚姻问题的前兆。

overture

['əʊvətʃʊə(r)], ['oʊvərtʃər]


Image Search
n. 提议；提案；主动表示；序曲
v. 提议；建议
an orchestral piece at the beginning of an opera, suite, play, oratorio, or other extended composition.
an independent orchestral composition in one movement.
an introduction to something more substantial.
an approach or proposal made to someone with the aim of opening negotiations or establishing a relationship.
"the talks were no more than an overture to a long debate"
"Coleen listened to his overtures of love"
And, knowing little about Geely, it didn't take the overture seriously, according to people familiar with the situation.据知情人士透露，由于对吉利知之甚少，福特汽车没有认真对待这一提议。
He resolved, therefore, to let things take their course without making any direct overture to the count.所以他决定让事情顺其自然发展，而不向伯爵作任何正面的提议。
Many spokesmen attacked consumingly this overture.大会上许多的发言人强烈抨击了这项提案。
Three-fours of the people agree with the overture presently.目前有四分之三的人赞成该提案。
They played the overture at a fairly slow tempo.他们用相当缓慢的速度演奏那首序曲。
This tool works differently from the Overture tool.这个工具厂不同序曲工具。
And, knowing little about Geely, it didn't take the overture seriously, according to people familiar with the situation.据知情人士透露，由于对吉利知之甚少，福特汽车没有认真对待这一提议。
He resolved, therefore, to let things take their course without making any direct overture to the count.所以他决定让事情顺其自然发展，而不向伯爵作任何正面的提议。

overwhelmed

[ˌəʊvə'welm], [ˌoʊvər'welm]


Image Search
vt. 打击；压倒；使感动；淹没；打败
bury or drown beneath a huge mass.
defeat completely.
give too much of a thing to (someone); inundate.
have a strong emotional effect on.
be too strong for; overpower.
"the water flowed through to overwhelm the whole dam and the village beneath"
"his teams overwhelmed their opponents"
"they were overwhelmed by farewell messages"
"I was overwhelmed with guilt"
"the wine doesn't overwhelm the flavor of the trout"
No difficulty can overwhelm us.困难压不倒我们。
If I cannot overwhelm with my quality, I will overwhelm with my quantity.如果我不能以质量压倒，我就一定要以数量压倒。
Your kindness quite overwhelmed me.你的好意使我感激难言。
The village was overwhelmed when the floods came.这个村庄在洪水泛滥时被淹没了。
Europe's golfers completely overwhelmed the Americans.欧洲的高尔夫运动员以压倒性的优势击败了美国对手。

Ultimately he wants to revise the pacifist constitution.他最终希望修改和平宪法。
I've never met such an ardent pacifist as Terry.我从未见过像特里这样热情的和平主义者。

pacify

pact

[pækt], [pækt]


Image Search
n. 契约；协定；条约
a formal agreement between individuals or parties.
It was a pact made in fun long ago.这是很久以前在开玩笑时定下的契约。
Tell Me Why You and I must make a pact.你和我必须订立契约。
They made a pact not to tell anyone.他们有协定，不告诉任何人。
They ratify the pact because they think it will bring peace.他们批准了这项协定，因为他们认为它将能带来和平。
They signed a nonaggression pact.他们签定了互不侵犯条约。
We will put military muscle into the mutual defence pact.我们将把兵力加进防御互助条约。

palpable

['pælpəbl], ['pælpəbl]


Image Search
adj. 易觉察的；可摸到的；明显的
(of a feeling or atmosphere) so intense as to seem almost tangible.
plain to see or comprehend.
able to be touched or felt.
"a palpable sense of loss"
"to talk of dawn raids in the circumstances is palpable nonsense"
"the palpable bump at the bridge of the nose"
The tension in the room was almost palpable.屋子里的紧张气氛几乎能感觉到。
None of the vessels and nerves of the hand is visible or palpable.手的血管和神经不能看到或摸到。
There is a palpable difference in their ages.他们的年龄有着明显的差别。
A sense of urgency was palpable in Bali.紧迫意识在巴厘岛会议中十分明显。

paltry

This is a paltry sum to pay for such a masterpiece.对这样一部杰作只付这么一点钱, 未免太少了。
It's paltry to do that job.做这件工作是毫无价值的。
How can you deliberately get up such paltry falsehoods?你怎么能故意编造出这么卑鄙的谎话?

one of several drawings making up a comic strip.
a flat board on which instruments or controls are fixed.

The date for the panel discussion is fixed now.座谈会的日期现已确定。

He panelled the wall with wood.他在墙上镶上木板。

"the tower offers a wonderful panorama of Prague"
"the galleries will offer a full panorama of 20th-century art"
promise graciously
As we stood at the top of the mountain, a beautiful panorama spread out before us.我们登上山顶时，一幅美丽的景色展现在我们的面前。
The book presents a panorama of British history since the Middle Ages.该书概述了中世纪以来的英国历史。
Henry watched the panorama of pass people with wide eyes.亨利观看着一连串过往的人群。

pantomime

['pæntəmaɪm], ['pæntəmaɪm]


Image Search
n. 哑剧；童话剧；哑剧演员；手势
v. 打手势；演哑剧
a dramatic entertainment, originating in Roman mime, in which performers express meaning through gestures accompanied by music.
an absurdly exaggerated piece of behavior.
a ridiculous or confused situation or event.
a theatrical entertainment, mainly for children, that involves music, topical jokes, and slapstick comedy and is based on a fairy tale or nursery story, usually produced around Christmas.
express or represent (something) by extravagant and exaggerated mime.
"he made a pantomime of checking his watch"
"the drive to town was a pantomime"
"the clown candidates pantomimed different emotions"
The actor is skilled in pantomime.这个演员擅长表演哑剧。
The audience roared with laughter at the pantomime.观众被这哑剧逗得哈哈大笑。
The children were very excited by the pantomime.孩子们看了童话剧非常兴奋。
Some tourists make themselves understood abroad by pantomime.一些游客在国外通常用手势来让别人明白自己的意思。
Apes are routinely beaten into submission and forced to pantomime human behaviors that are foreign and confusing.猿类被屈打得顺从，被迫模仿对于它们来说是莫名其妙，难以理解的人类行为举止。

papaya

[pə'paɪə], [pə'paɪə]


Image Search
n. 木瓜
a tropical fruit shaped like an elongated melon, with edible orange flesh and small black seeds.
the fast-growing tree that bears the papaya, native to warm regions of America. It is widely cultivated for its fruit, both for eating and for papain production.
He ate a papaya and his tummy got bigger.他吃了一个木瓜，肚子变大了一些。
It is OK really to eat papaya breast enhancement?吃木瓜真的可以丰胸嘛？

paradigm

['pærədaɪm], ['pærədaɪm]


Image Search
n. 范例；示范；典范；[语]词形变化表
a typical example or pattern of something; a model.
a worldview underlying the theories and methodology of a particular scientific subject.
a set of linguistic items that form mutually exclusive choices in particular syntactic roles.
(in the traditional grammar of Latin, Greek, and other inflected languages) a table of all the inflected forms of a particular verb, noun, or adjective, serving as a model for other words of the same conjugation or declension.
"there is a new paradigm for public art in this country"
"the discovery of universal gravitation became the paradigm of successful science"
"English determiners form a paradigm: we can say “a book” or “his book” but not “a his book.”"
There's no paradigm to follow in this new industry.在这个崭新的行业里没有范例可做参考。
No prevailing paradigm in science lasts forever.科学中没有任何流行范式能够存在永远。
We now see paradigms and paradigm overthrows everywhere, inside of science and out.我们现在可以随处看到典范和推翻典范的事例，无论在科学还是其他方面。
The Aristotelian paradigm prefers the frog perspective, whereas the Platonic paradigm prefers the bird perspective.亚里士多德的典范偏向蛙的眼光，而柏拉图的典范偏向鸟的眼光。

paragraph

['pærəɡrɑːf], ['pærəɡræf]


Image Search
n. 段落；节
vt. 将 ... 分段；写短评报道
vi. 写短评
a distinct section of a piece of writing, usually dealing with a single theme and indicated by a new line, indentation, or numbering.
arrange (a piece of writing) in paragraphs.
"the concluding paragraph"
"his style deploys a lack of conventional paragraphing"
The editor struck out the whole paragraph.编辑把整段全删掉了。
You'll find the last paragraph extremely apropos.你会觉得最后一段文字极为中肯。
Look at the second paragraph on page fifteen.请看第十五页的第二段。
This point has been dealt with in the preceding paragraph.这一点在前面一段里已经交代过了。
This paragraph relates to the October Revolution.这一节内容是论述十月革命的。
Don't omit this paragraph when you write your report.写报告时不要删去这一节。
The student is ask to paragraph an essay in class.学生们被要求在课堂上给一篇文章分段。
The teacher taught the students how to paragraph an essay.老师教学生如何把一篇文章分段。
The editor asked him to paragraph.编辑让他写短评。

parallel

['pærəlel], ['pærəlel]


Image Search
adj. 平行的；相同的；类似的；并联的
n. 对比；平行线(面)；双杠；相似物
vt. 相比；相应；与 ... 平行
(of lines, planes, surfaces, or objects) side by side and having the same distance continuously between them.
occurring or existing at the same time or in a similar way; corresponding.
involving the simultaneous performance of operations.
of or denoting electrical components or circuits connected to common points at each end, rather than one to another in sequence.
a person or thing that is similar or analogous to another.
a similarity or comparison.
each of the imaginary parallel circles of constant latitude on the earth's surface.
two parallel lines (‖) as a reference mark.
(of something extending in a line) be side by side with (something extending in a line), always keeping the same distance.
be similar or corresponding to (something).
"parallel lines never meet"
"a parallel universe"
"a challenge that has no parallel in peacetime this century"
"he draws a parallel between personal destiny and social forces"
"a big concrete gutter that paralleled the road"
"the lawlessness throughout officialdom was paralleled by an increase in lawlessness on the streets"
In the parallel world, there might be an answer for everything.在平行世界里,似乎有一切的答案。
Parallel processing is the most important peculiarity in this design.其中,并行化的设计理念是该设计的最大特点。
The railway lines run parallel to the road.铁路线和那条道路平行。
My experience in this matter is parallel to yours.在这件事情上，我的经验和你的类似。
My experience in selling is parallel to yours.在销售方面,我的经验和你相仿。
Japan's macroeconomic puzzle has a microeconomic parallel.日本的宏观经济难题是与其微观经济并联的。
Elements may be connected in parallel, series, or any combination thereof.这些硅碳棒可以是并联的，串连的，或者是串并混联的。
It is inappropriate to draw such a parallel.这种比拟是不恰当的。
The trees stand in parallel with the road.这些树与公路平行。
The gymnast swung on the parallel bars.体操运动员在双杠上摆动身子。
The accuracy of the parallel increased.这种比拟变得愈来愈确切了。
No one can parallel him in Math.在数学方面无人能与他匹敌。
Actually no one can parallel him in poetry.实际上，在诗歌方面无人能同他相提并论。
Her experiences parallel mine in many instances.她的经历多与我的相似。
They parallel with one another.他们相互平行。

parameters

[pə'ræmɪtəz], [pə'ræmɪtəz]


Image Search
n. 参数
a numerical or other measurable factor forming one of a set that defines a system or sets the conditions of its operation.
a quantity whose value is selected for the particular circumstances and in relation to which other variable quantities may be expressed.
a numerical characteristic of a population, as distinct from a statistic of a sample.
(in general use) a limit or boundary that defines the scope of a particular process or activity.
"the transmission will not let you downshift unless your speed is within the lower gear's parameters"
"they set the parameters of the debate"
Here the autofocus parameters are adjusted.这是调整自动聚集参数。
How many parameters can be displayer in the CMLU?综合录井仪能显示多少参数？

parody

['pærədi], ['pærədi]


Image Search
n. 仿作；拙劣的模仿
v. 拙劣模仿；作模仿诗文
an imitation of the style of a particular writer, artist, or genre with deliberate exaggeration for comic effect.
an imitation or a version of something that falls far short of the real thing; a travesty.
produce a humorously exaggerated imitation of (a writer, artist, or genre).
mimic humorously.
"the movie is a parody of the horror genre"
"he seems like a parody of an educated Englishman"
"his specialty was parodying schoolgirl fiction"
"he parodied his friend's voice"
Time is the wealth of change, but the clock in its parody makes it.时间是变化的财富。时钟模仿它,却只有变化而无财富。
She has become a grotesque parody of her former elegant self.她成为了以前那个举止优雅的自己的怪诞模仿品。
The trial was a parody of justice.这次审判是对公正的一次拙劣的模拟。
His style has often been parodied.他的风格经常被拙劣地模仿。

parsimonious

[ˌpɑːsɪ'məʊniəs], [ˌpɑːrsə'moʊniəs]


Image Search
adj. 极度节省的；吝啬的
unwilling to spend money or use resources; stingy or frugal.
"parsimonious New Hampshire voters, who have a phobia about taxes"
And physicists are very parsimonious with postulates.而物理学家的原则是使用尽量少的假定。
His parsimonious nature did not permit him to enjoy any luxuries.他那吝啬的本性不容许他享受任何奢侈品。

parsley

['pɑːsli], ['pɑːrsli]


Image Search
n. 欧芹；荷兰芹
a biennial plant with white flowers and aromatic leaves that are either crinkly or flat and used as a culinary herb and for garnishing food.
Parsley is used for flavoring food.欧芹常用来给食品调味。
He decorated the chicken with sprigs of parsley.他用欧芹的嫩枝点缀在鸡上。
Do you know about a third kind of parsley?这种荷兰芹通常被称为意大利欧芹或法国欧芹。
Parsley is often served with lamb fish and beef dishes.荷兰芹通常用在羊肉，鱼肉和牛肉中。

parsnip

['pɑːsnɪp], ['pɑːrsnɪp]


Image Search
n. 欧洲防风草；欧洲萝卜
a long tapering cream-colored root with a sweet flavor.
the widely cultivated Eurasian plant of the parsley family that yields this root.
This dish of parsnip tastes strange.这盘欧防风做的菜味道很怪。

participation

[pɑːˌtɪsɪ'peɪʃn], [pɑːrˌtɪsɪ'peɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 参加；参与
the action of taking part in something.
"participation in church activities"
By the way, must we guarantee in any way our participation in the tender?顺便问一下，我们应为参加投标做一点保证吗？
I'd like to be excused from any further participation in the work.我希望让我不再继续参加这项工作。
I'd like to express my thanks for your participation.对于您的参加,我表示衷心的感谢。
His participation is not welcomed.他的参与不受欢迎。
We win the game because of his participation.由于他的参与，我们赢了比赛。
I look forward to your support and participation in the programme.希望大家支持并参与这项计划。

particle

['pɑːtɪkl], ['pɑːrtɪkl]


Image Search
n. 颗粒；微粒；极小量；质点；粒子；[语]小品词
a minute portion of matter.
the least possible amount.
another term for subatomic particle.
a hypothetical object having mass but no physical size.
a minor function word that has comparatively little meaning and does not inflect, in particular.
(in English) any of the class of words such as in, up, off, over, used with verbs to make phrasal verbs.
(in ancient Greek) any of the class of words such as de and ge, used for contrast and emphasis.
"tiny particles of dust"
"he agrees without hearing the least particle of evidence"
We can see the dust particles floating in the sunlight clearly.我们可以很清楚地看到阳光下的灰尘颗粒。
An atom is the smallest indivisible particle of matter.原子是最小的不可分的物质微粒。
There wasn't a particle of truth in what he said.他说的没有一点真话。
The particle is displaced in a flow domain.这质点在流动区域内运动。
The particle will accelerate under the action of the applied force.这个粒子在所加力的作用下将作加速运动。
In 'She tore up the letter', the word 'up' is a particle.在 She tore up the letter 句中，up 便是小品词。

partisan

[ˌpɑːtɪ'zæn], ['pɑːrtəzn]


Image Search
adj. 偏袒的；党派性的
n. 强烈支持者；党羽；游击队员
a strong supporter of a party, cause, or person.
a member of an armed group formed to fight secretly against an occupying force, in particular one operating in enemy-occupied Yugoslavia, Italy, and parts of eastern Europe in World War II.
prejudiced in favor of a particular cause.
"newspapers have become increasingly partisan"
You must listen to both points of view and try not to be partisan.你必须兼听双方观点
The other obstacle is partisan bickering.另一个障碍是党派间的纷争。
He is a staunch partisan of the Republican Party.他是共和党的坚定支持者。
Partisan politics is often an obstruction to good government.党羽的政治阴谋常是良好政府的阻碍。
Even after the country is defeated, partisan fight the invader in the hill.即使在国家被击败之后,游击队仍在山里与入侵者抗战。
It is the partisan who drove the enemy forces out of our country.是游击队员把敌人从我们国家赶出去的。

partition

[pɑː'tɪʃn], [pɑːr'tɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 划分；隔离物
vt. 区分；隔开；分割
(especially with reference to a country with separate areas of government) the action or state of dividing or being divided into parts.
a structure dividing a space into two parts, especially a light interior wall.
the distribution of a solute between two immiscible or slightly miscible solvents in contact with one another, in accordance with its differing solubility in each.
each of a number of portions into which some operating systems divide memory or storage.
divide into parts.
divide (a room) into smaller rooms or areas by erecting partitions.
separate a part of a room from the rest by erecting a partition.
"the country's partition into separate states"
"an agreement was reached to partition the country"
"the hall was partitioned to contain the noise of the computers"
"partition off part of a large bedroom to create a small bathroom"
The key to resolve the problem is elaborate partition for time and manpower.关键的解决这人问题的方法是把时间和人力精心划分。
I could hear what he was saying on the phone through the partition.我能隔着墙听见他在电话里说了些什么。
Our office is comparted by a partition board.我们的办公室用一个隔扇分成两部分。
There is a plywood partition between the two rooms.两个房子中间有一个夹板墙。
The workers partition a room into three parts.工人们把一间房间分成三部分。
He partition off part of the room as a study.他将房间一部分隔开作书房。
We've partitioned off one end of the kitchen to make a breakfast room.我们已把厨房的一头隔开作吃早饭的房间。

partnership

['pɑːtnəʃɪp], ['pɑːrtnərʃɪp]


Image Search
n. 合伙人身份；合股；合伙经营
the state of being a partner or partners.
an association of two or more people as partners.
a business or firm owned and run by two or more partners.
a position as one of the partners in a business or firm.
"we should go on working together in partnership"
"an increase in partnerships with housing associations"
They decided to break up the partnership.他们决定终止合作关系。
Martin has taken him into general partnership in his company.马丁已让他成为公司的普通合伙人。
Last year we entered into partnership with him.我们去年和他合股。
My business was most successful when I formed a good partnership with someone else.当我与别人建立了良好的合股关系时,我的生意最兴旺发达。
She worked in partnership with her sister.她和妹妹合股经营。
I enter into partnership with him to do export business.我与他合伙做出口生意。

passionate

['pæʃənət], ['pæʃənət]


Image Search
adj. 热情的；激情的；易怒的
showing or caused by strong feelings or a strong belief.
showing or caused by intense feelings of sexual love.
"passionate pleas for help"
"a passionate kiss"
His passionate speech had an effect on our emotions.他的热情的演讲打动了我们的感情。
She is a passionate advocate of education reform.她是一名教育改革的热情拥护者。
He made a passionate speech about the sufferings of the poor.他就穷人的苦难做了一个充满激情的演讲。
His early experience turn him into a passionate social reformer.他早年的经历使他变成了一个狂热的社会改革者。

passive

['pæsɪv], ['pæsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 被动的；消极的
n. 被动性
accepting or allowing what happens or what others do, without active response or resistance.
denoting or relating to a voice of verbs in which the subject undergoes the action of the verb (e.g., they were killed as opposed to he killed them ).
(of a circuit or device) containing no source of electromotive force.
(of radar or a satellite) receiving or reflecting radiation from a transmitter or target rather than generating its own signal.
relating to or denoting heating systems that make use of incident sunlight as an energy source.
(of a metal) made unreactive by a thin inert surface layer of oxide.
a passive form of a verb.
the passive voice.
"the women were portrayed as passive victims"
He played a passive role in the marriage.他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。
You are passive when you allow things to happen, but do nothing.当你让这些事发生,而不做任何事来阻止它,你是消极的。
Good is the passive that obeys reason.善是服从理智的被动性。
Passive tear suctioning force can be demonstrated by a Venturi tube model.被动性泪液吸引之力量，可藉由文氏管模型来解释。

pasta

['pæstə], ['pɑːstə]


Image Search
n. 意大利面
a dish originally from Italy consisting of dough made from durum wheat and water, extruded or stamped into various shapes and typically cooked in boiling water.
Do you want chicken or pasta for dinner?晚餐您喜欢鸡肉还是意大利面？
I come from a large Italian family where pasta and cannoli are staples in our diet.我来自一个意大利大家庭，面食和奶油甜卷是我们膳食中的主食。

pathetic

[pə'θetɪk], [pə'θetɪk]


Image Search
adj. 可怜的；不足的；感伤的；悲哀的
arousing pity, especially through vulnerability or sadness.
miserably inadequate.
relating to the emotions.
"she looked so pathetic that I bent down to comfort her"
"his test scores in Chemistry were pathetic"
We saw the pathetic sight of starving children.我们看到挨饿的儿童悲惨可怜的样子。
She dances well, but as a singer, she is pathetic.她跳舞跳得好，但唱歌就差劲了。
God! The freshmen are pathetic this year!天啊！今年的大一新生什么也不懂！
I never heard anything that sounded so pathetic.我从未听说过如此悲伤的事了。
His tears were pathetic to witness.他的眼泪引起在场人的怜悯。
It was pathetic to watch her condition deteriorate.看着她的健康状况恶化真是感到难过。
The police do not pity those poor, pathetic and helpless homeless.警察一点也不同情那些既悲哀又无助的游民。
You are nothing but a pathetic fool.你只不过是个可怜的傻瓜。

patron

['peɪtrən], ['peɪtrən]


Image Search
n. 赞助人；老主顾；守护神
a person who gives financial or other support to a person, organization, cause, or activity.
a customer, especially a regular one, of a store, restaurant, or theater.
short for patron saint.
(in ancient Rome) a patrician in relation to a client.
(in ancient Rome) the former owner and (frequently) protector of a freed slave.
a person or institution with the right to grant a benefice to a member of the clergy.
"Charles became a patron of Rubens and van Dyck"
"we surveyed the plushness of the hotel and its sleek, well-dressed patrons"
Modern artists have difficulty in finding patrons.现代艺术家们很难找到赞助人。
He inscribed those poems to his patron.他将这些诗献给他的赞助人。
This store has many patrons.这家商店有许多老顾客。
The usher handed the patron to a reserved seat.引座员把顾客引到预订的座位上
St Christopher is the patron saint of travellers.圣·克里斯托弗是旅行者的守护神。

peaceful

['piːsfl], ['piːsfl]


Image Search
adj. 和平的；安宁的
free from disturbance; tranquil.
not involving war or violence.
(of a person) inclined to avoid conflict; not aggressive.
"everything was so quiet and peaceful in the early morning"
"a soldier was shot and seriously wounded at an otherwise peaceful demonstration"
"Dad was a peaceful, law-abiding citizen"
Hopes of a peaceful settlement are now fading.和平解决的希望正在消失。
China is a peaceful country.中国是一个爱好和平的国家。
The world today is far from peaceful.今天的世界还很不安宁。
Law and order are necessary for a peaceful society.法律和秩序对于社会安宁是必需的。
My husband loves adventurous life while I enjoy a more peaceful domestic life.我丈夫喜欢充满冒险的生活，而我则喜欢宁静的家居生活。

peak

[piːk], [piːk]


Image Search
n. 尖端；山顶；顶峰
v. 达到顶峰；使处于顶点
vi. 消瘦
the pointed top of a mountain.
a mountain, especially one with a pointed top.
a projecting pointed part or shape.
a point in a curve or on a graph, or a value of a physical quantity, higher than those around it.
the point of highest activity, quality, or achievement.
a stiff brim at the front of a cap.
the narrow part of a ship's hold at the bow or stern.
the upper, outer corner of a sail extended by a gaff.
reach a highest point, either of a specified value or at a specified time.
greatest; maximum.
characterized by maximum activity or demand.
decline in health and spirits; waste away.
"the snowy peaks rose against the blue of a cloudless sky"
"the rocky outcrops of peaks such as the Cassongrat offer a challenge to rock climbers"
"whisk 2 egg whites to stiff peaks"
"a slight increase in velocity provides a second peak on the general velocity curve"
"anyone who saw Jones at his peak looked upon genius"
"its popularity peaked in the 1940s"
"he did not expect to be anywhere near peak fitness until Christmas"
"at peak hours, traffic speeds are reduced considerably"
In Yersa I noticed a spike on the peak of the pyramid-shaped roof of a church.在叶拉萨村,我发现一座教堂的金字塔屋顶的尖端有一颗尖钉。
The mountain peaks are covered with snow all year.山顶上终年积雪。
Many mountaineers have reached that mountain peak.许多登山家都登上过那座大山的顶峰。
Tourism is at its peak in August.旅游业在八月份达到高峰。
Primary school enrolment will peak this year.今年小学入学人数将达到最高峰。
Sales tend to peak just before the holidays.节日前销售量趋于最高潮
Property prices have peaked.房地产价格已达到最高点。

peat

[piːt], [piːt]


Image Search
n. 泥煤；泥煤块
a brown, soil-like material characteristic of boggy, acid ground, consisting of partly decomposed vegetable matter. It is widely cut and dried for use in gardening and as fuel.
"cuttings are rooted in a homemade mixture of equal parts peat and sand"
In later years when the bog is drained, the peat can be dug out and used as fuel.再过几年，当沼泽干涸之后，泥煤可以挖出来用作燃料。
Peat is sometimes used as a fertilizer.泥炭有时被用作肥料。

peer

[pɪə(r)], [pɪr]


Image Search
n. 同辈；同等的人；贵族
vi. 凝视；窥视
look keenly or with difficulty at someone or something.
be just visible.
come into view; appear.
a member of the nobility in Britain or Ireland, comprising the ranks of duke, marquess, earl, viscount, and baron.
a person of the same age, status, or ability as another specified person.
make or become equal with or of the same rank.
"Blake screwed up his eyes, trying to peer through the fog"
"the two towers peer over the roofs"
"he has incurred much criticism from his academic peers"
Children are easily influenced by their peers.孩子很容易受同辈影响。
He was valued by both his peer and his superiors.他的同级和上级都很器重他。
The opinions of his peers are more important to him than his parents' ideas.在他看来，他同辈人的观点比他父母的观点更为重要。
It will not be easy to find his peer.很不容易找到像他那样的人.
He was created a peer of the UK in 2005.他在2005年被封为英国的贵族。
She peers through the mist, trying to find the right path.她透过雾眯着眼看，想找出正确的路。
She peer at me over the top of her glasses.她从眼镜上方盯着我看。
The cloud of data flowing through their workstations forms a clear digital globe for them to peer into.这些云聚的数据流过他们的工作站，形成了一种清澈的数据世界，让他们能够窥视其究竟。

perceived

[pə'siːv], [pər'sːv]


Image Search
v. 注意到；觉察到；认为；理解
become aware or conscious of (something); come to realize or understand.
become aware of (something) by the use of one of the senses, especially that of sight.
interpret or look on (someone or something) in a particular way; regard as.
"his mouth fell open as he perceived the truth"
"he perceived the faintest of flushes creeping up her neck"
"if Guy does not perceive himself as disabled, nobody else should"
I plainly perceive some objections remain.我清楚地察觉到还有一些反对意见。
We can perceive his sorrow by the looks on his face.我们从他的表情中觉察出悲伤。
Indeed, this problem is greater than one may perceive.确实，这个问题远大于你所能感知到的。
They perceive television as entertainment.他们将电视视为娱乐。
Adults learn what they perceive to be useful in their life situations.成人们学他们认为对其生活情境有帮助的东西。
At first I couldn't perceive what he meant.起先我不理解他说的意思。

percent

[pə'sent], [pə'sent]


Image Search
n. 百分比
adv. 百分之 ...
adj. 百分之 ... 的
by a specified amount in or for every hundred.
one part in every hundred.
the rate, number, or amount in each hundred; percentage.
"new car sales may be down nineteen percent"
"a reduction of half a percent or so in price"
"the percent of drug users who are infected"
The number of queues repaired out of the percent detected.修复的队列数目超过检测到的百分比。
Twenty percent of the products are exported.百分之二十的产品外销。
The company's market share is 48 percent in the marketplace.这家公司的市场占有率是百分之四十八。
The gross national product had increased 5 percent last year.去年的国民生产总值提高了百分之五。
The millionaire has handed over 50 percent of his stock to his first son.这个百万富翁已把他一半的股票移交给他的长子。
The covering of forestry in our town is 60 percent.我们镇的森林覆盖率是百分之六十。
I am a hundred percent in agreement with you.我百分之百同意你的看法。
We give 10 percent discount for cash.现金付款，我们九折优惠。
Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.天才是靠百分之一的灵感与百分之九十九的努力。

period

['pɪəriəd], ['pɪriəd]


Image Search
n. 一段时间；周期；时期；课时；学时；句号；月经
a length or portion of time.
a portion of time in the life of a nation, civilization, etc. characterized by the same prevalent features or conditions.
a major division of geological time that is a subdivision of an era and is itself subdivided into epochs, corresponding to a system in chronostratigraphy.
one of the set divisions of the day in a school allocated to a lesson or other activity.
each of the intervals into which the playing time of a sporting event is divided.
the interval of time between successive occurrences of the same state in an oscillatory or cyclic phenomenon, such as a mechanical vibration, an alternating current, a variable star, or an electromagnetic wave.
the time taken by a celestial object to rotate around its axis, or to make one circuit of its orbit.
the interval between successive equal values of a periodic function.
a flow of blood and other material from the lining of the uterus, lasting for several days and occurring in sexually mature women who are not pregnant at intervals of about one lunar month until the onset of menopause.
a punctuation mark (.) used at the end of a sentence or an abbreviation.
added to the end of a statement to indicate that no further discussion is possible or desirable.
a set of elements occupying an entire horizontal row in the periodic table.
a complex sentence, especially one consisting of several clauses, constructed as part of a formal speech or oration.
a complete idea, typically consisting of two or four phrases.
belonging to or characteristic of a past historical time, especially in style or design.
"he had long periods of depression"
"the early medieval period"
"he is the sole owner of the trademark, period"
"a splendid selection of period furniture"
He feels completely restored to health after a period of intensive care.通过一段时间的精心照顾，他感到身体完全康复了。
The exercise period was similar to the previous study.运动周期类似前面的研究。
Childhood is a period of rapid growth.幼年是生长迅速的时期。
He teaches 10 periods a week.他每周授课10课时。
This course needs 30 periods in all, and case analysis will use 4 periods.本课程的总学时是30学时，其中4学时是让学生做案例分析。
Use a period at the end of the sentence.在一个句子的末尾用句号。
How long is your period usually?通常你的月经周期多长?

periodic

[ˌpɪəri'ɒdɪk], [ˌpɪri'ɑːdɪk]


Image Search
adj. 周期的；定期的；间歇的；完句的
appearing or occurring at intervals.
relating to the periodic table of the elements or the pattern of chemical properties that underlies it.
relating to a rhetorical period.
"the periodic visits she made to her father"
Long long ago, we knew the periodic motion of a planet.很久以前, 我们就知道行星的周期运动。
Why are the version numbers not in any particular periodic sequence?为什么版本号不是按照任何特定的周期序列?
The doctor made periodic visit to the house to see if the baby was all right.医生定期到这家进行拜访,检查婴儿的健康。
There is a periodic reshuffle of our company staff.我们公司定期有人事变动。

perishable

['perɪʃəbl], ['perɪʃəbl]


Image Search
adj. 易腐烂的；会枯萎的；会死的
（复数）perishables:易腐烂的东西（尤指食物）.
(especially of food) likely to decay or go bad quickly.
(of something abstract) having a brief life or significance; transitory.
things, especially foodstuffs, likely to decay or go bad quickly.
"ballet is the most perishable of arts"
Perishable goods are piling up at the docks.码头上易腐烂的货物堆积如山。
Unlike perishable agricultural products, oil can be stored in the ground.不同于易腐烂的农产品，石油可以长期埋在地下。

perjury

['pɜːdʒəri], ['pɜːrdʒəri]


Image Search
n. 伪证罪；伪誓；背信弃义
the offense of willfully telling an untruth in a court after having taken an oath or affirmation.
He was accused of perjury with the intention of incriminating his employer.他被控告犯有意图加罪于其雇主的伪证罪。

permeable

['pɜːmiəbl], ['pɜːrmiəbl]


Image Search
adj. 可渗透的；可穿透的
(of a material or membrane) allowing liquids or gases to pass through it.
"a frog's skin is permeable to water"
The skin of amphibians is permeable to water.两栖动物的皮肤是透水的。
Permeable pavement is not very good for roads with a lot of traffic.可渗透的路面对高运输量的马路并不有效。

permeate

['pɜːmieɪt], ['pɜːrmieɪt]


Image Search
v. 弥漫；渗透；普及
spread throughout (something); pervade.
"the aroma of soup permeated the air"
His subtle satisfaction seemed to permeate the space around them.他难以捉摸的满足感好像弥漫在了他们的周围。
If your wine is still, pour it into the centre of the glass to let the bouquet permeate the vessel.如果是无汽泡的酒，直接倒入杯子中央，使酒的香气充分散发，弥漫整个酒杯。
Water will permeate blotting paper.水能渗透吸水纸。
Functional relationships permeate every part of science.函数关系渗透自然科学的每个部分。

perpetuate

[pə'petʃueɪt], [pər'petʃueɪt]


Image Search
vt. 使永存；使不朽
make (something, typically an undesirable situation or an unfounded belief) continue indefinitely.
preserve (something valued) from oblivion or extinction.
"the law perpetuated the interests of the ruling class"
"how did these first humans survive to perpetuate the species?"
These measures will perpetuate the hostility between the two groups.采取这些措施势必使那两集团永远对立。
They decided to perpetuate the memory of their leader by erecting a statue.他们为永远纪念那位领袖决定建一座雕像。

perplexed

[pə'plekst], [pər'plekst]


Image Search
adj. 困惑的；不知所措的；纠缠不清的
动词perplex的过去式和过去分词.
completely baffled; very puzzled.
(of something complicated or unaccountable) cause (someone) to feel completely baffled.
complicate or confuse (a matter).
"she gave him a perplexed look"
"she was perplexed by her husband's moodiness"
"they were perplexing a subject plain in itself"
We were perplexed by his failure to answer the letter.他何以不回信,我们大惑不解。
When new math was introduced into schools, many parents were perplexed by it.当学校开设新的数学课时，许多家长对此感到迷惑不解。
Faced with that dilemma, he was perplexed.他面对进退两难的局面，不知如何是好。

persevere

[ˌpɜːsɪ'vɪə(r)], [ˌpɜːrsə'vɪr]


Image Search
v. 坚持；不屈不挠
continue in a course of action even in the face of difficulty or with little or no prospect of success.
"his family persevered with his treatment"
When things get difficult, you just have to grit your teeth and persevere.遇到困难只需咬紧牙关坚持下去。
If you persevere with work, you'll succeed in the end.你如果把工作坚持下去，最终会取得成功的。
He was hopeless at French, but his teacher persevered with him.他怎么也学不会法语,可是老师仍锲而不舍地帮助他。

persevereing


Image Search
continue in a course of action even in the face of difficulty or with little or no prospect of success.
"his family persevered with his treatment"

persist

[pə'sɪst], [pər'sɪst]


Image Search
v. 坚持；执意；继续；持续
continue firmly or obstinately in an opinion or a course of action in spite of difficulty, opposition, or failure.
continue to exist; be prolonged.
"the minority of drivers who persist in drinking"
"if the symptoms persist for more than a few days, contact your doctor"
I hope you'll persist in your efforts.我希望你们再接再励。
He will persist in riding that dreadful bicycle.他执意要骑那辆破自行车。
If you persist, you will annoy them even more.你若固执，他们就更恼火了。
If you persist in breaking the law you will go to prison.如果你再继续违法的话，你会坐牢的。
They persist with the agricultural reform, despite opposition from the farmers.他们不顾农民反对,仍继续进行农业改革。
The cold weather will persist for the rest of the week.这种寒冷的天气将持续到本周末。

persistent

[pə'sɪstənt], [pər'sɪstənt]


Image Search
adj. 坚持的；连续的；固执的
continuing firmly or obstinately in a course of action in spite of difficulty or opposition.
continuing to exist or endure over a prolonged period.
(of a chemical or radioactivity) remaining within the environment for a long time after its introduction.
(of a part of an animal or plant, such as a horn, leaf, etc.) remaining attached instead of falling off in the normal manner.
"one of the government's most persistent critics"
"persistent rain will affect many areas"
"PCBs are persistent environmental contaminants"
He is a persistent pursuer of truth.他是个坚持不懈追求真理的人。
His great success cannot depart from his persistent effort.他取得这么大的成功和他坚持不懈的努力分不开。
A persistent cough may be a symptom of tuberculosis.持续的咳嗽可能是肺病的症候。
His persistent questions finally goaded me into an angry reply.他三番五次地问问题惹得我回答时也没有好气。

personify

[pə'sɒnɪfaɪ], [pər'sɑːnɪfaɪ]


Image Search
v. 拟人化；使人格化；是…的典型；是…的化身；表现
represent (a quality or concept) by a figure in human form.
attribute a personal nature or human characteristics to (something nonhuman).
represent or embody (a quality, concept, or thing) in a physical form.
"public pageants and dramas in which virtues and vices were personified"
"in the poem, the oak trees are personified"
"he fairly personifies trustworthiness"
The sun and the moon are often personified in poetry.诗歌中常把日、 月拟人化。
He is kindness personified.他是善良的化身。
He personifies the worship of money.他是拜金的化身。
Artists personify beauty in their works.艺术家在作品中表现美。

perspective

[pə'spektɪv], [pər'spektɪv]


Image Search
n. 远景；看法；透视
adj. 透视的
the art of drawing solid objects on a two-dimensional surface so as to give the right impression of their height, width, depth, and position in relation to each other when viewed from a particular point.
a picture drawn in perspective, especially one appearing to enlarge or extend the actual space, or to give the effect of distance.
a view or prospect.
the relation of two figures in the same plane, such that pairs of corresponding points lie on concurrent lines, and corresponding lines meet in collinear points.
a particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
true understanding of the relative importance of things; a sense of proportion.
an apparent spatial distribution in perceived sound.
"a perspective drawing"
"most guidebook history is written from the editor's perspective"
"we must keep a sense of perspective about what he's done"
A fine perspective opened out before us.一幅美丽的远景展开在我们眼前。
Do you agree with this perspective?你同意这个看法吗?
The painting provides us with one of the earliest examples of the use of perspective.那幅画给我们提供了采用透视画法的最早的范例。
The first row of each perspective shows its name.每个透视的第一行都显示该透视的名称。

pertain

[pə'teɪn], [pər'teɪn]


Image Search
vi. 关于；从属；适合
be appropriate, related, or applicable.
belong to something as a part, appendage, or accessory.
be in effect or existence in a specified place or at a specified time.
"matters pertaining to the organization of government"
"the premises, stock, and all assets pertaining to the business"
"their economic circumstances are vastly different from those which pertained in their land of origin"
This letter does not pertain to politics.这封信的内容与政治无关。
Learning the specific set of vocabulary words that pertain to one's business becomes a simple task.学习和自己行业有关的这组特殊字汇成为一件简单的工作。
They own the house and the land pertaining to it.他们拥有这栋房子以及附属于它的土地。
It does not pertain to the young to instruct their elders.年轻人不应该对老年人发号施令。

perturb

[pə'tɜːb], [pər'tɜːrb]


Image Search
vt. 使烦恼；使不安
make (someone) anxious or unsettled.
subject (a system, moving object, or process) to an influence tending to alter its normal or regular state or path.
"they were perturbed by her capricious behavior"
"nuclear weapons could be used to perturb the orbit of an asteroid"
King Herod was greatly perturbed when he heard this;and so was the whole of Jerusalem.希律王听后异常惊恐，耶路撒冷的全城居民也感到非常不安。
The state of being perturbed; agitation.搅乱，混乱处于不安的状态; 动荡

pervasive

[pə'veɪsɪv], [pər'veɪsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 普遍的；渗透的；遍布的
(especially of an unwelcome influence or physical effect) spreading widely throughout an area or a group of people.
"ageism is pervasive and entrenched in our society"
Involuntary unemployment is pervasive.非自愿性失业普遍出现。
It is the most pervasive compound on earth.它是地球上最普遍的化合物。
TV is the most powerfull and pervasive of the media.电视是传播媒介中最强大和最有渗透力的。
A sense of social change is pervasive in her novels.她的小说里充斥着社会变化的意识。

pessimist

['pesɪmɪst], ['pesɪmɪst]


Image Search
n. 悲观主义者
a person who tends to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen.
a person who believes that this world is as bad as it could be or that evil will ultimately prevail over good.
"the pessimists point to ways in which life has deteriorated"
"he finds solace in the writings of pessimist philosophers"
He is a pessimist and a defeatist.他是悲观主义者，也是失败主义者。
It may be that I am a pessimist, for spring it is, not autumn, that makes me sad.因为春天而非秋天使我感到伤感，所以也许我是个悲观主义者。

pessimistic

[ˌpesɪ'mɪstɪk], [ˌpesɪ'mɪstɪk]


Image Search
adj. 悲观的；悲观主义的
tending to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen.
"he was pessimistic about the prospects"
I have to say I'm rather pessimistic.我得说我相当悲观。
Her pessimistic attitude turns him off.她那悲观的态度很令他不高兴。
There is a pessimistic tone to what he is saying.他的话语中带着悲观的调子。
This might account for his pessimistic views.这也许是他持悲观主义观点的原因。
Dreiser's novels reveal a stream of pessimistic emotion.德莱塞的小说里渗透着一股沉重的悲观主义情绪。

pestle

['pesl], ['pesl]


Image Search
n. 杵；乳钵槌
a heavy tool with a rounded end, used for crushing and grinding substances such as spices or drugs, usually in a mortar.
a mechanical device for grinding, pounding, or stamping something.
crush or grind (a substance such as a spice or drug) with a pestle.
"she measured seeds into the mortar and pestled them to powder"
He ground the rock candy with a mortar and pestle.他自己动手用研钵和杵把冰糖研成粉。
A pestle can be ground into a needle and true knowledge comes from perseverance.想得到真正的学问，必有须磨杵成针的精神。

petty

['peti], ['peti]


Image Search
adj. 小的；琐碎的；次要的；狭隘的
of little importance; trivial.
(of behavior) characterized by an undue concern for trivial matters, especially in a small-minded or spiteful way.
of secondary or lesser importance, rank, or scale; minor.
(of a crime) of lesser importance.
"the petty divisions of party politics"
"he was prone to petty revenge on friends and family"
"a petty official"
"petty theft"
The party split into petty factions.该党分裂成若干小派系。
The paymasters of these petty crooks are the big crime syndicates.操纵这帮小流氓的就是那个大犯罪集团。
In his short life he had run the entire gamut of crime, from petty theft to murder.他在短短的一生中,从小偷小摸到杀人,什么罪都犯过。
Don't bug me with petty details.不要讲那些琐碎的细节来烦我。
People do not discourage this kind of petty work.人们对这种次要的工作不加以阻止。
She grew tired of his petty jealousies.她越来越讨厌他那种心胸狭窄的忌妒行为。
She is very petty at times.她有时很小心眼。

phase

[feɪz], [feɪz]


Image Search
n. 相位；方面；局面；阶段；时期
vt. 逐步执行
a distinct period or stage in a series of events or a process of change or development.
a stage in a person's psychological development, especially a period of temporary unhappiness or difficulty during adolescence or a particular stage during childhood.
each of the separate events in an eventing competition.
each of the aspects of the moon or a planet, according to the amount of its illumination, especially the new moon, the first quarter, the full moon, and the last quarter.
a genetic or seasonal variety of an animal's coloration.
a distinct and homogeneous form of matter (i.e. a particular solid, liquid, or gas) separated by its surface from other forms.
the relationship in time between the successive states or cycles of an oscillating or repeating system (such as an alternating electric current or a light or sound wave) and either a fixed reference point or the states or cycles of another system with which it may or may not be in synchrony.
carry out (something) in gradual stages.
introduce something into (or withdraw something from) use in gradual stages.
adjust the phase of (something), especially so as to synchronize it with something else.
"the final phases of the war"
"you are not obsessed, but you are going through a phase"
"the work is being phased over a number of years"
"our armed forces policy was to be phased in over 10 years"
No phase transition evidence is found.没有发现任何相位跃迁的证据。
Distortion can result from phase shifts.相位变化将造成失真。
This is but one phase of the subject.这仅是问题的一个方面。
They are talking about the changing phases of society.他们谈论着不断变化的社会状况。
That project would enter a second phase at the beginning of 2007.该项目将在2007年初进入下一阶段。
If a nuclear war really breaks out, the world will enter a very dangerous phase.假如真的爆发核战争,世界将进入一个非常危险的时期。
The use of lead-free petrol is now being phased in.无铅汽油的应用现正逐步推广。
The old currency will have been phased out by 1990.旧币分阶段至1990年将全部禁止流通。
The modernization of the industry was phased over a 20-year period.工业现代化分20年逐步实现。

phenomenon

[fə'nɒmɪnən], [fə'nɑːmɪnən]


Image Search
n. 现象；奇人；奇事
a fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause or explanation is in question.
a remarkable person, thing, or event.
the object of a person's perception; what the senses or the mind notice.
"glaciers are unique and interesting natural phenomena"
Their so-called prosperity is only a temporary phenomenon.但他们所谓的繁荣只是一个暂时的现象。
International terrorism is not just a recent phenomenon.国际恐怖主义并不是近年才有的现象。
Magnetism is a natural phenomenon.磁力是一种自然现象。
A child who could read at the age of one would indeed be a phenomenon.一个一岁的孩子能阅读，会被认为是个神童。
Beethoven was a phenomenon among musicians.贝多芬是音乐家中的奇才。
There are special reasons for this unusual phenomenon.这种奇事的发生，有其独特的原因。

philosophy

[fə'lɒsəfi], [fə'lɑːsəfi]


Image Search
n. 哲学；哲理
the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence, especially when considered as an academic discipline.
a particular system of philosophical thought.
the study of the theoretical basis of a particular branch of knowledge or experience.
a theory or attitude held by a person or organization that acts as a guiding principle for behavior.
"Schopenhauer’s philosophy"
"the philosophy of science"
"don't expect anything and you won't be disappointed, that's my philosophy"
This organization espouses the socialist philosophy.这个组织支持社会主义哲学。
He holds the chair of philosophy at Oxford.他任牛津大学哲学教授。
He regarded it as with profound philosophy.他认为这里面有深奥的哲理。

phoneme

['fəʊniːm], ['foʊniːm]


Image Search
n. 音位；音素
any of the perceptually distinct units of sound in a specified language that distinguish one word from another, for example p, b, d, and t in the English words pad, pat, bad, and bat.
English has 24 consonant phonemes.英语有24个辅音音素。
Phoneme segmentation plays a key role in speech recognition.音素分割在语音识别的过程中起着重要的作用。
In English, the 's' in 'sip' and the 'z' in 'zip' represent two different phonemes.英语中sip中的s和zip中的z为两个不同的音素。

physical

['fɪzɪkl], ['fɪzɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 物质的；身体的；体力的；物理的；肉体上的，身体上的
<美>体格检查
relating to the body as opposed to the mind.
involving bodily contact or activity.
relating to things perceived through the senses as opposed to the mind; tangible or concrete.
relating to physics or the operation of natural forces generally.
a medical examination to determine a person's bodily fitness.
"a whole range of physical and mental challenges"
"verbal or physical abuse"
"pleasant physical environments"
"physical laws"
It's a physical impossibility to be in two places at one time.同时在两地是自然规律上不可能的事。
Physical disability causes mental anguish.生理伤残会引起心理苦闷。
Staying up late makes him at his worst in terms of physical situation.熬夜使得他的体力状况处于低潮。
For them, getting rid of heavy physical labour is a big thing对他们来说, 摆脱重体力劳动是一件大事。
Stephen Hawkingis a Britain physical scientist.斯蒂芬·霍金是英国的物理学家。

picket

['pɪkɪt], ['pɪkɪt]


Image Search
n. 尖木桩；前哨；纠察队；工会纠察员
v. 用桩围住；设置警戒哨；担任纠察员
a person or group of people standing outside a place of work or other venue, protesting something or trying to persuade others not to enter during a strike.
a blockade of a workplace or other venue staged by a group of people in protest of something.
a soldier or party of soldiers performing a particular duty.
a pointed wooden stake driven into the ground, typically to form a fence or palisade or to tether a horse.
act as a picket outside (a place of work or other venue).
"a picket of soldiers fired a volley over the coffin"
"a cedar-picket stockade"
"strikers picketed the newspaper's main building"
None of the workers crossed the picket lines.没有一个工人越过罢工纠察线。
They marched to the factory and formed a picket.他们向工厂前进, 并组成了纠察队。
Five pickets were injured in the scuffle.在混战中有五名罢工纠察队员受伤。
Now I know I must picket and scream and shout so that they should not change me.我现在知道,我必须设纠察线、大喊大叫以免他们来改变我。
Some of the union member do not want to picket.工会的一些会员不想担任罢工纠察员。

picturesque

[ˌpɪktʃə'resk], [ˌpɪktʃə'resk]


Image Search
adj. 如画的；生动的；奇特的
visually attractive, especially in a quaint or pretty style.
(of language) unusual and vivid.
"the picturesque covered bridges of New England"
"his picturesque speech contrasted with his rough appearance"
The place is remarkable for its picturesque scenery.这个地方以它的如画的景色著称。
The castle stands in a picturesque setting surrounded by hills.这座城堡四周环山，风景如画。
The stable yard fraternity is seldom short of the picturesque word.稳定的庭院兄弟会很少缺生动的词汇。
The picturesque comet is already becoming a favored target for northern sky imagers.这颗生动的彗星已经成为北天天文摄影者的最爱。
I was impressed by the picturesque style of architecture.那别具一格的建筑风格给我留下了深刻的印象。

piggish

['pɪgɪʃ], ['pɪgɪʃ]


Image Search
adj. 猪似的；贪吃的；肮脏的
resembling a pig, especially in being greedy or unpleasant.
Piggish table manners,the piggy fat-cheeked little boy and his porcine pot-bellied father. 像猪一般的饮食方式，像猪一般的胖脸小男孩和他的猪一般大肚皮的父亲。
If you weren't feeling piggish after we hit an all-time high on the Nasdaq in 2000, you needed a shrink, pronto. 如果我们在2000年创了历史新高的时候你还没有当猪的感觉，我想你需要反省一下了。
If you weren’t feeling piggish after we hit an all-time high on the Nasdaq in 2000, you needed a shrink, pronto. 如果得到”绝对不买”的结论时,也许你此时应该减仓。
As we have learned, "Scene is piggish duck " also sufferred similar destiny in a lot of cities such as Jinan, Lanzhou, Beijing. 据了解,"风光馋嘴鸭"在济南、兰州、北京等许多城市也遭受了类似的命运。
A day of dusk, "Piggish " in the catnap in bistro, the hair comes up against the oil lamp on the desk, the person on the side saw cry in fear rises: "Be bad! 一天傍晚，“馋嘴”在小酒馆里打瞌睡，头发碰到桌上的油灯，旁边的人见了惊叫起来：“不好！
This strikes many people outside 85 Broad Street as piggish and unfair, since the American taxpayer helped rescue the system from which Goldman is now benefiting. 这让布罗德大街(BroadStreet)85号（高盛总部所在地，译者注）外的许多人感受到了高盛的贪婪和世道的不公，因为帮助金融体系纾困的是美国纳税人，现在受益的却是高盛。

pigment

['pɪɡmənt], ['pɪɡmənt]


Image Search
n. 色素； 颜料
v. 把 ... 加颜色； 变色
the natural coloring matter of animal or plant tissue.
a substance used for coloring or painting, especially a dry powder that, when mixed with oil, water, or another medium, constitutes a paint or ink.
color (something) with or as if with pigment.
"pigmented areas such as freckles"
This pigment is a good common food additive.该色素是稳定性好的食品添加剂。
How is retinal pigment denaturation treated?视网膜色素变性怎样治疗？
The primary white pigment is titanium dioxide.最重要的白色颜料是二氧化钛。
Of course, pigment is not the only part of a fresco.当然，颜料还不是画面的全部。
You just expand or shrink the millions of pigment cells or chromatophores in your skin to instantly change color.你只需要展开或收缩你皮肤里的上百万个色素细胞或色素体就可以立即变色。

piles

[paɪlz], [paɪlz]


Image Search
n. [医]痔疮(=hemorrhoids)
名词pile的复数形式.
动词pile的单数第三人称形式.
hemorrhoids.
a heap of things laid or lying one on top of another.
a large amount of something.
a lot of money.
a large imposing building or group of buildings.
a series of plates of dissimilar metals laid one on another alternately to produce an electric current.
dated term for nuclear reactor.
a funeral pyre.
place (things) one on top of another.
be stacked or loaded with.
increase in quantity.
cause to increase in quantity.
intensify or exaggerate something for effect.
(of a group of people) get into or out of a vehicle in a disorganized manner.
(of a vehicle) crash into.
a heavy beam or post driven vertically into the bed of a river, soft ground, etc., to support the foundations of a structure.
a triangular charge or ordinary formed by two lines meeting at an acute angle, usually pointing down from the top of the shield.
strengthen or support (a structure) with piles.
the soft projecting surface of a carpet or of a fabric such as velvet or flannel, consisting of many small threads.
furnish with a pile.
"he placed the books in a neat pile"
"the growing pile of work"
"he is admired for having made a pile for himself"
"a Victorian Gothic pile"
"she piled all the groceries on the counter"
"his in-box was piled high with papers"
"the work has piled up"
"the debts he piled up"
"you can pile on the guilt, but my heart has turned to stone"
"we all piled in and headed off to our mysterious destination"
"60 cars piled into each other on I-95"
"a thick-piled carpet"
The doctor told him to have a hip bath for seven days after having piles.医生告诉他得了痔疮后要用药剂坐浴七天。

pilfer

['pɪlfə(r)], ['pɪlfər]


Image Search
v. 盗；偷；窃
steal (typically things of relatively little value).
They may pilfer other animals' food.它们可能会偷吃其它动物的食品。
As we predicted from the results of the first experiments, knowers rushed to pilfer the human-made cache if they were paired with another knower.结果，知情渡鸦要是与另一只也知情的渡鸦在一起，就会急著去偷取人藏起的物事，符合我们根据先前的实验结果所做的预测。

pillage

['pɪlɪdʒ], ['pɪlɪdʒ]


Image Search
n. 掠夺；抢劫；掠夺物
v. 掠夺；抢劫
rob (a place) using violence, especially in wartime.
steal (something) using violence, especially in wartime.
the action of pillaging a place or property, especially in wartime.
"artworks pillaged from churches and museums"
The pillage was not contained to just the enlisted men.参与财宝掠夺的，不仅仅是那些应征入伍的大兵们。
They brought back horrific accounts of murder and pillage.他们带回了残杀掳掠的可怕消息。
The town was pillaged by the invading army.入侵的军队将该城镇掠夺一空。
Her handbag was pillaged on her way home.在回家的路上，她的手提包被抢劫了。

the most successful point; the culmination.
a high, pointed piece of rock.
a small pointed turret built as an ornament on a roof.
set on or as if on a pinnacle.
form the culminating point or example of.
"he had reached the pinnacle of his career"
"a rustic cross was pinnacled upon the makeshift altar"
I can see the small pinnacle from here.我能从这儿看到那个小尖塔。

pious

['paɪəs], ['paɪəs]


Image Search
adj. 虔诚的；伪善的；不太可能实现的
devoutly religious.
making a hypocritical display of virtue.
(of a hope) sincere but unlikely to be fulfilled.
dutiful or loyal, especially toward one's parents.
"there'll be no pious words said over her"
He is a pious Christian.他是一名虔诚的基督教徒。
He is a pious person to his belief.他是一个对其信仰虔诚的人。
Honest doubt is better than in a pious fraud.诚实的怀疑胜过伪善的信任。
Congress did no more than set out some pious hopes.国会除了提出一些不可能实现的希望之外别无所为。

pitiless

['pɪtiləs], ['pɪtiləs]


Image Search
adj. 无情的；冷酷的；无怜悯心的
showing no pity; cruel.
The fact stood out cut in steel on the pitiless daylight.在无情的光天化日下,这个事实是确凿无疑的。
This ruler is a pitiless tyrant.这个统治者是一个冷酷的暴君。
The pitiless north wind blew for weeks.凛冽的北风一连刮了几个星期。
The pitiless woman refused to help the poor sick girl.这铁石心肠的妇人拒绝帮助这个生病的可怜女孩。
They said he was a pitiless, cold-blooded fellow, with no geniality in him.他们说他是个毫无怜悯心、一点也不和蔼的冷血动物。

placate

[plə'keɪt], ['pleɪkeɪt]


Image Search

make (someone) less angry or hostile.
"they attempted to placate the students with promises"
His intent is clearly not to placate his critics.他的目的显然不是要安抚批评他的人。
The concessions did little to placate the students.让步根本未能平息学生的愤怒。

Image Search
a person who brings a case against another in a court of law.

platonic

[plə'tɒnɪk], [plə'tɑːnɪk]


Image Search
adj. 柏拉图哲学的；柏拉图主义的；理想的；不切实际的
(of love or friendship) intimate and affectionate but not sexual.
of or associated with the Greek philosopher Plato or his ideas.
confined to words, theories, or ideals, and not leading to practical action.
"their relationship is purely platonic"
The Platonic notion is that mathematics is the imperturbable structure that underlies the very architecture of the universe.柏拉图主义认为，数学所表现出的泰然自若之境界乃宇宙之根本。
Butritualremainsthat we must do as eries of platonic actions before we can haveintercourse.但是还有典礼，我们必须在我们可以交往之前，参加一系列不切实际的活动。

plausible

['plɔːzəbl], ['plɔːzəbl]


Image Search
adj. 似真实合理的；动听的；看起来有道理的，貌似可信的
(of an argument or statement) seeming reasonable or probable.
(of a person) skilled at producing persuasive arguments, especially ones intended to deceive.
"a plausible explanation"
"a plausible liar"
Such a theory seems very plausible.这一理论貌似十分有理。
He can not find a plausible reason for his absence.翻译他找不到缺席的合理理由。
Though controversial, it is plausible.虽有争议，却似乎行得通。
He trotted out a most plausible story, but most of us were inclined to doubt the truth of it.他提出了一个听起来很有道理的说法，但我们大多数人对此都持怀疑态度。

plea

[pliː], [pliː]


Image Search
n. 恳求；申诉；抗辩；借口
a request made in an urgent and emotional manner.
a claim that a circumstance means that one should not be blamed for or should not be forced to do something.
a formal statement by or on behalf of a defendant or prisoner, stating guilt or innocence in response to a charge, offering an allegation of fact, or claiming that a point of law should apply.
"he made a dramatic plea for disarmament"
"her plea of a headache was not entirely false"
"he changed his plea to not guilty"
The prisoner made a plea for mercy.囚犯恳求宽恕。
She made an impassioned plea for justice.她激昂地抗辩，恳求获得公正。
In making that plea he will breathe in vain.他做那种恳求是白费口舌的。
The thief entered a plea of not guilty.这个贼提出了无罪申诉。
It's expected Huckaby will enter a plea later this month.预计赫卡比将在本月晚些时候进行申诉。
The accused entered a plea of "not guilty".被告作了“无罪”的抗辩。
He was absent under the plea of illness.他借口有病没有出席。
Your plea of old age is only a pretence.您借口说您年纪老了，这不过是托辞。
He did not attend the dinner; his plea was that he was too busy to come.他没有参加那次宴会，借口是他太忙不能来。

plight

[plaɪt], [plaɪt]


Image Search
n. 困境；苦境
n. 誓约
vt. 宣誓；订婚
a dangerous, difficult, or otherwise unfortunate situation.
pledge or promise solemnly (one's faith or loyalty).
be engaged to be married to.
"we must direct our efforts toward relieving the plight of children living in poverty"
The Government seems to be closing its eyes to the plight of the unemployed.政府似乎对失业者的困境熟视无睹。
The television pictures brought home to us all the plight of the refugees.我们从电视上知道了难民所处的一切困境。
The plight of the refugees really wrung my heart.难民处境惨苦真叫我牵肠割肚。
The plight of the refugees arouses the compassionate old man.难民的困苦唤醒了那位有同情心的老人。
The plight of the famine victims commands everyone's sympathy.饥民的苦境值得大家同情。
The crew were in a sorry plight by the time they reached shore.船员们抵达岸边时境况已十分悲惨。
The poor girl was in a terrible plight.这个可怜的女孩处境极其恶劣。
I plight that I will always be faithful to my work.我发誓我会一直忠诚于我的工作。
She plighted herself to him.她和他订婚了。

plumage

['pluːmɪdʒ], ['pluːmɪdʒ]


Image Search

a bird's feathers collectively.

The parrot has got bright plumage.鹦鹉有一身漂亮的羽毛。
The costs of melanin-based plumage and iridescence are clearly different from the above.黑色素翅膀和彩虹色翅膀的代价与上面却完全不同。

plume

[pluːm], [pluːm]


Image Search
