given to or characterized by quarreling.
His brothers were greedy and quarrelsome.他的弟兄们贪婪且喜欢争吵。
A quarrelsome man has no good neighbours.好争吵者无好邻居。
He is a quarrelsome person.他是个爱争论的人。

quash

[kwɒʃ], [kwɔːʃ]


Image Search
v. 镇压；撤销；平息
reject or void, especially by legal procedure.
put an end to; suppress.
"his conviction was quashed on appeal"
"a hospital executive quashed rumors that nursing staff will lose jobs"
The army was called in to quash the revolt.军队被调来镇压叛乱。
The applicant sought judicial review to quash the order.申请人寻求司法复审以撤消命令。
The appeal court quashed the care order made by the juvenile court.上诉法院撤销了少年法院发出的照看令。
I was about to learn how to quash hunger.我要面对的就是如何驱走饥饿。
Growth, translated into jobs, is designed to quash the risk of social instability.经济增长带动就业增加，意在消除社会不稳定风险。

queue

[kjuː], [kjuː]


Image Search
n. 长队；行列；辫子
v. 排队
a line or sequence of people or vehicles awaiting their turn to be attended to or to proceed.
a list of data items, commands, etc., stored so as to be retrievable in a definite order, usually the order of insertion.
a braid of hair worn at the back.
take one's place in a queue.
be extremely keen to do or have something.
arrange in a queue.
"in the war they had queued for food"
"companies are queuing up to move to the bay"
People had to stand in a queue for hours to buy a ticket.人们买票得排几小时的队。
At the head of the queue was an old woman.在队列的前面有一个老妇人。
It was quite easy to tell that this queue was false.很容易看出这个辫子是假的。
We queued up for the bus.我们排队等公共汽车。
People are queuing to buy tickets.人们正排队买票。

quotation

[kwəʊ'teɪʃn], [kwoʊ'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 语录；引用；行情；引语；报价
a group of words taken from a text or speech and repeated by someone other than the original author or speaker.
a short musical passage or visual image taken from one piece of music or work of art and used in another.
the action of quoting from a text, speech, piece of music, or work of art.
a formal statement setting out the estimated cost for a particular job or service.
a price offered by a broker for the sale or purchase of a stock or other security.
a registration granted to a company enabling their shares to be officially listed and traded.
"a quotation from Mark Twain"
"a great argument with much quotation of Darwin"
"you will be sent a written quotation for the cost of repairing your machine"
Let us begin our discussion with a quotation.让我们用一条语录来开始我们的讨论。
The book opens with a quotation.这本书以引语开头。
Someone could figure out the economic trend by the analysis of security quotation.有些人可以通过证券行情分析预测出经济趋势。
I found a mistake in this quotation.我在这段引文中发现了一个错误。
I cannot give you our quotation right now.现在我不能给你我们的报价。
With regard to our quotation, we will discuss it later.关于我们的报价，以后再讨论。
They gave me a quotation for mending the roof.他们给了我修理屋顶的报价单。

radical

['rædɪkl], ['rædɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 激进的；彻底的；基本的
n. 激进分子
(especially of change or action) relating to or affecting the fundamental nature of something; far-reaching or thorough.
forming an inherent or fundamental part of the nature of someone or something.
(of surgery or medical treatment) thorough and intended to be completely curative.
advocating or based on thorough or complete political or social change; representing or supporting an extreme or progressive section of a political party.
characterized by independence of or departure from tradition; innovative or unorthodox.
denoting or relating to the roots of a word.
belonging to the root of a chord.
of the root of a number or quantity.
of, or springing direct from, the root or stem base of a plant.
very good; excellent.
a person who advocates thorough or complete political or social reform; a member of a political party or part of a party pursuing such aims.
a group of atoms behaving as a unit in a number of compounds.
the root or base form of a word.
any of the basic set of 214 Chinese characters constituting semantically or functionally significant elements in the composition of other characters and used as a means of classifying characters in dictionaries.
a quantity forming or expressed as the root of another.
a radical sign.
"a radical overhaul of the existing regulatory framework"
"the assumption of radical differences between the mental attributes of literate and nonliterate peoples"
"a radical American activist"
"the daring, avant-garde spirit of the music was too radical for the conservative audience"
"Okay, then. Seven o'clock. Radical!"
I know you are radical in your thinking, but don't go too far.我知道你思想激进,但不要走的太远。
He took up a radical position on this issue.他对这个问题抱着激进的态度。
They called for a radical reform of our tax system.他们要求对税收制度进行根本改革。
Lambert did not reach the more radical conclusion.兰伯特还没有达到更本质的结论。
Ted is a fire-eating radical.泰德是个咄咄逼人的激进份子。

radish

['rædɪʃ], ['rædɪʃ]


Image Search
n. （小）萝卜
a swollen pungent-tasting edible root, especially a variety that is small, spherical, and red, and eaten raw with salad.
the plant of the cabbage family that yields the radish.
She carved a flower out of a radish.她把萝卜刻成一朵花。
Please help me, Pull up the radish.请来帮我，拔萝卜吧。

ramekin

['ræməkɪn], ['ræməkɪn]


Image Search
n. 小干酪蛋糕
a small dish for baking and serving an individual portion of food.
a quantity of food served in a ramekin, in particular a small quantity of cheese baked with breadcrumbs, eggs, and seasoning.
Strain the mixture into the ramekin or bowl. 把黑豆奶和鸡蛋混合物倒进模子或圆盘里.
Dip bottom of 1 ramekin into bowl of very warm water 6 seconds. 将1个干酪蛋糕模的底部浸入一个装着开水的碗中约6秒。
Using thin sharp knife, cut around inside edge of each ramekin to loosen. 用薄快刀，沿内边缘将每个干酪蛋糕模橇松。
On the rack she sets a big bowl, with a small, flat ramekin upside down in it. 她会在搁架上放上个大碗，再用一个小而浅的烤碗*倒扣在碗内。
On top of the ramekin she sets a skinless half chicken or a hunk of lean pork shoulder. 烤碗上搁半只去皮鸡或一大块精猪腿肉。
Place dessert plate upside-down atop ramekin and invert, gently lifting off ramekin to allow panna cotta to settle onto plate. 将干酪蛋糕模倒扣在餐后甜点盘上，轻轻的将模子取起并将奶酪布丁留在盘中。

rampant

['ræmpənt], ['ræmpənt]


Image Search
adj. 猖獗的；蔓延的；猛烈的；[纹]跃立的
(especially of something unwelcome or unpleasant) flourishing or spreading unchecked.
(of a person or activity) violent or unrestrained in action or performance.
(of a plant) lush in growth; luxuriant.
(of an animal) represented standing on one hind foot with its forefeet in the air (typically in profile, facing the dexter (left) side, with right hind foot and tail raised, unless otherwise specified).
(of an arch) springing from a level of support at one height and resting on the other support at a higher level.
"political violence was rampant"
"rampant sex"
"a rich soil soon becomes home to rampant weeds"
"two gold lions rampant"
Sickness was rampant in the country.疾病在这个国家猖獗。
Malaria is still rampant in some swampy regions.疟疾在一些沼泽地区仍很猖獗。
Anarchy was rampant after the dictator died.独裁者死后政治混乱猖獗。
Dissension is rampant among the members of the committee.意见分歧在委员会的成员中蔓延。
Unemployment is now rampant in most of Europe.在欧洲的大部份地区，失业问题难以控制。

random

['rændəm], ['rændəm]


Image Search
adj. 任意的；随机的；随意的
n. 随意；任意
adv. 随机地
made, done, happening, or chosen without method or conscious decision.
governed by or involving equal chances for each item.
(of masonry) with stones of irregular size and shape.
unfamiliar or unspecified.
odd, unusual, or unexpected.
an unknown, unspecified, or odd person.
"a random sample of 100 households"
"are you going to take some random guy on Twitter's word?"
"the class was hard but he was so random that it was always fun"
"I just sat down by myself and talked to some randoms"
Men are exposed to more acts of random physical violence.男人受到更多的任意的身体强烈活动。
Most people know that the outcome of a coin toss is random.大部分人都知道掷硬币的结果是随机的。
The computer will generate apparently random numbers.电脑似乎将随机产生号码。
This random approach is not as dubious as one might expect.这种随意的途径并不象人们所预期的那样无把握。
All the random mingling and idle talk made him hate literary parties.所有随意的交往和闲谈都使他憎恨文学社。
Soiled dishes were piled at random.脏碟子胡乱地堆放着。
The librarian took a book at random from the shelf.图书管理员从书架上随便拿了一本书。
These fluctuations are random in nature.这种波动的性质是任意随机的。
This paper proposes a method of interference suppression for a random planar array.本文提出一种任意平面阵列抑制干扰的方法。
Complex organs made up of separate but necessary subsystems cannot be the result of random chance.复杂的器官是由独立的，必要的子系统组成，而且不能随机地形成。

range

[reɪndʒ], [reɪndʒ]


Image Search
n. 范围；射程；山脉；排；一系列；闲逛；炉灶；【数】值域，极差
v. 排列；使…站在某一方；延伸；漫游；射程达到(某距离)
the area of variation between upper and lower limits on a particular scale.
the scope of a person's knowledge or abilities.
the compass of a person's voice or a musical instrument.
the extent of time covered by something such as a forecast.
the area or extent covered by or included in something.
the set of values that a given function can take as its argument varies.
a set of different things of the same general type.
the distance within which something can be reached or perceived.
the maximum distance to which a gun will shoot or over which a missile will travel.
the maximum distance at which a radio transmission can be effectively received.
the distance that can be covered by a vehicle or aircraft without refueling.
the distance between a camera and the subject to be photographed.
the horizontal direction and length of a survey line determined by at least two fixed points.
a line or series of mountains or hills.
a series of townships extending north and south parallel to the principal meridian of a survey.
a line defined by landmarks or beacons, used to locate something offshore, especially a navigable channel or a hazard.
a large area of open land for grazing or hunting.
an area of land or sea used as a testing ground for military equipment.
an open or enclosed area with targets for shooting practice.
the area over which a plant or animal is distributed.
an electric or gas stove with several burners and one or more ovens.
a course of masonry extending from end to end at one height.
a row of buildings.
the direction or position in which something lies.
vary or extend between specified limits.
place or arrange in a row or rows or in a specified order or manner.
run or extend in a line in a particular direction.
(of a person or animal) travel or wander over a wide area.
(of a person's eyes) pass from one person or thing to another.
(of something written or spoken) cover or embrace a wide number of different topics.
obtain the range of a target by adjustment after firing past it or short of it, or by the use of radar or laser equipment.
(of a projectile) cover a specified distance.
(of a gun) send a projectile over a specified distance.
"the cost is thought to be in the range of $1-5 million a day"
"he gave some indication of his range"
"she was gifted with an incredible vocal range"
"an introductory guide to the range of debate this issue has generated"
"the area offers a wide range of activities for the tourist"
"something lurked just beyond her range of vision"
"these rockets have a range of 30 to 40 miles"
"planets within radio range of Earth"
"the vans have a range of 125 miles"
"the coastal ranges of the northwest"
"the range of the hills and valleys is nearly from north to south"
"patients whose ages ranged from 13 to 25 years"
"a table with half a dozen chairs ranged around it"
"he regularly came to the benches that ranged along the path"
"patrols ranged thousands of miles deep into enemy territory"
"his eyes ranged over them"
"tutorials ranged over a variety of subjects"
"radar-type transmissions which appeared to be ranging on our convoys"
The houses are sold out within this price range.在这个价位范围之内的房子已售完。
It has come within the range of practical politics.这就属于可实施性政治的范围了。
He used a whistle to decoy the birds within range.他用口哨把鸟群诱至射程内。
She is still within range of my gun.她仍在我枪炮的射程之内。
A range of hills rose on our left.山脉在我们左方出现。
Name one large mountain range in the United States.说出美国其中一个大山脉。
A range of buildings have sprung up along the river.沿河建起了一排楼房。
There is a fine range here in this book.这本小册子里记有一系列上等货。
Here we have a range of products, our toys.我们这儿有一系列的产品，我们的玩具。
She takes her dog for a range every afternoon.她每天下午牵着狗闲逛。
Gas is escaping from the range.瓦斯从瓦斯炉灶漏出。
The shabby houses used to range along the road.过去这路边破败的房子排成行。
The spectators ranged themselves along the route of the procession.观众沿游行队伍的路线列队停立。
On this issue, she has ranged herself with the Opposition.在这个问题上，她站在反对派一边。
The children's ages range from 8 to 15.这些孩子们的年龄在8岁到15岁之间。
Our conversation ranged over many topics.我们的谈话涉及很多话题。
We ranged the woods looking for a place to set up our tents.我们在树林里东走西跑，找个地方搭帐篷。
This rifle ranges over a mile.这种步枪射程达一英里。

ratify

['rætɪfaɪ], ['rætɪfaɪ]


Image Search
v. 批准；认可
sign or give formal consent to (a treaty, contract, or agreement), making it officially valid.
They ratify the pact because they think it will bring peace.他们批准了这项协定，因为他们认为它将能带来和平。
The government of Honduras refused to ratify the convention.洪都拉斯政府拒不批准该约。
It would reinforce the tendency to use the UN to ratify the gains of surprise attack.这会助长利用联合国使通过突然袭击的办法夺占的领土得到认可的倾向。
He said Lebanese President Emile Lahoud and his council are expected to ratify the plan during the coming week.他说，黎巴嫩总统拉胡德和议会将在本星期认可这个计划。

ratio

['reɪʃiəʊ], ['reɪʃioʊ]


Image Search
n. 比率；比例
the quantitative relation between two amounts showing the number of times one value contains or is contained within the other.
the relative value of silver and gold in a bimetallic system of currency.
"the ratio of men's jobs to women's is 8 to 1"
The ratios of 1 to 5 and 20 to 100 are the same.1与5之比和20与100之比相同。
Men outnumber women here in the ratio of three to one.此地男子数量以三比一超过女子。
The ratio of schoolboys to schoolgirls is 2 to 1.男学生和女学生的比例是2比1。
The ratio of nursing staff to doctors is 2:1.护士和医生的比例是2：1.

rational

['ræʃnəl], ['ræʃnəl]


Image Search
adj. 合理的；理性的；能推理的
n. 有理数
based on or in accordance with reason or logic.
(of a person) able to think clearly, sensibly, and logically.
endowed with the capacity to reason.
(of a number, quantity, or expression) expressible, or containing quantities that are expressible, as a ratio of whole numbers. When expressed as a decimal, a rational number has a finite or recurring expansion.
a rational number.
"I'm sure there's a perfectly rational explanation"
"Andrea's upset—she's not being very rational"
"man is a rational being"
Your choice was perfectly rational under the circumstances.在那种情况下,你的选择是相当合理的。
Man is a rational being.人是有理性的生物。
No rational person would go to work in his pyjamas.任何神智正常的人都不会穿着睡衣去上班。
The rational numbers also fit into this scheme.有理数也适用于这个图形。
A rational number can be expressed as a ratio of two integers.有理数可以被整数整除。

ravenous

['rævənəs], ['rævənəs]


Image Search
adj. 贪婪的；极饿的
extremely hungry.
(of hunger or need) very great; voracious.
"a ravenous appetite"
The country has also become a ravenous consumer.这个国家还成为一个贪婪的消费者。
The ravenous lion tore the quarry.饥饿的狮子撕碎了猎物。
The ravenous children ate everything on the table.饿极了的孩子把桌上所有东西吃掉了。

reaction

[ri'ækʃn], [ri'ækʃn]


Image Search
n. 反应；生理反应；反应能力；复旧；反动；化学反应
an action performed or a feeling experienced in response to a situation or event.
a person's ability to respond physically and mentally to external stimuli.
an adverse physiological response to a substance that has been breathed in, ingested, or touched.
a chemical process in which two or more substances act mutually on each other and are changed into different substances, or one substance changes into two or more other substances.
an analogous transformation of atomic nuclei or other particles.
a mode of thinking or behaving that is deliberately different from previous modes of thought and behavior.
opposition to political or social progress or reform.
repulsion or resistance exerted in opposition to the impact or pressure of another body; a force equal and opposite to the force giving rise to it.
"Carrie's immediate reaction was one of relief"
"a skilled driver with quick reactions"
"such allergic reactions as hay fever and asthma"
"the work of these painters was a reaction against fauvism"
"the institution is under threat from the forces of reaction"
Her arrest produced an immediate reaction from the press.她被捕的事立刻在新闻界引起反应。
I had a bad reaction after my typhoid injection.我注射了伤寒针剂后产生了不良反应。
His reaction of swiftness surprised us.他快速的反应能力让我们吃了一惊。
After all the excitement there was an inevitable reaction.热闹一番过后,生活沉闷如故。
The forces of reaction made reform difficult.反动势力给改革造成了困难。
This chemical reaction generates a lot of heat.这个化学反应产生很多热量。

readily

['redɪli], ['redɪli]


Image Search
adv. 容易地；迅速地；乐意地；欣然
without hesitation or reluctance; willingly.
without delay or difficulty; easily.
"he readily admits that the new car surpasses its predecessors"
"illegal fireworks are readily available"
These problems are not readily soluble.这些问题不容易解决。
They can readily be brought anywhere.它们易于携带。
She stood up readily.她迅速地站了起来。
She readily accepted his proposal of marriage.她乐意地接受了他的求婚。
Young people are readily pervious to new ideas.青年人乐意接受新思想。
He readily promised to help.他欣然答应帮忙。
She made the proposal, and I readily consented to it.她提出建议,我欣然同意。

realistic

[ˌriːə'lɪstɪk], [ˌriːə'lɪstɪk]


Image Search
adj. 现实的；现实主义的
having or showing a sensible and practical idea of what can be achieved or expected.
representing familiar things in a way that is accurate or true to life.
"jobs are scarce at the moment, so you've got to be realistic"
"a realistic human drama"
He was realistic about difficulties.他对困难持现实的态度。
We should encourage pupils to set realistic goals.我们要鼓励学生设定现实的目标。
This is a realistic novel about ghetto life.这是一部描写贫民窟的现实主义小说。
The great majority are realistic politicians.绝大多数是现实主义的政治家。
Dickens is one of the greatest critical realist writer of the Victorian Age.狄更斯是维多利亚时期最伟大的批判现实主义作家之一。

recalcitrant

[rɪ'kælsɪtrənt], [rɪ'kælsɪtrənt]


Image Search
adj. 反抗的；顽强的
having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline.
a person with an obstinately uncooperative attitude.
"a class of recalcitrant fifteen-year-olds"
The University suspended the most recalcitrant demonstraters.这所大学把几个反抗性最强的示威者开除了。
Donkeys are reputed to be the most recalcitrant animals.驴被认为是最倔强的牲畜。
The university suspended the most recalcitrant demonstrators.该大学对最为桀骜不驯的学生做了暂令停学的处理。

recede

[rɪ'siːd], [rɪ'siːd]


Image Search
vi. 后退；减弱
vt. 撤回
go or move back or further away from a previous position.
(of a quality, feeling, or possibility) gradually diminish.
(of a man's hair) cease to grow at the temples and above the forehead.
(of a man) begin to go bald at the temples or above the forehead.
(of a facial feature) slope backward.
withdraw from (an undertaking, promise, or agreement).
"the flood waters had receded"
"the prospects of an early end to the war receded"
"his dark hair was receding a little"
"Fred was receding a bit"
"a slightly receding chin"
His hair is beginning to recede from his forehead.他的头发开始从前额往后秃了。
As the tide receded we were able to look for shells.潮水退去，我们就能寻找贝壳了。
The prospect of bankruptcy has now receded.破产的危险已经减少了。
Eventually the danger began to recede.这种危险终于开始减轻。
The company decided to recede from a bargain.公司决定撤销买卖合同。

receptacle

[rɪ'septəkl], [rɪ'septəkl]


Image Search
n. 容器；花托；插座
an object or space used to contain something.
an organ or structure that receives a secretion, eggs, sperm, etc.
an electrical outlet into which the plug of an electrical device may be inserted.
an enlarged area at the apex of a stem that bears the organs of a flower or the florets of a flower head.
a structure supporting the sexual organs in some algae, mosses, and liverworts.
"trash receptacles"
Please find me a receptacle for sugar.请给我找一个放糖的容器。
Learning doesn't consist in being an empty receptacle.学习并不是往空容器里塞东西。
Note: this kind of receptacle shell is Au-plated.注:此类插座壳均为镀金。

receptionist

[rɪ'sepʃənɪst], [rɪ'sepʃənɪst]


Image Search

a person employed in an office or other establishment to answer the telephone, deal with clients, and greet visitors.

I will leave a message with the receptionist.我会给前台小姐留个口信。

recitation

[ˌresɪ'teɪʃn], [ˌresɪ'teɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 背诵；详述；吟诵
the action of repeating something aloud from memory.
the repetition of a list of facts.
"the recitation of traditional poems"
The boy stumbled through his recitation.这男孩结结巴巴地背诵。
The child's recitation of the text was letter-perfect.孩子背诵这篇课文一字不差。
She continued her recitation of the week's events.她接着逐一讲述这一周发生的事。
His recitation was almost expressionless.他的朗诵几乎毫无感情。
His recitation was cadenced and rich in feeling.他的朗颂抑扬顿挫, 富有感情。
When he finished his recitation , there was a spatter of applause.他朗诵完了以后，有阵稀稀落落的掌声。

reckless

['rekləs], ['rekləs]


Image Search
adj. 鲁莽的；不计后果的；大意的
(of a person or their actions) without thinking or caring about the consequences of an action.
"reckless driving"
He's a reckless driver.他是个鲁莽的司机。
He apologized for their reckless behavior.他对他们的鲁莽行为道了歉。
His brother is a reckless gambler.他的弟弟是个不计后果的赌徒。
It's the way you try to sound rough or reckless.你说起话来故意这样显得很粗野或者毫不在乎。

recovery

[rɪ'kʌvəri], [rɪ'kʌvəri]


Image Search
n. 恢复；痊愈；复原；重获
a return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength.
the action or process of regaining possession or control of something stolen or lost.
the action of regaining or securing compensation or money lost or spent by means of a legal process or subsequent profits.
an object or amount of money recovered.
a stroke bringing the ball from the rough or from a hazard back on to the fairway or the green.
an act of taking possession of a fumbled ball.
(in rowing, cycling, or swimming) the action of returning the paddle, leg, or arm to its initial position ready to make a new stroke.
the process of removing or extracting an energy source or industrial chemical for use, reuse, or waste treatment.
"signs of recovery in the housing market"
"a team of salvage experts to ensure the recovery of family possessions"
"debt recovery"
"the recoveries included gold jewelry"
We are surprised by the rapidity of her recovery.她恢复得那么快，我们都有些惊讶。
He is well on his way to recovery.他正在顺利恢复。
A lot has been done in the recovery of national economy in the past few years.在过去的几年中我们为了国民经济的恢复做了大量的工作。
The doctors held out no hope of recovery.医生们对痊愈不抱希望。
The doctors held out little hope for his recovery.大夫们都对他恢复健康不抱多大希望。
Th woman was delighted at the recovery of her stolen jewels.那位妇人对找回被盗的珠宝感到非常高兴。

recurrence

[rɪ'kʌrəns], [rɪ'kɜːrəns]


Image Search
n. 再现；再发生；反复
the fact of occurring again.
"a drug used to prevent the recurrence of breast cancer"
It constructed a melody of growing emotion with sadness and reach the recurrence of the theme.如此手法构造出一种不断升华的伤感直到主题旋律的再现。
You may receive information about recurrence risks and early warning signs or you may be offered more specific genetic testing to gather more information.您可以获得关于再现风险和早期前兆信号的信息，或许您可能被给予更加具体的遗传病测试来获取更多的信息。
A recurrence of such an oversight could impair our amicable relations.这样的疏忽倘若再发生，可能有损双方的友好贸易关系。
Measures must be taken to stop a recurrence of last night's violence.必须采取措施来防止昨晚的暴力事件再发生。
There may be progress here and there, for a time, but in the long run there is only recurrence.在某个时候，这里或那里可以有进步，但是从长远来看则只能有循环反复。
By the late nineteenth century the recurrence of this pattern had become obvious to many observers.到十九世纪末期，许多观察家都看出了这种反复现象。

refine

[rɪ'faɪn], [rɪ'faɪn]


Image Search
v. 精炼；改进；使更文雅
remove impurities or unwanted elements from (a substance), typically as part of an industrial process.
improve (something) by making small changes, in particular make (an idea, theory, or method) more subtle and accurate.
"sugar was refined by boiling it in huge iron vats"
"ease of access to computers has refined analysis and presentation of data"
The oil will be refined.这些石油将被精炼。
Their daily work is to refine crude oil.他们每天的工作是精炼原油。
Sugar, oil and metals are refined before use.糖, 油和金属在使用前须先提炼。
We shall have to refine on our methods of advertising.我们得进一步改进做广告的方法。
She will refine on her Bad points.她会改进她的缺点。
The author is planning to refine on his work of five years ago.作者打算把他5年前的著作修改得更完美些。
After30 years, the mature author was able to refine on the work of his youth.过去30年，这位作家已经成熟，他可以将年轻时候写的作品修改得更完美了。
Reading good books helps to refine our speech.读一些好书有助于使我们的言谈更优雅。

refurbish

[ˌriː'fɜːbɪʃ], [ˌriː'fɜːrbɪʃ]


Image Search
vt. 刷新；擦亮；再磨光
renovate and redecorate (something, especially a building).
"the premises have been completely refurbished in our corporate style"
The flat will be refurbished for the new tenants.这套房间将重新粉刷以接纳新房客。
Our house will be refurbished in the near future.我们的房子最近将进行翻修。
She refurbished all the pots and pans.她将所有的锅碗瓢盆都擦拭一新。

refute

[rɪ'fjuːt], [rɪ'fjuːt]


Image Search
vt. 驳斥；反驳；驳倒
prove (a statement or theory) to be wrong or false; disprove.
prove that (someone) is wrong.
deny or contradict (a statement or accusation).
"these claims have not been convincingly refuted"
"a spokesman totally refuted the allegation of bias"
As for the Flat Earth theory, I believe I could refute it.至于地平学说，我相信我能驳斥它。
Historical facts refute such a fallacy.历史事实驳斥了这种谎言。
He had hardly finished when someone rose to refute his points.他还没全说完，就有人起来反驳他的论点。
Nothing could refute her testimony that the driver was drunk.她关于那个司机已经喝醉的证词无可辩驳。
I was able to refute his argument.我能驳倒他的论点。

regime

[reɪ'ʒiːm], [reɪ'ʒiːm]


Image Search
n. 政体；政权；制度
n. 养生法(=regimen)
a government, especially an authoritarian one.
a system or planned way of doing things, especially one imposed from above.
a coordinated program for the promotion or restoration of health; a regimen.
the conditions under which a scientific or industrial process occurs.
"detention centers with a very tough physical regime"
"a low-calorie, low-fat regime"
The people are held down by a vicious and repressive military regime.人民受着凶恶而专制的军事政权的压迫。
The old capitalist regime is on its last legs.旧的资本主义制度即将灭亡。
The regime has been propped up by foreign aid.该政权是靠外国援助维持着的。
The overthrow of the regime was followed by a period of anarchy.那政权被推翻以後，有一段时期是无政府状态。
Furthermore, there are further initiatives to enhance the consumer protection regime.此外,其他加强保障消费者制度的措施会陆续推出。

region

['riːdʒən], ['riːdʒən]


Image Search
n. 地区；范围；领域；地带；地域
an area or division, especially part of a country or the world having definable characteristics but not always fixed boundaries.
an administrative district of a city or country.
a part of the body, especially around or near an organ.
an area of activity or thought.
"one of the region's major employers"
"an unexpected clenching sensation in the region of her heart"
"his work takes needlework into the region of folk art"
Most of the countries in the region have unstable economies.这个地区大多数国家的经济都不稳定。
I guess there are much less people in the Arctic regions than here.我想北极地区的人要比这里的少得多。
The region near the erupting volcano was evacuated rapidly.火山爆发处附近已迅速撤空。
These small spiced cakes are a peculiarity of the region.这些别有风味的小蛋糕是该地的特产。
He is earning a salary in the region of25,000.他当时的薪金在25,000英镑左右。
Her motherland is in the tropical region.她的祖国位于热带地区。
Ancient village of hilly area, being a result that accumulates with the time , is also the essence of the region culture.山地古村落,既是时间积淀的成果,也是地域文化的精髓。

registered

['redʒɪstəd], ['redʒɪstəd]


Image Search
adj. 注册的；登记过的；记名的
动词register的过去式和过去分词.
entered or recorded on an official list or directory.
(of a letter or parcel) sent by registered mail.
enter or record on an official list or directory.
enter one's name and other details on an official list or directory.
put one's name in a register as a guest in a hotel.
(of a couple to be married) have a list of wedding gifts compiled and kept at a store for consultation by gift buyers.
entrust (a letter or parcel) to a post office for transmission by registered mail.
(of an instrument) detect and show (a reading) automatically.
(of an event) give rise to a specified reading on an instrument.
express or convey (an opinion or emotion).
(of an emotion) show in a person's face or gestures.
properly notice or become aware of (something).
make an impression on a person's mind.
correspond or cause to correspond exactly in position.
"a registered charity"
"we have sent registered letters to all her addresses but there has been no response"
"the vessel is registered as Liberian"
"34,500 registered to vote"
"it is highly recommended that you register the letter containing your supporting documents"
"the electroscope was too insensitive to register the tiny changes"
"the blast registered 5.4 on the Richter scale"
"I wish to register an objection"
"nothing registered on their faces"
"he had not even registered her presence"
"the content of her statement did not register"
"they are adjusted until the impressions register"
During the quarantine, they will be monitored regularly by our registered nurse.在隔离期间，学校的注册护士将会定期照料被隔离人员。
The registered gage has priority to the unregistered gage.抵押物已登记的先于未登记的受偿。
The shares issued by a company may be registered shares or unregistered shares.公司发行的股票，可以为记名股票，也可以为无记名股票。
I signed for a registered letter.我签收了一封挂号信。
The thermometer registered 32C.温度计显示的读数为32C.
Her face registered dismay.她脸上流露出惊慌的神色
The car was registered in my name.汽车是用我的名字登记注册的。

regrettably

[rɪ'ɡretəbli], [rɪ'ɡretəbli]


Image Search
adv. 抱歉地；遗憾地；可悲地
unfortunately (used to express apology for or sadness at something).
"regrettably, last night's audience was a meager one"
He said that they had regrettably been obliged to give up the scheme for lack of support.他说因为缺乏支持，他们遗憾地被迫放弃了这项计划。
Regrettably, the experience of charities like the Battersea Dog's Home shows that many people rush into buying a dog without considering the four questions outlined above.遗憾地，像巴特西狗之家这类的慈善机构的经验可证明很多人没考虑以上略述的四个问题就匆忙去买狗。

regulations

[reɡjʊ'leɪʃnz], [reɡjʊ'leɪʃnz]


Image Search
n. 规程；条例
名词regulation的复数形式.
a rule or directive made and maintained by an authority.
in accordance with regulations; of the correct type.
of a familiar or predictable type; formulaic; standardized.
the action or process of regulating or being regulated.
"planning regulations"
"regulation army footwear"
"a regulation Western parody"
"the regulation of financial markets"
Technical regulations for saturation diving operat.饱和潜水作业技术规程。
He was taxed with neglecting the safety regulations.他由于忽视安全操作规程而受到责备。
Tomorrow is the effective date of regulations.明天就是条例的生效日期。
We need more elastic rules and regulations.我们需要更多的弹性规则和条例。

reign

[reɪn], [reɪn]


Image Search
n. 君主统治；在位期
v. 统治；支配
hold royal office; rule as king or queen.
be the best or most important in a particular area or domain.
(of a quality or condition) prevail; predominate.
(of a sports player or team) currently hold a particular title.
the period during which a sovereign rules.
the period during which someone or something is predominant or preeminent.
"Queen Elizabeth reigns over the UK"
"in America, baseball reigns supreme"
"confusion reigned"
"the original chapel was built in the reign of Charles I"
"these historic seconds inaugurated the reign of negative political advertising"
He has a tyrannical reign on his empire.他是个残暴的皇帝。
People will remember the tyrannies of his reign.人们不会忘记他统治时期的暴行。
The reign of Queen Victoria lasted more than sixty years.维多利亚女王的统治持续了六十多年。
The American Revolution took place during the reign of George III.美国独立战争发生在英王乔治三世统治时期。
He reigned over the country for forty years.他统治了这个国家四十年。
He will reign over the natural people of Israel.他将统治以色列的百姓。
Silence reigned everywhere.万籁俱寂。
Peace would then reign over the world.到那时和平会在整个世界上占上风。
It is better to reign in hell than serve in heaven.天堂为奴，不如地狱为主。

reimburse

[ˌriːɪm'bɜːs], [ˌriːɪm'bɜːrs]


Image Search
vt. 偿还；报销
repay (a person who has spent or lost money).
repay (a sum of money that has been spent or lost).
"the investors should be reimbursed for their losses"
"they spend thousands of dollars that are not reimbursed by insurance"
I was reimbursed in full.我已得到全部补偿。
We will reimburse the customer for any loss or damage.我们将赔偿顾客所受到的一切损失和损害。
The company will reimburse you for travel expenses.公司会为你报销差旅费。
All expenses will be reimbursed to you.一切费用都能给你报销。

reinforced

[riːɪn'fɔːst], [riːɪn'fɔːst]


Image Search
adj. 加强的
动词reinforce的过去式和过去分词.
strengthen or support (an object or substance), especially with additional material.
strengthen (an existing feeling, idea, or habit).
strengthen (a military force) with additional personnel or equipment.
"the helmet has been reinforced with a double layer of cork"
"various actions of the leaders so reinforced fears and suspicions that war became unavoidable"
"paratroopers were sent to reinforce the troops already in the area"
A heavily reinforced building used for launch operations of missiles and space launch vehicles.火箭发射防护室用于发射导弹和太空飞行器的牢固建筑物
A covering for a wheel, usually made of rubber reinforced with cords of nylon, fiberglass, or other material and filled with compressed air.轮胎车轮的覆盖物，通常由用尼龙绳、玻璃纤维或其它材料加固的橡胶制成，并注入了压缩的空气
The concrete walls are reinforced with steel rods.混凝土墙是用钢筋加固的。
A lightweight protective helmet, usually of metal or reinforced plastic, worn by workers in industrial settings.安全帽一种工人们在工业生产环境中戴的通常用金属或加强塑料制成的轻型保护头盔

reject

['riːdʒekt], ['riːdʒekt]


Image Search
vt. 拒绝；排斥；驳回；丢弃
n. 不合格产品；被拒之人
dismiss as inadequate, inappropriate, or not to one's taste.
refuse to agree to (a request).
fail to show due affection or concern for (someone); rebuff.
show an immune response to (a transplanted organ or tissue) so that it fails to survive.
a person or thing dismissed as failing to meet standards or satisfy tastes.
"union negotiators rejected a 1.5 percent pay increase"
"an application to hold a pop concert at the club was rejected"
"she didn't want him to feel he had been rejected after his sister was born"
"some of the team's rejects have gone on to prove themselves in championships"
He rejected their offer of a job.他拒绝了他们给他的工作。
After the transplant his body rejected the new heart.他的身体对新移植的心脏产生了排斥作用。
If the application is unfounded, the people's court shall make an order to reject it.申请不成立的,裁定予以驳回。
The supermarket rejected all spotted apples.超级市场丢弃了所有的烂苹果。
The factory sells some of its better rejects cheaply, but it throws most of the rejects away.这家公司廉价出售略好一些的次品，但将大多数次品丢弃。
He was a reject from the varsity team.他被大学代表队拒绝了。

['riːdʒekt], ['riːdʒekt]


Image Search

n. 不合格产品；被拒之人

"she didn't want him to feel he had been rejected after his sister was born"
He rejected their offer of a job.他拒绝了他们给他的工作。
After the transplant his body rejected the new heart.他的身体对新移植的心脏产生了排斥作用。

relaxed

动词relax的过去式和过去分词.
free from tension and anxiety; at ease.
(of a muscle or other body part) not tense.

"we were having a great time and feeling very relaxed"

"the team relaxes with a lot of skiing"

"they persuaded the local authorities concerned to relax their restrictions"
The dinner was a relaxed, unceremonious occasion.那次宴会很轻松，随随便便。
She remained peaceful and relaxed.她仍然是那样安详和放松。

Among her friends, casual dress and a relaxed manner are the rule.她的朋友一般都衣着休闲，举止也轻松随意。

relay

['riːleɪ], ['riːleɪ]


Image Search
vt. 转播；转达；中继；接力；接替
n. 继电器；接力赛；替班
a group of people or animals engaged in a task or activity for a fixed period of time and then replaced by a similar group.
a race between teams usually of sprinters or swimmers, each team member in turn covering part of the total distance.
an electrical device, typically incorporating an electromagnet, that is activated by a current or signal in one circuit to open or close another circuit.
a device to receive, reinforce, and retransmit a broadcast or program.
a message or program transmitted by a relay.
receive and pass on (information or a message).
broadcast (something) by passing signals received from elsewhere through a transmitting station.
lay again or differently.
"the wagons were pulled by relays of horses"
"a 550-meter relay race"
"a relay of a performance live from the concert hall"
"she intended to relay everything she had learned"
"the speech was relayed live from the White House"
"they plan to relay about half a mile of the track"
Images of the war were relayed around the world.世界各地转播了战争的图像。
I will relay your opinion to the headmaster.我愿把你的意见转告校长。
The Relay Agent could not start up its main thread.中继代理无法启动其主线程。
Frame Relay Connection and Traffic Flow Control.帧中继连接和流量控制。
The anchor man in a relay team runs last.接力队中的主力跑最后一棒。
Our Torch Relay will break new ground.我们的火炬接力将开创新局面。
This relay connects one input to one output.该继电器将一个输入连接到一个输出。
Six teams competed in yesterday's relay race.六个队参加了昨天的接力赛。
The anchor man in a relay team runs last.接力队中的主力跑最后一棒。
A new relay of horses was harnessed to the cart.用作轮换的马都已套到了那辆马车上。

release

[rɪ'liːs], [rɪ'liːs]


Image Search
n. 释放；让渡；发行
vt. 释放；让与；准予发表；发射
allow or enable to escape from confinement; set free.
allow (something) to move, act, or flow freely.
remove restrictions or obligations from (someone or something) so that they become available for other activity.
remove (part of a machine or appliance) from a fixed position, allowing something else to move or function.
allow (something) to return to its resting position by ceasing to put pressure on it.
allow (information) to be generally available.
make (a movie or recording) available for general viewing or purchase.
remit or discharge (a debt).
surrender (a right).
make over (property or money) to another person or entity.
the action or process of releasing or being released.
a handle or catch that releases part of a mechanism.
the action of making a movie, recording, or other product available for general viewing or purchase.
a movie or other product issued for viewing or purchase.
the action of releasing property, money, or a right to another.
a document effecting a release of property, money, etc.
"the government announced that the prisoners would be released"
"she released his arm and pushed him aside"
"the strategy would release forces for service in other areas"
"he released the handbrake"
"press and release the reset button quickly"
"no details about the contents of the talks were released"
"nine singles and one album had been released"
"a campaign by the prisoner's mother resulted in his release"
"the film was withheld for two years before its release"
"his current album release has topped the charts for six months"
The prisoner was questioned before his release.囚犯被释放之前受到了审问。
The puffball is ready to release its spores.尘菌已经要释放孢子了。
The electrons in the upper band eventually release energy, thereby emitting photons.上层能带中的电子最后会发射光子释放能量。

relevant

['reləvənt], ['reləvənt]


Image Search
adj. 相关的；切题的；中肯的；有重大关系的；有意义的，目的明确的
closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered.
appropriate to the current time, period, or circumstances; of contemporary interest.
"what small companies need is relevant advice"
"critics may find themselves unable to stay relevant in a changing world"
A paper relevant to this research was published by him.与本研究相关的一篇论文是他发表的。
Have you heard of the relevant report?你听说过相关的报道吗?
My next conclusion is more relevant.我的另一个结论更切题。
Portraits of people will draw readers'attention, especially if the images are relevant and tell a story.人物肖像可以吸引读者的注意,当图像切题并在讲述一个故事时更是如此。
These values are relevant in a relative sense.这些值只是在相对比较上才有中肯的意义。

reliance

[rɪ'laɪəns], [rɪ'laɪəns]


Image Search

"the farmer's reliance on pesticides"

I have no reliance about his assurance.我不信赖他的保证。
Don't place too much reliance on what he said.对他所说的话不要过于信赖。

relic

['relɪk], ['relɪk]


Image Search
n. 神圣的遗物；遗迹；纪念物
an object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical or sentimental interest.
a part of a deceased holy person's body or belongings kept as an object of reverence.
an object, custom, or belief that has survived from an earlier time but is now outmoded.
all that is left of something.
"individualized computer programming and time-sharing would become expensive relics"
"relics of a lost civilization"
This stone axe is a relic of ancient times.这把石斧是古代的遗物。
Gold is still a barbaric relic whose value rises only when inflation is high.黄金仍然只是未开化时代的遗物，其价值只在通涨高企时才会上升。
The calorie is a historical relic.卡是历史的遗迹。
The building stands as the last remaining relic of the town's cotton industry.这座建筑物是小镇棉纺业仅存的遗迹。
This ruined bridge is a relic of the Korean War in1950.那个被毁的桥是朝鲜战争的纪念物。
Julie saw the means offered of carrying off her precious relic, which Monte Cristo had forgotten.尤莉看到基督山不留意那只钱袋，她可以带走她那宝贵的纪念物了，便拉她的丈夫到门口。

relish

['relɪʃ], ['relɪʃ]


Image Search
v. 享受；从...获得乐趣；品味；渴望；喜欢；有滋味
n. 滋味；爱好；调味品
great enjoyment.
liking for or pleasurable anticipation of something.
a condiment eaten with plain food to add flavor.
an appetizing flavor.
a distinctive taste or tinge.
enjoy greatly.
be pleased by or about.
make pleasant to the taste; add relish to.
"she swigged a mouthful of wine with relish"
"I was appointed to a position for which I had little relish"
"use salsa as a relish with grilled meat or fish"
"the relish of wine"
"he was relishing his moment of glory"
"I don't relish the thought of waiting on an invalid for the next few months"
"I have also a novel to relish my wine"
Take each day and relish each moment.认真过每一天并且好好享受每一时刻。
He seemed to relish the scandal.他似乎对这件丑闻十分欣赏。
Take a moment and relish this with me! Soon all will be revealed!和我一起品味这份经历吧！很快一切都会浮出水面！
His wife won't relish having to wash all those dishes.他的妻子不会喜欢洗这一大堆碟子的。
He drank up the wine with relish.他津津有味地把酒喝光了。
I tasted the fish my mother cooked with relish.我津津有味地品尝了我妈妈做的鱼。
The game will lose its relish when you grow old.你年纪大了以后,就会发现这种游戏的趣味大打折扣了。
I have no relish for witnessing cruelty.我对看残忍的场面不感兴趣。
The teacher had no relish for his jokes.老师对他的笑话不感兴趣。
Hunger is the best relish for food.饥饿是食物最佳佐料。
Put some relish on a slice of bread.将调味品涂到一片面包上。

Margaret gave him a reluctant consent.玛格丽特勉强答应了他。

[rɪ'məʊt], [rɪ'moʊt]

(of an electronic device) operating or operated by means of radio or infrared signals.
distant in time.
distantly related.
having very little connection with or relationship to.

This is a village remote from the madding crowd.这是一个远离喧嚣尘世的村庄。
Mail comes to this remote village only once a week.邮车每周只到这个偏僻的村庄一次。
The bomb was exploded by remote control.这颗炸弹是遥控引爆的。
The connection between these ideas is very remote.这两种看法之间的距离很大。

rendezvous

['rɒndɪvuː], ['rɑːndɪvuː]

"I rendezvoused with Bea as planned"

She made the rendezvous with only minutes to spare.她还差几分钟时才来赴约。
He didn't tell me the rendezvous.他没有告诉我约会时间与地点。
The cafe is a popular rendezvous for young lovers.这个咖啡馆是年轻恋人的约会圣地。

We'll rendezvous at the railway station tomorrow afternoon.我们明天下午在火车站会合。
They decided to rendezvous at the club.他们决定在俱乐部集合。

rennet

['renɪt], ['renɪt]


Image Search
n. 牛犊胃内膜；凝乳
curdled milk from the stomach of an unweaned calf, containing rennin and used in curdling milk for cheese.
any preparation containing rennin, especially a pudding.
The sweet food is made from flavored milk and rennet.这种甜食是用加了调料的牛奶和牛犊的胃中凝乳块制成的。
Calf rennet is still used by specialty cheese manufacturers.小牛的凝乳酶素仍然被专业的乳酪生产商所使用。
Calf rennet is still used by some cheese manufacturers.小牛的凝乳酶素仍然被一些乳酪生产商所使用。

He renounced his religion and became a Muslim.他宣布脱离他原来的宗教而成为了一名穆斯林教徒。

Have you nothing to repent of?你没有可懊悔的事吗？
He repented what he has done.他懊悔他的所作所为。

replenish

[rɪ'plenɪʃ], [rɪ'plenɪʃ]


Image Search
vt. 补充；再装满
vi. 补充
fill (something) up again.
restore (a stock or supply of something) to the former level or condition.
"he replenished Justin's glass with mineral water"
"all creatures need sleep to replenish their energies"
We need to replenish our stocks of coal.我们需要再次补充煤的储备。
It's time to replenish the shop with the news year's goods.该为这家商店补充新年货物了。
These foods replenish the skeletal needs of the body.这些食物补充身体骨骼的需要。
Perhaps to replenish their energies for the coming week.可能是为新的一个星期的到来而补充能量。
Let me replenish your glass with some more wine.让我给你杯子里再添点葡萄酒。
Let me replenish your glass, eg with more wine.我给你把杯子再斟满吧.
Allow me to replenish your glass.让我再给您斟满。
We need to replenish our stocks of coal.我们需要再次补充煤的储备。
It's time to replenish the shop with the news year's goods.该为这家商店补充新年货物了。

replete

[rɪ'pliːt], [rɪ'pliːt]


Image Search
adj. 充满的；饱食的
filled or well-supplied with something.
very full of or sated by food.
"sensational popular fiction, replete with adultery and sudden death"
"I went out into the sun-drenched streets again, replete and relaxed"
His story was replete with falsehood.他的报导充满了虚伪。
He is longing for a home replete with warmth and comfort.他渴望有个充满温暖、舒适的家。
He was replete with food and drink.他吃喝得饱饱的。
It was a big meal and we all felt replete.这是丰盛的一餐，我们都吃得很饱。

replica

['replɪkə], ['replɪkə]


Image Search
n. 复制品
an exact copy or model of something, especially one on a smaller scale.
a duplicate of an original artistic work.
"a replica of the Empire State Building"
"it is a replica of an antique plaque"
This replica is every inch as good as the original.这种复制品完全和原版一样地好。
I had a replica in little of Independence Hall.我有一件独立纪念堂的小型复制品。

reprehensible

[ˌreprɪ'hensəbl], [ˌreprɪ'hensəbl]


Image Search
adj. 应受谴责的
deserving censure or condemnation.
"his complacency and reprehensible laxity"
It was reprehensible of him to be so disloyal.他如此不忠，应受谴责。
His conduct was thoroughly reprehensible.他的行为完全应该受到谴责。

repress

[rɪ'pres], [rɪ'pres]


Image Search
v. 抑制；压抑；镇压
subdue (someone or something) by force.
restrain, prevent, or inhibit (the expression or development of something).
suppress (a thought, feeling, or desire) in oneself so that it becomes or remains unconscious.
prevent the transcription of (a gene).
"the uprisings were repressed"
"Isabel couldn't repress a sharp cry of fear"
"the thought that he had killed his brother was so terrible that he repressed it"
He could hardly repress his tears.他的眼泪都忍不住快要流下来了。
He could hardly repress a smile at her simplicity.见她如此天真，他都忍不住想笑了。
His childhood was repressed and solitary.他的童年是压抑而孤独的。
We repress the uprising with the help of the army.我们用军队来镇压暴动。
All protests are brutally repressed by the government as illegal.所有的抗议活动都遭到当局的野蛮镇压，并被宣布为非法。

reprimand

['reprɪmɑːnd], ['reprɪmænd]


Image Search
n. 训斥；谴责
v. 训斥；谴责
a rebuke, especially an official one.
rebuke (someone), especially officially.
"officials were dismissed or reprimanded for poor work"
His boss gave him a reprimand for being late.他的老板因他迟到而训了他一顿。
He received a severe reprimand for his behaviour.他的行为受到了谴责。
His negligence passed without reprimand.他玩忽职守并未受到斥责。
She was severely reprimanded for accepting the money.她因为接受了那笔钱而受到严厉训斥。
His parents will reprimand him when he shows them his report card.当他把分数单交给父母亲看时，他们将严厉申斥他。

reproach

[rɪ'prəʊtʃ], [rɪ'proʊtʃ]


Image Search
n. 责备；耻辱
v. 责备；申斥
address (someone) in such a way as to express disapproval or disappointment.
accuse someone of.
censure or rebuke (an offense).
the expression of disapproval or disappointment.
a thing that makes the failings of someone or something else more apparent.
(in the Roman Catholic Church) a set of antiphons and responses for Good Friday representing the reproaches of Jesus Christ to his people.
"critics of the administration reproached the president for his failure to tackle the deficiency"
"his wife reproached him with cowardice"
"he gave her a look of reproach"
"his elegance is a living reproach to our slovenly habits"
His reply sounded to me like a reproach.他的回答在我听来象是责备。
Her behaviour was above/beyond reproach.她的行为是无可指责的。
His reply sounded to her like a reproach.他的回答在她听来像是责备。
A coward is a reproach to an army.懦夫是军队的耻辱。
This dirt is a reproach to the city.肮脏是城市的耻辱。
He brought reproach on himself by cheating in the exam.他考试作弊，自己给自己带来耻辱。
She reproached her husband for having forgotten their wedding anniversary.她责怪丈夫忘了他们的结婚周年纪念日。

repudiate

[rɪ'pjuːdieɪt], [rɪ'pjuːdieɪt]


Image Search
v. 拒绝；拒付；断绝；否认
refuse to accept or be associated with.
deny the truth or validity of.
refuse to fulfill or discharge (an agreement, obligation, or debt).
(especially in the past or in non-Christian religions) divorce (one's wife).
"she has repudiated policies associated with previous party leaders"
"the minister repudiated allegations of human rights abuses"
"breach of a condition gives the other party the right to repudiate a contract"
The new government repudiated the treaty signed by the former government.新政府拒绝履行前任政府签订的条约。
He repudiated the court's decision to offer bail.他不接受法庭的保释裁决。
He would repudiate all debts incurred by his son.他拒绝偿还他儿子的一切债务。
She repudiated her only daughter.她与她的独生女儿断绝了母女关系。
They repudiated all accusations of unlawful activity.他们否认所有对他们非法行为的指控。

repugnant

[rɪ'pʌɡnənt], [rɪ'pʌɡnənt]


Image Search
adj. 令人厌恶的；讨厌的；抵触的
extremely distasteful; unacceptable.
in conflict with; incompatible with.
given to stubborn resistance.
"the thought of going back into the fog was repugnant to him"
"a bylaw must not be repugnant to the general law of the country"
I find his racist views totally repugnant.我十分厌恶他的种族主义观点。
All food was repugnant to me during my illness.我生病时吃什么都恶心。
It is repugnant to me even to speak to him.我甚至连和他说话都感到讨厌。
Some people eat foods that are repugnant to others.某些人讨厌的食物,有些人却爱吃。
The idea of accepting a bribe is repugnant to me.我一想到受贿这种事就非常反感。
He had never run across such a repugnant creature.他从没有见过如此不合谐的怪物。

required

[rɪ'kwaɪəd], [rɪ'kwaɪəd]


Image Search
adj. 必需的
officially compulsory, or otherwise considered essential; indispensable.
in keeping with one's wishes; desired.
need for a particular purpose.
cause to be necessary.
specify as compulsory.
(of someone in authority) instruct or expect (someone) to do something.
regard an action, ability, or quality as due from (someone) by virtue of their position.
"eight editions were published, each required reading for trainees"
"the corset, the garment that ensured the required female shape"
"three patients required operations"
"it would have required much research to produce a comprehensive list"
"the minimum car insurance required by law"
"you will be required to attend for cross-examination"
"the care and diligence required of him as a trustee"
I did more work than required.我做了比所被要求的来得更多的工作。
All passengers are required to show their tickets.所有乘客都必须出示车票。
Learning to walk again after his accident required great patience.他出事后重新学习走路要有极大的毅力。
The ships required the protection of naval and air power.船只本身需要海军和空军的保护。

research

[rɪ'sɜːtʃ], [rɪ'sɜːrtʃ]


Image Search
n. 研究；调查
v. 研究；调查
the systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
acts or periods of investigation and study.
engaged in or intended for use in investigation and discovery.
investigate systematically.
discover facts by investigation for use in (a book, program, etc.).
"we are fighting meningitis by raising money for medical research"
"his pathological researches were included in official reports"
"a research student"
"she has spent the last five years researching her people's history"
"I was in New York researching my novel"
We all support his scientific research.我们都支持他的科学研究。
Research indicates that men find it easier to give up smoking than women.研究表明，男人比女人更容易戒烟。
My research is just bouncing along at present.目前我的调查进展得很顺利。
They have been researching the effects of the drug on mice.他们一直在研究老鼠对这种药物的反应。
He needs to research about the coffee market.他需要对咖啡市场进行调查。
We should get down to research more earnestly.我们一定要更加认真的调查。

the action of reserving something.

I can recommend it without any reservations.我可以毫无保留地推荐它。

resident

['rezɪdənt], ['rezɪdənt]


Image Search
n. 居民；住客；住院医生
adj. 居住的
a person who lives somewhere permanently or on a long-term basis.
a bird, butterfly, or other animal of a species that does not migrate.
a person who boards at a boarding school.
a British government agent in any semi-independent state, especially the Governor General's agent at the court of an Indian state.
a medical graduate engaged in specialized practice under supervision in a hospital.
living somewhere on a long-term basis.
having quarters on the premises of one's work.
attached to and working regularly for a particular institution.
(of a bird, butterfly, or other animal) nonmigratory; remaining in an area throughout the year.
(of a computer program, file, etc.) immediately available in computer memory, rather than having to be loaded from elsewhere.
"he has been resident in Brazil for a long time"
"resident farm workers"
"the film studio needed a resident historian"
The residents of the town are proud of its new library.该镇的居民都为镇上新建的图书馆感到自豪。
I have been resident in this hotel for two weeks.我已经在这家旅馆里住了两个星期了。
I would get the neurosurgery resident down here.我想请神经外科住院医师下楼到这儿来。
This dove was resident with us all the year round.这只鸽子一年到头居住在这里和我们为伴。
I've been resident in this hotel for five years.我住在这家旅馆五年了。

residual

[rɪ'zɪdjuəl], [rɪ'zɪdʒuəl]


Image Search
adj. 剩余的；残余的
n. 剩余部分；(复)追加酬金
remaining after the greater part or quantity has gone.
(of a quantity) left after other things have been subtracted.
(of a physical state or property) remaining after the removal of or present in the absence of a causative agent.
(of an experimental or arithmetical error) not accounted for or eliminated.
(of a soil or other deposit) formed in situ by weathering.
a quantity remaining after other things have been subtracted or allowed for.
a difference between a value measured in a scientific experiment and the theoretical or true value.
a royalty paid to a performer, writer, etc., for a repeat of a play, television show, etc.
a portion of rocky or high ground remaining after erosion.
the resale value of a new car or other item at a specified time after purchase, expressed as a percentage of its purchase price.
"the withdrawal of residual occupying forces"
"residual income after tax and mortgage payments"
"residual stenosis"
The debate over the residual powers of the States has been long drawn out.有关美国剩余的权力的争论已是旷日持久的了。
That's the residual outcome of your past thoughts and actions.那只是你过去的思想和行为所产生的残余结果。

resilience

[rɪ'zɪliəns], [rɪ'zɪliəns]


Image Search
n. 适应力；弹性
the capacity to recover quickly from difficulties; toughness.
the ability of a substance or object to spring back into shape; elasticity.
"the often remarkable resilience of so many British institutions"
"nylon is excellent in wearability and resilience"
She has shown great resilience to stress.她对压力表现出了极大的适应能力。
Further tests of the market's resilience will come later this week.进一步的试验市场的适应能力将在本周晚些时候。
Rubber has more resilience than wood.橡胶有比木头更大的弹性。
It also reflects the resilience of domestic demand.调整过程也反映出国内需求的弹性。
This wool possesses high resilience and tensile strength.这种毛弹性大，拉力强。

resilient

[rɪ'zɪliənt], [rɪ'zɪliənt]


Image Search
adj. 适应力强的；有弹力的
(of a person or animal) able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
(of a substance or object) able to recoil or spring back into shape after bending, stretching, or being compressed.
"babies are generally far more resilient than new parents realize"
"a shoe with resilient cushioning"
She is very resilient to change.她对变化有很强的适应力.
He'll get over it,young people are amazingly resilient.他会克服这些的，年轻人的适应力惊人。
The state and Confucianism were remarkably resilient.这种政治体制及儒学有着了不起的适应性。
Rubber is more resilient than wood.橡胶比木头弹性好。
The house had a squat, resilient look about it.房子低矮，但看上去很结实。

resolution

[ˌrezə'luːʃn], [ˌrezə'luːʃn]


Image Search
n. 决心；决定；解决；决议；坚决；分辨率
a firm decision to do or not to do something.
a formal expression of opinion or intention agreed on by a legislative body, committee, or other formal meeting, typically after taking a vote.
the quality of being determined or resolute.
the action of solving a problem, dispute, or contentious matter.
the passing of a discord into a concord during the course of changing harmony.
the disappearance of inflammation, or of any other symptom or condition.
the process of reducing or separating something into its components.
the replacing of a single force or other vector quantity by two or more jointly equivalent to it.
the smallest interval measurable by a scientific (especially optical) instrument; the resolving power.
the degree of detail visible in a photographic or television image.
the conversion of something abstract into another form.
the substitution of two short syllables for one long one.
"she kept her resolution not to see Anne any more"
"the conference passed two resolutions"
"he handled the last French actions of the war with resolution"
"the peaceful resolution of all disputes"
"the gradual resolution of an uncertain feeling into a named emotion"
Nothing can unsettle his resolution.什么也动摇不了他的决心。
Making resolution on new year's day is a custom that still prevail.在新年这一天下决心是一个依然流行的习俗。
The committee have adopted a resolution to build a park.委员会做出一个项决议，决定兴建一座公园。
His generosity led to the resolution of all our difficulties.他的慷慨相助使我们的困难全都得以解决。
We have passed a resolution to build a new laboratory.我们已通过决议建一个新实验室。
They declared that they responded with resolution to this statement .他们宣布他们坚决响应这一声明。
The early experiments were done with low resolution.早期的实验都是在低分辨率的条件下进行的。

resourceful

[rɪ'sɔːsfl], [rɪ'sɔːrsfl]


Image Search
adj. 资源丰富的；足智多谋的
having the ability to find quick and clever ways to overcome difficulties.
Til is a resourceful textile material.胡麻是一种资源丰富的纺织原料。
He is a keen and resourceful politician.他是个头脑敏锐又足智多谋的政治家。
He's an old man who is intelligent and resourceful.他是一位足智多谋的老叟。

resources

[rɪ'sɔːsɪz], [rɪ'sɔːsɪz]


Image Search
n. 资源；才智；储备力量
名词resource的复数形式.
a stock or supply of money, materials, staff, and other assets that can be drawn on by a person or organization in order to function effectively.
a country's collective means of supporting itself or becoming wealthier, as represented by its reserves of minerals, land, and other assets.
available assets.
an action or strategy that may be adopted in adverse circumstances.
one's personal attributes and capabilities regarded as able to help or sustain one in adverse circumstances.
the ability to find quick and clever ways to overcome difficulties.
the possibility of aid or assistance.
a leisure occupation.
provide (a person or organization) with materials, money, staff, and other assets necessary for effective operation.
"local authorities complained that they lacked resources"
"sometimes anger is the only resource left in a situation like this"
"we had been left very much to our own resources"
"a man of resource"
"the flower of the French army was lost without resource"
"ensuring that primary health care workers are adequately resourced"
The wish of fully utilizing the natural resources will eventually come true.充分利用自然资源的愿望终究会实现。
Most people have come to accept the need for conservation of natural resources.现在大多数人已认识到保护自然资源的必要。
Resources management is an important business skill.资源管理是一项重要的经营技能。
The government tried to prevent the diminution of resources.政府试图阻止资源的减少。
He saw that he could improve their chromosomes in a godlike way to exploit these resources, making them even better adapted to the environment he had set up for them.他认为自己有神通，能通过改善它们染色体的方式来开发这些才智，使它们更加适应自己为它们创立的环境。
They threw all their resources into the new endeavor.他们集中全部力量进行新的尝试。

response

[rɪ'spɒns], [rɪ'spɑːns]


Image Search
n. 反应；回答；响应；答复
a verbal or written answer.
a written or verbal answer to a question in a test, questionnaire, survey, etc.
a reaction to something.
an excitation of a nerve impulse caused by a change or event; a physical reaction to a specific stimulus or situation.
the way in which a mechanical or electrical device responds to a stimulus or range of stimuli.
a part of a religious liturgy said or sung by a congregation in answer to a minister or cantor.
a bid made in answer to one's partner's preceding bid.
"without waiting for a response, she returned to her newspaper"
"an extended, jazzy piano solo drew the biggest response from the crowd"
The tax cuts produced a favourable response from the public.税额削减受到了公众的欢迎.
I'm sorry; the correct response is B.不好意思,正确回答应该是B。
There was an enthusiastic response to my suggestions.我的提议得到了热情的响应。
他提出指控后迅即得到答复。他提出指控後迅即得到答覆.

responsive

[rɪ'spɒnsɪv], [rɪ'spɑːnsɪv]


Image Search
adj. 回答的；应答的；易感应的
reacting quickly and positively.
responding readily and with interest or enthusiasm.
denoting or relating to a website whose page design changes automatically according to the size of the screen on which it is viewed.
answering.
(of a section of liturgy) using responses.
"a flexible service that is responsive to changing social and economic patterns"
"our most enthusiastic and responsive students"
"a responsive site that would work on PCs and tablets equally well"
"I'm distracted by a nibble on my line: I jig it several times, but there is no responsive tug"
Mentally responsive and perceptive; quick.思维敏捷的思维反应迅速且感觉灵敏的; 快速敏捷的
Not responsive, as to treatment or stimuli.无感应的对治疗或刺激没有反应的
Highly aware of and responsive to what is fashionable and up-to-date.赶时髦的，新潮的对于流行的和时新的东西很敏感的并且积极响应的

restore

[rɪ'stɔː(r)], [rɪ'stɔːr]


Image Search
vt. 恢复；归还；复原
bring back (a previous right, practice, custom, or situation); reinstate.
return (someone or something) to a former condition, place, or position.
repair or renovate (a building, work of art, vehicle, etc.) so as to return it to its original condition.
give (something previously stolen, taken away, or lost) back to the original owner or recipient.
"the government restored confidence in the housing market"
"the effort to restore him to office isn't working"
"the building has been lovingly restored"
"the government will restore land and property to those who lost it through confiscation"
The military government promised to restore democracy within one year.军人政府答应在一年内重新建立民主体制。
Drastic measures will have to be taken to restore order.为恢复秩序必须采取严厉措施。
The police must try to restore order.警方必须努力恢复治安。
The new manager's job is to restore the company to profitability.新经理的工作是让这家公司能恢复盈利状况。
I feel quite restored to health after my holiday.假期过后，我觉得健康恢复得相当不错。
The stolen property must be restored to its owner.赃物必须物归原主。
It's easy to kill,but impossible to restore life.杀生容易,回生难。

restraints

[rɪst'reɪnts], [rɪst'reɪnts]


Image Search
制约因素
a measure or condition that keeps someone or something under control or within limits.
the action of keeping someone or something under control.
deprivation or restriction of personal liberty or freedom of movement.
a device which limits or prevents freedom of movement.
unemotional, dispassionate, or moderate behavior; self-control.
understatement, especially of artistic expression.
"decisions are made within the financial restraints of the budget"
"he remained aggressive and required physical restraint"
"car safety restraints"
"he urged the protesters to exercise restraint"
"with strings and piano, all restraint vanished"
To construct well-off society in Hubei minority areas enjoys exceptional advantages as well as unfavorable restraints.摘要湖北民族地区全面建设小康社会，既有其得天独厚的条件和基础，也有其不利的制约因素。

restrict

[rɪ'strɪkt], [rɪ'strɪkt]


Image Search
vt. 限制；约束
put a limit on; keep under control.
deprive (someone or something) of freedom of movement or action.
limit someone to only doing or having (a particular thing) or staying in (a particular place).
limit something, especially an activity, to (a particular place, time, or category of people).
withhold (information) from general circulation or disclosure.
"some roads may have to be closed at peak times to restrict the number of visitors"
"cities can restrict groups of protesters from gathering on a residential street"
"I shall restrict myself to a single example"
"the zoological gardens were at first restricted to members and their guests"
"at first the government tried to restrict news of our involvement in Vietnam"
In a move to restrict imports, the government raised custom duties.政府在限制进口的措施中提高了关税。
Recent laws have tended to restrict the freedom of the press.新法例有限制新闻自由的趋势。
I restrict myself to smoking two cigarettes a day.我限定自己每天只抽两支烟。
Fog restricted visibility.雾天能见度很低。
You are restricted to eight liters of duty-free wine.携带的免税酒不得超过八升。
Their policy was to restrict our growth.他们的政策是限制我们的发展。
Will realty restrict Chinese economy?房地产会制约中国经济吗?

restricted

[rɪ'strɪktɪd], [rɪ'strɪktɪd]


Image Search
adj. 受限制的；有限的；保密的
动词restrict的过去式和过去分词.
limited in extent, number, scope, or action.
(of a document or information) for limited circulation and not to be revealed to the public for reasons of national security.
(of a virus) unable to reproduce at its normal rate in certain hosts.
(of DNA) subject to degradation by a restriction enzyme.
put a limit on; keep under control.
deprive (someone or something) of freedom of movement or action.
limit someone to only doing or having (a particular thing) or staying in (a particular place).
limit something, especially an activity, to (a particular place, time, or category of people).
withhold (information) from general circulation or disclosure.
"Western scientists had only restricted access to the site"
"some roads may have to be closed at peak times to restrict the number of visitors"
"cities can restrict groups of protesters from gathering on a residential street"
"I shall restrict myself to a single example"
"the Zoological Gardens were at first restricted to members and their guests"
"at first the government tried to restrict news of our involvement in Vietnam"
The drug has only a restricted commercial use.这种麻醉药用作商品是极受限制的。
He managed to twist himself round in the restricted space.他设法在有限的空间内转过身来。
He leads a very restricted life.他的生活面非常狭窄。
Don't show this restricted material to others.不要把这些内部参考资料给别人看。

resume

[rɪ'zjuːm], [rɪ'zuːm]


Image Search
v. 重新开始；再继续
n. 简历；履历；摘要
begin to do or pursue (something) again after a pause or interruption.
begin speaking again after a pause or interruption.
take, pick up, or put on again; return to the use of.
variant spelling of résumé.
a brief account of a person’s education, qualifications, and previous experience, typically sent with a job application.
a summary.
"a day later normal service was resumed"
"he sipped at the glass of water on the lectern and then resumed"
"the judge resumed his seat"
"I gave him a quick résumé of events"
We resumed our work after a rest.休息之后我们重新开始工作。
I tried to persuade her to resume her job as secretary.我试图劝她重新干她的秘书工作。
Two days later, they resumed their journey.两天以後,他们继续旅行。
We'll stop now and resume at two o'clock.我们现在停下来, 到两点再干。
I enclosed my resume in my letter.我在信里附上了我的简历。
Do you have a resume with you?你带个人履历了吗?
The professor asked Peter to write a resume about this book.教授要求彼得写这本书的梗概。

retain

[rɪ'teɪn], [rɪ'teɪn]


Image Search
vt. 保持；保留；记住；聘请
continue to have (something); keep possession of.
not abolish, discard, or alter.
keep in one's memory.
absorb and continue to hold (a substance).
keep (something) in place; hold fixed.
keep (someone) engaged in one's service.
secure the services of (a person, especially an attorney) with a preliminary payment.
"built in 1830, the house retains many of its original features"
"the rights of defendants must be retained"
"I retained a few French words and phrases"
"limestone is known to retain water"
"remove the retaining bar"
"he has been retained as a freelance"
"retain an attorney to handle the client's business"
His speech could not retain the interest of his audience.他的讲话不能保持住听众的兴趣。
I will retain my right.我将保留我的权力。
Does it retain the key elements of the original story?它是否保留了原作的关键要素?
She has a good memory and finds it easy to retain matters.她记忆力好,很容易记住事情。
He retained the best lawyer in the state to defend his case.他为他的案子聘了该州最好的律师。

retaliate

[rɪ'tælieɪt], [rɪ'tælieɪt]


Image Search

make an attack or assault in return for a similar attack.

"the blow stung and she retaliated immediately"
"they used their abilities to retaliate the injury"
He sought every opportunity to retaliate on his persecutors.他寻求每一个机会向迫害他的人们复仇。
He was waiting for an opportunity to retaliate.他在伺机报复。
He slapped his sister, who retaliated by kicking him.他打了妹妹一巴掌，他妹妹回敬他一脚。

reticent

['retɪsnt], ['retɪsnt]


Image Search

He was reticent about his opinion.他有保留意见。
He seems unduly reticent on the subject of his past.他似乎对他过去的事情讳莫如深。
He was extremely reticent about his personal life.他对自己的个人生活讳莫如深。

retort

[rɪ'tɔːt], [rɪ'tɔːrt]


Image Search
v. 反驳；回嘴；反击
n. 反驳；顶嘴
say something in answer to a remark or accusation, typically in a sharp, angry, or wittily incisive manner.
repay (an insult or injury).
turn (an insult or accusation) back on the person who has issued it.
use (an opponent's argument) against them.
a sharp, angry, or wittily incisive reply to a remark.
a container or furnace for carrying out a chemical process on a large or industrial scale.
a glass container with a long neck, used in distilling liquids and other chemical operations.
heat in a retort in order to separate or purify.
"“No need to be rude,” retorted Isabel"
"it was now his time to retort the humiliation"
"he was resolute to retort the charge of treason on his foes"
"the answer they make to us may very easily be retorted"
"she opened her mouth to make a suitably cutting retort"
"the raw shale is retorted at four crude oil works"
He retorted that it was my fault as much as his.他反驳说我的错误并不比他的小。
The analysts could retort only that the geometric proofs were clumsy and inelegant.分析学家只能回嘴说几何的证明是笨拙而不优美的。
'Don't be ridiculous!' Pat retorted angrily.“别荒唐了！”帕特生气地回答道。
Her roommate's retort made her angry.她同屋的反驳使她生气。
Chueh-min thought he was making a crushing retort.觉民提出了这个他自己以为是很有力的反驳。
She appeared to enjoy a bold retort.这种大胆的顶嘴，她似乎觉得很有趣。

retrieve

[rɪ'triːv], [rɪ'triːv]


Image Search

vi. 找回猎物

bring (something) back into one's mind.

reel or bring in a fishing line.
an act of retrieving something, especially game that has been shot.
an act of reeling or drawing in a fishing line.
the possibility of recovery.
"I was sent to retrieve the balls from his garden"
"the police hope to encourage him to retrieve forgotten memories"
"he made one last desperate attempt to retrieve the situation"
"he ruined himself beyond retrieve"
The company is fighting to retrieve its market share.这个公司正在为恢复其市场份额(占有率)而奋斗。
She tried to retrieve the situation by making profuse apologies.她不住的道歉,力图挽回局面。
I should like to retrieve my umbrella which I left in the car.我想取回我留在车上忘记带走的雨伞。
The dog is trained to retrieve.这狗受过训能找到并带回猎物。
This is a loss beyond retrieve.这是无可挽回的损失。

We want someone not just to cheerlead but to help us revamp our organization.我们要的不是附和夸奖的人，而是能帮我们改进机构的人
We should pay attention to the seriousness of hidden peril and revamp them in time.要认识隐患危害的严重性,隐患的整改工作要及时;
Good economic benefits have been achieved after the revamp.改造后取得了良好的经济效益。
The stunt has been staged to celebrate a revamp of their logo.是为了演庆祝特别周年打改造自己的徽标。

reveal

[rɪ'viːl], [rɪ'viːl]


Image Search
vt. 显示；透露；揭示；展现
n. (外墙与门或窗之间的)窗侧；门侧；(汽车的)窗框
make (previously unknown or secret information) known to others.
cause or allow (something) to be seen.
make (something) known to humans by divine or supernatural means.
(in a movie or television show) a final revelation of information that has previously been kept from the characters or viewers.
either side surface of an aperture in a wall for a door or window.
"Brenda was forced to reveal Robbie's whereabouts"
"the clouds were breaking up to reveal a clear blue sky"
"the truth revealed at the Incarnation"
"the big reveal at the end of the movie answers all questions"
Several withered trees on the sides of the road reveal the desolation here.道路两旁的几棵枯木显示出这里的荒凉。
His deed revealed him to be a kind man.他的行为显示他是个好心的人。
The journalist did not want to reveal the identity of his informant.那个新闻工作者不想透露消息提供人的身分。
He would not reveal what decisions had been reached.他不肯透露做出了什么决定。
The facts quoted would reveal a sorry state of affairs in any community.所提出的事实会揭示社区中普遍存在的一种可悲的情形。
The door opened to reveal a cosy little room.房门打开，一间温暖舒适的小屋展现在眼前。

revealed

[rɪ'viːld], [rɪ'viːld]


Image Search
发现；透露；显露,动词reveal的过去式和过去分词
make (previously unknown or secret information) known to others.
cause or allow (something) to be seen.
make (something) known to humans by divine or supernatural means.
"Brenda was forced to reveal Robbie's whereabouts"
"the clouds were breaking up to reveal a clear blue sky"
"the truth revealed at the Incarnation"
Close examination revealed a crack in the vase.花瓶经仔细检查发现有裂缝。
The figures revealed by the report are astounding.这份报告透露的数字使人震惊。
A defector revealed the disposition of the enemy fleet.有一名叛变者透露了敌方舰队的部署。
He took off the hat and revealed his bald head.他脱下帽子，露出秃头。
The moonlight revealed her fair face.月光使她白的面孔显露出来。

The state does not collect enough revenue to cover its expenditure.政府征收的税收不能满足支出。
Rent is one form of revenue.房租是一种收入。
The document states that all revenue has to be declared to the tax office.该文件规定必须向税务局申报所有收入。
He reported his friend to the Inland Revenue for not paying his taxes.他向税务局揭发他的朋友漏税。

His reverie had thrown him into severe commotion.他的白日梦把他带入了严重的混乱。

reverse

[rɪ'vɜːs], [rɪ'vɜːrs]


Image Search
v. 逆转；倒退；互换；改变
adj. 相反的；反面的；颠倒的
n. 相反；背面；失败；倒档
move backward.
cause (a vehicle) to move backward.
turn (something) the other way around or up or inside out.
make (something) the opposite of what it was.
exchange (the position or function) of two people or things.
revoke or annul (a judgment, sentence, or decree made by a lower court or authority).
(of an engine) work in a contrary direction.
make (type or a design) print as white in a block of solid color or a halftone.
going in or turned toward the direction opposite to that previously stated.
operating, behaving, or ordered in a way contrary or opposite to that which is usual or expected.
(of a voltage applied to a semiconductor junction) in the direction which does not allow significant current to flow.
denoting a fault or faulting in which a relative downward movement occurred in the strata situated on the underside of the fault plane.
a complete change of direction or action.
reverse gear on a motor vehicle; the position of a gear lever or selector corresponding to this.
a play in which the ballcarrier reverses the direction of attack by lateraling or handling the ball to a teammate moving in the opposite direction.
the opposite or contrary to that previously stated.
an adverse change of fortune; a setback or defeat.
the opposite side or face to the observer.
a left-hand page of an open book, or the back of a loose document.
the side of a coin or medal bearing the value or secondary design.
the design or inscription on the reverse side of a coin or medal.
"the truck reversed into the back of a bus"
"I got in the car, reversed it and drove it up the driveway"
"after completing a row of leaves or flowers I have reversed the pattern"
"the damage done to the ozone layer may be reversed"
"the experimenter and the subject reversed roles and the experiment was repeated"
"the court reversed his conviction"
"the ship's engines reversed and cut out altogether"
"their press ads had a headline reversed out of the illustration"
"the trend appears to be going in the reverse direction"
"here are the results in reverse order"
"the growth actuates a reverse of photosynthesis"
"he didn't feel homesick—quite the reverse"
"the team suffered its heaviest reverse of the season"
"the address is given on the reverse of this leaflet"
The government has failed to reverse the economic decline.政府未能扭转经济滑坡的趋势。
He reversed the car into a tree.他倒车撞到了树上。
Statistics showed a reverse trend to that recorded in other countries.统计数字表明这种趋向与其他国家所示情况迥异。
Count down in reverse order 10, 9, 8...倒数--10、 9、 8...
In hot weather, the reverse happens.在热天,情况相反。
There's a picture of an eagle on the reverse of the coin.这个硬币的背面是一只鹰的图案。
Put the car into reverse.把车挂上倒挡。

revision

[rɪ'vɪʒn], [rɪ'vɪʒn]

the action of revising.

"the plan needs drastic revision"

The catalogue is under revision.目录正在修订之中。
She matured her novel by constant revision.她不断修改自己的小说以使其趋于完善。
The law is in need of revision.这法律需要修改。
Our budget needs drastic revision.我们的预算需作重大修改。
Friday afternoons are left free for revision.留出星期五下午的时间做复习。
You need enough revision for the test.为了考试你需要充分的复习。

revocation

[ˌrevə'keɪʃn], [ˌrevə'keɪʃn]

"for those who break the law, revocation of their liquor license may result"
