revolution

[ˌrevə'luːʃn], [ˌrevə'luːʃn]


Image Search
n. 革命；变革；重大改变；旋转
a forcible overthrow of a government or social order, in favor of a new system.
the American Revolution.
(in Marxism) the class struggle which is expected to lead to political change and the triumph of communism.
a dramatic and wide-reaching change in the way something works or is organized or in people's ideas about it.
an instance of revolving.
the movement of an object in a circular or elliptical course around another or about an axis or center.
a single orbit of one object around another or about an axis or center.
"marketing underwent a revolution"
"one revolution a second"
"observing the revolution about the axis of rotation"
Most countries have had revolutions aganist the government.大多数国家发生过反对政府的革命。
The industrial revolution had taken place in England first.工业革命首先在英国发生。
Those people go around preaching revolution.那些人到处宣扬革命。
The invention of aircraft caused a revolution in our ways of travelling.飞机的发明引起了旅行方式的巨大改变。
Credit cards have brought about a revolution in people's spending habits.信用卡的使用给人们的消费习惯带来巨大改变.
The earth makes one revolution round the sun each year.地球每年绕太阳旋转一周。
The earth completes one revolution each day.地球每天完成一次自转。

rife

[raɪf], [raɪf]


Image Search
adj. 非常多的；盛传的；流行的
(especially of something undesirable or harmful) of common occurrence; widespread.
full of.
in an unchecked or widespread manner.
"male chauvinism was rife in medicine in those days"
"the streets were rife with rumor and fear"
"speculation ran rife that he was an arms dealer"
His thesis is rife with errors.他的学位论文错误连篇。
Rumours are rife that he is going to resign.到处都在传，说他要辞职了。
It is a country where corruption is rife.这是个腐败成风的国家。
Disease and violence were rife in the city.这个城市里，疾病流行，暴力成灾。
Los Angeles is rife with gossip about the stars' private lives.洛杉矶盛传明星私生活的流言蜚语。
Superstition is still rife in country districts.迷信依然盛行在乡间地区。
Rumour is rife that they have met with a terrible disaster and that all are dead.说他们遭到大灾难并全都死了的谣言到处流行。

rig

[rɪɡ], [rɪɡ]


Image Search
n. 装备；帆具；服装；钻井架；钻塔
v. 装配；装扮；临时赶造；操纵
make (a sailing ship or boat) ready for sailing by providing it with sails and rigging.
assemble and adjust (the equipment of a sailboat, aircraft, etc.) to make it ready for operation.
set up (equipment or a device or structure), typically hastily or in makeshift fashion.
provide (someone) with clothes of a particular style or type.
the particular way in which a sailboat's masts, sails, and rigging are arranged.
the sail, mast, and boom of a sailboard.
an apparatus, device, or piece of equipment designed for a particular purpose.
an oil rig or drilling rig.
(in CB and shortwave radio) a transmitter and receiver.
a particular type of construction for fishing tackle that bears the bait and hook.
a set of amplifiers and speakers used by a live band or a DJ in a club.
a person's costume, outfit, or style of dress.
a tractor-trailer.
another type of vehicle, such as a horse-drawn carriage.
manage or conduct (something) fraudulently so as to produce a result or situation that is advantageous to a particular person.
cause an artificial rise or fall in prices in (a market, especially the stock market) with a view to personal profit.
a trick or way of swindling someone.
"the catamaran will be rigged as a ketch"
"most sails are kept ready rigged"
"he had rigged up a sort of tent"
"a cavalry regiment rigged out in green and gold"
"the yacht will emerge from the yard with her original rig"
"a lighting rig"
"the rig of the Army Air Corps"
"the results of the elections had been rigged"
"he accused games manufacturers of rigging the market"
Judging by its rig, I'd say it was a fishing boat.从船具装备来看，我认为这是一艘渔船。
Our camping rig includes cooking pots and sleeping bags.我们的野营装备包括锅子和睡袋。
Most modern yachts have a fore and aft rig, but the old galleons were squared-rigged.大多数现代化游艇配备的都是前后帆，而老式大帆船装的却是横帆。
On Halloween the children rig themselves up in funny clothes.万圣节前夕孩子们穿上各种滑稽的服装。
Oil suddenly jetted out of rig number four.油突然从四号钻井中喷了出来。
The oil rig is now fully operative.石油钻塔现全面开工。
I will have our people rig them with explosives.我将会用炸药让我们的民族装配他们。
They rigged the little boy out as a sailor.他们把小男孩打扮成水手模样。
Let's try to rig up some sort of shelter.让我们赶快搭个遮风挡雨的棚吧。
They tried to rig the election of officers.他们试图操控官员选举。

rigid

['rɪdʒɪd], ['rɪdʒɪd]


Image Search
adj. 坚硬的；严格的；固执的；僵硬的；刻板的
unable to bend or be forced out of shape; not flexible.
(of a person or part of the body) stiff and unmoving, especially as a result of shock or fear.
not able to be changed or adapted.
not adaptable in outlook, belief, or response.
"a seat of rigid orange plastic"
"his face grew rigid with fear"
"teachers are being asked to unlearn rigid rules for labeling children"
"ski instructors have become less rigid about style"
The tent has a rigid support.帐篷有一个坚硬的支柱。
He is a man of very rigid principles.他是一个原则性很强的人。
He's very rigid in his ideas.他的想法非常固执。
She was rigid with fear.她害怕得全身僵住了。
It's an exercise which adds a touch of the comic opera to his rigid training routines.这一练习给他那刻板的训练程序平添了一份滑稽的色彩。

rigorous

['rɪɡərəs], ['rɪɡərəs]


Image Search
adj. 严格的；严厉的；严峻的；细致的
extremely thorough, exhaustive, or accurate.
(of a rule, system, etc.) strictly applied or adhered to.
(of a person) adhering strictly or inflexibly to a belief, opinion, or way of doing something.
harsh and demanding.
"the rigorous testing of consumer products"
"rigorous controls on mergers"
"a rigorous teetotaler"
"my exercise regime is a little more rigorous than most"
The planes have to undergo rigorous safety checks.这些飞机得接受非常严格的安全检查。
The work failed to meet their rigorous standards.工作没有达到他们的严格标准。
It further implements the safe production responsibility system, and enforces rigorous safe production laws and regulations and a related accountability system.进一步实行安全生产责任体系，加强严厉的安全生产法规和相关责任体系。
He lived through the rigorous trials of revolutionary war.他经受了革命战争的严峻考验。
He makes a rigorous study of the plant in the area.他对该地的植物进行了慎密的研究。

rivet

['rɪvɪt], ['rɪvɪt]


Image Search
n. 铆钉
v. 铆接；固定；钉牢；集中；吸引
a short metal pin or bolt for holding together two plates of metal, its headless end being beaten out or pressed down when in place.
a device similar to a rivet for holding seams of clothing together.
join or fasten (plates of metal or other material) with a rivet or rivets.
hold (someone or something) fast so as to make them incapable of movement.
attract and completely engross (someone).
direct (one's eyes or attention) intently.
"the linings are bonded, not riveted, to the brake shoes for longer wear"
"the grip on her arm was firm enough to rivet her to the spot"
"he was riveted by the reports shown on television"
"all eyes were riveted on him"
Can I fasten these metal plates with rivets?我可以用铆钉把这些金属板固定在一起吗？
They riveted the steel beams together.他们把钢梁铆接在一起。
We stood riveted to the spot.我们寸步不移的站在那儿。
Her eyes were riveted on his face.她的眼睛盯着他的脸。
I was absolutely riveted by her story.她的故事完全把我吸引住了。

robust

[rəʊ'bʌst], [roʊ'bʌst]


Image Search
adj. 强健的；稳固的；耐用的；粗野的；浓的
strong and healthy; vigorous.
(of an object) sturdy in construction.
(of a process, system, organization, etc.) able to withstand or overcome adverse conditions.
uncompromising and forceful.
(of wine or food) strong and rich in flavor or smell.
"the Caplans are a robust, healthy lot"
"a robust metal cabinet"
"California's robust property market"
"the country's decision to bow to UN pressure was preceded by a robust defense of its policies"
She was almost 90, but still very robust.她将近90岁了，但身体仍然十分强健。
But I can say for sure that our monetary system is robust.但是,我可以很肯定地讲,我们的货币体系是稳固。
He bought a robust metal cabinet for his new house.他为新家购置了一个坚固耐用的金属柜。
He is a man with a rather robust sense of humor.他具备颇为粗俗的幽默感。
I would like a cup of robust tea to refresh myself.我要来一杯浓茶以恢复精力。

roil

Image Search

vi. 动荡
make (a liquid) turbid or muddy by disturbing the sediment.
(of a liquid) move in a turbulent, swirling manner.
another term for rile (sense 1).
"winds roil these waters"
"the sea roiled below her"

role

[rəʊl], [roʊl]


Image Search
n. 作用；角色
an actor's part in a play, movie, etc.
the function assumed or part played by a person or thing in a particular situation.
"Dietrich's role as a wife in war-torn Paris"
"she greeted us all in her various roles of mother, friend, and daughter"
The Panama Canal has played a very important role in transportation.巴拿马运河在运输上起到了非常重要的作用。
The key role of the teacher in the learning process should not be neglected.教师在学习中的关键作用是不该忽视的。
The role of the railway declines in the transport system.在运输系统中,铁路的重要性逐渐下降。
She prefers to play comic roles.她更喜欢扮演滑稽角色。
He played a passive role in the marriage.他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。
His dual role as a composer and a conductor made him very busy.他作曲家和指挥家的双重身份使他非常繁忙。

rotate

[rəʊ'teɪt], ['roʊteɪt]


Image Search
v. 轮流；(使)旋转
adj. 车轮状的
move or cause to move in a circle around an axis or center.
pass to each member of a group in a regularly recurring order.
grow (different crops) in succession on a particular piece of land to avoid exhausting the soil and to control weeds, pests, and diseases.
change the position of (tires) on a motor vehicle to distribute wear evenly.
"the wheel continued to rotate"
"the job of chairing the meeting rotates"
"these crops were sometimes rotated with grass"
The post of chairman rotates among members of the committee.主席一职由委员会的成员轮流担任。
Interns have to rotate for a few months.实习医生轮流工作了几个月。
He rotates the handle gently.他轻轻地转动手柄。
Does the earth rotate on an axis?地球是绕轴旋转的吗？

rotating

[rəʊ'teɪtɪŋ], [rəʊ'teɪtɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 旋转的
动词rotate的现在分词.
move or cause to move in a circle around an axis or center.
pass to each member of a group in a regularly recurring order.
grow (different crops) in succession on a particular piece of land to avoid exhausting the soil and to control weeds, pests, and diseases.
change the position of (tires) on a motor vehicle to distribute wear evenly.
"the wheel continued to rotate"
"the job of chairing the meeting rotates"
"these crops were sometimes rotated with grass"
Eddies are swirls or rotating water flow.漩涡即旋转的水流。
In rotating, the shaft splashes oil up into the bearings.当轴旋转的时候就把油溅入轴承。

rotund

[rəʊ'tʌnd], [roʊ'tʌnd]


Image Search
adj. (指人)圆胖的；(声音)洪亮的
(of a person) plump.
round or spherical.
(of speech or literary style) indulging in grandiloquent expression.
"huge stoves held great rotund cauldrons"
He was a large rotund man with a very jovial nature and a compassionate disposition.他是一个又高又胖的男人，天性快乐并富有同情心。
These rotund amphibians can grow to 8 inches (20 centimeters) in length and would cover a good-size tea saucer.这种洪亮的两栖动物可以长到20厘米长，可以盖住一个大尺寸的茶托。

rouse

[raʊz], [raʊz]


Image Search
v. 唤醒；激起
n. 觉醒；奋起
bring out of sleep; awaken.
cease to sleep or to be inactive; wake up.
startle out of inactivity; cause to become active.
startle (game) from a lair or cover.
haul (something) vigorously in the specified direction.
cause to feel angry or excited.
cause or give rise to (an emotion or feeling).
stir (a liquid, especially beer while brewing).
"she was roused from a deep sleep by a hand on her shoulder"
"she roused and looked around"
"once the enemy camp was roused, they would move on the castle"
"rouse the cable out"
"the crowds were roused to fever pitch by the drama of the race"
"his evasiveness roused my curiosity"
"rouse the beer as the hops are introduced"
These words seemed to rouse Uncle Vernon.这句话似乎唤醒了弗农姨父。
He's very hard to rouse in the morning.他早晨很难被唤醒。
I was roused by the sound of the bell this morning.今天早晨，我被铃声唤醒。
The speaker was trying to rouse the audience to enthusiasm.那位演讲者正设法激起听众的热情。
This will rouse the initiative of the people.这将激发群众的热情。
At the same time,our senses remain responsive enough so that extreme external stimuli can rouse us to wakefulness.同时，我们的感官能力，所以外界极其强烈的刺激能将我们唤醒进入觉醒状态。
Frantz Fanon devoted himself to his ideal, but the modern masterpiece has continued his work to rouse the politicians.法农早已为理想牺牲，现代电影继续追击，就看政客们何时觉醒！

rout

[raʊt], [raʊt]


Image Search
n. 彻底溃败； 凑热闹的人； 大败
v. 使 ... 溃败； 使 ... 败逃
a disorderly retreat of defeated troops.
a decisive defeat.
an assembly of people who have made a move toward committing an illegal act that would constitute an offense of riot.
a disorderly or tumultuous crowd of people.
a large evening party or reception.
defeat and cause to retreat in disorder.
cut a groove, or any pattern not extending to the edges, in (a wooden or metal surface).
another term for root2.
find (someone or something), or force them from a place.
"the retreat degenerated into a rout"
"the party lost more than half their seats in the rout"
"a rout of strangers ought not to be admitted"
"in a matter of minutes the attackers were routed"
"you routed each plank all along its length"
"Simon routed him from the stable"
It's an utter rout, and your broadcasts are criminal lies.这是一场溃败，你广播的新闻都是可耻的谎言。
Markets across Europe were also in freefall, following yet another rout in Asia.伴随着亚洲市场的节节溃败，整个欧洲市场同样直线下滑。

route

[ruːt], [ruːt]


Image Search
n. 路线；(固定)线路；途径
vt. 为 ... 安排路线；(按路线)发送
a way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination.
the line of a road, path, railroad, etc.
a circuit traveled in delivering, selling, or collecting goods.
a method or process leading to a specified result.
send or direct along a specified course.
"the most direct route is via Los Angeles"
"the many routes to a healthier diet will be described"
"all lines of communication were routed through Atlanta"
The route was once much travelled but has fallen into disuse.这条路线旅行的人以前常走，但是现在已不用了。
The bus route goes so far as that, so you'll need to take a taxi.汽车路线到此为止了，你得叫辆的士。
The plane deviated from its usual route.飞机偏离了正常的航线。
Professor Layard argues that higher income is a route to higher status.莱亚德教授提出,增加收入是提高地位的一个途径。
The flight is routed to Chicago via New York.这个航班被安排经纽约飞往芝加哥。
Our travel agent routed us through Italy.我们的旅行社安排我们途经义大利。
All train ferry traffic will be routed via Dover.所有的火车轮渡交通都将经多佛中转。

routine

[ruː'tiːn], [ruː'tiːn]


Image Search
n. 例行公事；常规；无聊
adj. 常规的；例行的；乏味的
a sequence of actions regularly followed; a fixed program.
a set sequence in a performance such as a dance or comedy act.
a sequence of instructions for performing a task that forms a program or a distinct part of one.
performed as part of a regular procedure rather than for a special reason.
organize according to a routine.
"I settled down into a routine of work and sleep"
"he was trying to persuade her to have a tap routine in the play"
"the principal insisted that this was just a routine annual drill"
"all had been routined with smoothness"
We must introduce some system into our office routine.我们须在我们日常公务中建立一些制度。
They did it as a matter of routine.他们那样做只是例行公事。
This type of work rapidly becomes routine.这种工作很快就变得乏味无聊。
You just need to break out of that boring routine.你只需改变一成不变的无聊生活。
The film is a love story, with routine portraits of a conductor and a violinist.那部电影是一个爱情故事,对於乐队指挥和小提琴手之间的爱情描写都是老一套。
Routine office jobs have no relish at all for me.我对坐办公室那种刻板的工作毫无兴趣。
It was a rather routine performance.那是很一般的演出。

rowdy

a noisy and disorderly person.

He was beaten to death by a rowdy person.他被一个暴徒打得死去活来。

rudder

['rʌdə(r)], ['rʌdər]


Image Search
n. 舵；方向舵；指导原则
a flat piece, usually of wood, metal, or plastic, hinged vertically near the stern of a boat or ship for steering.
a vertical airfoil pivoted from the horizontal stabilizer of an aircraft, for controlling movement around the vertical axis.
application of a rudder in steering a boat, ship, or aircraft.
"bring the aircraft to a stall and apply full rudder"
The wood rudder of the ship was broken.船的木头舵坏了。
Without a rudder the ship was not navigable.这船没有舵无法驾驶。
The rudder of that ship suddenly failed.那艘船的方向舵突然失灵了。
A life without a purpose is a ship without a rudder.没有目标的生活好比没有船舵的船。
What is the dietary rudder of the patient after esophagus cancer art?食管癌术后病人的饮食指导原则是什么？

rue

[ruː], [ruː]


Image Search
n. 懊悔；后悔；芸香
v. 后悔；懊悔；悲伤
bitterly regret (something one has done or allowed to happen).
repentance; regret.
compassion; pity.
a perennial evergreen shrub with bitter strong-scented lobed leaves that are used in herbal medicine.
used in names of other plants that resemble rue, especially in leaf shape, e.g., goat's-rue, meadow rue, wall rue.
"Ferguson will rue the day he turned down that offer"
"with rue my heart is laden"
"tears of pitying rue"
To his rue, the error cost him the game.让他后悔的是，这个错误让他满盘皆输。
Rue and thyme grow both in one garden.花园里同时种着芸香和百里香。
I rue never having been to university.我后悔从未上过大学。
He'll rue the day he married her.他将会因为和她结婚而抱恨终身。
It would be easy to look back and rue the wasted moments.人们总是容易回忆过去，懊悔浪费的光阴。

ruffle

['rʌfl], ['rʌfl]


Image Search
n. 褶饰；花边
v. 弄皱或弄乱某物；扰乱；激怒
disorder or disarrange (someone's hair), typically by running one's hands through it.
(of a bird) erect (its feathers) in anger or display.
disturb the smoothness or tranquility of.
disconcert or upset the composure of (someone).
ornament with or gather into a frill.
an ornamental gathered or goffered frill of lace or other cloth on a garment, especially around the wrist or neck.
a vibrating drumbeat.
"the father laughs and jovially ruffles his son's hair"
"on his departure to the high wires, the starling ruffled his feathers and flirted his wings"
"the evening breeze ruffled the surface of the pond in the yard"
"Brian had been ruffled by her questions"
"a blouse with a high ruffled neck"
Her blouse has a ruffle of lace around the neck.她的衬衫领子镶有褶裥花边。
The seamstress bound the hem of the dress with a ruffle.女裁缝用褶裥饰边给女上衣镶边。
A flag ruffled in the breeze.旗帜迎风飘扬。
A breeze ruffled the surface of the lake.一阵微风吹皱了湖面。
Don't ruffle my hair, I've just combed it.别把我的头发弄乱了
Nothing can ruffle her gentle disposition.她的温和性格使她遇到任何事情都不会恼火。
Anne is easily ruffled by awkward questions.安娜容易被一些难以回答的问题弄得心烦意乱。
Do not get so ruffled, you should not ruffle so easily.别那么生气,你不该那么容易发脾气。
He was determined, today, not to let Nancy Molineaux or anyone else ruffle him.他今天下了决心不让南希·莫利诺或者任何其他人激怒他。

ruminate

Image Search

think deeply about something.
(of a ruminant) chew the cud.
"we sat ruminating on the nature of existence"

The cow began to ruminate after eating up grass.牛吃完草后开始反刍。

rummage

['rʌmɪdʒ], ['rʌmɪdʒ]


Image Search
v. 到处翻寻；搜出；检查
n. 翻箱倒柜的寻找；临检
search unsystematically and untidily through a mass or receptacle.
find (something) by rummaging.
(of a customs officer) make a thorough search of (a vessel).
an unsystematic and untidy search through a mass or receptacle.
a thorough search of a vessel by a customs officer.
"he rummaged in his pocket for a handkerchief"
"Mick rummaged up his skateboard"
"our brief was to rummage as many of the vessels as possible"
Larry had to rummage through several cartons.拉里不得不翻了好几个纸盒。
The old lady began to rummage in her pocket for her spectacles.老太太开始在口袋里摸索，找她的眼镜。
I rummaged out some old clothes and give them to the man at the door?我找出些旧衣服送给门口的那个人。
He had a good rummage inside the sofa.他把沙发内部彻底搜寻了一翻。
She gave a good rummage around her basement but couldn't find her radio anywhere.她在地下室翻箱倒柜但是找不到她的收音机。

ruse

[ruːz], [ruːz]


Image Search
n. 策略；谋略；诈术
an action intended to deceive someone; a trick.
"Eleanor tried to think of a ruse to get Paul out of the house"
Their first ruse having failed, then tried another.他们一计不成, 又施一计。
Ruse culture shows diversity posture in the expression in market economy.谋略文化在市场经济中的表现呈多元化态势。
The criminal adopted ruse to escape detection.这罪犯采取诈术来逃避侦破。
To feign frankness is a ruse of war.装作坦白，是为了作战的目的。

rustic

['rʌstɪk], ['rʌstɪk]


Image Search
adj. 乡村的；纯朴的；手工粗糙的；土气的
n. 乡下人；村夫；农民
relating to the countryside; rural.
having a simplicity and charm that is considered typical of the countryside.
lacking the sophistication of the city; backward and provincial.
constructed or made in a plain and simple fashion, in particular.
made of untrimmed branches or rough timber.
with rough-hewn or roughened surface or with deeply sunk joints.
denoting freely formed lettering, especially a relatively informal style of handwritten Roman capital letter.
an unsophisticated country person.
"bare plaster walls and a terra-cotta floor give a rustic feel"
"you are a rustic halfwit"
"a rustic oak bench"
"a rustic bridge"
His rage was soon calmed down by the rustic peace.乡村的宁静很快就使他的怒气平静下来。
Visitors from cosmopolitan cities were held spellbound by the rustic scenery.来自大都会的游客被乡村景色迷住了。
The village has a certain rustic charm.这个村子有某一种质朴的魅力。
But little Pearl was not clad in rustic weeds.当然，小珠儿穿的并不是破衣烂衫。
He looks very rustic in his gown.他穿着那件大褂显着土得很。
She was more rustic in her effort to appear urban.她越是想装做城里人，越显得土里土气。
The fellow is as handsome a rustic as need be seen.这个家伙作为一个乡下人是够漂亮的。
How can the rustic understand literature?他一个山野村夫怎么会懂得文学呢?

ruthless

['ruːθləs], ['ruːθləs]


Image Search
adj. 残忍的；无情的
having or showing no pity or compassion for others.
"a ruthless manipulator"
The ruthless enemy killed the old lady.残忍的敌人杀害了那位老太太。
To foreign observers, American capitalism looks ruthless.对于外国人来说，美国的资本主义看起来是残忍的。
He's a ruthless businessman, as I know to my cost.我吃了苦头后才知道他是个无情的商人。
Go up against ruthless street racers out to win at any cost.不惜任何代价对赢上升对抗无情的街道叁赛者。

sabotage

['sæbətɑːʒ], ['sæbətɑːʒ]


Image Search
n. 怠工；破坏
vt. 破坏
deliberately destroy, damage, or obstruct (something), especially for political or military advantage.
the action of sabotaging something.
Their sabotage put back production badly.他们的怠工严重影响了生产。
The fire at the factory was caused by sabotage.那家工厂的火灾是有人蓄意破坏引起的。
They are carrying out subversion,sabotage,intervention and aggression everywhere in the world.他们在全世界到处进行颠覆，破坏，干涉和侵略。
They tried to sabotage my birthday party.他们企图破坏我的生日晚会。
The rebels had tried to sabotage the oil pipeline.反叛者试图破坏输油管道。

safeguard

['seɪfɡɑːd], ['seɪfɡɑːrd]


Image Search
n. 保卫者；保护措施
vt. 保卫；保护
a measure taken to protect someone or something or to prevent something undesirable.
protect from harm or damage with an appropriate measure.
"there were multiple safeguards to prevent the accidental release of a virus"
"low interest rates are offering the opportunity to safeguard their financial futures"
There is no safeguard against inappropriate data types being added.没有保护措施来防止添加不适当的数据类型。
We must safeguard our national interests.我们必须保卫国家的利益。
To safeguard the peace is one of the important tasks of the army.军队的重要任务之一是保卫和平。
Safeguard records from damage or deterioration.保护以防记录损坏或变质。
There is no safeguard against inappropriate data types being added.没有保护措施来防止添加不适当的数据类型。

sage

[seɪdʒ], [seɪdʒ]


Image Search
n. 圣人；哲人
n. 鼠尾草；蒿属植物
adj. 贤明的；明智的
an aromatic plant with grayish-green leaves that are used as a culinary herb, native to southern Europe and the Mediterranean.
used in names of aromatic plants of the mint family that resemble sage, e.g., wood sage.
either of two bushy North American plants with silvery-gray leaves.
short for sagebrush.
a profoundly wise man, especially one who features in ancient history or legend.
having, showing, or indicating profound wisdom.
"they nodded in agreement with these sage remarks"
A sage has more than one teacher.圣人无常师。
Confucius is considered the greatest of the ancient Chinese sages.孔子被认为是中国古代最伟大的圣贤。
The sage is the instructor of a hundred ages.这位哲人是百代之师。
Sage has been known to symbolize strength for thousands of years.鼠尾草千百年来被当作强有力的象征。
The girl planted some scarlet sage in her garden.女孩在她的花园里种了些一串红。
I was grateful for the old man's sage advice.我很感激那位老人贤明的忠告。
It is habit of age to give sage advice to youth.给青年一些贤明的建议是老年人的一种习性。
What a sage reply you gave!多聪明的回答啊！
This is sage advice I can pass on to every writer and artist.这是一个我能够传达给每一个作家和艺术家的大师级建议。

salvage

['sælvɪdʒ], ['sælvɪdʒ]


Image Search
vt. 救助；打捞；抢救
n. 海上救助；打捞；抢救
rescue (a wrecked or disabled ship or its cargo) from loss at sea.
retrieve or preserve (something) from potential loss or adverse circumstances.
the rescue of a wrecked or disabled ship or its cargo from loss at sea.
the cargo saved from a wrecked or sunken ship.
the rescue of property or material from potential loss or destruction.
payment made or due to a person who has saved a ship or its cargo.
"an emerald and gold cross was salvaged from the wreck"
"it was the only crumb of comfort he could salvage from the ordeal"
"a salvage operation was under way"
"salvage taken from a ship that had sunk in the river"
The government tried to salvage several business companies from bankruptcy.政府设法把这几个商业公司从破产境地中拯救出来。
They are trying to salvage the wrecked ship.他们努力抢救遇难的船只。
All attempts to salvage the wrecked ship failed.抢救失事船只的一切努力都失败了。
It is time for Morrison to salvage his career.这是莫里森拯救他职业生涯的时代。
We were unable to salvage anything when the factory burnt down.当工厂烧毁时，我们没有能抢救出任何东西。
Salvage of the wreck is made difficult by bad weather.船遇难後因天气恶劣救援工作十分困难。
The salvage operation cannot begin for several months.开始的几个月打捞工作没办法开展。
We'll pull alongside the ship and put a salvage crew aboard.我们要靠拢那艘船，把打捞人员送上船去。
There is little hope of the salvage.营救的希望几乎没有。

sanction

['sæŋkʃn], ['sæŋkʃn]


Image Search
n. 批准；约束力；处罚
vt. 批准；支持
a threatened penalty for disobeying a law or rule.
measures taken by a nation to coerce another to conform to an international agreement or norms of conduct, typically in the form of restrictions on trade or on participation in official sporting events.
a consideration operating to enforce obedience to any rule of conduct.
official permission or approval for an action.
official confirmation or ratification of a law.
a law or decree, especially an ecclesiastical decree.
give official permission or approval for (an action).
impose a sanction or penalty on.
"a range of sanctions aimed at deterring insider abuse"
"he appealed to the bishop for his sanction"
"only two treatments have been sanctioned by the Food and Drug Administration"
The minister can only act in this matter with the sanction of Parliament.部长只有得到国会批准才能就此事采取行动。
The book was translated without the sanction of the author.这本书未经作者许可就给翻译了。
Western nations imposed tough sanctions on the country.西方各国对这个国家实行了严厉制裁。
The church would not sanction the king's second marriage.教会不会批准国王第二次结婚。
They refused to sanction segregation.他们拒绝支持种族隔离。
They were satisfied with this pragmatic sanction.他们满足于得到实用上的支持。

['sæŋktʃuəri], ['sæŋktʃueri]


Image Search

a place of refuge or safety.
a nature reserve.
a holy place; a temple or church.
the inmost recess or holiest part of a temple or church.
the part of the chancel of a church containing the high altar.
"people automatically sought a sanctuary in time of trouble"
"a bird sanctuary"
The celebrant vested himself in the sanctuary.主持弥撒的神甫在祭坛上穿上祭袍。
It is a classic sanctuary in which the rationalist fancy may take refuge.这是一所古雅的圣殿，理性主义者可以躲在其中。
The chapel became a sanctuary for the refugees.这座小教堂成为难民的庇护所。
His garden was his pride and joy and became a sanctuary for birds.他的花园是他的得意之作，并成为了鸟儿的庇护所。

sangfroid

[sɒŋ'frwɑː], [sɑːŋ'frwɑː]


Image Search

composure or coolness, sometimes excessive, as shown in danger or under trying circumstances.
She had the strength and sangfroid of a woman in the prime of life.她具有正值青春的少妇的力量和沉着。

sanitary

['sænətri], ['sænəteri]


Image Search
adj. 卫生的；清洁的
relating to the conditions that affect hygiene and health, especially the supply of sewage facilities and clean drinking water.
hygienic and clean.
"a sanitary engineer"
"the most convenient and sanitary way to get rid of food waste from your kitchen"
There was a small and not very sanitary inn nearby.附近有一家不那么卫生的小客栈。
It's not sanitary to let flies come near food.让苍蝇接近食物是不卫生的。
The oral sanitary product containing the zedoary turmeric oil has the function of inhibiting various pathogenic bacteria and virus growth while guaranteeing the tooth sanitation.所述的含莪术油的口腔卫生产品在用于保证牙齿清洁的同时，具有抑制口腔和上呼吸道内各种致病细菌和病毒生长的作用。

satire

['sætaɪə(r)], ['sætaɪər]


Image Search
n. 讽刺文；讽刺
the use of humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues.
a play, novel, film, or other work that uses satire.
a genre of literature characterized by the use of satire.
(in Latin literature) a literary miscellany, especially a poem ridiculing prevalent vices or follies.
"a stinging satire on American politics"
Satire is a high and subtle art.讽刺是一门崇高而又含蓄的艺术。
Politicians are legitimate targets for satire.政治家理所当然是讽刺的靶子。

saunter

walk in a slow, relaxed manner, without hurry or effort.
a leisurely stroll.

"a quiet saunter down the road"
He sauntered by with his hands in his pockets.他双手插在口袋里悠闲地走了过去。
Sometimes in the summer my wife and I saunter there in the cool of the evening.在夏日,内子和我有时会在黄昏阴凉时分到那里散步。
This part of the route should be an easy saunter.这段路想必好走。
Let's go for a saunter along the river.我们沿着河走走吧。

savor

['seɪvə], ['seɪvə]


Image Search
n. 味道； 气味； 滋味
vi. 有 ... 的味道或风味
vt. 调味； 品尝； 欣赏
=savour（英）
taste (good food or drink) and enjoy it completely.
enjoy or appreciate (something pleasant) completely, especially by dwelling on it.
have a suggestion or trace of (something, especially something bad).
a characteristic taste, flavor, or smell, especially a pleasant one.
a suggestion or trace, especially of something bad.
"gourmets will want to savor our game specialties"
"I wanted to savor every moment"
"their genuflections savored of superstition and popery"
"the subtle savor of wood smoke"
Love life, only to survive in order to savor the taste of life, and feel the warmth of life, and create a brilliant life!珍爱生命，只有生存下去，才能体味生命的滋味，感受生命的温暖，创造生命的辉煌！
He needs to savor his victory.他需要享受胜利的滋味。
So the next time you savor a new candy or potato chip, thank the flavorists.所以下回你品尝新口味的糖果或土豆片时，要特别感谢这些调味学家。
I will savor its taste and give thanks.一口一口，细细品尝，满怀感激。
So the next time you savor a new candy or potato chip, thank the flavorists.所以下回你品尝新口味的糖果或土豆片时，要特别感谢这些调味学家。
I will savor all the various flavors life has to offer.我会欣赏生命中一切酸甜苦辣。
I'd love to savor the dulcet tones of the Marine Band while swapping off-color jokes with a high-level Republican war criminal.其实我挺乐意一边欣赏缅因州乐队的美妙旋律，一边和共和党的战争贩子交换低俗的玩笑。

Savoy.

scan

[skæn], [skæn]


Image Search
vt. 扫描；浏览；审视；细看
vi. 合韵律；划分音步
n. 扫描；浏览；细看
look at all parts of (something) carefully in order to detect some feature.
look quickly but not very thoroughly through (a document or other text) in order to identify relevant information.
cause (a surface, object, or part of the body) to be traversed by a detector or an electromagnetic beam.
cause (a beam) to traverse across a surface or object.
convert (a document or picture) into digital form for storage or processing on a computer.
resolve (a picture) into its elements of light and shade in a prearranged pattern for the purposes of television transmission.
analyze the meter of (a line of verse) by reading with the emphasis on its rhythm or by examining the pattern of feet or syllables.
(of verse) conform to metrical principles.
an act of scanning someone or something.
a medical examination using a scanner.
an image obtained by scanning or with a scanner.
"he raised his binoculars to scan the coast"
"we scan the papers for news from the trouble spots"
"their brains are scanned so that researchers can monitor the progress of the disease"
"we scanned the beam over a sector of 120°"
"text and pictures can be scanned into the computer"
"a quick scan of the sports page"
"a brain scan"
"we can't predict anything until we have seen the scan"
Could you teach me how to scan an image?你可以教我如何扫描一个影像吗?
I scanned the newspaper when I was waiting for the bus.等公共汽车的时候，我匆匆浏览了一下报纸。
She scanned his face, looking for signs of what he was thinking.她审视他的脸,试图探寻他在思考什么。
I scanned my pocket for change.我仔细查看囗袋找零钱。
The verses scan well.这些诗句符合韵律。
The doctors gave him an ultrasonic brain scan.医生给他做了脑部超声波扫描检查。
I'm too busy to read the whole newspaper, I just scan the headline.我太忙了，没法看整份报纸，只是浏览了一下大标题。
Employers receive many resumes and must scan each of them quickly.雇主会收到许多简历，因此必须快速浏览它们。

Image Search

barely sufficient or adequate.
barely amounting to a specified number or quantity.

"companies with scant regard for the safety of future generations"
"she weighed a scant two pounds"
"he does not scant his attention to the later writings"

Your attachment to substandard lodgings and scant tuition in Dover is clearly irrational.你留恋多佛低于标准的住宿条件和不足的奖学金，这明显是非理性的。

scarce

[skeəs], [skers]


Image Search
adj. 缺乏的；不足的；稀少的；罕见的
adv. 勉强
(especially of food, money, or some other resource) insufficient for the demand.
occurring in small numbers or quantities; rare.
scarcely.
"as raw materials became scarce, synthetics were developed"
"the freshwater shrimp becomes scarce in soft water"
"a babe scarce two years old"
Food and fuel were scarce in this region.这地区食物和燃料都很缺乏。
Firewood is scarce in many parts of the world.世界上很多地区都缺乏木材。
Food commands a higher price when it is scarce.食物(供应)不足时，售价较高。
As Singapore is a small island, land is scarce.新加坡是一个小岛,土地稀有。
Good fruit is scarce in winter and costs a lot.好的水果冬天难得见到，而且价格昂贵。
I could scarce believe my eyes.我几乎不敢相信自己的眼睛。

"the scenario is World War II"
The scenario was remade 12 times.剧本总共修改了12次。
A detailed script or scenario consulted to avoid discrepancies from shot to shot in a film.一个好的电影剧本是制作一部好影片的重要因素。
It looked ominously like we were about to repeat the earlier scenario.而且看上去很不妙，好象我们又得重复上次那一幕了。
Take a glaring scenario closer home.我们周围地区便有些很明显的例子。
What's your worst-case scenario for Asia?你认为在亚洲可能发生的最恶劣情形会是怎样?

one's day-to-day plans or timetable.
a timetable.
an appendix to a formal document or statute, especially as a list, table, or inventory.
(with reference to an income tax system) any of the forms (named “A,” “B,” etc.) issued for completion and relating to the various classes into which taxable income is divided.

"we have drawn up an engineering schedule"

"the release of the single is scheduled for April"

I'll work out the schedule.我来拟定时间表。
Please show me the taxation schedule.请让我看看税收一览表。
Owing to various delays en route, we arrived two days behind schedule.由于路上的种种耽搁, 我们比原计划迟到了两天。
He was scheduled to attend the party.他预定出席那个宴会。
The morning is the best time of the day to schedule a briefing.简报最好安排在早上。
The professor was invited to schedule a new book.那名教授受邀为一本新书编目录。

scheme

[skiːm], [skiːm]


Image Search
n. 阴谋；计划；方案
v. 图谋；设计；策划；<非正式>认为
a large-scale systematic plan or arrangement for attaining some particular object or putting a particular idea into effect.
a secret or underhanded plan; a plot.
a particular ordered system or arrangement.
a public housing complex.
make plans, especially in a devious way or with intent to do something illegal or wrong.
"a clever marketing scheme"
"police uncovered a scheme to steal paintings worth more than $250,000"
"a classical rhyme scheme"
"the whole scheme is plunged into darkness, bar the light in Victor's house"
"he schemed to bring about the collapse of the government"
Their scheme was exposed.他们的阴谋被暴露了。
The police have uncovered a scheme of robbery.警察当局破获了一起阴谋抢劫案。
They were bitterly opposed to the scheme.他们强烈反对这个计划。
I rather doubt if such an ambitious scheme could be made a success of.我真怀疑这样一个雄心勃勃的计划是否会成功。
A rival company has set afloat a new credit scheme.一家竞争的公司已开始实施一项新的信用购物方案。
My contention is that the scheme will never work.我认为这个方案行不通。
He is scheming for power.他在图谋争权。
He schemed to keep his rivals in ignorance of his plans.他图谋不让他的对手们知道他的计划。
They schemed out a new method of bridge building.他们设计了一种新的造桥方法。
They have been scheming to overthrow the government.他们一直在策划推翻政府。
What do you scheme?你认为怎么样？

school

[skuːl], [skuːl]


Image Search
n. 学校；学派；院系；鱼群
v. 教育；训练；成群地游

the buildings used by an institution for educating children.
the students and staff of a school.
a day's work at school; lessons.
any institution at which instruction is given in a particular discipline.
another term for university.
a department or faculty of a college concerned with a particular subject of study.
a group of people, particularly writers, artists, or philosophers, sharing the same or similar ideas, methods, or style.
a style, approach, or method of a specified character.
send to school; educate.
train or discipline (someone) in a particular skill or activity.
a large group of fish or sea mammals.
(of fish or sea mammals) form a large group.
"Ryder's children did not go to school at all"

"school started at 7 a.m."

"the Frankfurt school of critical theory"
"filmmakers are tired of the skin-deep school of cinema"
"he was schooled in Boston"
"he schooled her in horsemanship"
She studies in a high school.她在一所中学学习。
Soon, the whole school knew about her win.不久，全校师生都知道她获胜了。
This is the argument of the school.这就是流行学派的论据。
The Prague School has three important points.布拉格学派有三个至为重要的观点。
What was your experience in film school like?可否谈谈你在大学电影系的经历?
The graduate school is recruiting students, you can try.研究生院在招生，你可以试试啊！
She should be schooled with her peers.她应当与她的同龄人一起接受教育。
I have schooled myself to remain calm under pressure.我练就一副在压力之下保持镇静的本领。

scope

[skəʊp], [skoʊp]


Image Search
n. 机会；范围；眼界；观看的仪器
vt. 仔细研究
the extent of the area or subject matter that something deals with or to which it is relevant.
the opportunity or possibility to do or deal with something.
a purpose, end, or intention.
a telescope, microscope, or other device having a name ending in -scope.
the length of cable extended when a ship rides at anchor.
the range of the effect of an operator such as a quantifier or conjunction.
assess or investigate (something).
set the scope of (a projected undertaking).
look at carefully; scan.
denoting an instrument for observing, viewing, or examining.
"we widened the scope of our investigation"
"the scope for major change is always limited by political realities"
"Plato maintains religion to be the chief aim and scope of human life"
"infrared night scopes"
"they'd scoped out their market"
"it is important that a project is scoped correctly to ensure the budget can be accurately defined"
"they watched him scoping the room, looking for Michael"
"microscope"
He gets a work that gives scope for his abilities.他得到了一份有机会发挥他才能的工作。
He has no scope for his particular talents.他没有施展自己特殊才能的机会。
It is within my scope.那是在我的范围之内。
This subject is outside the scope of our inquiry.这个问题不在我们探讨的范围之内。
We have to broaden our scope.咱们应当扩大一下眼界。
The scope for human error could also be minimised.人为出错的机会也尽可能减低。
He scopes the big picture of Israeli-Arab relations.他认真地查看关于以色列和阿拉伯关系的大图片。

scorch

[skɔːtʃ], [skɔːrtʃ]


Image Search
v. （使）烧焦；变焦；（使）枯萎
n. 烧焦
burn the surface of (something) with flame or heat.
become burned when exposed to heat or a flame.
(of the heat of the sun) cause (vegetation or a place) to become dried out and lifeless.
(of a person or vehicle) move very fast.
the burning or charring of the surface of something.
a form of plant necrosis, typically of fungal origin, marked by browning of leaf margins.
"surrounding houses were scorched by heat from the blast"
"the meat had scorched"
"a desolate, scorched landscape"
"a sports car scorching along the expressway"
"a scorch mark"
Jenny scorch her jacket carelessly while she is smoking her pipe.珍妮抽烟斗时不小心把夹克烧焦。
Luckily, flashes of such strong radiation occur so far away they will not scorch our planet.幸运的是，诸如这类的强辐射大发生离我们非常的遥远，他们不会烧焦我们的地球。
Jenny scorch her jacket carelessly while she is smoking her pipe.珍妮抽烟斗时不小心把夹克烧焦。
Luckily, flashes of such strong radiation occur so far away they will not scorch our planet.幸运的是，诸如这类的强辐射大发生离我们非常的遥远，他们不会烧焦我们的地球。

scorn

[skɔːn], [skɔːrn]


Image Search
n. 轻蔑；奚落；笑柄
v. 轻蔑；鄙视；嘲弄；不屑
the feeling or belief that someone or something is worthless or despicable; contempt.
a person viewed with scorn.
a statement or gesture indicating scorn.
feel or express contempt or derision for.
reject (something) in a contemptuous way.
refuse to do something because one is too proud.
"I do not wish to become the object of scorn"
"a scandal and a scorn to all who look on thee"
"I was routinely ridiculed and scorned by conservatives and liberals alike"
"opponents scorned his offer to negotiate"
"at her lowest ebb, she would have scorned to stoop to such tactics"
He eyed me with a terrible scorn.他极其轻蔑地打量着我。
He spat out the words with scorn.他用轻蔑的口吻说了这番话。
He were to become a mark of public scorn.他将成为公众奚落的典型。
The loser's scorn for the award is pure sour grape.失败者对奖品的轻视纯粹是吃不到葡萄说葡萄酸。
The small weak child became the scorn of the class.这个瘦小软弱的孩子成为全班嘲笑的对象。
You've no right to scorn a poor girl.你没有权利藐视一个穷女孩。
The palace should not scorn the cottage.高贵者不应该看不起卑贱者。
They have become what they profess to scorn.他们成了自己曾声称看不起的那种人。
She scorned our offers of help.她不屑接受我们的帮助。

scour

['skaʊə(r)], ['skaʊər]


Image Search
v. 擦洗；搜寻；腹泻
n. 擦洗；腹泻
clean or brighten the surface of (something) by rubbing it hard, typically with an abrasive or detergent.
remove (dirt or unwanted matter) by rubbing with an abrasive or detergent.
(of water or a watercourse) make (a channel or pool) by flowing forcefully over something and removing soil or rock.
administer a strong purgative to.
the action of scouring or the state of being scoured, especially by swift-flowing water.
an act of rubbing something hard to clean or brighten it.
diarrhea in livestock, especially cattle and pigs.
subject (a place, text, etc.) to a thorough search in order to locate something.
move rapidly in a particular direction, especially in search or pursuit of someone or something.
"he scoured the bathtub"
"use an electric toothbrush to scour off plaque"
"a stream came crashing through a narrow cavern to scour out a round pool below"
"give the floor a good scour"
"David scoured each newspaper for an article on the murder"
"he scoured up the ladder"
He scoured off the dirt from the floor.他擦去地板上的污垢。
This rusted pan does not scour easily.这只生锈的锅不容易擦乾净。
The police scoured the area looking for the lost child.警方搜遍这个地区寻找这个走失的孩子。
The cleaning lady gave it a good scour.清洁女工将它好好地刷洗了一遍。
I gave the dirty floor a good scour.我把脏地板好好擦了一下。

scrupulous

['skruːpjələs], ['skruːpjələs]


Image Search
adj. 小心谨慎的；细心的；严谨的
(of a person or process) diligent, thorough, and extremely attentive to details.
very concerned to avoid doing wrong.
"the research has been carried out with scrupulous attention to detail"
"she's too scrupulous to have an affair with a married man"
However, without the most scrupulous cleanliness, this practice can, in some cases, lead to an infection with hepatitis and other sexually transmitted diseases.不过，如果没有小心谨慎的清洁，这种习惯在一些情形下可能导致肝炎和其它性传播疾病的感染。
Only those scrupulous readers can find this mistake.只有非常细心的读者才会发现这个错误。

scrutinize

['skruːtənaɪz], ['skruːtənaɪz]


Image Search
v. 仔细检查；细看
examine or inspect closely and thoroughly.
"customers were warned to scrutinize the small print"
We must scrutinize and evaluate.我们必须细细察看并做出评价。
She leaned forward to scrutinize their faces.她探身向前，端详他们的面容。
The boss came to scrutinize how things were going on for himself.老板亲自详察工作进展情况。
All parts of the aircraft are closely scrutinized for signs of wear or damage.飞机的所有部件都被仔细查看以防磨损和损坏。

scuffle

['skʌfl], ['skʌfl]


Image Search
v. 混战；扭打；拖脚行走
n. 混战
a short, confused fight or struggle at close quarters.
an act or sound of moving in a hurried, confused, or shuffling manner.
engage in a short, confused fight or struggle at close quarters.
move in a hurried, confused, or awkward way, making a rustling or shuffling sound.
(of an animal or person) move (something) in a scrambling or confused manner.
"there were minor scuffles with police"
"he heard the scuffle of feet"
"the teacher noticed two students scuffling in the corridor"
"a drenched woman scuffled through the doorway"
"the rabbit struggled free, scuffling his front paws"
The police scuffled with the demonstrators.警察和示威群众混战起来。
They scuffled with reporters.他们与记者扭打起来。
the drunken men started to scuffle.这些喝醉的人们开始扭打起来。
Five pickets were injured in the scuffle.在混战中有五名罢工纠察队员受伤。
A few isolated scuffles broke out when police tried to move the demonstrators.当警察试图驱散示威者时，发生了几起零星的扭打。　

scuttle

['skʌtl], ['skʌtl]


Image Search
n. 煤斗；天窗
v. 凿沉；急走；快跑
a metal container with a sloping hinged lid and a handle, used to fetch and store coal for a domestic fire.
the amount of coal held in a scuttle.
run hurriedly or furtively with short quick steps.
an act or sound of scuttling.
sink (one's own ship) deliberately by holing it or opening its seacocks to let water in.
deliberately cause (a scheme) to fail.
an opening with a lid in a ship's deck or side.
"carrying endless scuttles of coal up from the cellar"
"a mouse scuttled across the floor"
"I heard the scuttle of rats across the room"
"some of the stockholders are threatening to scuttle the deal"
Basically use at window of housetop scuttle, balcony.主要用于屋顶天窗、阳台窗。
The children scuttle across the street.我看见他急匆匆地穿街而过。
The spectators scuttled for shelter when it began to rain.一下起雨来，观众就纷纷找地方躲避。

['siːlənt], ['siːlənt]


Image Search
n. 密封剂；密封层
material used for sealing something so as to make it airtight or watertight.
If the discoloration is the joints, please remove the sealant that used in craft completely.如果是接缝处的变色，必须将连接处密封剂完全去除。
A summary of the research of low monol polyether polyols polyurethane sealant is given.总结了低单聚醚聚氨酯密封剂的研制。

section

['sekʃn], ['sekʃn]


Image Search
n. 部分；部门；章节；区域；断面；剖面图；零件；路段；切开
v. 划分；切开
any of the more or less distinct parts into which something is or may be divided or from which it is made up.
a relatively distinct part of a book, newspaper, statute, or other document.
a measure of land, equal to one square mile.
a particular district of a town.
a distinct group within a larger body of people or things.
a group of players of a family of instruments within an orchestra.
a small class of students who are part of a larger course but are taught separately.
a specified military unit.
a subdivision of an army platoon.
a secondary taxonomic category, especially a subgenus.
the cutting of a solid by or along a plane.
the shape resulting from cutting a solid along a plane.
a representation of the internal structure of something as if it has been cut through vertically or horizontally.
a separation by cutting.
a thin slice of plant or animal tissue prepared for microscopic examination.
divide into sections.
separate an area from a larger one.
cut (animal or plant tissue) into thin slices for microscopic examination.
divide by cutting.
commit (someone) compulsorily to a psychiatric hospital in accordance with a section of a mental health act.
"arrange orange sections on a platter"
"the children's section of the library"
"the brass section"
"graduate students lead discussion sections for professors' lecture courses"
"a camouflage section was added to the army"
"she began to section the grapefruit"
"parts of the curved balcony had been sectioned off with wrought-iron grilles"
"it is common veterinary practice to section the nerves to the hoof of a limping horse"
"should she be sectioned?"
White lines divide the playing area into sections.这些白线把赛区分成各个部分。
I hope someone competent will join our section.我希望有能力的人加入本部门。
The report has a section on accidents at work.报告中有一段谈到工作中的事故问题。
She lives near the business section.她住在商业区附近。
This illustration shows a section through the timber.本图所示为木材的纵剖面。
The architect drew the house in section.建筑师画出房子的剖面图。
The shed comes in sections that you assemble yourself.这个棚子有几个部分
While driving on the bumpy section of the road, he switches on the shock-absorbers.在路面不平的路段他开启了减震器。
The surgeon performed a section on the vein.外科医生施行了静脉切开手术。

sector

['sektə(r)], ['sektər]


Image Search
n. 部门；部分；区域
n. [计]扇形；扇区
vt. 使分成部分
an area or portion that is distinct from others.
a distinct part or branch of a nation's economy or society or of a sphere of activity such as education.
a subdivision of an area for military operations.
a subdivision of a track on a magnetic disk.
the plane figure enclosed by two radii of a circle or ellipse and the arc between them.
a mathematical instrument consisting of two arms hinged at one end and marked with sines, tangents, etc. for making diagrams.
"the industrial and commercial sector"
perceive superficially
The government made an investigation of the employment in the public and private sectors.政府对国营和私营部门的就业情况作了一次调查。
Fashion is one sector of the beauty industry.时装是美容行业的一个部分。
We must be careful not to confuse a segment and a sector.我们必须小心不要把细分市场和部分市场混淆。
The enemy attacked in the southern sector.敌军对南部地区发起进攻。
A sector of a cylindrical capacitor may thus be utilized as an energy filter.柱面扇形电容器可作为能量过滤器。
Your professional reputation will be in the spotlight as this coming Friday's full moon will light up your honors and recognition sector.当即将到来周五的满月照亮你象征荣耀与褒奖的扇形面时，你职业上的名誉将得到瞩目。
There are several sectors unusable in this disk.这张磁盘有几个扇区坏了。

security

[sɪ'kjʊərəti], [sə'kjʊrəti]


Image Search
n. 安全；保证；证券；债券；抵押；防护措施
the state of being free from danger or threat.
the safety of a state or organization against criminal activity such as terrorism, theft, or espionage.
procedures followed or measures taken to ensure the safety of a state or organization.
the state of feeling safe, stable, and free from fear or anxiety.
a private police force that guards a building, campus, park, etc.
a thing deposited or pledged as a guarantee of the fulfillment of an undertaking or the repayment of a loan, to be forfeited in case of default.
a certificate attesting credit, the ownership of stocks or bonds, or the right to ownership connected with tradable derivatives.
"the system is designed to provide maximum security against toxic spills"
"a matter of national security"
"amid tight security the presidents met in the Colombian resort"
"this man could give the emotional security she needed"
I'll undertake for your security.我将保证你的安全。
The visitors were secarched for security reasons.为了安全起见,来宾受到了检查。
Our own actions are our security.我们的行为是自己的保证。
He traded in securities and became rich.他做证券交易发了财。
The value of a derivative is based on another security.金融衍生工具的价值以另一种债券为基准。
He has given his house as security for the loan.他以抵押自己的房屋作为贷款的担保。
A life insurance policy may serve as security for a loan.人寿保险可作贷款的抵押。
We need greater security in car parks.我们需要加强停车场的安全措施.

vi. 寻找

go to (a place).
"they came here to seek shelter from biting winter winds"
"the new regime sought his extradition"
"he sought help from the police"
"it's his job to seek out new customers"
"I sought my bedroom each night to brood over it"
Tortured by fear, he decided to seek the aid of a psychiatrist.他终日恐惧不安,决定寻求心理医生的帮助。
Many single people are seeking that special someone.许多单身人士都在追求他们的唯一。
Some nations will seek the change of their energy supply sources to reduce emissions, or for other reasons.为了减少碳排量,或是出于其他原因,一些国家试图改变他们的能源供应来源。
You seek all day and you find it, and then you realize that it is worthless.你终日寻寻觅觅,找到了,之后却发现那根本不值得寻找。

This earthquake measured 7 according to the seismic survey.经测定，这次地震的烈度为七级。

We go out very seldom.我们绝少外出。
She seldom, if ever, goes to the cinema.她难得看电影。

"he has been selected to take part"
"a phenotype can be selected against"
"click Tools on the menu bar and select Settings"
"he joined his select team of young Intelligence operatives"
"the opera was seen by a small and highly select audience"

They select him to their leader.他们选择他为他们的领导人。
She selected a diamond ring from the collection.她从收藏品中挑选了一枚钻石戒指。
You may select those books you like best.你可以从那些书中挑选你最喜欢的书。
A select group were invited to the wedding reception.一群经过挑选的人士被邀请参加婚宴。
Select film excerpts will be played on the film festival.精选电影摘录将在电影节播放。
This is a very select area; you have to be rich to live here.这是高级住宅区，你必须有钱才能住在这里。

She is selective in the dresses she wears.她对于自己穿的衣服精挑细选。

self-seeking


Image Search
n. 利己主义；只顾自己
another term for self-serving.
concern for oneself before others.
Love is patient, Love is kind, love is not self seeking. 爱是刚强;爱是节制;爱是恒久忍耐.
Cynical, self seeking, materialistic and ungoverned by the principles of the Truth. 冷嘲热讽、寻求自己、注重物质利益，不愿意受真理的约束。
Let him seek peace and ensue it! 让他去追求和平并为和平而奔波吧。
The plaintiff is seeking remedy through the court. 原告通过法院请示获得救济。
I have been seeking it all round. 我一直在四处寻找它。
I do not like to go to the movies by my self. 我不喜欢自己一个人看电影。

a part of a film dealing with one particular event or topic.

arrange in a particular order.
ascertain the sequence of amino acid or nucleotide residues in (a protein, DNA, etc.).
play or record (music) with a sequencer.
"the content of the program should follow a logical sequence"
"a grueling sequence of exercises"
"the famous underwater sequence"
"trainee librarians decide how a set of misfiled cards could be sequenced"

She made a sequence of dance movements.她做了一个连续的舞蹈动作。
He described the events of that day in sequence.他按先后次序描述了那一天发生的种种事件。
A sequence of murders had prompted the police to actions.一连串的谋杀迫使警方不得不采取行动。
Please sequence the names in alphabetical order.请按字母顺序排列好名单。

adj. 尊贵的

It was a beautiful morning, calm and serene.那是一个宁静、明媚的早晨。
Light music fills my heart with serene joyfulness.轻音乐能带给我平静的欢乐。

I enjoyed the serenity and the peacefulness when I was in the church.当我身处大教堂时赶到平和与宁静。

series

['sɪəriːz], ['sɪriːz]


Image Search
n. （单复同）系列；丛书；连续
a number of things, events, or people of a similar kind or related nature coming one after another.
a set of books, maps, periodicals, or other documents published in a common format or under a common title.
a set of games played between two teams, or among any number of individual competitors.
a line of products, especially vehicles or machines, sharing features of design or assembly and marketed with a separate number from other lines.
a set of stamps, banknotes, or coins issued at a particular time or having a common design or theme.
a set of related television or radio programs, especially of a specified kind.
another term for tone row.
denoting electrical circuits or components arranged so that the current passes through each successively.
(in chronostratigraphy) a range of strata corresponding to an epoch in time, being a subdivision of a system and itself subdivided into stages.
a set of elements with common properties or of compounds related in composition or structure.
a set of quantities constituting a progression or having the several values determined by a common relation.
a group of speech sounds having at least one phonetic feature in common but distinguished in other respects.
"the explosion was the latest in a series of accidents"
"a playoff series against Portland"
"early models of the 600D series incorporated a centrifugal oil filter"
"a new drama series"
"the Pliocene series"
"the metals of the lanthanide series"
The lecture series falls naturally into three parts.该系列讲座可自然分作三部分。
The theory is based on a series of wrong assumptions.这一理论是以一系列错误的设想为依据的。
He published a new series of readers for students of English.他出版了一套新的英语学习丛书。
After a series of unsuccessful attempts, he has finally passed the driving test.经过连续几次的失败，他最后终于通过了驾驶考试。

Image Search

a reversal or check in progress.
a plain, flat offset in a wall.
the distance by which a building or part of a building is set back from the property line.
"a serious setback for the peace process"
He met with many a setback in his lifetime.他一生中遭到过许多挫折。
This setback has drained away my keenness.这次挫折削弱了我的热情。
Undaunted by his first setback, he decided to try once more.不为最初的失败而动摇，他决定再试一次。
This latest arrest was just one minor setback.最近的逮捕只不过是一个小小的退步。

severe

strict or harsh.

He's suffering from severe mental disorder.他患有严重的精神病。

sex

[seks], [seks]


Image Search
n. 性别；性欲；性
vt. 区别 ... 性别；引起 ... 性欲
(chiefly with reference to people) sexual activity, including specifically sexual intercourse.
a person's genitals.
either of the two main categories (male and female) into which humans and most other living things are divided on the basis of their reproductive functions.
the members of either sex considered as a group.
the fact of belonging to either the male or female sex.
determine the sex of.
present something in a more interesting or lively way.
arouse or attempt to arouse someone sexually.
variant spelling of sexi-, shortened before a vowel (as in sexennial ), or shortened before a consonant (as in sexfoil ).
six; having six.
"they enjoyed talking about sex"
"adults of both sexes"
"she was well known for her efforts to improve the social condition of her sex"
"the same allowances for childcare should be available to all single parents irrespective of sex"
"sexing chickens"
"the department set up a task force to help sex up the concept of conserving water"
"sexivalent"
Everybody can come to this school,without respect to class, race, or sex.不论阶级、种族、性别,人人都可以进这所学校上课。
She disguised her true sex under a man's garment.她身穿男装来掩饰自己的真实性别。
Hunger and sex are elemental drives of human beings.食欲和性欲是人类的原始冲动。
The movie is full of sex and violence.这部电影充满了性和暴力。
It's difficult to sex newborn chicks.新生小鸡雏的性别是很难判断的。
They sex up their commercial advertisements to attract customers.他们使商业广告充满性感内容以吸引顾客。

shale

[ʃeɪl], [ʃeɪl]


Image Search
n. 页岩；泥板岩
soft, finely stratified sedimentary rock that formed from consolidated mud or clay and can be split easily into fragile slabs.
The new process extracts oil from shale.这一新过程可从页岩里提炼出石油。
Most of the rock in this mountain is shale.这座山上大部分的岩石都是页岩。
It is the density data of the shale.这是泥页岩密度数据。

sham

[ʃæm], [ʃæm]


Image Search
n. 假；赝品；骗子；枕头套
adj. 假的；伪造的
v. 假装；学样子
a thing that is not what it is purported to be.
pretense.
a person who pretends to be someone or something they are not.
short for pillow sham.
bogus; false.
falsely present something as the truth.
pretend to be or to be experiencing.
"the proposed legislation is a farce and a sham"
"it all turned out to be sham and hypocrisy"
"he was a sham, totally unqualified for his job as a senior doctor"
"a clergyman who arranged a sham marriage"
"was he ill or was he shamming?"
"she shams indifference"
His love was a sham; he only wanted her money.他爱她是假的，他只想要她的钱。
She claims to know all about computers but really she's a sham.她自称精通计算机，其实她是假充内行。
Are these real diamonds or only sham?这些是真的钻石还是赝品?
He a man! Hell! He was a hollow sham.他是男子汉？见鬼！他是个虚伪的骗子。
They cunningly played the game of sham peace.他们狡滑地玩弄假和平的把戏。
He's only shamming.他只是假装而已。

shameful

['ʃeɪmfl], ['ʃeɪmfl]


Image Search
adj. 可耻或丢脸的
worthy of or causing shame or disgrace.
"a shameful accusation"
It was shameful of them to surrender.他们投降是可耻的。
They considered her behaviour a shameful piece of snobbery.他们认为她为人势利，行为可耻。
These shameful manoeuvres were aimed at securing his election.这些可耻的伎俩都是为了能让他当选。
There is nothing shameful about that, since she was a witch who had used a pillow to deceive him.这没有什么对不起人的地方，她是会拿枕头和他变戏法的女怪。

sheepish

['ʃiːpɪʃ], ['ʃiːpɪʃ]


Image Search
adj. 羞怯的；局促不安的；驯服的；胆怯的
(of a person or expression) showing embarrassment from shame or a lack of self-confidence.
"a sheepish grin"
She had a rather sheepish smile.她笑起来很害羞的样子
He came into the room looking distinctly sheepish.他走进房间，看起来很明显局促不安的。

shift

[ʃɪft], [ʃɪft]


Image Search
v. 移动；改变；换挡；字型转换
n. 轮班；变化；移动；计谋；轮班职工
move or cause to move from one place to another, especially over a small distance.
change the position of one's body, especially because one is nervous or uncomfortable.
change the emphasis, direction, or focus of.
change in emphasis, direction, or focus.
move (data) one or more places to the right or left in a register.
press the shift key on a typewriter or computer keyboard.
sell (something).
change gear in a vehicle.
be evasive or indirect.
a slight change in position, direction, or tendency.
the displacement of spectral lines.
a key on a typewriter or computer keyboard used to switch between two sets of characters or functions, principally between lower- and upper-case letters.
short for sound shift.
the gearshift or gear-changing mechanism in a motor vehicle.
the positioning of successive rows of bricks so that their ends do not coincide.
a movement of the digits of a word in a register one or more places to left or right, equivalent to multiplying or dividing the corresponding number by a power of whatever number is the base.
a change of position by two or more players before the ball is put into play.
one of two or more recurring periods in which different groups of workers do the same jobs in relay.
the group of people who work during a particular shift.
a woman's straight unwaisted dress.
a long, loose-fitting undergarment.
an ingenious or devious device or stratagem.
"I shift the weight back to the other leg"
"he shifted a little in his chair"
"she's shifting the blame onto me"
"the wind had shifted to the east"
"the partial remainder is shifted left"
"a lot of high-priced product you simply don't know how to shift"
"she shifted down to fourth"
"they know not how to shift and rob as the old ones do"
"a shift in public opinion"
"the night shift"
"the thousand shifts and devices of which Hannibal was a master"
The tools shift around in the car boot every time we turn a corner.我们每次转弯，汽车行李箱里的工具就来回动。
The Left is shifting their ground.左派正在改变立场。
You have to shift as you drive around the corner.你拐角时要换挡变速。
They were taking turns to be on the night shift.他们轮流做夜班。
This accident caused a dramatic shift in public opinion.这个意外引起了公众舆论的急剧变化。
The 21st century has been seeing a gradual shift of people from the country to the town.21世纪,人口开始渐渐由乡村向市镇转移。
As a temporary shift, he covered up the leak with a plastic bag.作为权宜之计，他用塑料袋把漏洞给包上了。

shoal

[ʃəʊl], [ʃoʊl]


Image Search
adj. 浅的
n. 浅水处；沙洲；鱼群；一大群
v. （使)变浅；群聚
a large number of fish swimming together.
a large number of people.
(of fish) form shoals.
an area of shallow water, especially as a navigational hazard.
a submerged sandbank visible at low water.
a hidden danger or difficulty.
(of water) become shallower.
(of water) shallow.
"a shoal of bream"
"a rock star's entrance, first proceeding with his shoal of attendants"
"he alone could safely guide them through Hollywood's treacherous shoals"
In the shoal water, we could see shoals of tiny fish darting about.在浅水区，我们看到一群小鱼在游来游去。
The boat struck a shoal and fetched up all standing.那艘船撞上浅滩突然停了下来。
I waded in the shoal almost a mile before I got to dry land.我在浅滩中涉水几乎一英里远才到了陆地。
The ship ported sharply to the left to avoid a shoal.船猛烈向左转以躲避一鱼群。
Shoals of tourists come here in the summer.这里夏季常有大批游客。
The shark described a circle around the shoal of fish.这条鲨鱼围绕着鱼群游动。
The fishmen shoal the narrow part of a river to fish.渔夫使河道狭窄处水变浅以便捕鱼。

shortage

['ʃɔːtɪdʒ], ['ʃɔːrtɪdʒ]


Image Search
n. 不足；缺少，短缺
a state or situation in which something needed cannot be obtained in sufficient amounts.
"a shortage of hard cash"
The war was lost because of a shortage of munitions.战争因军火不足而失败。
Power shortage browned out the city that winter.那年冬天，由于电力不足，市里采取了部分停电供应措施。
He always bemoans the shortage of funds for research.他总是叹息研究经费不足。
Continuance of the war will mean shortage of the food.战争的持续意味着食品短缺。
The company's main problem is the shortage of skilled personnel.这家公司的主要问题是缺少有技术的人员。

a very small amount.

play a very fast, intricate style of rock lead guitar.
"her beautiful dress was torn to shreds"
"there was not a shred of evidence that linked him to the fire"

We haven't got a shred of evidence.我们没有丝毫证据。

It was a shrewd assessment and probably pretty close to the truth.这个评估很有道理，可能相当正确。
He's an artist, a scientist and a shrewd businessman (all) rolled into one.他既是艺术家，又是科学家，同时还是个精明的生意人。
His skill in negotiating earned him a reputation as a shrewd tactician.他的谈判技巧使他赢得了精明战略家的名声。
His shrewd eyes looked across at his wife.他那敏锐的目光射向他的妻子。
The question was a quick, shrewd parry.这句问话是一种穷急智生的狡猾的遁辞词。

shun

They shun personal fame and gains.他们不计个人名利。
This recluse shunned all company.这位隐士不与任何人来往。
Wise men love truth, whereas fools shun it.智者热爱真理,愚者回避真理。
He shunned meeting any of his friends.他避免与他的任何朋友碰面。

Mark has been Luke's sidekick since junior high school.打从初中开始,马克和路克一直就是哥儿俩。
Daniels was ready to jump ship last week, following in the footsteps of her former sidekick, Forrest Sawyer.丹尼尔斯上周已决定跟随她的以前助手索耶的脚步辞职。

avoid (someone or something) by stepping sideways.

a step taken sideways, typically to avoid someone or something.
"as she walked she sidestepped the many cracks in the pavement"
"he neatly sidestepped the questions about riots"
He cleverly sidestepped the tackle.他巧妙地一晃，绕过阻截队员。

This attempt to sidestep the question of what intelligence is was very ingenious.这种回避了什么是智能的问题的尝试是非常巧妙的。

relating to or having significance.
"a significant increase in sales"
"in times of stress her dreams seemed to her especially significant"
"she gave him a significant look"
The question under discussion is significant.讨论中的问题是重要的。
Economic conditions are significant in many ways.经济条件在许多方面都是很重要的。
All of us want our lives to be significant.我们每个人都希望我们的人生是有意义的。
It was truly a significant conversation.这是非常有意义的谈话。
Grandpa looked over and gave me a significant smile.爷爷看着我给了我一个意味深长的微笑。
His first appearance in literary history is curious and significant.他在文学史上的初露锋芒是奇特而意味深长的。

silt

[sɪlt], [sɪlt]


Image Search
n. 淤泥
v. (使)淤塞
fine sand, clay, or other material carried by running water and deposited as a sediment, especially in a channel or harbor.
a bed or layer of silt.
sediment whose particles are between clay and sand in size (typically 0.002–0.06 mm).
become filled or blocked with silt.
fill or block with silt.
"the river's mouth had silted up"
The harbor is being up with silt.那海港被淤泥阻塞了。
A concrete wall is built to stop silt from leaking to the conservation land.一道水泥墙修筑起来，用以防止泥沙流进保留地。
The sand have silt up the mouth of the river.泥沙已把河口堵住了。

['sɪmələ(r)], ['sɪmələr]


Image Search
adj. 类似的
resembling without being identical.
(of geometric figures) having the same shape, with the same angles and proportions, though not necessarily of the same size.
a person or thing similar to another.

"a soft cheese similar to Brie"
"the principle of treatment by similars"
The two buildings are similar on the whole.从整体来看，这两幢楼是相似的。
I sympathize with you; I've had a similar unhappy experience myself.我很同情你，我自己也有过类似的不幸遭遇。
He talked about it in a similar way.他对此事有相似的说法。
Gold is similar in color to brass.金和铜颜色相仿。
We have similar opinions.我们的看法相同。

simulate

['sɪmjuleɪt], ['sɪmjuleɪt]


Image Search
vt. 假装；模拟；模仿
imitate the appearance or character of.
pretend to have or feel (an emotion).
produce a computer model of.
"red ocher intended to simulate blood"
"it was impossible to force a smile, to simulate pleasure"
"future population changes were simulated by computer"
These insects can simulate dead leaves .这些昆虫可以伪装成枯叶。
I tried to simulate surprise at the news.听到这个消息后，我竭力装出一副吃惊的样子。
He shook a sheet of metal to simulate the noise of thunder.他摇动一块金属薄片来模拟雷声。
You can simulate different browser types for tests.您可以为测试模拟不同类型的浏览器。
A sheet of metal was shaken to simulate the noise of thunder.猛力抖动金属片以模仿雷声。
This demo app shows you how to use a picture and a label to simulate a title bar on a form.这个演示应用程序向你展示了如何在一个窗体中，使用一幅图片和一个标签来模仿一个标题栏。

simulation

[ˌsɪmju'leɪʃn], [ˌsɪmju'leɪʃn]


Image Search

imitation of a situation or process.
the action of pretending; deception.
the production of a computer model of something, especially for the purpose of study.
"simulation of blood flowing through arteries and veins"
"clever simulation that's good enough to trick you"
"the method was tested by computer simulation"
Simulation testing is key to a successful project.模拟测试是成功项目的关键。
The pilot's skills are tested through simulation.飞行员的技术是通过模拟飞行来检测的。
The simulation shows good result.仿真结果表明效果良好。
Simulation results show the effectiveness of the method.仿真结果表明了该方法的有效性。
This coat is really simulation.这件外套简直是赝品。

sincere

[sɪn'sɪə(r)], [sɪn'sɪr]


Image Search

free from pretense or deceit; proceeding from genuine feelings.
(of a person) saying what they genuinely feel or believe; not dishonest or hypocritical.
"they offer their sincere thanks to Paul"
How can I persuade you that I am sincere?怎样才能使你相信我是真心实意的呢?
I will oblige any sincere request.我会答应任何诚意的请求。
I think he is sincere and quite without affectation.我认为他为人诚挚，毫不做作。
Sincere congratulations on your son wedding please convey our best wish.令郎喜结良缘谨此致以诚挚的祝贺并请转达最美好的祝愿。
Please accept my sincere thanks and best wishes.请接受我诚挚的感谢和最美好的祝愿。

singular

['sɪŋɡjələ(r)], ['sɪŋɡjələr]


Image Search
(of a word or form) denoting or referring to just one person or thing.
single; unique.
exceptionally good or great; remarkable.
strange or eccentric in some respect.
(of a square matrix) having a zero determinant.
denoting a point that is a singularity.
the singular form of a word.
"she always thought of herself as singular, as his only daughter"
"the singular beauty of the desert"
"no explanation accompanied this rather singular statement"
"the first person singular"
"It" is the third-person singular neuter pronoun.“it”是第三人称单数的中性代名词。
I was struck with the man's singular appearance.那个人的奇特外貌给我留下了深刻的印象。
Talking to him is a singular experience.与他交谈是一种非同平常的体验。
She had a singular insight into life.她对于人生有一个非凡的了解。
The young man has a singular ear for music.这个年轻人对音乐有非凡的欣赏力。
But his vision was too singular to be stultified for long.但是他的洞察力是如此非凡，不可能长久地被愚弄。
Give the singular forms of the following nouns.写出下列名词的单数形式。
Singular nouns are used only in the singular, always with a determiner.单数名词只有单数形式，总是与限定词连用。

evil or criminal.

"there was something sinister about that murmuring voice"

Events began to take on a more sinister aspect.事情开始呈现较为不祥的征兆。

Excavation of the site will begin tomorrow.明天开始挖掘工作。

A man was eating a huge slab of pizza.一个人正在吃巨大的厚厚的批萨。

slake

[sleɪk], [sleɪk]


Image Search

combine (quicklime) with water to produce calcium hydroxide.
"slake your thirst with some lemonade"
"restaurants worked to slake the Italian obsession with food"
We had to slake ourselves with rainwater in the desert.在沙漠中我们不得不用雨水解渴。
A menu will not satisfy your hunger, a formula will not slake your thirst.菜单不可能填饱你的肚子，一套准则也不可能消除你的饥渴。
We returned to the barn and slake our thirst with tea我们回到谷仓,饮茶解渴
I shall not seek a well to slake the burning thirst of my heart,我不会找一口井来消除内心强烈的渴望，
Hasn't NATO slaked his lust for blood?难道北约还没有满足他的血腥的欲望吗？
