We will submit ourselves to the court's judgement.我们服从法庭的判决。
We have to submit ourselves to discipline.我们必须遵守纪律。
He submitted his proposal for urban development to the city council.他将城市发展建议提交市议会。
Please fill in and submit the form below.请填写并递交以下表格。
I submit that more proof is needed to support the case.我认为这个案子需要更多的证据证实。
They refused to submit to the unjust decision.他们拒绝服从这个不公正的决定。
He submitted unwillingly to his mother.他不情愿地屈服于他母亲。

subordinate

[sə'bɔːdɪnət], [sə'bɔːrdɪnət]


Image Search
adj. 下级的；次要的
n. 属下；附属物
vt. 使服从；把 ... 放在次要
lower in rank or position.
of less or secondary importance.
a person under the authority or control of another within an organization.
treat or regard as of lesser importance than something else.
make subservient to or dependent on something else.
"his subordinate officers"
"in adventure stories, character must be subordinate to action"
"practical considerations were subordinated to political expediency"
He is a subordinate officer.他是位下级军官。
She works in the subordinate hospital of our universtiy.她在我们学校的附属医院工作。
All the other issues are subordinate to this one.所有问题都要以这个问题为主。
He was always friendly to his subordinates.他对下级一向和蔼可亲。
Please delegatea task to a subordinate.请把任务委托给下属。
He subordinated his wishes to the general good of the group.他使自己的愿望服从于集体的利益。
WE should subordinate our personal interests to those of the collective.我们应该让个人利益服从集体利益。
In her book, she subordinates this issue to more general problems.在她的书中,她把这个问题处理的不如一般问题重要。

subsequent

['sʌbsɪkwənt], ['sʌbsɪkwənt]


Image Search
adj. 随后的；后来的
coming after something in time; following.
(of a stream or valley) having a direction or character determined by the resistance to erosion of the underlying rock, and typically following the strike of the strata.
"the theory was developed subsequent to the earthquake of 1906"
Subsequent events proved me wrong.後来发生的事证明我错了。
He confessed to other crimes subsequent to the bank robbery.他供认抢劫银行案後，又坦白了其他罪行。
Subsequent to its success as a play, it was made into a film.该剧在舞台上获得成功之後，又摄制成了电影。
Subsequent events confirmed our doubts.后来发生的事证实了我们的怀疑。
The events I'm speaking of were subsequent to the war.我现在说到的事情都是战后发生的。

subside

[səb'saɪd], [səb'saɪd]


Image Search
vi. 沉没；平息；下陷
become less intense, violent, or severe.
lapse into silence or inactivity.
(of water) go down to a lower or the normal level.
(of the ground) cave in; sink.
(of a swelling) reduce until gone.
"I'll wait a few minutes until the storm subsides"
"Fred opened his mouth to protest again, then subsided"
"the floods subside almost as quickly as they arise"
"the island is subsiding"
"it took seven days for the swelling to subside completely"
The hematoma will usually subside in time.血肿通常随时间消逝。
The storm began to subside.风暴渐渐平息了。
He waited until the applause had subsided.他一直等到掌声平息后才继续下去。
Weak foundations caused the house to subside.由于地基不牢，这所房子已下陷。

subsidiary

[səb'sɪdiəri], [səb'sɪdieri]


Image Search
n. 子公司；附属机构
adj. 辅助的；补贴的；附属的
less important than but related or supplementary to something.
(of a company) controlled by a holding or parent company.
a company controlled by a holding company.
a thing that is of lesser importance than but related to something else.
"many environmentalists argue that the cause of animal rights is subsidiary to that of protecting the environment"
"Mozart follows his first theme by a crowd of subsidiaries"
be disguised by(with) sth
A lack of corporate interest has made the subsidiary an orphan.因缺乏共同利益,这家附属机构无人管理。
I plan to study journalism as a subsidiary course.我打算辅修新闻学。
Public transportation plays a subsidiary role.公共交通起辅助的作用。
The subsidiary distribution is under way.补助金的发放正在有序进行。
This ia a subsidiary stream which flows into the main river.这是一条流入大河的支流。
The question of finance is subsidiary to the question of whether the project will be approved.财务问题是这一项目是否获准的附带问题。

substance

['sʌbstəns], ['sʌbstəns]


Image Search
n. 实质；物质；财产；内容；重要性
a particular kind of matter with uniform properties.
an intoxicating, stimulating, or narcotic chemical or drug, especially an illegal one.
the real physical matter of which a person or thing consists and which has a tangible, solid presence.
the quality of having a solid basis in reality or fact.
the quality of being dependable or stable.
the quality of being important, valid, or significant.
the most important or essential part of something; the real or essential meaning.
the subject matter of a text, speech, or work of art, especially as contrasted with the form or style in which it is presented.
wealth and possessions.
the essential nature underlying phenomena, which is subject to changes and accidents.
"a steel tube coated with a waxy substance"
"proteins compose much of the actual substance of the body"
"the claim has no substance"
"some were inclined to knock her for her lack of substance"
"he had yet to accomplish anything of substance"
"the substance of the treaty"
"a woman of substance"
The Substance and Prospect of "East China Sea" Dispute between China and Japan中日"东海问题"的实质及展望
The emery is a hard metallic substance.金刚砂是非常坚硬的金属物质。
Beware of what you do with this dangerous substance.你处理这些危险品时，可要当心。
Later he became a man of substance.后来，他成为颇具资产的人。
There is not anything of real substance in their book.他们的书中没有什么实质性的内容。
This argument has some substance.这项争论具有一定的重要性。

substitute

['sʌbstɪtjuːt], ['sʌbstɪtuːt]


Image Search
n. 代用品；代替者；替补队员
vt. 代替；用 ... 代替；代以
a person or thing acting or serving in place of another.
a sports player nominated as eligible to replace another after a game has begun.
a person or thing that becomes the object of love or other emotion deprived of its natural outlet.
use or add in place of.
act or serve as a substitute.
replace (someone or something) with another.
replace (a sports player) with a substitute during a contest.
replace (an atom or group in a molecule, especially a hydrogen atom) with another.
(of a compound) in which one or more hydrogen atoms have been replaced by other atoms or groups.
"soy milk is used as a substitute for dairy milk"
"a father substitute"
"dried rosemary can be substituted for the fresh herb"
"I found someone to substitute for me"
"customs officers substituted the drugs with another substance"
"he was substituted for Nichols in the fifth inning"
"a substituted alkaloid"
Water is not a proper substitute for wine.水不是酒的适当代用品。
Is saccharin a good substitute for sugar?糖精是糖的良好替代品吗?
We recommend this brand as a good substitute.我们推荐的新品种可以完全替代原来的产品。
His friend Humboldt was his substitute.他的朋友洪堡接替了他。
There's no substitute for parents.父母亲是没有别人可以代替的。
Substitute Mario Goetze was the hero, as he scored the only goal with seven minutes to go.替补队员马里奥•格茨在比赛结束前7分钟踢进了全场唯一的一个进球，成为了英雄人物。
Only art can substitute for nature.唯有艺术能代替自然。
You would substitute when the manager is away.经理不在的时候由你来代理。
I had to substitute on a few things.有几项我不得不换一换。
The coach substituted Smith for Jones.教练让史密斯上场，换下了琼斯。
We substituted a red ball for blue to see if the baby would notice.我们用红皮球换下了蓝皮球，看这婴儿会不会发觉。
They don't like potatoes, so we substitute rice.他们不喜欢土豆,所以我们代之以大米。

substitution

[ˌsʌbstɪ'tjuːʃn], [ˌsʌbstɪ'tjuːʃn]


Image Search
n. 代替；替换；交换
the action of replacing someone or something with another person or thing.
"a tactical substitution"
The substitution of coal for oil is desirable.以煤代替石油是可取的。
It was merely the substitution of one piece of nonsense for another.这不过是用一个谎话来代替另一个谎话。
They're studying a substitution for the medicine.他们正在研制一种该药的替代品。
Substitutions must occur at or within the team's substitution box.替换必须发生在本队内的替换区。
The South Korean coach requests substitution.韩国队教练要求换人。
The second language is a macro language for performing textual substitution.第二种语言是宏语言，用来进行文字的转换。

successful

[sək'sesfl], [sək'sesfl]


Image Search
adj. 成功的；圆满的
accomplishing an aim or purpose.
having achieved popularity, profit, or distinction.
"a successful attack on the town"
"a successful actor"
She made a successful debut.她初次登台获得成功。
He aims to be a successful writer.他的目标是成为一个成功的作家。
They are highly successful in business.他们经商非常成功。
We are confident of a successful outcome.我们相信会有圆满的结果。
The meeting came to a successful conclusion.会议圆满结束。
The operation was completely successful.手术圆满成功。

successive

[sək'sesɪv], [sək'sesɪv]


Image Search
adj. 连续的；接连的；接二连三的
following one another or following others.
"they were looking for their fifth successive win"
We have had three successive years of good harvest.我们已连续三年丰收。
He dropped the nails on the ground and successive clangs were heard.他把钉子掉到了地上，听见了一连串的叮当声。
Continuity is ensured by using the same props in successive scenes.在连续的场景中使用同样的道具以确保前后衔接。
Andrea paid no attention to the successive charges which were brought against him.安德烈听着维尔福起诉书中接连提出来的罪名。
The successive terrorism attacks have aroused the attention from all humanity.接二连三的恐怖袭击已经引起了所有人的关注。

succinct

[sək'sɪŋkt], [sək'sɪŋkt]


Image Search
adj. 简洁的
(especially of something written or spoken) briefly and clearly expressed.
"use short, succinct sentences"
Milton summarizes the people's case in many such succinct passages.弥尔顿在许多简洁的段落中概括了人民的处境。

sufficient

[sə'fɪʃnt], [sə'fɪʃnt]


Image Search
adj. 足够的；充分的
enough; adequate.
"a small income that was sufficient for her needs"
The money I have saved is sufficient for buying a car.我所存的钱足以买一辆汽车。
I doubt whether they really have sufficient manpower.我怀疑他们是否真有足够的人力。
There is sufficient food for everybody.有足够的饭菜供大家吃。
We must work hard, but equally we must get sufficient rest.我们必须努力工作,但同时也要有充分的休息。
There was always sufficient reason for such an attention.对这种殷勤致意,总是不乏理由的。

sulky

['sʌlki], ['sʌlki]


Image Search
adj. 生气的；阴沉的
morose, bad-tempered, and resentful; refusing to be cooperative or cheerful.
expressing or suggesting gloom and bad temper.
a light two-wheeled horse-drawn vehicle for one person, used chiefly in harness racing.
"disappointment was making her sulky"
"she had a sultry, sulky mouth"
He was very sulky about it indeed.他对这事确实很生气。
The boss was as sulky as a bear that day.老板那天怒气冲冲。
I should have been sulky and mean.我应该阴沉而自卑。
I see that Basil is in one of his sulky moods.我觉得贝西尔现在情绪很低沉。

sullied

['sʌli], ['sʌli]


Image Search
v. 玷污；弄脏
n. <古>污点；污斑
damage the purity or integrity of; defile.
"they were outraged that anyone should sully their good name"
I wouldn't sully my hands by acceptinga bribe.我决不接受贿赂，一尘不染。
You shouldn't sully his character for no reason.你不应该平白无故地污蔑他人格低下。
Any further recalls will sully their reputations, perhaps irreparably.再有任何召回事件都会玷污它们的声誉，而且可能无法挽回。
No speck of dirt had ever sullied his hands.他的双手从来都是一尘不染。
She wondered if she dared risk sullying the gleaming sink.她犹豫了一下，怕把亮闪闪的洗涤槽弄脏。

sum

[sʌm], [sʌm]


Image Search
n. 金额；总数；要点
v. 概括；总结；归纳；总计
a particular amount of money.
the total amount resulting from the addition of two or more numbers, amounts, or items.
the total amount of something that exists.
an arithmetical problem, especially at an elementary level.
find the sum of (two or more amounts).
(of two or more amounts) add up to a specified total.
"they could not afford such a sum"
"the sum of two prime numbers"
"the sum of his own knowledge"
"if we sum these equations we obtain X"
"these additional probabilities must sum to 1"
I had to spend a large sum of money to get it back.我得花一大笔钱才把它弄回来。
I save a nice little sum out of my wages each week.我从每周的工资中节省一笔可观的金额。
The sum of 5 and 3 is 8.五加三的总和是八。
Is that the sum of what you've done in the last two years?这就是你最近两年中完成的全部数量吗？
What I just said is the sum of the book.我刚才所说的是这本书的要点。
We can sum up the main point of the lesson in three sentences.我们可以用三句话来概括本课要点。
So, to sum up, we need to concentrate on staff training.概括地说，我们需要集中精力进行职工培训。
The last section sums up all the arguments on either side.最后一部分总结了双方的全部论点。
Please sum up what you said just now.请把你刚才说的总结一下。
Now, I sum them up in 3 main points.下面，我将其归纳为三点。
These instances sum up to several dozen.这些例子总计达数十个。

summary

['sʌməri], ['sʌməri]


Image Search
n. 摘要；总结
adj. 简略的；概要的；即决的
a brief statement or account of the main points of something.
dispensing with needless details or formalities; brief.
(of a judicial process) conducted without the customary legal formalities.
(of a conviction) made by a judge or magistrate without a jury.
"a summary of Chapter Three"
"summary financial statements"
"summary arrest"
Please write me a summary of this report.请替我写一份这份报告的摘要。
Your summary will need fleshing out before you present it.你的总结需要增加一些具体材料再交出。
I went through by a summary method.我成功运用了一个简易的方法。
He gave a summary report of the day's events.他对一天的事件作了简要的报告。
Such an offence will lead to a summary fine.这类过错要当场予以罚款。

superb

[suː'pɜːb], [suː'pɜːrb]


Image Search
adj. 极好的
excellent.
impressively splendid.
"a superb performance"
"a superb Egyptian statue of Osiris"
The sports facilities are superb in this city.这个城市的运动设施是一流的。
The goalkeeper brought off a superb save.守门员漂亮地救出了险球。
Ideas will come to you easily and some will prove to be superb.你总很容易就能想到好计划，其中一些将得到极好的证实。

superfluous

[suː'pɜːfluəs], [suː'pɜːrfluəs]


Image Search
adj. 多余的；过剩的；不必要的
unnecessary, especially through being more than enough.
"the purchaser should avoid asking for superfluous information"
Repack all the superfluous cups in the box.把多余的杯子都重新装入箱中。
He has already been told, so our comments are superfluous.早就有人同他说过，所以我们的意见是多余的。
The market is already superfluous.市场已经过剩了。
She crossed out all the superfluous words and phrases in the draft.她把草稿中不必要的词句都杠掉了。
In writing telegrams omit superfluous words.写电报稿要省去不必要的文字。

supplement

['sʌplɪmənt], ['sʌplɪmənt]


Image Search
n. 增刊；补充物
vt. 增补；补充
something that completes or enhances something else when added to it.
a substance taken to remedy the deficiencies in a person's diet.
a separate section, especially a color magazine, added to a newspaper or periodical.
the amount by which an angle is less than 180°.
add an extra element or amount to.
"the handout is a supplement to the official manual"
"multivitamin supplements"
"she took the job to supplement her husband's income"
It comes out each week and it has a magazine supplement.每周出版一期，还附有杂志增刊。
The upset supplement supplier went up with the puppet to the upper room for supper.心烦意乱的增刊供给者与傀儡一起到上面的房间吃晚餐。
The money I got was a useful supplement to my ordinary income.我得到的那笔钱是很管用的外快。
Man's work is rather the needful supplement to himself than the outcome of it.一个人的工作更多地是他自身的必要补充,而非这种补充的结果。
She gives private lessons to supplement her income.她给私人授课以贴补收入。
I supplement my grant by working in the evenings.我除享受助学金外还打夜工以增加收入。
I never refuse odd jobs to supplement my income it's all grist to the mill.我为增加收入，对于做零活总是来者不拒--多多益善。

supplementary

[ˌsʌplɪ'mentri], [ˌsʌplɪ'mentri]


Image Search
adj. 补充的；附加的
completing or enhancing something.
a supplementary person or thing.
"the center's work was to be seen as supplementary to orthodox treatment and not a substitute for it"
This reader is supplementary to the textbook.这本读物是补充教科书的。
The supplementary goods have been gotten gready.要补充的货物已经准备好了，
What supplementary services will be offered?提供什么样的附加服务?
Supplementary punishments may also be applied independently.附加刑也可以独立适用。

suppose

[sə'pəʊz], [sə'poʊz]


Image Search
vt. 假设；假定；认为；想；应该；让(虚拟语气)
vi. 推测
assume that something is the case on the basis of evidence or probability but without proof or certain knowledge.
used to make a reluctant or hesitant admission.
used to introduce a hypothesis and trace or ask about what follows from it.
used to introduce a suggestion.
(of a theory or argument) assume or require that something is the case as a precondition.
believe to exist or to possess a specified characteristic.
be required to do something because of the position one is in or an agreement one has made.
be forbidden to do something.
"I suppose I got there about half past eleven"
"I'm quite a good actress, I suppose"
"suppose he had been murdered—what then?"
"suppose we leave this to the police"
"the procedure supposes that a will has already been proved"
"he supposed the girl to be about twelve"
"I'm supposed to be meeting someone at the airport"
"I shouldn't have been in the kitchen—I'm not supposed to go in there"
Suppose you have a thousand dollars, what will you do with it.假设你有一千美元，你会用它做什么。
Let us suppose another planet with conditions similar to those on the earth.让我们假定另外有一个具有和地球上相似条件的行星。
Some religions suppose that there is a Heaven physically above the earth.一些宗教认为地球上面真有一个天国。
I suppose we shall be having some sort of celebration for the bride.我想我们还是来为新娘庆贺一番吧。
You are not suppose to stay home during the weekend.你不应该周末还呆在家里。
Suppose we dine together.让我们一块儿吃饭吧
I suppose he would be about fifty when he obtained a doctorate.我推测他获得博士学位时大概是五十岁左右。

surge

[sɜːdʒ], [sɜːrdʒ]


Image Search
n. 汹涌；波涛；猛增
v. 汹涌；涌起；激增；[海]缆绳滑脱
a sudden powerful forward or upward movement, especially by a crowd or by a natural force such as the waves or tide.
a sudden large increase, typically a brief one that happens during an otherwise stable or quiescent period.
a major deployment of military forces to reinforce those already in a particular area.
a powerful rush of an emotion or feeling.
a sudden marked increase in voltage or current in an electric circuit.
(of a crowd or a natural force) move suddenly and powerfully forward or upward.
increase suddenly and powerfully, typically during an otherwise stable or quiescent period.
(of an emotion or feeling) affect someone powerfully and suddenly.
(of an electric voltage or current) increase suddenly.
(of a rope, chain, or windlass) slip back with a jerk.
"flooding caused by tidal surges"
"the firm predicted a 20% surge in sales"
"Sophie felt a surge of anger"
"the journalists surged forward"
"shares surged to a record high"
"indignation surged up within her"
A surge of demonstrators broke through the fence.汹涌而来的示威者冲破了围栏。
The great surge had built up in the Gulf Stream.汹涌的巨浪在墨西哥湾流形成了。
Oil was the prime cause of the price surge.石油是物价上涨的主要原因。
The tides surged over the rocks.潮水奔腾着涌过礁石。
The crowd surged past him.人们从他身边涌过。
Anger surged up within him.怒火在他心中燃烧。
The value of exports surged last year.去年出口值激增。

surpass

[sə'pɑːs], [sər'pæs]


Image Search
vt. 超越；胜过
exceed; be greater than.
be better than.
do or be better than ever before.
"prewar levels of production were surpassed in 1929"
"he continued to surpass me at all games"
"the organist was surpassing himself"
To be in love is to surpass oneself.人在爱中超越自我。
You seem to surpass yourself in this painting.你在这幅画的创作上似乎超越了你自己。
Her sweetness nothing can surpass.温柔甜蜜世无双。
It is hard to surpass Evans in speed.要在速度上胜过艾文斯很难。

surreptitiously

[ˌsʌrəp'tɪʃəsli], [ˌsʌrəp'tɪʃəsli]


Image Search
adv. 偷偷摸摸地；暗中地
in a way that attempts to avoid notice or attention; secretively.
"Mary surreptitiously slipped from the room"
One time, my brother and I surreptitiously made gunpowder.有一次，我和我哥哥偷偷摸摸地制作了火药。

surrogate

['sʌrəɡət], ['sɜːrəɡət]


Image Search
n. 代理人；代用品；代孕者
adj. 替代的
a substitute, especially a person deputizing for another in a specific role or office.
(in the Christian Church) a bishop's deputy who grants marriage licenses.
a judge in charge of probate, inheritance, and guardianship.
"she was regarded as the surrogate for the governor during his final illness"
I do not know if your company has surrogate in our country.我不知道贵公司在我国是否有代理。
In addition, the patient or surrogate may correct any historical misinformation at this time.病人或代诉者还可在此时纠正病史中的一些错误信息。
Fiction is a poor surrogate for real experience.小说中的事远逊于实际体验。
The youngest child of Michael Jackson was borned by a surrogate.迈克尔杰克逊最小的孩子是由一位代孕母亲所生的。
She saw him as a sort of surrogate father.在她心目中，他仿佛是能替代父亲角色的人。

survey

['sɜːveɪ], ['sɜːrveɪ]


Image Search
n. 问卷；测量；调查；纵览；视察
v. 调查；审视；研究；测量；勘定；环视
(of a person or their eyes) look carefully and thoroughly at (someone or something), especially so as to appraise them.
examine and record the area and features of (an area of land) so as to construct a map, plan, or description.
investigate the opinions or experience of (a group of people) by asking them questions.
investigate (behavior or opinions) by questioning a group of people.
a general view, examination, or description of someone or something.
an investigation of the opinions or experience of a group of people, based on a series of questions.
an act of surveying an area of land.
a map, plan, or detailed description obtained by a survey.
a department carrying out the surveying of land.
"her green eyes surveyed him coolly"
"he surveyed the coasts of New Zealand"
"95% of patients surveyed were satisfied with the health service"
"the investigator surveyed the attitudes and beliefs held by residents"
"the author provides a survey of the relevant literature"
"the flight involved a detailed aerial survey of military bases"
"the U.S. Geological Survey"
A recent survey of public opinions shows that most people are worried about the increasing crime.一份最近的民意调查表明,大多数人对不断增长的犯罪率表示忧虑。
The surveyor made a survey of the land.测量员对土地进行了测量。
After much delay, the results of the survey were published.耽搁多时之后,调查结果终于公布了。
From the top of the hill you can have a survey of the whole city.从山顶上你可以俯瞰整个城市。
Ali was his principal attendant during this nocturnal survey.阿里陪着他作这次夜间视察。
They surveyed the damage inflicted by the storm.他们调查了暴风雨造成的损失。
She surveyed me haughtily over the top of her glasses.她傲慢地从眼镜的上方审视我。
For this book, the author has surveyed recent developments in linguistics.为了写这本书,作者研究了语言学目前的发展情况。
They have started to survey the country that the new motorway will pass through .他们已开始测量这条新公路将要通过的农村。
The work of surveying and determining the frontier of all the cities and districts went on smoothly.我省重新勘定各市、区边界的工作进展顺利。
They sadly surveyed the scene before them.他们悲伤地环视眼前的情景。

survive

[sə'vaɪv], [sər'vaɪv]


Image Search
vt. 幸免于难；存活；艰难度过；比 ... 活得长
vi. 活着；继续存在
continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship.
continue to live or exist in spite of (an accident or ordeal).
remain alive after the death of (a particular person).
manage to keep going in difficult circumstances.
"against all odds the child survived"
"he has survived several assassination attempts"
"he was survived by his wife and six children"
"she had to work day and night and survive on two hours' sleep"
She was the only one to survive the crash.她是这次飞机失事的唯一幸存者。
These birds are able to survive the perils of the Arctic winter.这些鸟能在北极寒冷的冬天里生存。
I don't know how I ever survived high school.我都不知道我是怎样熬过高中那段岁月的。
Santos is survived by his wife of 49 years.桑托斯的妻子比他多活了49年。
You need to be tough to survive in the jungle.要在丛林中活下来就要有坚忍不拔的意志。
We cannot survive for long without food and drink.我们没有食物和饮料就活不了多久。

suspended

[sə'spendɪd], [sə'spendɪd]


Image Search
adj. 被暂时搁置的
(of a sentence) imposed by a judge or court but not enforced as long as no further offense is committed within a specified period.
(of solid particles) dispersed through the bulk of a fluid.
supported by attachment from above; hanging.
temporarily prevent from continuing or being in force or effect.
officially prohibit (someone) from holding their usual post or carrying out their usual role for a particular length of time.
defer or delay (an action, event, or judgment).
(of a judge or court) cause (an imposed sentence) not to be enforced as long as no further offense is committed within a specified period.
hang (something) from somewhere.
(of solid particles) be dispersed throughout the bulk of a fluid.
"he was given a suspended prison sentence of 22 months"
"suspended sediments inhibit the sun's energy from being used for reef building"
"small vents in the suspended ceilings supply fresh air"
"work on the dam was suspended"
"two officers were suspended from duty pending the outcome of the investigation"
"the judge suspended judgment until January 15"
"the sentence was suspended for six months"
"the light was suspended from the ceiling"
"the paste contains collagen suspended in a salt solution"
She was lucky to get off with a suspended sentence.她侥幸被判缓刑。
She was suspended from school for stealing.她因有偷窃行为遭勒令停学处分。
The judge gave him a nine-month suspended sentence.法官判处他9个月监禁，缓期执行。
A lamp was suspended from the ceiling above us.我们头顶上的天花板上吊著一盏灯。
The policeman was suspended while the complaint was investigated.因该警察遭投诉，在调查期间已令其暂停职务。
The daily flight to the city has been temporarily suspended because of the earthquake.因为地震，每天飞往这个城市的航班暂停了。
The driver's certificate was suspended by the police.这个司机的驾驶执照被警察吊销了。
His license was suspended for six months.他的执照被吊销6个月。

sustainable

[sə'steɪnəbl], [sə'steɪnəbl]


Image Search
adj. 可持续的；合理利用的；养得起的；可承受的
able to be maintained at a certain rate or level.
conserving an ecological balance by avoiding depletion of natural resources.
able to be upheld or defended.
"sustainable fusion reactions"
"our fundamental commitment to sustainable development"
"sustainable definitions of good educational practice"
Sustainable development is the common target of human beings.可持续的合理发展是人类追求的共同目标。
In our nation, we've just started to take a fresh look at our sustainable development strategy.我国开始重新审视我们的可持续发展战略。
We should advocate the sustainable use of rainforest resources.我们应该提倡热带雨林资源的合理利用。
Is your salary sustainable for your whole family?你的薪水够养活你全家人吗？

swindle

['swɪndl], ['swɪndl]


Image Search
v. 诈骗；骗取
n. 诈取；骗局
use deception to deprive (someone) of money or possessions.
obtain (money) fraudulently.
a fraudulent scheme or action.
"a businessman swindled investors out of millions of dollars"
"he was said to have swindled $62.5 million from the pension fund"
"he is mixed up in a $10 million insurance swindle"
He tried to swindle the insurance company.他企图诈骗保险公司。
Honest merchants do not swindle their customers.诚实的商人不欺骗他们的顾客。
The gang swindle the bank out of $1.5m.该团伙骗走银行150万美元。
I got bitten in a mail order swindle.我在一次邮购诈欺中受骗了。
The big bank swindle involved a lot of people.许多人与这起诈骗银行的大案有牵连。
It is nothing more or less than a swindle.这完完全全是一个骗局。

swoop

[swuːp], [swuːp]


Image Search
v. 抓取；猛扑；突然袭击
n. 俯冲；攫取；突然袭击
(especially of a bird) move rapidly downward through the air.
carry out a sudden attack, especially in order to make a capture or arrest.
seize with a sweeping motion.
a swooping or snatching movement or action.
"the barn owl can swoop down on a mouse in total darkness"
"investigators swooped on the Graf family home"
"she swooped up the hen in her arms"
"four members were arrested following a swoop by detectives on their homes"
The robber swooped up the banknotes.劫匪把钞票一把抢走了。
The eagle poised in mid-air ready to swoop on its prey.那鹰在半空中盘旋准备扑向猎物。
The owl swooped down on the mouse.那只猫头鹰向着老鼠猛扑下来。
We decided to swoop down upon the enemy there.我们决定突袭驻在那里的敌人。
The plane made a swoop over the city.那架飞机突然向这座城市猛降下来。
Police made a dawn swoop.警方于拂晓时发动了突袭。

symbolic

[sɪm'bɒlɪk], [sɪm'bɒlɪk]


Image Search
adj. 象征的；符号的
n. 代号
serving as a symbol.
significant purely in terms of what is being represented or implied.
involving the use of symbols or symbolism.
"a repeating design symbolic of eternity"
"the release of the dissident was an important symbolic gesture"
"the symbolic meaning of motifs and designs"
It is highly philosophical and symbolic.其中蕴涵着深刻的哲理和丰富的象征。
A wedding ring is usually a symbolic gesture of love.结婚戒指通常是爱情象征的表示。
Dreams of ill health can be either literal or symbolic warnings.生病的梦会是真正的或象征的警告。
The power of the monarchy in britain today is more symbolical than real.今日英国君主的权力多为象征性的，无甚实际意义。
MatLab has a strong symbolic operation function.MatLab具有强大的符号运算功能.

symphony

['sɪmfəni], ['sɪmfəni]


Image Search
n. 交响乐
an elaborate musical composition for full orchestra, typically in four movements, at least one of which is traditionally in sonata form.
an orchestral interlude in a large-scale vocal work.
something regarded, typically favorably, as a composition of different elements.
(especially in names of orchestras) short for symphony orchestra.
"autumn is a symphony of texture and pattern"
"the Boston Symphony"
The first movement of the symphony is beautiful.这部交响乐的第一乐章是很优美的。
I like listening to the symphony.我喜欢听交响乐。

syncope

['sɪŋkəpi], ['sɪŋkəpi]


Image Search
n. [语]字中音省略；中略；[医]昏厥
temporary loss of consciousness caused by a fall in blood pressure.
the omission of sounds or letters from within a word, e.g., when probably is pronounced ˈpräblē.
Can you give me some medicine to calm the syncope down?你有什么药能治我这晕厥病吗?

syndicate

['sɪndɪkət], ['sɪndɪkət]


Image Search
n. 企业联合
v. 联合组织
a group of individuals or organizations combined to promote some common interest.
an association or agency supplying material simultaneously to a number of newspapers or periodicals.
a committee of syndics.
control or manage by a syndicate.
publish or broadcast (material) simultaneously in a number of newspapers, television stations, etc.
sell (a horse) to a syndicate.
"large-scale buyouts involving a syndicate of financial institutions"
"the loans are syndicated to a group of banks"
"his reports were syndicated to 200 other papers"
"the stallion was syndicated for a record $5.4 million"
A syndicate of local businessmen is bidding for the contract.一个当地企业家的联合组织在向这一合同投标。

synopsis

[sɪ'nɒpsɪs], [sɪ'nɑːpsɪs]


Image Search
n. 摘要；概要
a brief summary or general survey of something.
an outline of the plot of a book, play, movie, or episode of a television show.
"a synopsis of the accident"
He just wants the synopsis and the list of options.他只想要选项的摘要和列表。
The synopsis of the book is very good.这本书的梗概非常好。
Biographies, filmographies and synopsis can also be sent on a separate sheet.您也可以将个人简介、电影作品目录及参赛作品介绍作为附件寄来。

tacky

['tæki], ['tæki]


Image Search
adj. 发粘的；俗气的；破烂的
(of glue, paint, or other substances) retaining a slightly sticky feel; not fully dry.
showing poor taste and quality.
"the paint was still tacky"
"even in her faintly tacky costumes, she won our hearts"
The paint is still tacky so don't touch it.油漆未干，切勿碰摸。
The solution must be allowed to become tacky.必须让胶水发粘。
She looks really tacky in that dress.她穿那件衣服看起来俗不可耐。
This is sort of tacky gift for a birthday.这个生日礼物有点俗气。
The tacky tractor trailers trucks.破烂的拖拉机是用来拖卡车的。

tact

[tækt], [tækt]


Image Search
n. 机智；手法
adroitness and sensitivity in dealing with others or with difficult issues.
"the inspector broke the news to me with tact and consideration"
We reposed great trust in his tact and discretion.我们极为信任他的机智和谨慎。
A minister of foreign affairs has to have tact.外交部长必须机智老练。

tally

['tæli], ['tæli]


Image Search
n. 帐；记分；一致；标签
vt. 计算；记录；使一致
vi. 计算；记分；一致
a current score or amount.
a record of a score or amount.
a particular number taken as a group or unit to facilitate counting.
a mark registering a number or amount.
a piece of wood scored across with notches for the items of an account and then split into halves, each party keeping one.
an account kept on a tally stick.
a counterpart or duplicate of something.
a label attached to a plant or tree, or stuck in the ground beside it, that gives information about it, such as its name and class.
agree or correspond.
calculate the total number of.
"that takes his tally to 10 goals in 10 games"
"I kept a running tally of David's debt on a note above my desk"
"their signatures should tally with their names on the register"
"the votes were being tallied with abacuses"
Don't forget to keep a careful tally of what you spend.别忘了仔细记下你的开支帐目。
You can buy on tally in this shop.在这家商店里可以赊购。
He added to his tally in the last minute.他在比赛最后一分钟又得了分。
All the figures tally with the projected total.合计和预算的总额一致。
What you are now doing does not quite tally with your statement.你现在的所作所为与你声称的不大一致。
The tally of computation and observation is in a good agreement.将计算值与实测资料比较，结果表明符合程度良好。
When the votes were counted, they fell short of the tally needed for a non-binding resolution rejecting a troop buildup.当计算票数时，其议员感觉在对于无须遵守的表决抵制集结军队的一项缺少纪录。
Our team tallied three runs in that inning.我队在那一局中得三分。
The tally of computation and observation is in a good agreement.将计算值与实测资料比较，结果表明符合程度良好。
When the votes were counted, they fell short of the tally needed for a non-binding resolution rejecting a troop buildup.当计算票数时，其议员感觉在对于无须遵守的表决抵制集结军队的一项缺少纪录。
The two lists do not tally.这两张单子不相符。
His account of the accident tallies with yours.他对该故事的说法和你一样。

tangible

['tændʒəbl], ['tændʒəbl]


Image Search
adj. 可触摸的；实际的；有形的；确凿的
perceptible by touch.
clear and definite; real.
a thing that is perceptible by touch.
"the atmosphere of neglect and abandonment was almost tangible"
"the emphasis is now on tangible results"
It is the only tangible object the astronomer can handle.这是天文学家能够掌握的唯一可接触的对象。
The tension between them was almost tangible.他们之间的紧张关系几乎让人都感觉得出来。
The plan brought few tangible benefits to the poor.这个计划没有给穷人带来多少实际好处。
Fossils give us tangible evidence that dinosaurs really existed.化石给了我们恐龙确实存在的确切证据。

taper

['teɪpə(r)], ['teɪpər]


Image Search
n. 小蜡烛；蜡芯；尖锥形；渐弱
v. 逐渐变小；逐渐消失
adj. 尖细的；划分等级的
diminish or reduce or cause to diminish or reduce in thickness toward one end.
gradually lessen.
a slender candle.
a wick coated with wax, used for conveying a flame.
a gradual narrowing.
a gradual or incremental reduction.
"the tail tapers to a rounded tip"
"the impact of the dollar's depreciation started to taper off"
"the current industry standard taper of 5 degrees"
"with the taper in training, athletes can feel less hungry"
They had red tapers on the table at Christmastime.在圣诞节期间他们在桌子上点红色的细蜡烛。
Financial aids generally taper off after the first year of college.助学金通常在大学一年级之后逐渐减少。
Taper the plug off a bit with the chisel so that it will fit into the hole.用凿子把塞子的一头削掉一点，使它能塞进洞里。
The storm is beginning to taper off now.风暴现在逐渐减弱了。

tapes

[teɪps], [teɪps]


Image Search
n. 胶纸带；磁带
名词tape的复数形式.
a narrow strip of material, typically used to hold or fasten something.
long narrow flexible material with magnetic properties, used for recording sound, pictures, or computer data.
a cassette or reel containing recorded material.
a recording on a cassette or reel.
a strip of paper or plastic coated with adhesive, used to stick things together.
a strip of material stretched across the finish line of a race, to be broken by the winner.
a strip of white material at the top of a tennis net.
a strip of material used to mark off an area.
a tape measure.
record (sound or pictures) on audio or videotape.
fasten or attach (something) with adhesive tape.
seal or mark off an area or thing with tape.
"a roll of tape"
"it is not known who taped the conversation"
The police seized various books and tapes.警方查获了各种书和磁带。
Borrowing tapes from the library would be the next-best thing.从资料库借磁带是退而求其次的办法。
You can use these tapes as aural material.你可以把这些磁带当作听力材料。
The reproductive quality of audio tapes has improved enormously.录音磁带的复制质量有了很大改进。

target

['tɑːɡɪt], ['tɑːrɡɪt]


Image Search
n. 目标；对象；靶
vt. 把 ... 作为目标；瞄准
a person, object, or place selected as the aim of an attack.
a mark or point at which someone fires or aims, especially a round or rectangular board marked with concentric circles used in archery or shooting.
an objective or result toward which efforts are directed.
a person or thing against whom criticism or abuse is or may be directed.
an idealization of the articulation of a speech sound, with reference to which actual utterances can be described.
a small round shield or buckler.
select as an object of attention or attack.
aim or direct (something).
"the car met its sales target in record time"
"two men were targeted by the attackers"
"a significant nuclear capability targeted on the US"
The sights of the gun must be in alignment with the target.枪的瞄准器必须与射击目标对准成一线。
The shot was way off target.这次射得远离目标。
A stationary target is easiest to aim at.静止的目标是最容易瞄准的。
The company has met their export target.该公司已经实现了它们的出口目标。
Before you apply for the supply of information, please make sure that you know the business registration number of all your target businesses.在作出申请前,你必须知悉所有查询对象的商业登记号码。
I aimed at the target but hit the wall.我瞄准了靶射击,但却打在了墙上。
In the future, the Group will target its marketing and promotional activities to reach the mass of customers through cost effective means.展望未来,集团将在具成本效益的情况下,以市场推广及宣传活动为目标,把九方推广至广大消费者。
The two sides had decided not to target each other with the strategic nuclear weapons under their respective control.双方决定,不把各自控制下的战略核武器瞄准对方。

taro

['tɑːrəʊ], ['tɑːroʊ]


Image Search
n. 芋头
a tropical Asian plant of the arum family that has edible starchy corms and edible fleshy leaves, especially a variety with a large central corm grown as a staple in the Pacific.
the corm of the taro plant.
They were the first people to cultivate taro.他们是最先开始种植芋头的人。
Taro is a tropical plant used widely in the Pacific Islands.芋头是太平洋群岛普遍食用的热带植物。

tarry

['tæri], ['tæri]


Image Search
v. 耽搁；逗留
adj. 用柏油覆盖的
of, like, or covered with tar.
stay longer than intended; delay leaving a place.
"a length of tarry rope"
"she could tarry a bit and not get home until four"
Then open the door, and flee, and tarry not.说完了，就开门逃跑，不要迟延。
Why did he tarry so long on his way?他为什么在途中耽搁了那么久?
He tarried for a few days in my house.他在我家里小住了几天。
Tarry awhile at this charming country inn.在这个可爱的乡村小酒馆里呆一会儿吧。
This road needs to be tarry so that it can last longer.这条路需要用柏油覆盖才能用更长的时间。

tart

an open pastry case containing a filling.
a woman who dresses or behaves in a way that is considered tasteless and sexually provocative.
a prostitute.
dress or make oneself up in order to look attractive or eye-catching.
decorate or improve the appearance of something.
sharp or acid in taste.
(of a remark or tone of voice) cutting, bitter, or sarcastic.
"the tarts were touting for trade"
"the page layouts have been tarted up with cartoons"
"a tart apple"
"I bit back a tart reply"
She replied, speaking for the first time, in her usual tart and offhand way.于是她开口回答了，用她平常那种尖酸刻薄的声调随口说道。
She popped the tart into the oven.她把果馅饼很快地放进烤箱里。

task

[tɑːsk], [tæsk]


Image Search
n. 任务；工作
vt. 交给某人（任务)；使做艰苦的工作
a piece of work to be done or undertaken.
assign a piece of work to.
make great demands on (someone's resources or abilities).
"NATO troops are tasked with separating the warring parties"
"it tasked his diplomatic skill to effect his departure in safety"
It's an arduous task.这是一项艰巨的任务。
It is an irksome task.那是件令人厌烦的工作。
Her work is a laborious task.她的工作很艰苦。
This is a task well within your ability.这完全是你力所能及的工作。
We should devote all our efforts to task.我们应该全力以赴地工作。

taskmaster

['tɑːskmɑːstə(r)], ['tæskmæstər]


Image Search
n. 工头(监工)；严厉的主人、师父或教师
a person who imposes a harsh or onerous workload on someone.
The profession of medicine is a stern taskmaster. 医生这个职业总要求其从事者承担繁重的任务
You are now halfway through this taskmaster's visit to your sign. 经由这个监工对你宫位的拜访，你正处于中间状态。
I see the evil taskmaster with arms crossed and foot tapping. 我甚至能看到那邪恶的工头站在面前，双臂交叉，脚尖打着拍子。
Captives are altogether at ease; They do not hear the voice of the taskmaster. 18被囚的人同得安逸，听不见督工的声音。
When I was in the Army, Lt. Surge was my strict CO. He was a hard taskmaster . 当我在军中的时候;马志士上尉是我严格的指挥官;他可是一个严厉的上司.
She was such a taskmaster when we worked together on a group project. 我们一起做项目的时候，她对我们的要求非常严格。

tattered

['tætəd], ['tætərd]


Image Search
adj. 破烂的；衣服褴褛的
动词tatter的过去式和过去分词形式.
old and torn; in poor condition.
"an old woman in tattered clothes"
He persists in wearing his tattered overcoat.他坚持要穿他破烂的大衣。
The bum wore a tattered sweater and ripped pants.那个流浪汉的运动衫和裤子破旧褴褛。
Their tattered clothing and broken furniture indicated their poverty.他们褴褛的衣服和破烂的家具显出他们的贫穷。

taunt

[tɔːnt], [tɔːnt]


Image Search
n. 辱骂；嘲弄
v. 嘲弄
a remark made in order to anger, wound, or provoke someone.
provoke or challenge (someone) with insulting remarks.
reproach (someone) with something in a contemptuous way.
"students began taunting her about her weight"
"she had taunted him with going to another man"
His genial sufficiency was a taunt and a mockery to many.他那么和蔼自满的态度，许多人都认为是一种辱骂和嘲弄。
But in England if the palm faces inward it's a taunt, especially if executed with an up-ward jerk of the fingers.可在英国，做该手势时如果掌心向内，特别是还同时把手指往上伸的话，则表示对人的辱骂。
He will taunt an opponent endlessly, even during battle, raising their ire until they make a fatal mistake - and then take advantage of them.即使在战斗中，他也会无休止的嘲弄对手，激起他们的怒气直到他们犯下致命错误，然后他就会取得优势。

taut

[tɔːt], [tɔːt]


Image Search
adj. 拉紧的；绷紧的；紧张的；整洁的
stretched or pulled tight; not slack.
(especially of muscles or nerves) tense; not relaxed.
(of writing, music, etc.) concise and controlled.
(of a ship) having a disciplined and efficient crew.
"the fabric stays taut without adhesive"
"a taut text of only a hundred and twenty pages"
If a bow-string is too taut, it will snap.拉得太紧，弓弦就会断。
The lovely mouth was taut with irony.漂亮的嘴讥讽地绷紧着。
He had a taut expression on his face, apparently very angry.他脸紧绷绷的，像很生气的样子。
As she rubbed those taut muscles, she hummed and prayed.她一边蹭着紧张的肌肉，一边嘟嘟囔囔地祈祷着。
He waved his arm at the taut wire of the horizon.他挥臂指向笔直的地平线。

teal

[tiːl], [tiːl]


Image Search
n. 蓝绿色；水鸭
adj. 蓝绿色的
a small freshwater duck, typically with a greenish band on the wing that is most prominent in flight.
a dark greenish-blue color.
For example, the color may be aqua, teal, or green.例如,颜色可以是浅绿、蓝绿色,或者绿色。
This would moisten a bit of the exposed lake bed and provide an emergency stopover for the enormous flocks of geese, avocets, grebes and teal that visit the Salton Sea.这可以使裸露的河床潮湿一点，给鹅群，长嘴鸟，水鸟没，野鸭等提供暂时在索尔顿湖的栖息之地。
I was shocked and saw the sky quickly, and there was a teal fireball past slowly.我吓了一跳迅速往天空看，看到一枚蓝绿色的光球缓慢的划过。

team

[tiːm], [tiːm]


Image Search
n. 队；组
v. 使相配；使合作；结成一队
adj. 团队的
a group of players forming one side in a competitive game or sport.
two or more people working together.
used before another word to form the name of a real or notional group which supports or favors the person or thing indicated.
two or more animals, especially horses, harnessed together to pull a vehicle.
come together as a team to achieve a common goal.
match or coordinate a garment with (another).
harness (animals, especially horses) together to pull a vehicle.
"a team of researchers"
"are you team Mac or team PC?"
"he teamed up with the band to produce the album"
"a pinstripe suit teamed with a crisp white shirt"
"the horses are teamed in pairs"
John is the spark plug on his rowing team.约翰是划船队的中坚分子。
A cricket team is comprised of eleven players.一个板球队由11名队员组成。
A team of nurses assisted the doctor in performing the operation.一组护士协助医生施行手术。
It's hard to team these colours up.把这些颜色配起来是困难的。
He didn't want to team up with anybody.他不想与任何人合作。
Volleyball is a team game.排球是一项要求全队默契配合的运动。
We won't hire anyone who isn't team player.我们不会雇佣不配合集体工作的人。

technical

['teknɪkl], ['teknɪkl]


Image Search
adj. 技术的；专业的；工艺的
relating to a particular subject, art, or craft, or its techniques.
(especially of a book or article) requiring special knowledge to be understood.
of, involving, or concerned with applied and industrial sciences.
resulting from mechanical failure.
according to a strict application or interpretation of the law or rules.
short for technical foul.
"technical terms"
"a technical report"
"an important technical achievement"
"a technical fault"
"the arrest was a technical violation of the treaty"
On technical matters, I defer to the experts.在技术问题上，我遵从专家的意见。
The flight was delayed owing to technical reasons.这次飞行由于技术的原因而被推迟。
This book is too technical for me.对我来说，这本书太专业了。
The article is full of technical terms.这篇文章满篇皆是专业术语。
It is special craft art technical skill in Yunnan.这是云南独特的工艺美术技艺。

techniques

[tek'niːks], [tek'niːks]


Image Search
n. 技术；技巧
名词technique的复数形式.
a way of carrying out a particular task, especially the execution or performance of an artistic work or a scientific procedure.
skill or ability in a particular field.
a skillful or efficient way of doing or achieving something.
"he has excellent technique"
"tape recording is a good technique for evaluating our own communications"
A surge of innovation in techniques is on the horizon.技术改进的浪潮即将出现。
The workers are trying to apply modern techniques to this traditional craft.工人们试图将现代技术用于这项传统工业。
Our comrades must do their utmost to learn the techniques of production.我们的同志们必须用极大的努力去学习生产技术。
Taking tests needs some special techniques.参加考试需要一些特殊的技巧。

technology

[tek'nɒlədʒi], [tek'nɑːlədʒi]


Image Search
n. 技术；工艺；工艺学
the application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry.
machinery and equipment developed from the application of scientific knowledge.
the branch of knowledge dealing with engineering or applied sciences.
"advances in computer technology"
The government saw the introduction of new technology as vital.政府认为引进新技术至关重要。
Britain is behind Japan in developing modern technologies.在发展现代技术方面英国落后于日本。
He majors in engine technology in this college.他在这所学院主修发动机工艺。
They are studying chemical technology.他们在研究化学工艺学。

telco

['telkəʊ], ['telkoʊ]


Image Search
n. 电话公司
a telecommunications company.
Our training courses are targeted for IT and Telco professionals. 我们的培训课程是以IT与电信业专业人士为定位的。
The Internet is rapidly replacing the telco's own network. 网络正迅速地替换网络供应商自己的网络。
Vacuum tube amplifiers used the first time in coast-to-coast telco circuits. 真空管放大器首次用于大西洋岸至太平洋岸的电信电路中。
The new company you will join is a Telco giant with solid reputation. 你要加盟的新公司是声誉显赫的电信业巨臂。
Proctor Test Set is a tool used by Telco personnel to diagnose problems with phone lines. 代理测试集是电讯工作人员用来检测电话线路问题的一种工具。
Confirming Design Layout Report Date. The date a common carrier accepts the facility designed proposed by the Telco. 确认设计布局报告日期。公用电信公司接受电信公司提议设计的设备的日期。

telegraph

['telɪɡrɑːf], ['telɪɡræf]


Image Search
n. 电报；电报机
vt. 打电报；显示
a system for transmitting messages from a distance along a wire, especially one creating signals by making and breaking an electrical connection.
a device for transmitting messages by telegraph.
send (someone) a message by telegraph.
send (a message) by telegraph.
convey (an intentional or unconscious message), especially with facial expression or body language.
"news came from the outside world by telegraph"
"I must go and telegraph Mom"
"she would rush off to telegraph news to her magazine"
"a tiny movement of her arm telegraphed her intention to strike"
It was in an obscure warehouse on Telegraph Road.那是电报路上一座不明显的仓库。
Telegraph to her parents at once.立即给她父母打电报。
Send the message on the telegraph.这个消息用电报机发出。
A teleprinter is really a machine which sends a typewriter message over a telegraph circuit.打字电报机实际上是一种在电报电路上传送打印信息的机器。

template

['templeɪt], ['templeɪt]


Image Search
n. 样板；模板
a shaped piece of metal, wood, card, plastic, or other material used as a pattern for processes such as painting, cutting out, shaping, or drilling.
something that serves as a model for others to copy.
a preset format for a document or file, used so that the format does not have to be recreated each time it is used.
a nucleic acid molecule that acts as a pattern for the sequence of assembly of a protein, nucleic acid, or other large molecule.
a timber or plate used to distribute the weight in a wall or under a support.
"the plant was to serve as the template for change throughout the company"
"a memo template"
This template allows for slight song variations.这个样板可以允许歌声稍有变化。
The French Revolution was the template for all the future revolutions.法国革命是后来所有革命的样板。
Save the active document or template with its current name.以其目前的名字保存当前的文件或模板。
A template is like an online blank form.模板类似于一份联机空白表格。

temporary

['temprəri], ['tempəreri]


Image Search
adj. 暂时的；临时的
n. 临时工
lasting for only a limited period of time; not permanent.
a person employed on a temporary basis, typically an office worker who finds employment through an agency.
"a temporary job"
He suffered a temporary loss of memory.他暂时丧失了记忆。
My love for you is not a temporary madness.我对你的爱意,并不是暂时的疯狂。
The two parties procured a temporary agreement.双方达成了临时协议。
I engaged a young woman as a temporary secretary.我雇用一位年轻妇女当临时秘书。
The huts can be made into temporary houses.这些简陋的小屋可改装为临时住宅。
The boss hired some temporary workers.老板雇佣了一些临时工。
She works in the office as a temporary.她在办公室做临时雇员。

tenable

['tenəbl], ['tenəbl]


Image Search
adj. 站得住脚的；无懈可击的
able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection.
(of an office, position, scholarship, etc.) able to be held or used.
"such a simplistic approach is no longer tenable"
"the post is tenable for three years"
None of these arguments are tenable.这些论点没有一个是站得住脚的。
The lectureship is tenable for a period of three years.讲师这一职位任期三年。
In a word, our theory is tenable.综上所述，我们的理论成立。

tenacious

[tə'neɪʃəs], [tə'neɪʃəs]


Image Search
adj. 抓紧的；坚决的；(记忆力)强的
tending to keep a firm hold of something; clinging or adhering closely.
not readily relinquishing a position, principle, or course of action; determined.
persisting in existence; not easily dispelled.
"a tenacious grip"
"you're tenacious and you get at the truth"
"a tenacious local legend"
He hold on to my arm with a tenacious grip.他紧紧抓住我的手臂不放。
The eagle seized its prey in a tenacious grip.鹰将捕获物紧紧抓住。
She is tenacious in defence of her rights.她坚决维护自己的权利.
He is tenacious of his opinions.他固执己见。

tend

[tend], [tend]


Image Search
v. 趋向；易于；朝向
v. 照料；照管
regularly or frequently behave in a particular way or have a certain characteristic.
be liable to possess or display (a particular characteristic).
go or move in a particular direction.
approach (a quantity or limit).
care for or look after; give one's attention to.
direct or manage; work in.
wait on as an attendant or servant.
"written language tends to be formal"
"Walter tended toward corpulence"
"the road tends west around small mountains"
"the Fourier coefficients tend to zero"
"Viola tended plants on the roof"
"I've been tending bar at the airport lounge"
Weeds tend to displace other plants.杂草越来越多，有取代其他植物之势。
During the interview, some interviewees tend to exaggerate.面试时,有些面试者会有夸大的倾向。
He's a good salesman, but his offhand manner does tend to put people off.他是个很好的推销员，可是他那随便的态度容易使人产生反感。
Prices are tending upward.物价在上涨。
Mother being ill, he had to tend her at home.母亲病了,他得在家照料她。
You'd better tend to your own affairs.你还是管好自己的事情吧!

tension

['tenʃn], ['tenʃn]


Image Search
n. 紧张；拉力；张力；紧张状态；[电]电压
vt. 使拉紧；使绷紧
the state of being stretched tight.
the state of having the muscles stretched tight, especially as causing strain or discomfort.
a strained state or condition resulting from forces acting in opposition to each other.
the degree of tightness of stitches in knitting and machine sewing.
electromotive force.
mental or emotional strain.
a strained political or social state or relationship.
a relationship between ideas or qualities with conflicting demands or implications.
apply a force to (something) which tends to stretch it.
"the parachute keeps the cable under tension as it drops"
"the elimination of neck tension can relieve headaches"
"a mind that is affected by stress or tension cannot think as clearly"
"the coup followed months of tension between the military and the government"
"the basic tension between freedom and control"
The tension is building up.形势逐步紧张起来。
The tension soon transmitted itself to all the members of the crowd.这种紧张情绪很快感染了人群中所有的人。
A positive-stress component means tension.正应力分量表示拉力。
If a wire is held under tension, it gets slightly longer.电线在拉力状态下会变得略微长点。
A leather loop that slides to change the tension on the cord of a drum.滑动皮环通过滑动以改变鼓弦张力的皮环
This wire will take 50 pounds tension before breaking.这根金属线在断裂之前能承受五十磅的张力。
Tension mounted as we waited for the exam results to be published.我们在等待公布考试结果时气氛越来越紧张。
high tension unit for x-ray television diagnosisX线电视诊断用高电压装置

tepid

['tepɪd], ['tepɪd]


Image Search
adj. 微温的；不热心的
(especially of a liquid) only slightly warm; lukewarm.
showing little enthusiasm.
"the applause was tepid"
Her feet firmly planted on the tepid rough brick of the floor.她一双脚稳固地立在微温而粗糙的砖地上。
The play was greeted with tepid applause.这台戏只得到了零落的掌声。
The critics's reaction to the film was rather tepid.评论家对那部影片的反映不太热烈。

termination

[ˌtɜːmɪ'neɪʃn], [ˌtɜːrmɪ'neɪʃn]


Image Search

an induced abortion.
an act of dismissing someone from employment.
an assassination, especially of an intelligence agent.

an ending or result of a specified kind.
"the termination of a contract"
"a good result and a happy termination"
She chose to have an early termination.她选择了早期终止妊娠。
I was discharged of all my obligations after my termination.在我的合同终止时，我的义务也终止了。
How long is the termination period of your present position?您现在的劳动合同什么时候结束?
This affair was brought to a happy termination.这件事得到圆满的结果。

terrain

[tə'reɪn], [tə'reɪn]


Image Search
n. 地带；地形
a stretch of land, especially with regard to its physical features.
variant form of terrane.
a fault-bounded area or region with a distinctive stratigraphy, structure, and geological history.
"they were delayed by rough terrain"
The car blitzed through rough terrain.这辆汽车长驱穿越了崎岖地带。
Valley glaciers are confined to valleys in mountainous terrain.山谷冰川只限于多山地带的山谷。
It's a difficult terrain for tanks.这是坦克作战的困难地形。
They stopped and began to reconnoitre the terrain.他们停下来，开始勘测地形。
The terrain in that part of the country is as falt as a board.这个国家有些地方的地形很平坦。

Her reply about the matter was terse.她对此事的答复简明扼要。

She sent a testimonial from her former employer when applying for the post.她申请那职位时寄去了前雇主的推荐书。
At the testimonial dinner everyone flattered him shamelessly .在庆祝获奖宴会上，每个人都对他进行无耻的奉承。

text

[tekst], [tekst]


Image Search
n. 正文；文本；课文；原文
v. 发短信
a book or other written or printed work, regarded in terms of its content rather than its physical form.
a piece of written or printed material regarded as conveying the authentic or primary form of a particular work.
written or printed words, typically forming a connected piece of work.
data in the form of words or alphabetic characters.
the main body of a book or other piece of writing, as distinct from other material such as notes, appendices, and illustrations.
a script or libretto.
a written work chosen or assigned as a subject of study.
a textbook.
a passage from the Bible or other religious work, especially when used as the subject of a sermon.
a subject or theme for a discussion or exposition.
a text message.
fine, large handwriting, used especially for manuscripts.
send a text message to.
"a text that explores pain and grief"
"in some passages it is difficult to establish the original text"
"stylistic features of journalistic text"
"the pictures are clear and relate well to the text"
"the book is intended as a secondary text for religion courses"
"he took as his text the fact that Australia is paradise"
"I thought it was fantastic that he took the trouble to text me"
The text is accompanied by illustrations.正文附有插图。
It was edited from the original text.这是根据原文本编译的。
Read the text first and then explain the new words.先读课文，然后解释生词。
He studied Shakespeare's texts.他学习了莎士比亚的原作。
The translation should fully express the meaning of the original text.译文应充分地表达原文的意思。
Laura, will you text me the venue again?劳拉,你能把聚会地点再给我发一次吗？

theme

[θiːm], [θiːm]


Image Search
n. 主题；题目；主旋律
the subject of a talk, a piece of writing, a person's thoughts, or an exhibition; a topic.
the first major constituent of a clause, indicating the subject-matter, typically being the subject but optionally other constituents, as in “ poor he is not.”.
an essay written by a student on an assigned subject.
an idea that recurs in or pervades a work of art or literature.
a prominent or frequently recurring melody or group of notes in a composition.
(of music) frequently recurring in or accompanying the beginning and end of a film, play, or musical.
a setting given to a leisure venue or activity, intended to evoke a particular country, historical period, culture, etc.
the stem of a noun or verb; the part to which inflections are added, especially one composed of the root and an added vowel.
any of the twenty-nine provinces in the Byzantine empire.
give a particular setting or ambience to (a venue or activity).
"the theme of the sermon was reverence"
"a theme song"
"a family fun park with a western theme"
"the amusement park will be themed as a Caribbean pirate stronghold"
Peace was the dominant theme of the conference.和平是大会的首要议题。
What is the essential theme of the play?这剧本的主题是什麽?
The theme for tonight's talk is education.今天谈话的题目是教育。
The theme of our discussion was Europe in the 1980's'.我们讨论的题目是｀八十年代的欧洲＇.
A slow theme introduces the first movement.第一乐章以缓慢的主旋律开始。

theory

['θɪəri], ['θɪri]


Image Search
n. 学说；理论；原理；意见
a supposition or a system of ideas intended to explain something, especially one based on general principles independent of the thing to be explained.
a set of principles on which the practice of an activity is based.
an idea used to account for a situation or justify a course of action.
a collection of propositions to illustrate the principles of a subject.
"Darwin's theory of evolution"
"a theory of education"
"my theory would be that the place has been seriously mismanaged"
There're many theories about the origin of life.关于生命起源的学说有很多。
In theory, anything could happen.理论上来说,任何事情都会发生。
Not everyone can understand Einstein's Theory of Relativity.不是每个人都能读懂爱因斯坦的相对论的。
In his book, he explained the operating theories of computer in detail.在他的书中,他详细阐述了计算机的工作原理。
Mary is full of fascinating theories about men and women.玛丽对男人和女人充满了迷人的想法。
She has a theory that drinking milk prevents cold.她有一种说法,认为喝牛奶能防止感冒。

thereby

[ˌðeə'baɪ], [ˌðer'baɪ]


Image Search
adv. 因此；从而
by that means; as a result of that.
"students perform in hospitals, thereby gaining a deeper awareness of the therapeutic power of music"
They paid cash, thereby avoiding interest charges.他们付了现款，因此不必另外加息。
He became a citizen, thereby gaining the right to vote.他成为公民，并因此获得了选举权。
I have never been to that city; thereby I don't know much about it.我从未去过那座城市,因此对它不怎么熟悉。
Suppliers will lower the price to increase sales, thereby moving toward equilibrium.供给者将降低价格以增加销售

thesis

['θiːsɪs], ['θiːsɪs]


Image Search
n. 毕业论文；论文；论题；论点；命题
a statement or theory that is put forward as a premise to be maintained or proved.
(in Hegelian philosophy) a proposition forming the first stage in the process of dialectical reasoning.
a long essay or dissertation involving personal research, written by a candidate for a college degree.
an unstressed syllable or part of a metrical foot in Greek or Latin verse.
"his central thesis is that psychological life is not part of the material world"
"a doctoral thesis"
Charles is writing his graduation thesis now.查尔斯正在写毕业论文。
He has already started his thesis.他已经开始写毕业论文了。
He wrote his doctoral thesis on electromagnetism.他写有关电磁的博士论文。
He's been pegging away at his thesis for months.他写论文已经忙了几个月了。
He is working hard at this thesis.他正在努力地撰写论文。
Is my thesis statement concise and clear?我的论题陈述是简洁而清楚的吗?
This is the most problematic part of his thesis.这是他论题中最有争议的部分。
He clearly presented his thesis.他把自己的论点阐述得很清楚。

thrifty

['θrɪfti], ['θrɪfti]


Image Search
adj. 节俭的；兴旺的；茁壮的
(of a person or their behavior) using money and other resources carefully and not wastefully.
(of livestock or plants) strong and healthy.
prosperous.
Her mother is a thrifty housewife.她妈妈是一个节俭的主妇。
Only very thrifty children manage to fill up a money-box.只有非常节俭的儿童才会设法填满一个储蓄罐。
Mr. Thompson is so thrifty that he is able to save more than half of his weekly salary.汤普森先生是如此节俭,以致他能省下超过一半的周薪。

thrive

[θraɪv], [θraɪv]


Image Search
vi. 兴旺；繁荣；茁壮成长
(of a child, animal, or plant) grow or develop well or vigorously.
prosper; flourish.
"the new baby thrived"
"education groups thrive on organization"
A business cannot thrive without good management.没有良好的经营管理，事业就不会兴旺发达。
But will they survive and thrive?但是，他们会生存下来并兴旺繁殖吗?
May our country prosper and thrive forever!希望我们的国家繁荣兴旺，长盛不衰。
A business can not thrive without investment.没有投资任何生意都无法繁荣。
Few plants or animals thrive in the desert.很少植物或动物能在沙漠中很好地生长。
Sheep do not thrive on long pasture.羊吃长草不能健壮。
Children thrive on fresh air and good food.儿童的健康成长需要有新鲜的空气和富有营养的食物。

thrombosis

[θrɒm'bəʊsɪs], [θrɑːm'boʊsɪs]


Image Search
n. [医]血栓形成；血栓症
local coagulation or clotting of the blood in a part of the circulatory system.
"increased risk of thrombosis"
Thrombosis may occur as early as the first day after cannulation.血栓形成可早在置管后第一天发生。

thwart

[θwɔːt], [θwɔːrt]


Image Search
v. 反对；阻碍
n. 座板
adv. 横过
adj. 横向的
prevent (someone) from accomplishing something.
oppose (a plan, attempt, or ambition) successfully.
a structural crosspiece sometimes forming a seat for a rower in a boat.
from one side to another side of; across.
"he never did anything to thwart his father"
"the government had been able to thwart all attempts by opposition leaders to form new parties"
"a pink-tinged cloud spread thwart the shore"
She intends to thwart his plans, and be revenged on him.她要破坏他的计划，以图报复。
Sometimes it isn't you I hate but your power to thwart me.有时让我讨厌的并不是你，而是你阻挠我的能力。
I don't think that will thwart our purposes.我认为那不会使我们的目的受到挫折。
Our course must thwart those designs.我们的方针是必须挫败他们这种企图。
He made the fish fast to bow and stern and to the middle thwart.他把绑鱼的绳子系在船头、船梢的中间的座板上。

timid

['tɪmɪd], ['tɪmɪd]


Image Search
adj. 胆怯的；害羞的
showing a lack of courage or confidence; easily frightened.
"I was too timid to ask for what I wanted"
They taunted him for being timid.他们讥笑他胆小。
He is as timid as a sheep.他像绵羊一样怯懦。
The least noise would startle the timid child.最小的响声也会吓着这个胆小的孩子的。
He is a timid boy; it's impossible for him to brawl with anyone.他是一个胆小的男孩，他不可能和任何人吵架。
She was too timid to talk with other travelers.她很害羞，不敢和其他旅行者交谈。
She is a timid cat.她是个腼腆的女人。
I wanted to take him fishing but I was too timid to ask him.我曾想带他去钓鱼，但我不好意思对他开口。

tint

[tɪnt], [tɪnt]


Image Search
n. 色彩； 浅色； 染发剂
vt. 给 ... 染色
a shade or variety of color.
an area of faint even color printed as a halftone, used for highlighting overprinted text.
a set of parallel engraved lines to give uniform shading.
a trace of something.
an artificial dye for coloring the hair.
an application of hair dye.
color (something) slightly; tinge.
dye (someone's hair) with a tint.
"the sky was taking on an apricot tint"
"a tint of glamour"
"peering into the mirror to see if any white hair showed after her last tint"
"her skin was tinted with delicate color"
Tint leaves the footage colors but wipes out darks.著色使得画面的色彩，但清除掉深色衣物。
Today salt-loving bacteria thrive in brine pools on the dry lake bed, lending a blood-red tint in this aerial view.如今，喜爱盐分的宅细菌在干涸湖床上的咸水池里繁茂生长，使得这幅空拍画面带着血红的色彩。
She gave me instructions on how to apply the tint.她告诉我如何使用染发剂。

tiptoe

['tɪptəʊ], ['tɪptoʊ]


Image Search
n. 脚尖
v. 用脚尖走
adv. 用脚尖
walk quietly and carefully with one's heels raised and one's weight on the balls of the feet.
carefully avoid discussing or dealing with (a difficult or sensitive subject).
"Liz tiptoed out of the room"
"he admits he has never been one to tiptoe around controversial issues"
If he stood on tiptoe, he could reach the shelf.如果他踮起脚尖，他能够到架子。
He stood on tiptoe and tried to see over the wall.他踮起脚尖，试图看到墙那边。
The nurse walked on tiptoe for fear of waking the patient.护士踮着脚走,生怕吵醒病人。
She does not tiptoe through life taking cues from others.她从来不依葫芦画瓢小心翼翼地生活。
She tiptoed across to the bed where the child was lying asleep.孩子睡了，她掂着脚走到床前。
There are deer that tiptoe into my yard and savor the fat apples in the snow.还有鹿悄悄地走进我家院子尽情享受雪地里大苹果的甘美。
I stood tiptoe upon a little hill.我踮着脚站在一座小山顶上。

tiresome

['taɪəsəm], ['taɪərsəm]


Image Search
adj. 令人厌倦的；讨厌的
causing one to feel bored or annoyed.
"weeding is a tiresome but essential job"
I had planned to go to your party, but you know I had to finish that tiresome paper.我原本打算去参加你的晚会，可你知道我还得完成那令人厌倦的考卷。
His speech is really tiresome.他的演讲实在令人厌倦。
Deliver me from such tiresome people.让我离开这些讨厌的人们吧。
He can be a very tiresome child at times.他有时候会是一个非常讨厌的孩子。

tog

[tɒɡ], [tɑːɡ]


Image Search
n. 衣服
v. 给穿上
clothes.
be or get dressed for a particular occasion or activity.
"running togs"
"we got togged up in our glad rags"
She asked the dog to bring her the tog.她要那只狗带来她的外套。
Get yourself togged up, and we are going out to celebrate.把漂亮衣服穿上

toil

[tɔɪl], [tɔɪl]


Image Search
n. 辛苦；苦工；罗网；圈套
v. 费力地做；苦干；跋涉
work extremely hard or incessantly.
move slowly and with difficulty.
exhausting physical labor.
"we toiled away"
"she began to toil up the cliff path"
"a life of toil"
We were quite exhausted with the toil.我们因那件辛苦的工作而感到十分疲惫。
Every grain of it comes from hard toil.粒粒皆辛苦。
Thus his youth had been spent in rude and ill-paid toil.他的青年时期便是那样在干着报酬微薄的辛苦工作中消磨过去的。
He was destined to plod the path of toil.他注定要在艰辛的道路上跋涉。
She was caught in the toils of despair.她陷于绝境。
The thief was caught in the toils of the law.窃贼落入了法网。
I shall have to toil and moil all my days.我必须一年到头拼命地干。
We toil away all afternoon to get the house ready for our guest.我们忙了一下午收拾房子准备迎接宾客。
The slaves toiled up the hill pulling the heavy blocks.那些奴隶艰难地把沉重的石块拖上山。

topic

['tɒpɪk], ['tɑːpɪk]


Image Search
n. 题目；话题；标题
a matter dealt with in a text, discourse, or conversation; a subject.
that part of a sentence about which something is said, typically the first major constituent.
"sleep deprivation became a frequent topic of conversation"
Lack of space forbids further treatment of the topic here.因篇幅所限，此处不便对本题作进一步阐述。
This essay is so short that it can only scratch the surface of the topic.这篇文章很短，只能对这一问题作肤浅的探讨。
The essay isn't even remotely relevant to the topic.这篇文章毫不切题。
The topic seemed to have a fascination for her.这个题目似乎对她很有吸引力。
They discussed the weather and other topics.他们讨论了气候和其他的话题。
Let's take leave of the topic and turn to another.这个问题就说到这里吧，现在来谈谈另一个话题。
Can we shunt the talks onto a new topic?我们谈话换个新话题好吧？

topple

['tɒpl], ['tɑːpl]


Image Search
vt. 使倒塌；推翻
vi. 倒塌
overbalance or become unsteady and fall slowly.
cause to become unsteady and fall.
"she toppled over when I touched her"
"the push almost toppled him to the ground"
The explosion toppled the near chimney.这次爆炸把不远处的烟筒炸倒了。
He toppled his opponent.他摔倒对方。
This scandal may topple the government.这桩丑闻有可能使政府垮台。
The pile of books toppled over onto the floor.那一摞书倒在地上了。
That Building is going to topple down.那幢建筑物摇摇欲坠。

torment

['tɔːment], ['tɔːrment]


Image Search
n. 苦痛；拷问；折磨；烦恼
vt. 使苦恼；折磨

a cause of suffering.

annoy or provoke in a deliberately unkind way.
"their deaths have left both families in torment"
"the journey must have been a torment for them"
"he was tormented by jealousy"
"every day I have kids tormenting me because they know I live alone"
He was in torment after the operation.手术后他非常痛苦。
That child is a torment to his parents.这孩子对他的父母是一种折磨。
He suffered a hideous torment when the enemy caught him.敌人抓到他后，他受到可怕的折磨。
What a little torment that child is!这孩子真烦人！
She torments everyone with silly questions.她用无聊的问题来烦扰大家。
Seth was tormented by feelings of guilt.内疚之感折磨着塞斯。

tout

Image Search

scalp (a ticket).
offer racing tips for a share of any resulting winnings.
spy out the movements and condition of (a racehorse in training) in order to gain information to be used when betting.
a person soliciting custom or business, typically in an aggressive or bold manner.
a person who buys tickets for an event to resell them at a profit; a scalper.
a person who offers racing tips for a share of any resulting winnings.
an informer.
used before the name of a city to refer to its high society or people of importance.
"Jim was touting his wares"
"the headquarters facility was touted as the best in the country"
"le tout Washington adored him"

The politician was touted as a friend of people.这个政客被吹捧为人民之友。

trace

[treɪs], [treɪs]


Image Search
n. 痕迹；微量；踪迹
v. 追踪；描绘；找出根源
find or discover by investigation.
find or describe the origin or development of.
follow or mark the course or position of (something) with one's eye, mind, or finger.
take (a particular path or route).
copy (a drawing, map, or design) by drawing over its lines on a superimposed piece of transparent paper.
draw (a pattern or line), especially with one's finger or toe.
give an outline of.
a mark, object, or other indication of the existence or passing of something.
a line or pattern displayed by an instrument using a moving pen or a luminous spot on a screen to show the existence or nature of something that is being investigated.
a physical change in the brain presumed to be caused by a process of learning or memory.
a very small quantity, especially one too small to be accurately measured.
a slight indication or barely discernible hint of something.
a procedure to investigate the source of something, such as the place from which a telephone call was made, or the origin of an error in a computer program.
a line which represents the projection of a curve or surface on a plane or the intersection of a curve or surface with a plane.
a beaten path or small road; a track.
the sum of the elements in the principle diagonal of a square matrix.
each of the two side straps, chains, or ropes by which a horse is attached to a vehicle that it is pulling.
"police are trying to trace a white van seen in the area"
"Bob's book traces his flying career with the Marines"
"through the binoculars, I traced the path I had taken the night before"
"a tear traced a lonely path down her cheek"
"the article traces out some of the connections between education, qualifications, and the labor market"
"remove all traces of the old adhesive"
"his body contained traces of amphetamines"
"just a trace of a smile"
When the police exhume the corpse they discover trace of poison in it警方掘出尸体, 发现有中毒的痕迹
Traces of blood were found in the bathroom.在浴室里发现一点血。
The police have detected the trace of the murderer after several days of investigation.警察经过几天的调查,发现了凶手的踪迹。
He traces his descent back to an old norman family.他追踪自己的世系上溯至一个古老的诺曼家族。
He traced his signature laboriously.他吃力地签上自己的名字。
I have nothing to trace.我没找到任何东西。

the dramatic genre represented by tragedy.
"a tragedy that killed 95 people"
"Greek tragedy"

Shakespeare's Hamlet is a very famous tragedy.莎士比亚的《哈姆雷特》是一部十分著名的悲剧。
It was not long before tragedy struck again.没多久，灾难又再次降临。
This recent tragedy has put the manufacturersof the drug squarely in the dock.新近发生的这一悲惨事件使药品厂商受到指控。
It was a tragedy that she died so young.她这么年轻就去世，真是太不幸了。

['trædʒɪk], ['trædʒɪk]

causing or characterized by extreme distress or sorrow.
suffering extreme distress or sorrow.

"the shooting was a tragic accident"
"the tragic parents reached the end of their tether"
"on the other hand, I like degenerate, tragic food"

I don't like the tragic ending of the film.我不喜欢电影悲剧的结尾。
Her tragic story touched us all deeply/touched our hearts with sorrow.她的经历很悲惨，我们都深受感动[我们都很伤心]。
She listened to the tragic news ashen-faced.她听到这一悲惨消息，脸都白了。
The university was shocked at the tragic incident.大学人员都被这场悲惨的事故震惊了。

Our CEO talks and behaves without a trait of authority.我们公司的首席执行官言行举止没有一点官气。

tranquil

Image Search
adj. 安静的；宁静的；稳定的；不变的
free from disturbance; calm.

The countryside is very tranquil, with less people.乡下挺安静的，人没那么多。
Driven by primordial instinct, the salmon hurl themselves upstream to spawn in the same tranquil pools where they themselves were born.由原始的本能所驱动，大马哈鱼会奋力逆流而上在它们出生的同一个安静的水池内产卵。
A peaceful and tranquil atmo here permeates the place.这地方充满着一种宁静的气氛。
In this tranquil night, you may know what I am thinking?在这个宁静的夜晚，你可知道我在想些什么吗？

"I went to sleep on the couch before transferring to my bedroom later in the night"

"it took three hours and several bus transfers to get there"
The exhibition was transferred to another city two days later.两天后,这个展会转移到另外一个城市。
She has been transferred to another department.她已被调往另一个部门。
I took the subway and then transferred to the bus.我搭乘地铁然后再改乘公共汽车。
Our company will have a transfer to London.我们公司将迁往伦敦。
His job requires him to accept transfers from a city to another.他的工作要求他在不同的城市间来回奔波。
She got a transfer at the relay station.她在中转站换车了。
International trade involves the transfer of currency from one country to another.国际贸易涉及货币由一国向另一国的汇兑。

transform

[træns'fɔːm], [træns'fɔːm]

vi. 改变；变形；变态

change the voltage of (an electric current).
change (a mathematical entity) by transformation.
the product of a transformation.
a rule for making a transformation.
"lasers have transformed cardiac surgery"
"an automobile that transformed into a boat"
She is responsible for the character part of the hero's devoted mother.她负责这个主人公的忠诚的母亲的角色部分。
The magician transformed the frog into a princess.魔术师把青蛙变成了公主。
His plans were transformed overnight into reality.他的计划迅速变为现实。
We should try to transform heat into power.我们应该设法将热转化为能量。
I believe she would transform me into a talker.我相信，她会把我这个沉默寡言的人变成个碎嘴子。

transformation

[ˌtrænsfə'meɪʃn], [ˌtrænsfər'meɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 转型；转化；改造
a thorough or dramatic change in form or appearance.
a metamorphosis during the life cycle of an animal.
the induced or spontaneous change of one element into another by a nuclear process.
a process by which one figure, expression, or function is converted into another that is equivalent in some important respect but is differently expressed or represented.
a process by which an element in the underlying deep structure of a sentence is converted to an element in the surface structure.
the genetic alteration of a cell by introduction of extraneous DNA, especially by a plasmid.
the heritable modification of a cell from its normal state to a malignant state.
"its landscape has undergone a radical transformation"
Transformation is not only a choice, but also a strategy.转型不仅是选择，更是战略。
The foundation is about to go through another transformation.基金会正准备进行另一次转型。
The subway is part of Beijing's transformation to a more urbane metropolis.地铁是北京向一个更为现代的大都市转型的一部分。
His character seems to have undergone a complete transformation since his marriage.他结婚之后性格判若两人。
The transformation of that project has been finished.那个项目的改造已经完成。
The transformation of traditional industries was accelerated.传统工业加快了改造步伐。
We have chosen the peaceful transformation of capitalist industry and commerce.我们对资本主义工商业采用了和平改造的办法。

[træn'zɪʃn], [træn'zɪʃn]


Image Search

the process or a period of changing from one state or condition to another.
the process by which a person permanently adopts the outward or physical characteristics of the gender with which they identify, as opposed to those associated with their birth sex. The process may or may not involve measures such as hormone therapy and gender reassignment surgery.
a passage in a piece of writing that smoothly connects two topics or sections to each other.
a momentary modulation from one key to another.
a change of an atom, nucleus, electron, etc. from one quantum state to another, with emission or absorption of radiation.
undergo or cause to undergo a process or period of transition.
adopt permanently the outward or physical characteristics of the gender one identifies with, as opposed to those associated with one's birth sex.
"students in transition from one program to another"
"she had been living as a woman for eight years at that point and had completed her transition in 2001"

His attitude underwent an abrupt transition.他的态度突然改变了。
We hope there will be a peaceful transition to the new system.我们希望能够和平过渡到新的制度。

transport

a large vehicle, ship, or aircraft used to carry troops or stores.

"the bulk of freight traffic was transported by truck"
"for a moment she was transported to a warm summer garden on the night of a ball"
"she was transported with pleasure"
"many possess their own forms of transport"
"the transport of crude oil"
"art can send people into transports of delight"
The goods have been cased up for transport.货物已装箱待运。
London Transport run extra trains during the rush-hour.伦敦运输公司在交通高峰时 间增开加班列车。
Please find alternative means of transport.请另外找一个运输方法。
The transport of goods by air is very expensive.空运货物费用十分昂贵。
A helicopter was used to transport the wounded.一架直升飞机被用来运送伤员。
Wheat is transported from the farms to the mills.把小麦从农场运到面粉厂。
Flies transport different kinds of diseases.苍蝇传播各种不同的疾病。
I was reluctant to let language transport me.我不情愿被语言弄得失魂落魄。

transportation
