trend

[trend], [trend]


Image Search
n. 趋势；倾向；方位
vi. 倾向；转向
a general direction in which something is developing or changing.
a fashion.
a topic that is the subject of many posts on a social media website within a short period of time.
change or develop in a general direction.
(especially of geographical features) bend or turn away in a specified direction.
(of a topic) be the subject of many posts on a social media website within a short period of time.
"an upward trend in sales and profit margins"
"the latest trends in modern dance"
"for more than 20 days in a row, most of the top Twitter trends were Olympics-related"
"unemployment has been trending upward"
"the Richelieu River trends northward to Lake Champlain"
"I've just taken a quick look at what's trending on Twitter right now"
The trend of prices is still upward.物价仍有上涨趋势。
The youth like to follow the latest trends in fashion.年轻人喜好追求最新的流行款式。
This quartet represents a major new trend in modern music.这首四重奏的曲子反映了现代音乐中一种主要的新趋向。
The event changed the trend of public opinion.这件事改变了舆论的趋向。
The mountains have a western trend.群山向西延伸。
The prices of houses are trending upwards.房价趋于上涨。
The trend towards product customization has forced many apparel manufacturers to shift from mass production to more flexible, high-volume production.产品的定制化趋势迫使许多服装制造厂家不得不由批量生产转向更灵活的高产量生产。
Actually, the trend of Anti-Humanistic thought is also a kind of humanism which is deeply influenced by the shift of western philosophy.反人道主义思潮受到西方哲学转向的深刻影响，反人道主义思潮实际上也是一种人道主义。

trespass

['trespəs], ['trespəs]


Image Search
n. 非法侵入；罪过；[法]侵害诉讼
v. 非法侵入；侵害；冒犯
enter the owner's land or property without permission.
make unfair claims on or take advantage of (something).
commit an offense against (a person or a set of rules).
entry to a person's land or property without their permission.
a sin; an offense.
"there is no excuse for trespassing on railroad property"
"she really must not trespass on his hospitality"
"a man who had trespassed against Judaic law"
"the defendants were guilty of trespass"
"the worst trespass against the goddess Venus is to see her naked and asleep"
They forgive the people who trespass against them.他们总是宽恕冒犯他们的人。

trifle

['traɪfl], ['traɪfl]


Image Search
n. 琐事；少量
v. 浪费；玩弄
a thing of little value or importance.
a small amount of something.
a cold dessert of sponge cake and fruit covered with layers of custard, jelly, and cream.
treat (someone or something) without seriousness or respect.
talk or act frivolously.
waste something, especially time, frivolously.
"we needn't trouble the headmaster over such trifles"
"the thousand yen he'd paid seemed the merest trifle"
"he is not a man to be trifled with"
"we will not trifle—life is too short"
I do not want to make a fuss over such a trifle.我不想为这种小事大惊小怪。
They had an altercation about a trifle.他们为一点小事争吵起来。
He told her not to pester him with trifles.他告诉她别拿些琐事来烦他。
I have only a trifle of wine left.我只剩下一点点酒了。
I'll have just a trifle of the dessert.我只要吃少量的甜点心。
Don't trifle away your time on curio hunting.别把时间都浪费在搜集古玩上面。
Don't trifle with serious matter.对大事不可儿戏。
Never trifle with other's affections.不要玩弄别人的感情。
It's dangerous to trifle with such a fierce animal.逗弄如此凶残的动物是很危险的。

trigger

['trɪɡə(r)], ['trɪɡər]


Image Search
v. 使发生；触发；使运行
n. 扳机；起因
a small device that releases a spring or catch and so sets off a mechanism, especially in order to fire a gun.
an event or circumstance that is the cause of a particular action, process, or situation.
cause (an event or situation) to happen or exist.
cause (a device) to function.
(of an event or situation) cause (someone) to do something.
(especially of something read, seen, or heard) distress (someone), typically as a result of arousing feelings or memories associated with a particular traumatic experience.
"he pulled the trigger of the shotgun"
"the trigger for the strike was the closure of a mine"
"an allergy can be triggered by stress or overwork"
"the death of Helen's father triggered her to follow a childhood dream and become a falconer"
"she started crying and told me that my news had really triggered her"
Price increases will trigger off demands for wage increases.价格上涨会激发人们增长工资的要求。
The odour of food may trigger people's appetite.食物的香味能引起人的食欲。
A detonator is used to trigger an explosive device.雷管用来引爆爆炸装置。
I pulled the trigger and the gun went off.我一扣扳机，枪就响了。
It was the trigger for a whole new investigation.这是新一轮调查的直接起因。

trite

[traɪt], [traɪt]


Image Search
adj. 平庸的；陈腐的
(of a remark, opinion, or idea) overused and consequently of little import; lacking originality or freshness.
"this point may now seem obvious and trite"
For the rest, she was a strong-minded woman; never said a weak or a trite thing.此外，她还是个意志坚强的女人，从来不说一句示弱或者平庸的话。
He ended his lecture with a trite morality.他以陈腐的说教结束了演讲。

trough

[trɒf], [trɔːf]


Image Search
n. 水槽；马槽；低谷；低潮
a long, narrow open container for animals to eat or drink out of.
a long, narrow, open container for growing plants or mixing chemicals.
a channel used to convey a liquid.
a long hollow in the earth's surface.
an elongated region of low atmospheric pressure.
a hollow between two wave crests in the sea.
a region around the minimum on a curve of variation of a quantity.
a point of low activity, achievement, or satisfaction.
"a water trough"
"a vast glacial trough"
"learning a language is a series of peaks and troughs"
So she quickly emptied her jar into the trough.她迅速地把水罐里的水统统倒进水槽。
This type of barrier is a combination of the pumping trough and the hydraulic ridge.这类屏障是把抽水槽和水力分水岭结合在一起。
However, as a mother of two, she was soon out of the trough.但是，作为两个孩子的母亲，她很快就走出了低谷。
But economists do not necessarily expect the trough in production to be long.但是，经济学家并不一定认为生产低潮会持续很长时间。

trove

[trəʊv], [troʊv]


Image Search
n. 贵重发现物；珍藏品
a store of valuable or delightful things.
"the museum's trove of antique treasure"
He assembled a rich trove of Chinese porcelain.他收集了一批中国瓷器。
Mogao Grottoes is a veritable treasure trove of cultural relics.莫高窟还是一座名副其实的文物宝库。
Somewhere in the BBC archives, there is a treasure trove of cricket history for future reference.在英国广播公司档案馆的一处，有些可供今后参考的珍贵的板球史料。
The center housed a priceless treasure trove.该中心存放着一件无价之宝。
The gallery is a treasure trove of medieval art.这个画廊是中世纪艺术的宝库。

truclent


Image Search
eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant.
"his days of truculent defiance were over"

tuberculosis

[tjuːˌbɜːkju'ləʊsɪs], [tuːˌbɜːrkjə'loʊsɪs]


Image Search
n. 肺结核
an infectious bacterial disease characterized by the growth of nodules (tubercles) in the tissues, especially the lungs.
As late as the 1950s tuberculosis was still a threat.直到二十世纪五十年代，结核病仍然使人不寒而栗。
In cases of tuberculosis blood is expectorated.肺结核病有咯血症状。
She is wasting away with tuberculosis.她因患肺结核而一天天瘦下去。
The best remedy for tuberculosis consists in rest.肺结核病的最好良药就是休息.

tundra

['tʌndrə], ['tʌndrə]


Image Search
n. 苔原；冻土地带
a vast, flat, treeless Arctic region of Europe, Asia, and North America in which the subsoil is permanently frozen.
Gley soils are typical of tundra, meadows, and boggy areas.灰黏土是苔原、草地以及沼地所特有的。
In the north are vast stretches of icy, treeless tundra.北部为冰天雪地的没有树木的辽阔平原，称之为冻原带。

turbid

['tɜːbɪd], ['tɜːrbɪd]


Image Search
adj. 混浊的；泥水的；浓密的
(of a liquid) cloudy, opaque, or thick with suspended matter.
confused or obscure in meaning or effect.
"the turbid estuary"
"a turbid piece of cinéma vérité"
Flushed by a clear stream, the turbid water was being diluted and squeezed out.在一股清流的冲击下，杯子里的浑水不断地被稀释、充溢了出来。
The turbid yellow river water fiercely reflected the blazing sun of the plateau.那浑黄的河水在高原阳光的曝晒下，反射着强烈的光。

turmeric

['tɜːmərɪk], ['tɜːrmərɪk]


Image Search
n. ［植］姜黄；姜黄根之粉末
a bright yellow aromatic powder obtained from the rhizome of a plant of the ginger family, used for flavoring and coloring in Asian cooking and formerly as a fabric dye.
the Asian plant from which turmeric is obtained.
Turmeric has been used for thousands of years.姜黄已经被使用了数千年。

turnip

['tɜːnɪp], ['tɜːrnɪp]


Image Search
n. 萝卜；芜菁；大头菜
a round root with white or cream flesh that is eaten as a vegetable and also has edible leaves.
a root similar or related to the turnip, especially a rutabaga.
the European plant of the cabbage family that produces the turnip.
a large, thick, old-fashioned pocket watch.
My nephew loves to eat raw turnip.我的侄子喜欢生吃萝卜。
She was very surprised to see the turnip.牠很惊讶的看到了萝卜，
Would you like some turnip?吃点芜菁吗？

tussle

['tʌsl], ['tʌsl]


Image Search
n. 扭打；斗争；论争
v. 扭打；打斗
a vigorous struggle or scuffle, typically in order to obtain or achieve something.
engage in a vigorous struggle or scuffle.
"there was a tussle for the ball"
"the demonstrators tussled with police"
I had a tussle to get the knife off him.我与他扭打一阵才把刀子夺下。
We have a tussle every year about where to go on holiday.我们每年都要为前往何处度假而争论一番.
They began to tussle with each other for the coin.他们为争夺硬币扭打起来。
The children were tussling with one another for the ball.孩子们在你抢我夺地争球。

ultimate

['ʌltɪmət], ['ʌltɪmət]


Image Search
adj. 根本的；极限的；最后的；终极的
n. 终极；极品；根本
being or happening at the end of a process; final.
being the best or most extreme example of its kind.
basic or fundamental.
denoting the maximum possible strength or resistance beyond which an object breaks.
the best achievable or imaginable of its kind.
a final or fundamental fact or principle.
short for Ultimate Frisbee.
"their ultimate aim was to force his resignation"
"the ultimate accolade"
"the ultimate constituents of anything that exists are atoms"
"the ultimate in decorative luxury"
Hard work is the ultimate source of success.努力工作是成功之本。
This had been an ultimate issue.这个问题是个原则性的问题。
GUPTA And the Ironman is the ultimate competition.甘普塔铁人是一个极限的竞争。
I believe that I will bring my ultimate competitiveness in the advanced business management into full play with the guidance of professional teachers.我认为在精英的师资力量的指导下我将在高级商业管理方面发挥我极限的竞争力。
The British made the ultimate triumph.英国人取得了最后的胜利。
Our ultimate objective is the removal of all nuclear weapons.我们的最终目标是消除所有核武器。
Nuclear weapons are the ultimate deterrent.核武器是终极的威慑力量。
Such behavior is the ultimate in idiocy.这样的行为愚蠢透顶。
These ceramic tiles are the ultimate in modern kitchen design.这种瓷砖是现代厨房装修中的极品。
The crew is always the ultimate factor in the boat.船员一直是船上的根本因素。
The ultimate source of these rollercoaster movements was the Asian savings surplus.导致这类剧烈波动的最根本原因是亚洲的储蓄过剩。

ultimately

['ʌltɪmətli], ['ʌltɪmətli]


Image Search
adv. 最后；最终
finally; in the end.
at the most basic level.
"the largest firms may ultimately become unstoppable"
"ultimately he has only himself to blame"
Every value they created ultimately redounded to his boss.他们创造的价值最后全进了他们老板的腰包。
Ultimately, the success of the product depends on the good marketing.最终，产品的成功还是取决于高明的销售手段。
His rashness led ultimately to his ruin.他的急躁鲁莽最终导致了他的毁灭。
The committee ultimately adopted his suggestions.委员会最终采纳了他的建议。
All wealth comes ultimately from human labor.一切财富归根到底来源於人类的劳动。

uncivilized

[ʌn'sɪvəlaɪzd], [ʌn'sɪvəlaɪzd]


Image Search
adj. 未开化的；不文明的
=uncivilised(英).
动词uncivilize的过去式和过去分词.
(of a place or people) not considered to be socially, culturally, or morally advanced.
impolite; bad-mannered.
In uncivilized conditions, life of man is" nasty, brutish and short.人未开化时过的是“卑贱、野蛮、短暂”的生活。
These artefacts are correctives to the usual view of these people as completely uncivilized.通常认为这些人完全没有开化，这些工艺品改变了人们的这种看法。
It is an uncivilized tradition passed down from the history.这是历史流传下来的一种不文明的传统。
The foreigners view the local people as uncivilized beings.这些外国人将当地人看作是不文明的人。

uncouth

[ʌn'kuːθ], [ʌn'kuːθ]


Image Search
adj. 粗俗的；笨拙的；无教养的
(of a person or their appearance or behavior) lacking good manners, refinement, or grace.
(especially of art or language) lacking sophistication or delicacy.
(of a place) uncomfortable, especially because of remoteness or poor conditions.
"he is unwashed, uncouth, and drunk most of the time"
"uncouth sketches of peasants"
His nephew is an uncouth young man.他的侄子是一个粗野的年轻人。
He behaves in a most uncouth way.他的举止真是笨拙。
She may embarrass you with her uncouth behavior.她的粗野行为可能会让你尴尬。

underestimate

[ˌʌndər'estɪmeɪt], [ˌʌndər'estɪmeɪt]


Image Search
n. 低估
v. 低估
estimate (something) to be smaller or less important than it actually is.
regard (someone) as less capable than they really are.
an estimate that is too low.
"the administration has grossly underestimated the extent of the problem"
"he had underestimated the new president"
The figure of $10 million was a serious underestimate.一千万美元这个数据是一个严重的低估。
It seems to have been due to his consistent underestimate of her political weight.看来是由于希思一贯低估她的政治能量。
Never underestimate the power of a woman.决不要低估妇女的力量。
Don't underestimate the difficulties of the work.不要低估了这项工作的艰巨性。
You shouldn't underestimate the risks of the enterprise.你不应低估这一计划的风险。

undergo

[ˌʌndə'ɡəʊ], [ˌʌndər'ɡoʊ]


Image Search
vt. 经历；经受；遭受
experience or be subjected to (something, typically something unpleasant, painful, or arduous).
"the baby underwent a life-saving brain operation"
This city underwent great changes.这座城市经历了巨大的变化。
The castle will undergo extensive and costly renovations.那城堡要用巨资进行全面整修。
Man's idea of God would undoubtedly undergo a change if we were to discover other intelligent beings in the universe.如果我们真的发现宇宙中有其他的智慧生命,人类关于上帝的观念一定会经历一场变化。
I hope that I shall never again have to undergo such unpleasant experience.我希望我永远不会再遭遇到这种不愉快的经历。
She underwent a thorough examination at the hospital.她在医院里接受了全面检查。
The idea must undergo the test of experiment.观念必须经得起实验的检验。
Metals undergo expansion when heated.金属加热时会膨胀。

underlying

[ˌʌndə'laɪɪŋ], [ˌʌndər'laɪɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 潜在的；隐含的；在下面的；基本的；<经>优先的
动词underlie的现在分词
present participle of underlie.
(especially of a layer of rock or soil) lie or be situated under (something).
be the cause or basis of (something).
"the fundamental issue that underlies the conflict"
This word has its underlying meaning.这个单词有它潜在的含义。
The underlying assumption is that the amount of money available is limited.隐含的假定是可用的资金有限。
We dug down to the underlying rock.我们往下挖直到碰到了下面的石块。
The underlying idea is an appealing one.基础的概念是一种吸引人的概念。

undermine

[ˌʌndə'maɪn], [ˌʌndər'maɪn]


Image Search
vt. 逐渐削弱；暗中损害；在...下挖；从根基处损害
erode the base or foundation of (a rock formation).
dig or excavate beneath (a building or fortification) so as to make it collapse.
damage or weaken (someone or something), especially gradually or insidiously.
"this could undermine years of hard work"
They will do anything to undermine their adversary's reputation.他们会不择手段地去损害对手的名誉。
The President's enemies are spreading rumours to undermine his authority.总统的敌人在散布谣言以逐渐破坏他的威信。
Badgers had undermined the foundations of the church.獾在这座教堂的地基处打了洞。
A mole can undermine the strongest rampart.一只田鼠能毁坏最坚固的堡垒。

underscore

[ˌʌndə'skɔː(r)], [ˌʌndər'skɔːr]


Image Search
vt. 划线于；强调；提供伴奏乐
n. 下划线；影片伴奏乐
a line drawn under a word or phrase for emphasis.
(on a computer or typewriter keyboard) a short horizontal line (_) on the baseline.
underline (something).
emphasize.
"the company underscored the progress made with fuel cells"
Let me underscore two of many reasons for this concern.值得担忧的原因很多，让我着重说明其中两点。
Please underscore the word three times for emphasis.为了强调起见，请在该词下面划三条线。
Let me underscore that you should focus on an important problem.让我强调一下：你必须关注于某一重要问题。
These results underscore the importance of context in studies of social capital.这些结果强调了社会资本研究中环境的重要性。
They must begin with a letter or the underscore character开始部分必须为一个字母或是下划线

undertaken

[ˌʌndə'teɪkən], [ˌʌndə'teɪkən]


Image Search
v. 接手；从事
动词undertake的过去分词.
commit oneself to and begin (an enterprise or responsibility); take on.
promise to do a particular thing.
guarantee or affirm something; give as a formal pledge.
catch up with and pass (another vehicle) while traveling on the inside.
"a firm of builders undertook the construction work"
"the firm undertook to keep price increases to a minimum"
"a truck driver implicitly undertakes that he is reasonably skilled as a driver"
"he undertook me, at 70 mph, while on his mobile phone"
One example is to pay a tax professional to alert one to the tax deductibility of activities already undertaken.一个例子是支付一个税专业人士提醒一到已经被接手的活动税可推断性。
In Guizhou, logging is undertaken in the forest areas.在贵州，森林地区的人们从事伐木业。
In this next example,you will see the type of concealment activity Iraq has undertaken in response to the resumption of inspections.在下面的这个例子中，你们将明白伊拉克为应付再度武器核查从事了什么类型的隐藏活动。

unerring

[ʌn'ɜːrɪŋ], [ʌn'ɜːrɪŋ]


Image Search
adj. 不犯错误的；一贯准确的；万无一失的
always right or accurate.
"an unerring sense of direction"
The antique dealer has an unerring ability to spot a fake.那古董商慧眼识珠，鉴别假货从不出错。
You can trust his unerring taste in cloths.你可以相信他的衣着品位，绝对没问题。
He had an unerring instinct for when people were lying to him.他具有准确的直觉，能判断别人什么时候是在说谎。
He have an unerring knack of saying the wrong thing.他有个出言必失的本事。

Image Search

unfortunately

[ʌn'fɔːtʃənətli], [ʌn'fɔːrtʃənətli]


Image Search
adv. 不幸地；遗憾地
it is unfortunate that.
"unfortunately, we do not have the time to interview every applicant"
Unfortunately, I missed the last train.我不幸错过了末班火车。
Unfortunately, I hurt my knee when I fell down on the ice.真不幸，我在冰上摔倒时摔伤了膝盖。
Unfortunately I am not aware of that.遗憾的是，我不知道此事。
Unfortunately, the restaurant he recommended fell far short of our expectations.遗憾的是,他推荐的餐厅与我们心目中的相去甚远。

unfulfilled

[ˌʌnfʊl'fɪld], [ˌʌnfʊl'fɪld]


Image Search
adj. 没有成就感的；未完成的；未实现的
not carried out or brought to completion.
not having fully utilized or exploited one's abilities or character.
"it was his unfulfilled ambition to write"
By this time, Tolstoy was being noticed as a writer but he still felt unfulfilled .这时候，托尔斯泰以作家的身分闯出了名声，但依旧感觉不得志。
He died early with his ambitions unfulfilled.他过早地去世，壮志不遂。
So much for the unfulfilled myths.这些未有应验的预言暂且谈到这里。
It ends with the expectation unfulfilled.它以未能实现的盼望而结束。

ungainly

[ʌn'ɡeɪnli], [ʌn'ɡeɪnli]


Image Search

He walked in long ungainly strides.他迈着笨拙的大步子行走。
I thought him terribly ungainly when he danced.我觉得他跳舞极其难看。

unified

['juːnɪfaɪd], ['juːnɪfaɪd]


Image Search
adj. 统一的
动词unify的过去式和过去分词.
make or become united, uniform, or whole.
"the government hoped to centralize and unify the nation"
We need to agree on a unified basic price.我们必需商定一个统一的基本价格。
Everything is a unified system of contradictions.任何事物都是矛盾的统一体。

uniform

['juːnɪfɔːm], ['juːnɪfɔːrm]


Image Search
n. 制服
adj. 一致的；统一的
remaining the same in all cases and at all times; unchanging in form or character.
of a similar form or character to another or others.
denoting a garment forming part of a person's uniform.
the distinctive clothing worn by members of the same organization or body or by children attending certain schools.
a police officer wearing a uniform.
a code word representing the letter U, used in radio communication.
make uniform.
"blocks of stone of uniform size"
"a uniform package of amenities at a choice of hotels"
"black uniform jackets"
"airline pilots in dark blue uniforms"
"uniforms were already on the scene"
He looks very manly in his uniform.他穿着制服十分精神。
The students are wearing school uniforms.学生们穿着校服。
The rows of houses were uniform in appearance.这一排排的房屋外表都是一样的。
Their internal temperatures are essentially uniform with the environment.它们的体温与周围环境基本上是一致的。
Lack of uniform standards is a problem.尚缺乏统一标准规定。
Now many bus routes in this city charge two yuan as a uniform fare.现在,这座城市的许多公交路线无论距离远近都统一收取两元车费。

unintelligent

[ˌʌnɪn'telɪdʒənt], [ˌʌnɪn'telɪdʒənt]


Image Search
adj. 无知的；愚蠢的
having or showing a low level of intelligence.
"a good-natured but unintelligent boy"
The boy is not so much unintelligent as uneducated.与其说这男孩无知,不如说他没受过教育。
It appears to be unintelligent behavior.这似乎是愚昧的行为。

unique

[ju'niːk], [ju'niːk]


Image Search
adj. 独特的；独一无二的；稀罕的
being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else.
particularly remarkable, special, or unusual.
belonging or connected to (one particular person, group, or place).
a unique person or thing.
"the situation was unique in modern politics"
"a unique opportunity to see the spectacular Bolshoi Ballet"
"a style of architecture that is unique to Portugal"
He occupies a unique place in English literature.他在英国文学中占有独特的地位。
The elephant's trunk is a unique form of appendage.象的鼻子是一种独特的附肢。
It's a unique work of art.这是独一无二的艺术作品。
The custom is unique to the region.这种风俗是这一地区特有的。
Her style of writing is rather unique.她的写作风格很不寻常。

universal

[ˌjuːnɪ'vɜːsl], [ˌjuːnɪ'vɜːrsl]


Image Search
adj. 普遍的；全世界的；宇宙的；全体的；通用的
n. 通用原理，普遍原则
of, affecting, or done by all people or things in the world or in a particular group; applicable to all cases.
denoting a proposition in which something is asserted of all of a class.
denoting or relating to a grammatical rule, set of rules, or other linguistic feature that is found in all languages.
(of a tool or machine) adjustable to or appropriate for all requirements; not restricted to a single purpose or position.
a person or thing having universal effect, currency, or application, in particular.
a universal proposition.
a term or concept of general application.
a nature or essence signified by a general term.
a universal grammatical rule or linguistic feature.
"universal adult suffrage"
These phenomena is very universal.这些现象己经非常普遍了。
Overpopulation is a universal problem.人口过多是全球性的问题。
Music has been called the universal language.人们称音乐为世界的语言。
The doer is a universal structure.行事者是一个宇宙的结构。
A universal theory cannot be induced from a finite number of facts.一项宇宙的学说不能从有限数目的事实归纳而得。
Americans strongly favour the introduction of universal health care.美国人强烈赞同推行覆盖全体国民的医保制度。
Therefore any attempt at a universal tool set also proves futile.因此,任何建立一个通用工具集的尝试被认为是徒劳的。
There are no economic universals.英语是一种世界通用的语言。

unkempt

[ˌʌn'kempt], [ˌʌn'kempt]


Image Search
adj. 乱蓬蓬的；不整洁的
(especially of a person) having an untidy or disheveled appearance.
"they were unwashed and unkempt"
The old man was shabby and unkempt.老头蓬头垢面，衣衫褴褛。
Their faces were unkempt, their clothing sloppy.他们仍然仪容不整，衣服也都是遢里邋遢的。
During the owners' absence the lawn became dreadfully unkempt.主人们不在的时候，草地变得凌乱不堪。

unruly

[ʌn'ruːli], [ʌn'ruːli]


Image Search
adj. 难控制的；无法无天的；任性的
disorderly and disruptive and not amenable to discipline or control.
"complaints about unruly behavior"
They are unruly mob.他们是些难以控制的暴徒。
The unruly students mocked their teacher.这群无法无天的学生嘲笑老师。
The unruly crowd became even more boisterous when he tried to quiet them.他试图使那些横蛮任性的人们安静下来，可他们却吵嚷得更加厉害。

unscrupulous

[ʌn'skruːpjələs], [ʌn'skruːpjələs]


Image Search
adj. 肆无忌惮的；不道德的
having or showing no moral principles; not honest or fair.
You always take part with the unscrupulous man.你总是袒护那些肆无忌惮的人。
He once did me such an unscrupulous shot in the eye.他曾经如此肆无忌惮地恶意中伤过我。
He was utterly unscrupulous in his competition with rival firms.他与对立公司竞争完全不讲道德。

upheaval

[ʌp'hiːvl], [ʌp'hiːvl]


Image Search
n. 向上的运动；剧变；动乱
a violent or sudden change or disruption to something.
an upward displacement of part of the earth's crust.
"major upheavals in the financial markets"
The French Revolution was a volcanic upheaval in European history.法国大革命是欧洲历史上的一次剧变。
It was a terrible upheaval when his father died.他父亲去世时家里一团糟。
I can't face the upheaval of moving house again.我无法忍受再次搬家的折腾。
Many years ago, Johnson faced a major upheaval in his life.许多年前，约翰逊遭遇生命中的剧变。
A drastic interest-rate cut this week coincided with stockmarket upheaval.伴随着本周利率的大幅降低而来的是证券市场有力的反弹。
Mass unemployment may lead to social upheaval.大批失业会导致社会动乱。
It was a violent political upheaval.这是一场激烈的政治动乱。
The country has been thrown into an upheaval.这个国家已经陷入动乱之中。

uproot

[ˌʌp'ruːt], [ˌʌp'ruːt]


Image Search
vt. 连根拔起；迁离；根除
pull (something, especially a tree or plant) out of the ground.
eradicate; destroy.
move (someone) from their home or a familiar location.
"the elephant's trunk is powerful enough to uproot trees"
"a revolution is necessary to uproot the social order"
"my father traveled constantly and uprooted his family several times"
Whthin seconds a tornado can uproot trees.几秒钟内，龙卷风就能连根拔起大树。
The trunk of an elephant is powerful enough to uproot trees.大象的长鼻强壮得足以将树木连根拔起。
The family decided to uproot themselves and emigrate to Australia.他们全家决定离开故土，移居澳大利亚。
To take the new job he had to uproot his whole family and settled abroad.他为接受新的工作不得不举家迁居，在国外重新安家。
A bad habit once contracted takes a very long time to uproot (or root up).坏习惯一旦养成，需要很长的时间才能根除。
A bad habit once contracted takes a very long time to uproot.坏习惯一旦养成，需要很长的时间才能根除。

utilitarian

[ˌjuːtɪlɪ'teəriən], [ˌjuːtɪlɪ'teriən]


Image Search
adj. 功利的；实用的
n. 功利主义者
designed to be useful or practical rather than attractive.
relating to or adhering to the doctrine of utilitarianism.
an adherent of utilitarianism.
"a utilitarian theorist"
In the selection, he attempts to clarify the utilitarian standard.在这段选文中，他试图对功利标准作一清楚表述。
The buildings were utilitarian rather than decorative.这些建筑是实用性的，而不是装饰性的。
He is very down to earth and is a real utilitarian.他那个人很现实, 是个十足的功利主义者。

utility

[juː'tɪləti], [juː'tɪləti]


Image Search
n. 效用；实用；公用事业（费）；[计]应用程序
adj. 多效用的；多功能的
the state of being useful, profitable, or beneficial.
(in game theory or economics) a measure of that which is sought to be maximized in any situation involving a choice.
an organization supplying the community with electricity, gas, water, or sewerage.
stocks and bonds in public utilities.
a utility program.
useful, especially through being able to perform several functions.
denoting a player capable of playing in several different positions in a sport.
functional rather than attractive.
relating to the lowest US government grade of beef.
"he had a poor opinion of the utility of book learning"
"a utility truck"
"utility clothing"
I have always doubted the utility of these conferences on disarmament.我一直怀疑这些裁军会议的效用。
Their research project has limited practical utility.他们的研究项目实用价值很有限。
Does your rent include utilities?房租包括水电和煤气的费用吗？
Utility prices, including water, electricity, gas, rose by 5.6 per cent.水、电、煤气在内的公用事业价格都上涨了5.6%。
This utility can be run only in safe mode.此应用程序仅可在安全模式下运行。

utilize

['juːtəlaɪz], ['juːtəlaɪz]


Image Search
vt. <美>利用或使用
=utilise（英）
make practical and effective use of.
"vitamin C helps your body utilize the iron present in your diet"
What criteria do you utilize in selecting employees?在筛选雇员时你使用什么标准？
In order to utilize land more fully, they adopted close planting.为了更充分利用土地，他们采取了密植的办法。

vacate

[və'keɪt], [və'keɪt]


Image Search
v. 空出；让出
leave (a place that one previously occupied).
give up (a position or office).
cancel or annul (a judgment, contract, or charge).
"rooms must be vacated by noon on the last day of your vacation"
"he will vacate a job in government sales"
You might envision passengers standing and waiting for others to vacate a seat so that they may limber up.你能想象到乘客们站立着等待其他人空出座位，那么他们就能放松下了。

vacillate

['væsəleɪt], ['væsəleɪt]


Image Search
v. 游移不定；踌躇；犹豫
alternate or waver between different opinions or actions; be indecisive.
"I had for a time vacillated between teaching and journalism"
She vacillated between hope and fear.她时而抱有希望，时而心存恐惧。
But a few cadres started to vacillate.但是,也有少数干部起了波动。
You are bound to vacillate at times.有时你肯定还是会犹豫不决。
You can tell when they're stressed out, they'll equivocate and vacillate.当他们压力过大时，你是可以辨别出来的，因为他们会支支吾吾、犹豫不决。

vagabond

a person who wanders from place to place without a home or job.
a rascal; a rogue.
having no settled home.
wander about as or like a vagabond.
The vagabond began to regret his waste of time.这个流浪汉开始后悔他虚度了光阴。
He leads a vagabond life.他过着流浪生活。

The man put up a valiant fight for victory.这个人为了赢得胜利进行了英勇的斗争。
To a valiant heart nothing is impossible.勇士面前无难事。
The man was also a valiant warrior, but he was a leper.他又是大能的勇士，只是长了大麻疯。
Let's hail to the valiant victors.让我们向勇敢的胜利者致敬！
A large reception was held in honor of the valiant explorers.为勇敢的探险家们举行了一个盛大的招待会。

validity

[və'lɪdəti], [və'lɪdəti]


Image Search
n. 合法性；有效性；正确性
the quality of being logically or factually sound; soundness or cogency.
the state of being legally or officially binding or acceptable.
"one might question the validity of our data"
"return travel must be within the validity of the ticket"
The judge did not question the validity of my statement.法官对我的陈述的合法性没有表示怀疑。
The experimental results demonstrate the validity of this approach.实验结果说明了该方法的有效性。
We had doubts about the validity of their argument.我们对他们的论点的正确性有过怀疑。

vandalism

['vændəlɪzəm], ['vændəlɪzəm]


Image Search
n. 【U】故意破坏公物（艺术或文化的等）的行为
action involving deliberate destruction of or damage to public or private property.
Vandalism used to be a rare occurrence here.过去这里很少发生故意破坏公物的事。
The school suffered from widespread vandalism.这所学校遭受广泛的野蛮破坏。
However, vandalism and theft are criminal offenses.然而，故意破坏和偷窃是犯罪行为。

variable

['veəriəbl], ['veriəbl]


Image Search
adj. 可变的；易变的
n. 变量；易变的东西
not consistent or having a fixed pattern; liable to change.
(of a wind) tending to change direction.
(of a quantity) able to assume different numerical values.
(of a species) liable to deviate from the typical color or form, or to occur in different colors or forms.
able to be changed or adapted.
(of a gear) designed to give varying ratios or speeds.
an element, feature, or factor that is liable to vary or change.
a quantity that during a calculation is assumed to vary or be capable of varying in value.
a data item that may take on more than one value during the runtime of a program.
short for variable star.
the region of light, variable winds to the north of the northeast trade winds or (in the southern hemisphere) between the southeast trade winds and the westerlies.
"the quality of hospital food is highly variable"
"the drill has variable speed"
"there are too many variables involved to make any meaningful predictions"
Prices are variable according to the rate of exchange.物价会随汇率而变动。
His mood is as variable as the weather.他的情绪如天气般反覆无常。
The quality of the hotel food is distinctly variable.这个旅馆的饭菜有时很好有时很差.
The temperature is a variable in the experiment.在该实验中温度是个变量。
With so many variables, the exact cost is difficult to estimate.由于有许多可变因素,很难准确地估算出成本。
All these variables can affect a student's performance.所有这些变数都会影响学生的成绩。

variables

['veəriəblz], ['veəriəblz]


Image Search
n. 变量
名词variable的复数形式.
an element, feature, or factor that is liable to vary or change.
a quantity which during a calculation is assumed to vary or be capable of varying in value.
a data item that may take on more than one value during the runtime of a program.
short for variable star.
the region of light, variable winds to the north of the northeast trade winds or (in the southern hemisphere) between the southeast trade winds and the westerlies.
"there are too many variables involved to make any meaningful predictions"
Demography is the analysis of population variables.人口学是对人口变量的分析。
In algebra, we use letters to represent variables.代数中，我们用字母来代表变量。

vehicle

['viːɪkl], ['viːɪkl]


Image Search
n. 车辆；交通工具；传播媒介；手段；工具
a thing used for transporting people or goods, especially on land, such as a car, truck, or cart.
a thing used to express, embody, or fulfill something.
a substance that facilitates the use of a drug, pigment, or other material mixed with it.
the figurative language used in a metaphor, as distinct from the metaphor's subject.
a movie, television program, song, etc., that is intended to display the leading performer to the best advantage.
"I use paint as a vehicle for my ideas"
No entry for vehicle!禁止车辆入内！
It is time for the yearly check of vehicle safety.到车辆安全年审的时间了。
Subway is a convenient vehicle for those white collars.地铁对于白领阶层来说是很方便的交通工具。
Television has become an important vehicle for spreading political ideas.电视已成为传播政治思想的重要媒介。
It subsequently evolved into an even more complex investment vehicle.并随后发展成为一种更为复杂的投资手段。
Language is the vehicle of thought.语言是表达思想的工具。

[vend], [vend]


Image Search
v. 叫卖；出售
offer (small items, especially food) for sale, especially either from a stall or from a slot machine.
sell (something).

Image Search

great respect; reverence.

Her veneration for traditional learning never wavered.她对传统学问的敬意从未动摇。

ventriloquist

[ven'trɪləkwɪst], [ven'trɪləkwɪst]


Image Search
n. 作腹语者；口技表演者
a person who can speak or utter sounds so that they seem to come from somewhere else, especially an entertainer who makes their voice appear to come from a dummy of a person or animal.
To practice your ventriloquist voice, keep your lips motionless.要练习以腹语术发声,你得保持双唇不动。
Every ventriloquist carries a dummy of their own.所有的口技表演者都随身带着人偶。

veracity

[və'ræsəti], [və'ræsəti]


Image Search
n. 真实性；诚实
conformity to facts; accuracy.
habitual truthfulness.
"officials expressed doubts concerning the veracity of the story"
"voters should be concerned about his veracity and character"
I don't doubt the veracity of your report.我毫不怀疑你报告中的真实性。
The chairman disallowed the veracity of his report.主席不承认他的报道的真实性。
There is no question of his veracity.他的诚实是毫无疑问的。
I can testify to this man's veracity and good character.我可以作证,此人诚实可靠,品德良好。

verge

[vɜːdʒ], [vɜːrdʒ]


Image Search
v. 接近；濒于；下沉；趋于
v. 处在...的边沿
n. 边缘；界限；权杖
an edge or border.
an extreme limit beyond which something specified will happen.
a grass edging such as that by the side of a road or path.
an edge of tiles projecting over a gable.
approach (something) closely; be close or similar to (something).
a wand or rod carried before a bishop or dean as an emblem of office.
incline in a certain direction or toward a particular state.
"they came down to the verge of the lake"
"I was on the verge of tears"
"despair verging on the suicidal"
"his style verged into the art nouveau school"
The path verges on the edge of a precipice.这条小径濒临断崖的边缘。
He is verging on a breakdown.他正濒临精神崩溃。
The sun was verging towards the horizon.太阳向地平线下降。
The economy verges toward inflation.经济倾向于通货膨胀。
Her land verges on the neighboring township.她的土地与邻镇相连。
The country's economy is on the verge of collapse.这个国家的经济已到了崩溃的边缘。
Large numbers of people had to struggle on the verge of starvation.那时许多人不得不挣扎在饥饿的边缘。
The little boy walked along the grass verge, trying not to step into the field.这个小男孩沿着草地的边上走,以防踩到地里。
The old man was on the verge of eighty.那老人已年近八十。

veritable

['verɪtəbl], ['verɪtəbl]


Image Search
adj. 真实的；确实的；真正的
used as an intensifier, often to qualify a metaphor.
"the early 1970s witnessed a veritable price explosion"
This campaign took on the proportions of a veritable war against the peasantry .这次运动很大部份是反农民的真实的战争。
The show is a veritable reservoir of new talent.这个演出真是新秀集萃。
We found ourselves in the midst of a veritable fairyland.我们发现我们在名副其实的仙境中。
It was not easy to work in the shed; in winter it was a veritable ice-box.在这木棚里工作可不轻松，冬天简直是个冰箱。
The public gave her a veritable ovation.观众给了她一个真正的哄堂喝彩。
This book is a veritable feast for the mind.这是本给心灵带来真正快乐的书。

versatile

['vɜːsətaɪl], ['vɜːrsətl]


Image Search
adj. 多才多艺的；通用的；多功能的
able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
changeable; inconstant.
"a versatile sewing machine"
Versatile actors can play all kinds of roles.多才多艺的演员能演各种类型的角色。
He is one of the most versatile actors.他是最多才多艺的演员之一。
These cotton towels are quite versatile for this reason.鉴于这点,这些毛巾都是通用的。
I bought a versatile kitchen machine last month.我上个月买了一部多功能的厨房用机器.
This knife is actually a highly versatile tool.这把小刀实际上是一个多功能的工具。
Plastics are a kind of versatile material in industry.在工业中,塑料是一种多用途材料。

version

['vɜːʃn], ['vɜːrʒn]


Image Search
n. 版本；说法；译本；形式
a particular form of something differing in certain respects from an earlier form or other forms of the same type of thing.
a particular edition or translation of a book or other work.
an adaptation of a novel, piece of music, etc. into another medium or style.
a particular release of a piece of computer software.
an account of a matter from a particular person's point of view.
the manual turning of a fetus in the uterus to make delivery easier.
an abnormal displacement of the uterus.
create a new version of.
"a revised version of the paper was produced for a later meeting"
"the English version will be published next year"
"a film version of a wonderfully funny cult novel"
"he told her his version of events"
"it's the software for you if you need versioning and group editing"
The new version of this dictionary is not in use yet.这本字典的新版本还未通行。
The two newspapers gave different versions of what happened.两家报纸对发生的事说法不一。
The book was translated into many versions and sold all over the world.这本书被翻译成多种译文并行销全球。
This shirt is a cheaper version of the one I saw in that shop.这件衬衫同我在那家商店里见到的几乎一样，但它是便宜货。

vertigo

['vɜːtɪɡəʊ], ['vɜːrtɪɡoʊ]


Image Search
n. 眩晕
a sensation of whirling and loss of balance, associated particularly with looking down from a great height, or caused by disease affecting the inner ear or the vestibular nerve; giddiness.
It is very important to determine if vertigo truly exists.要确定是否真的有眩晕困扰是十分重要的。

via

['vaɪə], ['vaɪə]


Image Search
prep. 经由；通过
traveling through (a place) en route to a destination.
by way of; through.
by means of.
"they came to Europe via Turkey"
"they can see the artists' works via a camera hookup"
"a file sent via electronic mail"
We went from London to Washington via New York.我们从伦敦经纽约到华盛顿。
This flight is routed to Chicago via New York.这班机是经纽约飞往芝加哥的。
He flew to Europe via the North Pole.他经由北极飞到欧洲。
I can send him a note via the internal mail system.我可以通过内部通信系统给他发个通知。
We could send the letter via airmail.我们可以通过空邮寄信。

vibrant

['vaɪbrənt], ['vaɪbrənt]


Image Search
adj. 震颤的；响亮的；充满活力的；精力充沛的；(色彩)鲜明的
full of energy and enthusiasm.
quivering; pulsating.
(of color) bright and striking.
(of sound) strong or resonating.
"a vibrant cosmopolitan city"
"Rose was vibrant with anger"
"a vibrant male voice"
The leaves were vibrant in the breeze.叶子在微风中抖动。
His vibrant voice commove the air.他响亮的声音振动了空气。
The city is vibrant with life.这城市充满生机。
She was vibrant with health and enthusiasm.她健康活泼生气勃勃。
He always uses vibrant colours in his paintings.他在画中总是使用鲜明的色彩。

viewpoint

['vjuːpɔɪnt], ['vjuːpɔɪnt]


Image Search
n. 观点；看法
another term for point of view.
I look at this problem from a different viewpoint.我从不同的观点来看这个问题。
You always depend on an obsolete viewpoint.你老是信赖一个过时的观点。
Either viewpoint must lead to the same answer.任何一种看法都应该导致同一答案。
She will have her own viewpoint on the matter.她对这个问题会有她自己的看法。

vigilant

['vɪdʒɪlənt], ['vɪdʒɪlənt]


Image Search
adj. 警戒的；警惕的
keeping careful watch for possible danger or difficulties.
"the burglar was spotted by vigilant neighbors"
We must keep an vigilant eye upon imperialism.我们必须对帝国主义保持警戒。
A pilot must be vigilant at all times.飞行员必须随时保持警惕。
The night shift has to be doubly vigilant.值夜班要加倍警惕。
The British Prime Minister Gordon Brown has urged people to be vigilant against the potential terrorist attack.英国首相戈登.

vigilante

[ˌvɪdʒɪ'lænti], [ˌvɪdʒɪ'lænti]


Image Search
n. 义警警员；治安团体的成员
a member of a self-appointed group of citizens who undertake law enforcement in their community without legal authority, typically because the legal agencies are thought to be inadequate.
I'm a vigilante trying to clean up the streets.我是维持街道秩序的义务警员。
Also, Spider-Man was branded as a vigilante by the police.此外，蜘蛛侠还被警察称为义务警员。

vigorous

['vɪɡərəs], ['vɪɡərəs]


Image Search
adj. 精力充沛的；有力的；元气旺盛的
strong, healthy, and full of energy.
characterized by or involving physical strength, effort, or energy.
(of language) forceful.
"vigorous aerobic exercise"
"a vigorous denial"
Old as he is, he is none the less vigorous and active.虽然他年纪很大了，他仍然精力充沛。
He never ceased to chase after his dream in his vigorous youth.在精力充沛的年轻时代他从未停止过追求自己的梦想。
She gave the floor a vigorous sponge all over.她用海绵把地板 使劲儿擦了一遍。
He uttered several vigorous expletives when he dropped the iron on his foot.他的熨斗掉下砸在脚上，他随口骂了几声。
These corn plants are very vigorous.这些玉米秧正茁壮生长。

violation

[ˌvaɪə'leɪʃn], [ˌvaɪə'leɪʃn]


Image Search
n. 违反；违背；妨碍
the action of violating someone or something.
"the aircraft were in violation of UN resolutions"
The drunken driver was brought to the police station for violation of traffic regulations.这个喝醉了的司机因违反交通规则而被带进了警察局。
From now on any violation of the regulation must be cruelly punished.今后任何违反秩序的行为会受到严厉惩罚。
They were in open violation of the treaty.他们公然违反条约。
Stealing was a violation of my ethics.偷盗违背了我的道德标准。

virtually

['vɜːtʃuəli], ['vɜːrtʃuəli]


Image Search
adv. 实际上；几乎
nearly; almost.
by means of virtual reality techniques.
by means of a computer; computationally.
"the college became virtually bankrupt"
It is virtually impossible to predict the future accurately.精确预言未来的事实际上是办不到的。
It's not an agreement as such, but it will have virtually the same effect as one.它算不上是协定, 但实际上起协定的作用。
This opinion was held by virtually all the experts.差不多所有的专家都持这一看法。
Virtually all the members were in agreement with the proposal.几乎所有的成员都同意这项提议。

visible

['vɪzəbl], ['vɪzəbl]


Image Search
adj. 看得见的；可见的；显而易见的
able to be seen.
(of light) within the range of wavelengths to which the eye is sensitive.
able to be perceived or noticed easily.
in a position of public prominence.
relating to imports or exports of tangible commodities.
"the church spire is visible from miles away"
"a visible improvement"
"a highly visible member of the royal entourage"
"the visible trade gap"
The big rafter is visible in this room.这间屋子粗大的椽子可以看得见。
Various parts of his anatomy were clearly visible.他身体的各个部分都看得很清楚。
The tower was visible from afar.从远处就能望到那座塔。
The body was visible below the surface of the lake.尸体在湖水下清晰可见。
Police regulations prescribe that an officer's number must be clearly visible.警员条例要求执行职务者的号码标志必须清楚易见。
She showed no visible nervousness.她没有表现出明显的紧张。

vision

['vɪʒn], ['vɪʒn]


Image Search
n. 视力；视觉；幻觉；眼光；洞察力；想象力
v. 幻想；设想
the faculty or state of being able to see.
the ability to think about or plan the future with imagination or wisdom.
a mental image of what the future will or could be like.
the images seen on a television screen.
an experience of seeing someone or something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition.
a vivid mental image, especially a fanciful one of the future.
a person or sight of unusual beauty.
imagine.
"she had defective vision"
"the organization had lost its vision and direction"
"a vision of retirement"
"the idea came to him in a vision"
"he had visions of becoming the Elton John of his time"
I've had my eyes tested and the report says that my vision is perfect.我的眼睛检查过了，检查报告说我的视力非常好。
How do you cope with the problem of poor vision?怎样解决视力不好这一难题呢?
As it were,where there is human vision,there is almost needs machine vision.可以说 ,需要人类视觉的场合几乎都需要机器视觉。
High above, a vision of prisming colour takes wing;在远远的天空中,一个幻觉般的影像正在高高地飞翔;
As a prime minister, he lacked the strategic vision of, say, someone like Churchill.作为首相,他缺乏像丘吉尔那样的战略眼光。
All you business leaders tonight are outstanding achievers in your respective fields. You have a wealth of successful experiences and strategic vision.今晚与会的各位企业家,都是你们所在行业的佼佼者,具有丰富的成功经验和战略眼光。
We need someone with real vision to lead the party.我们需要具有真知灼见的人来领导这个党。
She unites common sense with vision.她将想象力与常识联系起来。
He tried to vision himself in a past century.他假想自己身处百年之前。

His failed to pass his visual test.他没有通过他的视力测试。

"memories of that evening were still vivid"

This girl gave a vivid description of the event.那女孩对这件事作了一番生动的描述。
Only the vivid red hair ever stood out.只有鲜艳的红头发非常令人注目。
The actresses were wearing vivid historical costumes.女演员们穿着鲜艳的古装。
The new varieties have very vivid designs and beautiful colors.那新产品图案新颖，色泽鲜艳。
Television presents a vivid world in front of us.电视在我们面前展示出一个栩栩如生的世界。
Dickens'novels are full of vivid characterization.狄更斯的小说中充满了栩栩如生的人物形象。
The sculpture is really very vivid.真是被雕刻得栩栩如生啊。

She struggled for years to find her true vocation.她多年来苦苦寻找真正适合自己的职业。
The industry is facing vocation conformity in China.在中国,这种工业面临行业整合。
Teaching children is a vocation.教育儿童是一项使命。

vole

[vəʊl], [voʊl]


Image Search

a small, typically burrowing, mouselike rodent with a rounded muzzle, found in both Eurasia and North America.
A water vole swam vigorously upstream.一只水鼠奋力向上游游去。
A little vole with a bag on his back was singing and walking across a field .一只小田鼠背着包，快活地唱着歌儿，在田野上走。

volume

a scroll of parchment or papyrus containing written matter.
the amount of space that a substance or object occupies, or that is enclosed within a container, especially when great.
an amount or quantity of something, especially when great.
a certain, typically large amount of something.
fullness or expansive thickness of something, especially of a person's hair.
quantity or power of sound; degree of loudness.
"the sewer could not cope with the volume of rainwater"
"changes in the volume of consumer spending"
"the volumes of data handled are vast"
"he turned the volume up on the radio"
This volume contains selections from his early works.该卷包含了他的早期作品文选。
This volume is foxed on the flyleaf.这卷书的空白页发黄了。
A gas has neither definite volume nor definite shape.气体既无一定体积,又无一定形状。
Is that volume still in print?那册书还能买到吗？
He bound up the two book into one volume .他将两本书装订成一册。
This button is for adjusting the volume.这个按钮是调节音量的。
She turned down the volume on the radio.她关小了收音机的音量。
Gastric secretion is reduced in volume and total acid content.胃分泌的容量和总酸度降低。

an organ solo played before, during, or after a church service.

voracious

They are aggressively territorial and voracious to fault.好斗与贪婪也是它们的弱点。
Kids can have voracious appetites.小孩会很贪吃。
He was a voracious reader of the translations of Eastern religious works.他如饥似渴地阅读东方宗教著作的译本。

vow

Image Search

"I vowed myself to this enterprise"

All the men took a vow of loyalty to their leader.所有士兵都发誓效忠他们的指挥官。
Once he took the vow his loyalty never wavered.他一旦宣了誓，他就一直忠贞不渝。
Catholic priests take a vow of celibacy.天主教神父发誓不结婚。
I vowed never to reveal the secret.我发誓决不泄漏这一秘密。
I vow to give my time and strength to this case.我发誓将我的时间和精力致力于这一事业。

This is the virgin voyage of the ship.这是这艘船的处女航。

She went on a long sea voyage.她乘船在海上长途旅行。
Once the voyage comes to an end.旅程结束之际。
Happiness is a voyage, not a destination.快乐是旅程，不是目的地。
My dream is to voyage around the world in a hot air balloon.我的梦想是乘着热气球周游世界。
They planned to voyage across the Pacific Ocean.他们计划做穿越太平洋的旅行。

wade

[weɪd], [weɪd]


Image Search
v. 跋涉；涉水
n. 跋涉
walk through water or another liquid or soft substance.
walk through (something filled with water).
read laboriously through (a long piece of writing).
get involved in (something) vigorously or forcefully.
make a vigorous attack or intervention.
an act of wading.
"we waded ashore"
"firefighters waded the waist-deep flood water"
"he waded into the yelling, fighting crowd"
"Nicola waded in and grabbed the baby"
I wade down a shallow pebbly stream daily.我每天沿着一条浅的有卵石的小溪跋涉。
I assume that Wade discussed the quality issues with you.我承担那跋涉与你讨论质量议题。
We'll wade the stream at its shallowest point.我们将在小河最浅的地方涉水过去。
A child can wade across them without a parent's cautions.无须父母的告诫，孩子们就可以涉水而过。
I wade down a shallow pebbly stream daily.我每天沿着一条浅的有卵石的小溪跋涉。
I assume that Wade discussed the quality issues with you.我承担那跋涉与你讨论质量议题。

wane

[weɪn], [weɪn]


Image Search
n. 衰落；亏缺；变弱
v. 变小；亏缺；呈下弦
(of the moon) have a progressively smaller part of its visible surface illuminated, so that it appears to decrease in size.
(especially of a condition or feeling) decrease in vigor, power, or extent; become weaker.
the amount by which a plank or log is beveled or falls short of a squared shape.
"confidence in the dollar waned"
The empire was on the wane after its period of prosperity.帝国经过全盛以后逐渐衰落。
By now the power of the Roman Empire was on the wane.到这时，罗马帝国已日益衰败。
Why should the moon have wax and wane?为什么一定会月有阴晴圆缺?
The sick man's strength is on the wane.病人的体力越来越弱。
The government's popularity is on the wane.政府的声望日益低落。
As time went on, so their hopes began to wane.随着时间的消逝，他们的希望开始变得渺茫。
The moon waxes and wanes every month.月亮每个月都有盈亏。
When the moon is at its full, it begins to wane.月盈则亏。

wax

[wæks], [wæks]


Image Search
n. 蜡；蜂蜡
vt. (用蜡)涂
vi. 变圆
a sticky yellowish moldable substance secreted by honeybees as the material of honeycomb; beeswax.
a white translucent material obtained by bleaching and purifying beeswax and used for such purposes as making candles, modeling, and as a basis of polishes.
a viscous substance, typically a lipid or hydrocarbon.
earwax.
used in reference to phonograph records.
cover or treat (something) with wax or a similar substance, typically to polish or protect it.
remove unwanted hair from (a part of the body) by applying wax and then peeling off the wax and hairs together.
make a recording of.
(of the moon between new and full) have a progressively larger part of its visible surface illuminated, increasing its apparent size.
become larger or stronger.
begin to speak or write about something in the specified manner.
a fit of anger.
"he didn't get on wax until 1959"
"I washed and waxed the floor"
"he waxed a series of tracks that emphasized his lead guitar work"
"his anger waxed"
"they waxed lyrical about the old days"
"she is in a wax about the delay to the wedding"
Blobs of wax covered the candlestick.烛台上全是一团团的蜡。
He is modeling a unicorn in wax .他在用蜡制作独角兽。
They bought wax and honey up by the great.他们大量购进蜜蜡和蜂蜜。
Why did she have to wax the floors herself?她干什么非要自己动手给地板打腊?
I wax my boots chiefly to waterproof them.我给靴子打蜡主要是为了防水。
The moon is waxing.月亮越来越圆。

waylay

[weɪ'leɪ], [weɪ'leɪ]


Image Search

He waylaid me with a request for a loan.他等我经过时拦住我向我借钱。
The patrol was waylaid by bandits.巡逻队遭到土匪伏击。

accustom (an infant or other young mammal) to food other than its mother's milk.

a young child.
"the doctor tried to wean her off the sleeping pills"
"I was weaned on a regular diet of Hollywood fantasy"
She had her baby weaned a year later.她在一年后才把孩子的奶断掉。
Police weaned him away from drugs.警察让他逐渐戒毒。
The patch enables smokers to wean themselves off cigarettes very gradually.这张贴片能使吸烟者很缓慢地把烟戒掉。
She tried to wean him from playing football.她试图让他不再踢足球。

weary

['wɪəri], ['wɪri]


Image Search
adj. 疲倦的；厌烦的
v. 疲倦；厌烦；生厌
feeling or showing tiredness, especially as a result of excessive exertion or lack of sleep.
reluctant to see or experience any more of; tired of.
calling for a great amount of energy or endurance; tiring and tedious.
cause to become tired.
grow tired of or bored with.
"he gave a long, weary sigh"
"she was weary of their constant arguments"
"the weary journey began again"
"she was wearied by her persistent cough"
"she wearied of the sameness of her life"
After many hours in the saddle he was very weary.骑马骑了几个小时后，他非常疲倦。
I feel weary after such a long journey.经过这么长时间的旅行后，我觉得很累。
We all grew weary of his long-winded speech.我们对他冗长的发言都感到很厌烦。
He began to be weary of the research work.他开始对研究工作感到厌烦。
The long walk completely wearied us.这麽长的路走得我们疲惫不堪。
They weary of countless restrictions and fetters.他们对种种清规戒律感到很厌烦。
Novelists should never allow themselves to weary of the study of real life.小说家们永远不应对研究真实的生活感到厌烦。
He began to weary of the work.他开始对工作感到厌倦。

wedge

[wedʒ], [wedʒ]


Image Search
n. 楔子；楔形物
vt. 楔住；嵌；挤进
a piece of wood, metal, or some other material having one thick end and tapering to a thin edge, that is driven between two objects or parts of an object to secure or separate them.
an object or piece of something having the shape of a wedge.
a formation of people or animals in the shape of a wedge.
a golf club with a low, angled face for maximum loft.
a golf shot made with a wedge.
a shoe, typically having a fairly high heel, of which the heel and sole form a solid block, with no gap under the instep.
a wedge heel.
another term for dash.
fix in position using a wedge.
force into a narrow space.
"a wedge of cheese"
"the door was wedged open"
"I wedged the bags into the back seat"
Put a wedge under the door so that it will stay open.在门底下塞一块楔子，让门保持开着。
The attackers formed a wedge and plowed through the enemy line.进攻者形成了一个楔子，突破了敌军的阵线
He had a banana and a wedge of cheese for lunch.他中饭吃一根香蕉和一块楔形的奶酪。
Please wedge this cabinet to keep it from tipping.请在橱底楔入楔子以防它倾斜。
Open the door wide and wedge it with a wad of newspaper把门开大,再用一卷报纸把它楔牢。
The box won't wedge into such a narrow space.那盒无法塞进那么小的地方去。
She could not wedge another item into the suitcase .她再也无法把别的东西塞进箱子里去了。
I was so tightly wedged between two fat women that it was difficult for me to get up and leave the bus.我被两个肥胖的女人紧紧地挤在中间，以致于要站起来下公共汽车都很难。

weird

[wɪəd], [wɪrd]


Image Search
adj. 离奇的；古怪的；怪异的
n. 命运；预言者
suggesting something supernatural; uncanny.
very strange; bizarre.
connected with fate.
a person's destiny.
induce a sense of disbelief or alienation in someone.
"the weird crying of a seal"
"a weird coincidence"
He looks like nothing on earth in those weird clothes.他穿著奇装异服难看极了。
Jane, I found that guy somewhat weird.珍妮, 我发觉那家伙有点古怪。
That was really a weird movie.那部电影真怪异!
I heard weird shrieks in the darkness.我在黑暗中听到奇怪的尖叫声。

welfare

['welfeə(r)], ['welfer]


Image Search
n. 福利；福利事业；幸福
the health, happiness, and fortunes of a person or group.
statutory procedure or social effort designed to promote the basic physical and material well-being of people in need.
financial support given to people in need.
"they don't give a damn about the welfare of their families"
"the protection of rights to education, housing, and welfare"
The welfare of the individual is bound up with the welfare of the community.个人的福利与社会的福利有着密切的关系。
These are matters that bear on the welfare of the community.这些都是与社会福利有关的问题。
The government decided to promote public welfare.政府决定发展公共福利。
My principal concern is my family's welfare.我至为关心的是我一家的幸福。

whereas

[ˌweər'æz], [ˌwer'æz]


Image Search
conj. 然而；鉴于
in contrast or comparison with the fact that.
(especially in legal preambles) taking into consideration the fact that.
"you treat the matter lightly, whereas I myself was never more serious"
Some people like coffee, whereas others like tea.有人喜欢咖啡,然而也有人喜欢茶。
His children are well bred, whereas those of his sister's are naughty.他的孩子很有教养，但他姐姐的孩子却调皮得很。
Whereas we want a flat, they would rather live in a house.我们想住公寓房，而他们却想住一所房子。
Whereas the peoples of the colonies have been grieved and burdened with taxes...鉴于各殖民地民众备受重税负担之苦....

whereby

[weə'baɪ], [wer'baɪ]


Image Search
adv. 凭借
by which.
"a system whereby people could vote by telephone"
He devised a plan whereby he might escape.他想出了一个可藉以逃脱的办法。
Whereby shall we find fault with him?我们凭什么指责他呢？
There is no other way whereby we can cross the river.我们没有别的办法过河。
Love is the chain whereby to bind a child to his parents.爱是连结子女与父母的链子。

wherever

[weər'evə(r)], [wer'evər]


Image Search
adv. 无论什么地方
conj. 无论在哪里
in or to whatever place (emphasizing a lack of restriction).
in all places; regardless of where.
used for emphasis instead of “where” in questions, typically expressing surprise or confusion.
in every case when.
"meet me wherever you like"
"it should be available wherever you go to shop"
"wherever can he have gone to?"
"use whole grain breakfast cereals wherever possible"
I can fall asleep wherever and in any position.我可以在任何地方任何位置睡着。
Remember you are a Chinese wherever you go.不论你到哪里,记住你是中国人。
We'll go wherever you like.你爱去哪儿我们就去哪儿。

wholesome

['həʊlsəm], ['hoʊlsəm]


Image Search
adj. 有益健康的；合乎卫生的
conducive to or suggestive of good health and physical well-being.
conducive to or promoting moral well-being.
"the food is plentiful and very wholesome"
"good wholesome fun"
Bread and milk is wholesome breakfast.面包和牛奶加有益于健康的早餐。
You should read some wholesome books.你应当读些有益的书。
It is not wholesome to eat without washing your hands.不洗手吃饭是不卫生的。

widespread

['waɪdspred], ['waɪdspred]


Image Search
adj. 分布(或散布)广的；普遍的
found or distributed over a large area or number of people.
"there was widespread support for the war"
The high cost prohibits the widespread use of the drug.该药因价格昂贵而影响其被广泛应用。
Widespread flooding is affecting large areas of Devon.洪水泛滥，淹没了德文郡的广大地区。
The Government acted quickly to relieve the widespread distress caused by the earthquake.地震造成大范围的灾难,政府迅速采取行动赈济灾民。
The new laws gained widespread acceptance.新法例广获赞同。
English is more widespread and more used in international intercourse than German.英语在国际交往中比德语使用得更为广泛。
The news of the radiation leak caused widespread public alarm.辐射泄露的消息引起了公众的普遍恐慌。

wilderness

['wɪldənəs], ['wɪldərnəs]


Image Search
n. 荒野；荒地
an uncultivated, uninhabited, and inhospitable region.
a neglected or abandoned area of a garden or town.
a position of disfavor, especially in a political context.
"the man who led the Green Party out of the wilderness"
Jesus went out into the wilderness to think alone.耶稣走进荒野去独自思考。
A hot spring has been found in the wilderness.荒野里发现了一处温泉。
They transformed the wilderness into a garden.他们把荒地变成了花园。
How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!他们在旷野悖逆他，在荒地叫他担忧，何其多呢。

wily

['waɪli], ['waɪli]


Image Search
adj. 狡猾的
skilled at gaining an advantage, especially deceitfully.
"his wily opponents"
Foxes are supposed to be wily creatures.据说狐狸是狡猾的动物。
We must eat our fruit from the wily serpent's jaws.我们必须从那条狡猾的蛇的嘴巴里去抢食果实。

wistful

['wɪstfl], ['wɪstfl]


Image Search
adj. 渴望的；忧思的；留恋的
having or showing a feeling of vague or regretful longing.
"a wistful smile"
The boy looks with wistful eyes at the toy on display.那男孩看著展出的玩具，眼中流露出渴望的神情。
The poor mother has wistful reminiscences of her lost youth.这个贫穷的母亲怅惘地回忆她已经逝去的青春。
His sole reference to Watergate was wistful.他对水门事件的唯一反应就是陷入沉思。
She had a last wistful look at the house.她留恋地最后朝那房子看了一眼。

wonky

['wɒŋki], ['wɑːŋki]


Image Search
adj. 动摇的；靠不住的；不稳的；错误的
crooked; off-center; askew.
(of a thing) unsteady; shaky.
not functioning correctly; faulty.
"you have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth"
"they sat drinking, perched on the wonky stools"
"your sense of judgment is a bit wonky at the moment"
The bridge still stands though one of the arches is wonky.桥虽然竖立在那，但有一个拱门却是摇晃的。
A new study found that headphone ear buds can make pacemaker a bit wonky.一份最新的研究报告指出入耳式耳塞可能影响心脏起搏器的正常功能。
The only potential hiccup is his wonky pinkie.唯一的隐患是他脆弱的小手指。
She still feels a bit wonky after her accident.她出了事故以后仍然觉得有些虚弱.
I'm not crossing that bridge. It looks pretty wonky.我不会从那个桥过的。它看起来很不稳。

workplace

['wɜːkpleɪs], ['wɜːrkpleɪs]


Image Search
n. 工作场所
a place where people work, such as an office or factory.
The balanced workplace isn't exactly new.均势工作场所确切地说并不是新名词。
Workplace harassment can take many forms.构成工作场所骚扰的形式有很多种。

worse

[wɜːs], [wɜːrs]


Image Search
adj. 更坏的；更差的；更严重的
adv. 更坏；更差
n. 更坏的事物
comparative of bad, ill.
of poorer quality or a lower standard; less good or desirable.
more serious or severe.
more reprehensible or evil.
in a less satisfactory or pleasant condition; more ill or unhappy.
comparative of badly, ill.
less well or skillfully.
more seriously or severely.
a more serious or unpleasant event or circumstance.
a less good, favorable, or pleasant condition.
of poor quality or a low standard.
(of a person) not able to do a particular thing well.
not appropriate in a particular situation.
not such as to be hoped for or desired; unpleasant or unwelcome.
(of something causing pain, danger, or other unwelcome consequences) severe or serious.
unfavorable; adverse.
having a harmful effect on.
failing to conform to standards of moral virtue or acceptable conduct.
(of language) using words generally considered offensive; vulgar.
(of a part of the body) injured, diseased, or painful.
(of a person) unwell.
(of food) decayed; putrid.
(of the atmosphere) polluted; unhealthy.
regretful, guilty, or ashamed about something.
worthless; not valid.
good; excellent.
in an unsatisfactory, inadequate, or unsuccessful way.
in an unfavorable way.
in an unacceptable or unpleasant way.
to a great or serious degree; severely.
"the accommodations were awful, and the food was worse"
"the movement made the pain worse"
"it is worse to intend harm than to be indifferent"
"he felt worse, and groped his way back to bed"
"the more famous I became the worse I painted"
"the others had been drunk too, worse than herself"
"the small department was already stretched to the limit, but worse was to follow"
"the weather changed for the worse"
"a bad diet"
"I'm so bad at names"
"morning was a bad time to ask Andy about anything"
"bad weather"
"bad headaches"
"bad reviews"
"soap was bad for his face"
"the bad guys"
"a bad back"
"I tried medication but felt even worse the next morning"
"everything in the fridge went bad"
"bad air"
"she feels bad about ending their engagement"
"he ran up 87 bad checks"
"they want the baddest, best-looking Corvette there is"
"a badly managed company"
"try not to think badly of me"
"she realized she was behaving rather badly"
"the building was badly damaged by fire"
The weather is getting worse and worse.天气越来越坏。
As time goes by my memory seems to get worse .随着时间的流逝，我的记忆力越来越差。
It's even worse if you have a balcony.如果你有阳台的话情况会更糟。
I'm afraid he is getting steadily worse.恐怕他的病情越来越严重了。
He is behaving worse than ever.他的所作所为比以前更坏。
She has been taken worse recently.最近她的病况更恶化了。
We thought that the situation was as bad as it could be, but worse was to follow.我们还以为那是最坏的情况呢，可没想到更糟的还在后面。

worthy

['wɜːði], ['wɜːrði]


Image Search
adj. 有价值的；可尊敬的；值得的；配得上的
n. 知名人士；杰出人物
having or showing the qualities or abilities that merit recognition in a specified way.
deserving effort, attention, or respect.
good enough; suitable.
a person notable or important in a particular sphere.
deserving of a specified thing.
suitable or fit for a specified thing.
"issues worthy of further consideration"
"generous donations to worthy causes"
"no composer was considered worthy of the name until he had written an opera"
"schools governed by local worthies"
"newsworthy"
"roadworthy"
This is a worthy English-Chinese dictionary.这是一本有价值的英汉词典。
This book is worthy of reading.这本书值得一读。
No man thinks more highly than I do of the patriotism, as well as abilities, of the very worthy gentlemen who have just addressed the house.没有人比我对刚刚向议会全体代表发言的可尊敬的先生们的爱国精神和才干更钦佩了。
Mr. Foker himself is a worthy man, though not of high extraction or indeed much education.福克先生本人也是值得尊敬的,尽管他出身不太高贵,受的教育确实也有限。
The event is worthy of being remembered.那事件是值得记忆的。
His behavior is worthy of praise.他的行为值得称道。
The book is well worthy of his reputation.这本书完全配得上他的声望。
I want you to sell these two and find more worthy replacements.我需要你卖这些二和发现更多杰出人物替换。

wrath

[rɒθ], [ræθ]


Image Search
n. 愤怒；激怒
extreme anger (chiefly used for humorous or rhetorical effect).
"he hid his pipe for fear of incurring his father's wrath"
The mother allayed her son's wrath.母亲平息了他儿子的愤怒。
Envy and wrath shorten the life.嫉妒和愤怒会缩短生命。
A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.和善的回答能驱散愤怒,但是粗鲁的话语却能激起怒火。
The wrath of the people is now aroused.人们被激怒了。
The old man opened the floodgates of wrath.这老人大发雷霆。

writhe

[raɪð], [raɪð]


Image Search
v. 挣扎；扭曲；翻腾；受苦
n. 扭动；翻腾；苦恼
make continual twisting, squirming movements or contortions of the body.
respond with great emotional or physical discomfort to (a violent or unpleasant feeling or thought).
"he writhed in agony on the ground"
"she bit her lip, writhing in suppressed fury"
Her remarks made him writhe with shame.她的话羞得他十分难堪。
The more the worms writhe, the more I yearn to crush out their entrails.虫子越受苦，我就越想碾碎它们。
The patient was writhing on the bed in agony.病人疼得在床上直打滚。
They surely writhe under this pressure.他们肯定对这种压力感到苦恼。
Students will writhe under such unjust treatment.学生们因受到这样不公正的待遇而感到非常难受。
His family could only cry and watch this expert marksman twist and writhe in his death agonies.他的家人只能嚎啕大哭，眼睁睁地看着这个出色的神枪手在扭曲翻滚中痛苦地死去。

yam

[jæm], [jæm]


Image Search
n. 山药；番薯
the edible starchy tuber of a climbing plant, widely distributed in tropical and subtropical countries.
the plant that yields the yam.
a sweet potato.
The main crops are corn, millet, yam, naked oats, buckwheat, and other small grains.主要农作物为玉米、小米、山药、莜麦、荞麦和其他的小杂粮。
Two important aboriginal foods are the fruit of the cycad palm, and a large nutritious yam.澳洲土著人有两种重要的食物：一种是铁树目裸子类棕桐树的果子，另一种是又大又有营养的山药。
A true yam is a starchy edible root generally imported to the United States from the Caribbean.真正的番薯是指一种可使用的淀粉质根菜类食物，通常从加勒比海输入美国。
Today the terms generally are used interchangeably , and the U.S.Department of Agriculture requires that a label with the word yam be accompanied by the term sweet potato.一般而言，今天这两个词被大家混用，美国农业部要求商品标签上印有”番薯“字样的产品也必须加上”甘薯“这个词。
Today the terms generally are used interchangeably , and the U.S. Department of Agriculture requires that a label with the word yam be accompanied by the term sweet potato.一般而言,今天这两个词被大家混用,美国农业部要求商品标签上印有“番薯”字样的产品也必须加上“甘薯”这个词。

yap

[jæp], [jæp]


Image Search
v. 狂吠；唠叨；吵嚷
n. 狂吠；废话；粗汉
give a sharp, shrill bark.
talk at length in an irritating manner.
a sharp, shrill bark.
a person's mouth.
loud, irritating talk.
"the dachshunds yapped at his heels"
"he should keep his yap shut"
"she'll give you a lot of yap"
That woman will yap away for hours about nothing.那个女人将会哇啦哇啦一连胡说上几个小时。
Stop yapping!别瞎扯了！
His mother yapped at him for staying away so long.他母亲因为他离开她太久而对他吵嚷起来。
They heard a yap and ran out of the house.他们听见了一声狂吠就跑出了屋外。
What a yap he was, he did not know how to whisper.他真是个粗汉,他不会小声地说话。

zany

['zeɪni], ['zeɪni]


Image Search
n. 小丑；笨人
adj. 滑稽的；荒唐的
amusingly unconventional and idiosyncratic.
an erratic or eccentric person.
a comic performer partnering a clown, whom he imitated in an amusing way.
"zany humor"
I thought morning deejays were supposed to be zany.我想早间音乐主持人是很愚蠢的。
She made us all laugh with her zany tricks.她那些滑稽的恶作剧逗得我们都大笑起来。
They threw their King Kong together with an unthinking haste that accounts for its zany illogic.他们在一片未思索的匆忙中，匆匆把金刚凑在一起，而必须为电影的荒唐不合逻辑负责。

zucchini

[zu'kiːni], [zu'kiːni]


Image Search
n. 西葫芦；茭瓜；美洲南瓜
a green variety of smooth-skinned summer squash.
